Reviews.Title: “An absolute treat to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Nushethi
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times now and I always look forward to it. The service is always perfect, I feel like the social elite because of the atmosphere and attentive service. I LOVE the food here too. I've experienced the high tea, a la carte menu at the Cafe Opera and the all you can eat buffet at the same restaurant. In fact I used to come to Sydney just to have the buffet here. The food is always great, the waiters are attentive and friendly and after I eat I feel wonderfully content! I wish I could have this feeling all the time! Unfortunately, everything really is expensive. In fact for me it's fairly unaffordable which is why I only get to go here when it's my birthday because my family will treat me to a stay here. I'm incredibly envious of people who are able to afford to stay here regularly. I'm considering chatting up a few people who frequent the bar here to find out what area of employment they are in and get myself into that field asap! Oh, the views and location are also worth a mention. I've had views of Watson Bay, the Botanical Gardens and the Harbour Bridge, all stunning whichever you choose. The last time I stayed here I even got to see fireworks shooting up from Watsons Bay! So romantic! Just a note, I've only ever stayed in the 20th floor and above, so I do not know if the lower levels have good views or if they're blocked by buildings, so if possible, ask for something above 20. It's also seriously close to food, transport, shopping.....just everything! I love it! The beds are ridiculously comfortable and I love that the controls for the blinds and lights are next to the bed. Also, something that I always encounter is that I end up boiling hot and sweating at night under the blankets they provide, no matter how much I cool the room. Well, that's something that I could easily fix by removing the blanket, but I'd love to know what they've got in those blankets to make them retain heat so well! Finally, there is an odd window in the bathroom that opens up. I have no idea what it's for! If you're outside the bathroom you can still open this window and watch the person inside do their business. Is this a design flaw or designed for kinky couples in mind? I always use it to watch TV from the bathroom, but I've always wondered why they're in every room. All in all, you will not be disappointed by staying here. Well worth the price if you can afford it. My birthday is coming up in a few days; I'm keeping my fingers crossed that a family member will take pity and spoil me again with a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts”
Reviews.Author: Kitkat071
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after a 24 hour flight. When we arrived blood shot eyes we were greeted with a smile. We were upgraded to an executive room and whe. We were given a lovely bottle of red from the hunter valley and a big fruit bowl. There's lots of room for your bags, plenty of hooks for all the girls needs and the meals in the resteraunt were lovely. It's nice and central and the shopping is t to far a walk. No need for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as Always!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed three nights at the Intercontinental earlier this month to celebrate my 50th Birthday. This was our 4th visit to Sydney and our 4th stay at this hotel. My wife and I loved it this time just as much as we have on the previous three occasions. The location is fabulous and there is nothing better than hitting the button to raise the blind first thing in the morning to reveal such a great view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Service was great and the rooms well appointed, clean and a credit to the hotel. Breakfast was first class with a wide choice. Thanks to all for making our stay special, and we will return hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stugs123
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with an old world charm. Great location with great views of Sydney. We had the buffet dinner which was really nice and very impressed with the service from our waiter. What was dissapointing was that Priority club doesn't seem to be recognised.

Reviews.Title: “Almost good”
Reviews.Author: Philostratus
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for years because of convenience to Sydney Opera House & also using Priority Privilege card. Rooms are ordinary, some have great harbour views. Club Level on top has superb all round views and outside deck to enjoy them, however the furniture, carpet, service, etc. is just shabby. Air-conditioning does not work, so you pay premium price for Club and swelter. By now, 5 star hotel should have free Internet, but no. Cafe Opera very "asian" with staff and buffet dishes - catering to group tourism sector. They had trouble communicating in English or smiling. Breakfast you have to queue! Not as good as other 5 star hotels eg. Shangri-La (nearby) and Sheraton-on-the-Park where we now stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, one of the best Sydney hotels”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay at the Intercontinental. Was able to check in (very) early after calling to discuss a few days before. Large rooms, extremely well appointed and excellent views. Could not say a bad word about the experience. A little expensive but service to match

Reviews.Title: “The Excutive Club lounge is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Mat L
Reviews.Content: If your can fit a suite(room) into your budget, it's a must to experience the Excutive club lounge. The View is spectacular & the service is first class. Breakfast 6.30- 11am, tea & coffee all day & free drinks & snacks between 5 & 7pm. Although I did run into a problem, with a trainee staff member over drink! The manager was quick to sort that out. My wife & I have been going for five years now & look forward to our next stay already.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dexx
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed by the very helpful staff and quickly registered. Our room was upgraded to one overlooking the Botanic Gardens with a view down Sydney Harbour towards the Heads. The room was very well appointed, comfortable and clean. The hotel lounge is a very popular meeting place: we took afternoon tea with a friend and enjoyed the fast and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here”
Reviews.Author: ramnastacks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend to help friends celebrate a big birthday. We stayed Club which meant we had use of the 32nd floor where guests are really pampered with good food and great wines and great views! We made full use of the of the pool and sauna too for relaxed times when we weren't out and about. Great location for walking ease to The Rocks and Sydney Opera House. The room/bathroom was clean and the bed so comfortable. We loved the views from our suite. Highly recommend. The staff were all really helpful - so a huge thanks to them too.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: autumn19
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit the Intercontinental again this year...seems a fun thing to do. We also paid that little bit extra for an Excutive Club room this time...good decision. We checked in at 3pm on Good Friday...waiting only approx 3 minutes...smooth check in from the Duty Manager (I think his name was Jeremy...apologies if wrong) a very pleasant young man who was interested and helpful with our booking. Our room on the 21st floor was nice, and the view amazing. Everything was clean and the bathroom well stocked with towels etc. I just wish more hotels had separate showers...we not so young/agile brigade find hopping in and out of a bath a wee bit difficult...but no real biggie. Our room rate gave us entry to the 31st floor club lounge...WOW...even for a Sydneysider it was spectacular. The staff are very good and so helpful and pleasant. We had a nice afternoon tea, then went back for the evening twilight drinks/canapes...well it was a bit of a "zoo" at that time...a bit embarassing to see people taking such an advantage of free drinks and food. We were not able to get a seat at a table, but Nicola seated us in a "relaxing room" until we got a table and kept making sure we were OK. She offered us extra time for the twilight drinks etc, but we had a dinner booking, so she kindly offered us a free champagne with breakfast next morning...what a nice treat. Thanks Nicola. The other staff were so busy but all very pleasant to even the most demanding...well done staff ! Breakfast next morning was nice and quiet, with ample choice (and good to see the scrambled egg spoon was not sitting in a container of water like last time down in the Cafe Opera ! a pet hate of mine)...we had taken the precaution of asking Nicola what would be the best time to get to the club lounge for breakfast as they had been so busy the night before...she recommended before 9am as she knew there was a group of 20 who were coming up at 9am...we heeded her advice and were happy. Checkout was express and our car promptly brought up from the parking area. All in all a fun time...we will do it again ! Thanks to ALL the pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: orthosurg
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Sydney to see the production of La Traviata (which was fantastic). I took my partner and opted to pay a little extra for a club room. I also took my 20 year old daughter who stayed in a separate room on the floor below (not club). I guess I was a little surprised that there was absolutely no difference in the quality or size of the room. Whilst the fit out was good, if a little dated it was as small as the standard room. The club, whilst having a sensational view of Sydney harbour was a little disappointing. During the twilight hours of 5 to 7pm when drinks and nibbles are complimentary, this drinks were of a very average quality. Indeed the wine was, in my opinion very ordinary and barely drinkable. The nibbles were okay but nothing out of the ordinary and completely unimaginative. After having a fabulous night out at the opera and having a meal after it was somewhat disappointing to have drinks (which were in fact 'last drinks) at midnight. I have stayed at the Four seasons a number of times and it is great to know that whenever you come in it is always possible to have a nightcap. The ambiance of the hotel is terrific, it is a lovely building and the staff were fantastic. Overall, pretty good, but not special which was a shame, because it could be!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Intercontinental hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lele777
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 6 April to 9 April in a superior city room 2411 on level 24 had a beatiful view , i was very happy with my stay at Intercontinental Sydney , the rooms were in a good size spacious and the bed was very confortable had a good sleep, the location is excellent handy to main areas in sydney, i will recommend this truly 5 star hotel to any one who visits sydney, my only bad point is the lobby lights are bit dark and i feeled a bit depresssed.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Sydney !”
Reviews.Author: djhallett
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying 6 nights over the Easter period at this excellent hotel. As our travel agent had confirmed, we were up graded to the Intercontinental Club for the period of our stay which meant we had the privileges of the Club on the 32nd Floor. Firstly the view is stunning !! One has a 360 degree view of Sydney harbour from this floor. Each morning we enjoyed a leisurely breakfast buffet. During the day we enjoyed refreshments. At Happy Hour (5 to 7) we enjoyed drinks and snacks. So why is this hotel so good one asks ? It simple really... the staff really care. Every staff person we encountered smiled, attended to our requests, and most of all made us feel welcome. Every day when we returned from our activities we were greeted with a happy smile. In particular the staff in The Club Continental are a credit to the hotel. Our room was well appointed, clean and well maintained . We had dinner in the Cafe Opera and the Seafood buffet was superb..Not cheap $90a head. But one has a huge range of fresh succulent seafood, including grilled buttered lobster !! For the meat eaters there was a good selection of Roasts and hot dishes. So don't bother looking elsewhere..stay here,you won't be sorry

Reviews.Title: “Definately a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaUnitedfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, in a city view room...the view was fantastic from the 27th floor. The bed was really comfy, the breakfast great, used the pool and the sauna...but for me it was the staff that made this a 5 star experience....they were all fantastic... I would definately stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: shadz1976
Reviews.Content: it is a walking disctance from the famous opera house and all the great food places there. a clean and very good hotel.. price wise is really OK for such a property. they have a great roof top where you can have dinner with a spectacular view of the city

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad communication”
Reviews.Author: CJSYD
Reviews.Content: We booked our room from Wotif as a spur of the moment Easter weekend getaway for one night in our own magnificent city. We booked the east harbour view room which was advertised as a "seasonal offer" including buffet breakfast and complimentary valet parking. On our booking form I ticked for a 2pm check in, but I am fully aware that check in is 3pm and had hoped that the room would be ready earlier for us to enjoy it. At 2pm when we tried to check in we were advised that the room was not yet ready and that check in was at 3pm, so as the staff had my mobile number and said that they would ring us as soon as it was ready we headed to the bar for a couple of drinks. At $25 for a cocktail and $10 for a Jim Beam and coke it gets expensive after a couple of drinks, so at 3pm I went back to reception to check on our room. Another 20 minutes I was told, they are doing the room now, "we'll ring you shortly." At 3.45pm my wife was getting fidgety and again went to reception to enquire and she was told that the room was finished but needed to be inspected before we could have it and it would be about 15 or 20 minutes but they would ring us. We then went for a walk and ended up at Circular Quay and an hour later still no phone call. We headed back to find out what was happening and were advised at 5pm that the room was ready, but as it was a different girl on reception she had no idea that we had been waiting and had not been advised to ring us. I asked "Can you tell me why it took so long" and received no explanation, the girl didn't seem to know why, so we left it at that and headed up to our room 1605 which was fantastic. I just put it down to us being a one off, one night Wotif buyer and other guests paying more or staying longer would be looked after first. You get what you pay for type of thing. We left the hotel for drinks and dinner and upon our arrival back later that night we discovered a hand written apology note and a plate of chocolates as a gesture of good will which was graciously accepted. The bedding was very good, even though it was 2 single beds pushed together, with great pillows and everything was very clean. Breakfast was really nice in Cafe Opera, good service and plenty to choose from. When we checked out we asked if we could leave the car parked there for a little longer while we ventured to The Rocks markets, and we were told we could leave the car and bags with them while we went there, after an hour we returned and left the hotel. All in all, it was a great stay, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Club stay”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: Ambassador check-in was completed in the lobby, there doesnâ€™t seem to be a VIP check-in or any specialist Ambassador/Priority Club staff here in Sydney. Our Ambassador gift was a box of 3 chocolates, in Bangkok & Hanoi, we received a cuddly bear & an die-cast rickshaw model respectively, câ€™mon Sydney give out some fun stuff will you? Our complimentary fruit plate was missing both days. On a busy Saturday, our room upgrade was not to a bigger room but a room with a slightly better view. Surprisingly no welcome letter. The view of the harbour from the Club Lounge here is pretty impressive, any visitor from out of town will experience a picture postcard view. Sydney Harbour by day from such a height is magical, Sydney by night, beautiful. Evening drinks was relaxed with mood lighting & a great atmosphere, drinks were served by staff who offered a good selection of beers, wines, spirits & had a number of cocktails on menu. The only disappointment was food & canapÃ©s were limited to 1 tasting plate per person, unlike other InterCâ€™s it is usually a large selection of canapÃ©s, cakes, cheese, sandwiches, dips & deserts. The 4 canapÃ©s were ok but they werenâ€™t enough to carry through the 2 hour evening drinks service, perhaps this can be reviewed to include a self-service? The sum of all the small annoyances were hardly worth spoiling a great occasion, an unforgettable view with a beautiful woman.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: PadreJose
Reviews.Content: We booked in for one night while visiting the Archibald Prize at the Sydney Art Gallery. When booking in we chose a harbour view room. The room was nothing short of wonderful with a large and comfortable bed, a delightful window seat and excellent bathroom. From our bed we looked straight up the harbour over Pinchgut towards the heads. It was divine. Service was excellent at all times and the hotel amenities very good. My only small criticism extends to the buffet breakfast. The offering was uninspiring and redolent of hotel breakfasts from the 1990s. Regardless of that I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Danzelldc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental Sydney on the last day of March 2012 for 1 night to attend a wedding of a friend whom was holding his special day at the hotel. The service was wonderful and welcoming. All the staff were friendly, from reservations, to the porters, to front desk and to housekeeping who greeted us when we passed by them on our floor. We were appointed a very comfortable room with a great view of the beautiful botanical gardens. Their location is fantastic. Everything is within walking distance - Circular Quay is a 2 min short stroll away and Pitt St Mall is another short stroll the other way. I personally regret not choosing to stay at the Intercontinental for my own pre-wedding day and my wedding night. If I did, perhaps I may have avoided the nightmare that was Shangri-La Sydney and the drama of having my wedding dress brought up 30 minutes late. We had a lovely stay at the Intercontinental and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: casula
Reviews.Content: Stayed as Ambassador member for a weekend with our free voucher. Check-in was fabulous, staff very attentive, asked lots of questions i.e. restaurant recommendations for dinner (outside of the hotel, which I thought they would probably recommend Etch etc instead), asked if we wanted the check out for 4pm etc. Porters whisked away our luggage to our room without a second thought. Very impressive. We were also upgraded to a King Deluxe Harbour Bridge room. Very nice room, although not all that big, but I guess its an average hotel size. Bed very comfortable and we really enjoyed the window seat which was lovely to relax and watch the views of Circular Quay from. Bathroom quite small in comparison to other luxury hotels, but it served the purpose. Didn't eat in any of the restaurants unfortunately as we wanted to explore the City instead. Only had cocktails in the Cortille Lounge which was very nicely set up and a very pleasant environment to relax. Overall impressive hotel in great location to the Quay, Opera House, Botanic Gardens and The Rocks area. Staff couldn't do enough for us either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AuroraUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position and handy for the main attractions and just across the road from the Botanical Gardens and handy for The Quay. The lobby and bar area are well appointed. The rooms are located in a tower built atop the beautiful Old Teasury Building. Rooms are more than adequate, ours was a basic with a city view. All staff we came into contact with were extremely efficient and pleasant to deal with. Breakfast was included in our rate and is very good. Bar prices are in line with what you would expect of a hotel of this standard. We stayed 4 nights, check out was 11.00A.M. and as our flight wasn't till late evening they stored our luggage and then provided access to the gym area to freshen up before our flight. Ask at reception. It is a good option for a Sydney stay and would use it again if the rate fitted our budget, AuroraUK

Reviews.Title: “OK rooms, bad quality room service food, bad quality Rewards support”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyLion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 40 nights consecutively, and I can tell you for sure that compared to its peer hotels (e.g. Marriott), it is inferior. Room service food is wayyy too salty, very limited choices of food (puny selection of Asian food). Expect to wait a long time and plenty of escalations to get your rewards points (despite telling front desk at least twice to credit points into the account). Definitely on my ban-list for future business stays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: charkey25
Reviews.Content: Sensational view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge from the 17th floor, beautifully comfy bed. Was surprised not to see blackout blinds on the window...not that we required them as we wanted an early start, but imagine it would be very hard for someone wanting some sleep during daylight hours....it is a very bright room. Again though, great for us. Breakfast at Cafe Opera was all you could ask for and more. Delicious. Service exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: xuvirginian
Reviews.Content: It was a great choice to stay in this hotel in Sydney: perfect location, close to everything including the train station; fantastic views to over look the bridge, the Opera House, the botanic garden and the city; polite and helpful staff; spacious room; clean sheets, etc.. The price for all these in Australia is reasonable. All these made our trip more pleasant. The only draw back is that there is no free wi-fi zone in the lobby like many like-wise hotels. The room internet charge is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL BUT AMBASSADOR MEMBERS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIETRAVELADVISER
Reviews.Content: I contacted the Intercontinental Sydney to make a reservation (for Mar 23-26). I was connected to a person with an American accent so I presumed that I had been directed to a central booking agency. I advised that I was an Ambassador member of Intercontinental and wanted an executive room with harbour view for 3 nights. The agent advised that only city views were available. I asked what room I would get with my Ambassador upgrade entitlement. I was advised that I would be upgraded to a Harbour View Suite. I accepted this information and confirmed the booking. The operator then said that she would transfer me to a special Ambassador member number. I then received a recorded message telling me to call back during office hours (come on Intercontinental - call this customer service?). There was no information given on office hours. Being now suspicious I telephoned Sydney Intercon on expensive telephone rates from Perth. The reservations person then advised that I would definitely NOT be upgraded to a harbour view suite. Image my indignation if I had turned up at the hotel and not received the upgrade that I had been told I would get. The operator than said that harbour view executive rooms were available (why was central reservations not aware of this?). All in all a poor show Intercontinental. On the basis of this I was tempted to cancel sixteen nights of reserved accommodation overseas for May 2012. However I will hold this action if I get a reasonable response from Intercon on why this mess occurred. For persons holding Ambassador level at Intercontinental which they purchased for $200 or so, be aware that central reservations do not hold current information on room availability. Further be aware that the guaranteed room upgrade appears to be a 'smoke and mirrors' exercise. In the end we cancelled the reservation and stayed at the Westin for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Views”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller_2008
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a night at the Hotel and paid extra to get access to the Club Lounge on the hotel's roof. This is perhaps Sydney's best view of the harbour, harbour bridge, heads and the city. The Room is huge, includes both indoor and outdoor seating and serves very good complimentary food and drinks. Having breakfast on the outside seating area overlooking the harbour was the best. My recommendation is to purchase the cheapest city view room you can with access to the Club Room (and spend your time in the Club Lounge- especially at sunset). It is the best view and Club facility in Sydney. PS Room was not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “recent stay at club intercon,sydney”
Reviews.Author: Callmehelen
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights at Club InterContinental, Sydney- had superb time, great room and view, staff in club lounge were fantastic - Grizzell, along with her great team, ensured that our time spent there was far above expectation

Reviews.Title: “Central location.”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: This is standard intercontinental property with everything you would expect and I wasn't dissapointed. It's very central to all the city sights and close to the park for some space and of course the ferry terminal. I would quite happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: OldAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The service at intercon Sydney has been faultless from reception, hkeeping, room service, business centre to bell boy. The bed and pillows were lovely. We will stay again. Love the double bubbles!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Club Lounge superb”
Reviews.Author: Travelmatt99
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Sydney is a typical Intercontinental. Most staff are great, service levels high, etc. I've been staying here for years and always stay here. What sets it apart is the Club Lounge with the best views of Sydney. Don't waste your money on a harbour view room, just add the Club Lounge for $150 dollars. Much of it pays for itself when you factor in free wifi (saving daily $25), breakfast, evening drinks, etc I often work in Sydney and when I interview people in the lounge who have lived in Sydney all their lives, even they find the view jaw dropping. The view will literally make your trip if you are in Sydney for a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Class and Style”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: The IC is a beautiful hotel that meets your needs everytime. From the eager conceirge, to the reception staff, you are looked after well. My room was good, but the bed was even better. The location is second to none. You sit right next to icons like the Opera House and Circular Quay. Totally happy, and I am fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no banana”
Reviews.Author: FamilyonHolidays_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental Sydney but were a little disappointed that the furnishings didn't match the San Francisco intercontinental or the Sydney Westin. What we liked: lovely staff, great lobby, beautiful breakfast room, great position. Room for improvement: call me spoilt, but I can't sleep without a pillow-top mattress any more! Annoying requests: je voudrais real coffee in the rooms, and a slice of artisan bread with my poached eggs for breakfast. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect harbor view”
Reviews.Author: Brian W S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days. Had 17th floor harbor view. Excellent views from 31st floor lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: twin123185
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before a cruise and was very happy. I always stay at an Intercontinental when possible and this night was free for me as I get a free night a year with my Priority Rewards Visa card. For $49 per year its a steal as this hotel is over $400 US per night. The room had a good view and was a good size and comfy. The electric shades have inspired me to look into it at home. Location is a five minute walk to Circular Quay so the location is perfect. Also the opposite was it was a 10 minute walk to the main shopping area. Check in was efficient and friendly as was the greeting where I got out of the cab. The concierge team was very helpful with anything I asked about and were very knowledgeable. A word of warning for Americans - be prepared for sticker shock - food expensive - a cup of coffee, tea and ONE croissant was $22! We did not eat at the restaurants so I can't comment. This is a very good hotel and worthy of the Intercontinental name.

Reviews.Title: “As good as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: welshtraveller09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights 17 years ago and thought it might be the ideal location for a return visit to Sydney. My wife had stayed here separate to me on a few business trips about 8 to 12 years ago and she agreed with me. We were efficiently checked in for our harbour bridge view room and the room we got was exactly as it should be, roomy, very comfortable, with a superb view of the bridge. However, Sydney is a vibrant and lively city and we should have anticipated that a bridge view would inevitably mean a little city noise. The noise wasn't bad enough to worry 99% of people, but we live in the country, we'd just holidayed in NZ where everywhere we stayed our room was in total silence so we noticed the faint hum of traffic. We wouldn't have been disappointed if nothing could have been done, but we thought we'd check with reception anyway and they were superb. At a very reasonable rate we were able to upgrade to a higher floor where we had a view of both the bridge and opera house. It was a truly stunning view and was so quiet. We absolutely loved our stay, the hotel was top quality with great service and facilities. It was at least as good as my wife and I remembered and we're so glad we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: wunderful
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our visit to Sydney for our 25 year anniversary. We honeymooned there and my husband thought it would be romantic to go back. We only had 8 days so it was a long flight from California but well worth it. We picked this hotel because of trip advisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. We paid for a east harbor view but were upgraded to a full harbor view. There is hardly a prettier sight anywhere in the world. They light up the bridge and the harbor is spectacular. They have a little seat by the window where you can just soak up the beauty, day and night. What a great city and a great hotel. The staff were very responsive and went above and beyond. One night we couldn't get our internet to work in the room and they sent two individuals to come and work on it. They also never ask for tips and they seem to have a real desire to just help out. The concierge won some international award for being the best in the business. The only negative is that the restaurants are quite expensive. We did celebrate our 25th at the hotel restaurant, Etch. It was fabulous. Great place. Sydney is super expensive for Americans but the hotel is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but nothing special for 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Gloria S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend in February, the room was quite nice and very clean, bathroom a bit dated but for 5 star I expected something a bit more opulent. It was a great location, only a couple of minutes walk to Circular Quay. We also booked this room through Expedia - mystery hotel. Our room did not have a very good view mostly over office blocks, I also felt the blind did not keep out the afternoon sun. We did not have the breakfast as we thought it was quite expensive and it did not come with the room price. On arrival in a cab, no one offered to take our bag and no one showed us to our room, which is what I expected in this type of hotel. On checkout there was a very long line, they did offer the choice of checkout through a post box, but as we did not have a chance to view the account before hand this was not really a very good option. I also think that because we booked online through Expedia we were treated a little like second class guests. Probably the best thing about the hotel (if you ask) is that after checkout our flight was not for several hours and they allowed us up to the pool / gym area to take a shower or freshen up at no extra charge. All in all for under $350 per night it was a nice hotel in a good location just nothing more. Internet was very expensive $25 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very happy.”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of times last year. Both times were great, except for the unwanted upgrade. I can't say which room I booked or received but I know they gave me a free upgrade that I did appreciate but, didn't want or except. I believe the upgraded room had a bath and balcony but no spa, I luv spa's :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but something was a bit 'off'”
Reviews.Author: bid79
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Intercon when we have a special occasion to attend in Sydney. We recently stayed here for one night after getting an online deal. Our stay was lovely, with a spotless, newly refurbished, well laid-out room, friendly valet parking men and check-in staff, and possibly the best hotel breakfast Iâ€™ve ever had (or seen). I was however, left a little disappointed and felt as though we were treated as second-class guests â€“ perhaps due to booking online? In particular, we were given a room close to the lifts â€“ which would normally be absolutely fine, but with a sick husb, and a lot of noise from a crew of wedding guests when we checked in at 6:45pm, we asked to move rooms (nicely â€“ perhaps too nicely?) we were told that no others - in our class of rooms - were available. Then a $100 security fee took two weeks â€“ and about 5 phone calls to be removed from my credit card despite the hotel being paid-for upfront, there being no damage, and we didnâ€™t have anything from the minibar or in-house. The intercon has everything youâ€™d need to have a lovely time in Sydney. it remains my choice for a special weekend in sydney. But while the staff are very friendly, I think the system at the Intercontinental differentiates between guests, and as someone who books through an online reservations site, itâ€™s pretty clear that i am at the bottom of the Interconâ€™s food chain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: MB M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercon when we missed our flight home. This hotel has an amazing location! Not even two blocks from Circular Quay- with the Harbor Bridge and Opera House for your enjoyment. There are many restaurants and bars all in the area and the ferries are all right there as well-- making it easy to explore! The hotel staff was great and the rooms were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara J
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a week at the Intercontinental in Sydney. My room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was consistently helpful and friendly. We were able to negotiate a room rate that included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was great with lots of fresh fruit and yogurt as well as the traditional eggs, sausage, muffins... The location was perfect as it was within walking distance of our office as well as a plentiful choice of restaurants for dinner. The only negative was that Internet access was pricey. If I have the opportunity to visit Sydney again, the only reason I wouldn't stay at the Intercontinental was if I could get free Internet access at a hotel of the same caliber like the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “A very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Polycarp L
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The view from the 31st floor club room is excellent - i was able to skype with my wife and kids in London and show them the wonderful views - a truly amazing experience. The rooms are comfortable, but actually not as nice or as big as the intercontinental in Adelaide - that was truly 5 star plus. Staff are friendly and approachable. My TV was not working properly when I arrived and was fixed within 10mins. The food in the club room is ok - again not as good as the Adelaide Intercontinental. Anyhow - this is an excellent hotel - I can't complain - keep up the good work - may be well worth your while brightening up the rooms, like the Adelaide hotel! thanks Sam

Reviews.Title: “Don't event think about staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: Roomtraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are small, bathrooms are ridiculously old and employees are NOT friendly. Actually they treat customers as enemies! Never looking to accommodate our needs. Never seen something close to this. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. Seriously. The manager will write back saying next time they will take care of us. Guess what: no next time. And hopefully no next first time for my fellow travelers to stay away from a tourist trap!

Reviews.Title: “Just stay away....not kidding!”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveler55
Reviews.Content: The management of this property seemed to have a policy to "upsell" and "capture extra revenue" at any cost. Employees will sell you the harbor view for extra $50 a night. $150 a day to use the executive lounge, $30 for an umbrella, $60 for the wireless Internet and it doesn't stop. Things that other properties would give you as an amenity because of your Platinum status, here they chose to charge. and they recognize other hotels in the chain give amenities but they say they can't afford doing it. I will kid you not. When I asked what were the benefits for being a platinum member, the girl at the reception replied "you are able to earn points.....oh....and also redeem them!!" Woooow. All this was even before checking in. You will find a small run down, dirty carpet, overused mattresses room. Poor lighting and and old AC system. The bathroom is small, old and probably more a motel 6 type. They know about it an say that all rooms are the same, except the suites, which of course are their excuse to squeeze you $400 extra a night. I saw the general manager answers some reviews here so I decided to give him a call to discuss my points of view, while at the hotel. I got his assistant voice mail, a manager on duty and then an excuse that he was out. Never heard from him. I guess it's easier to just reply to tripadvisor comments once the damage is done, although very, very expensive Mr Fred. The hotel has a good location. The lobby is very small and old. The restaurant and lobby bar are not nice and give you the impression of being more a holiday inn or a 4 starts hotel type. Poor lighting and cold ambiance. If you are the kind of traveler that just having a bed and a bathroom make you happy and are not detail oriented, than I guess this hotel would be ok, if you got a rate of $140-180tops. If you are detailed oriented, your hotel room is an essential part of your travel experience and like using the hotel facilities, just stay away, I am not kidding. And to the hotel management: don't try responding all comments here, acknowledge that you have not invested in the property, that you are running on low margins and just rebrand the property to something that suits a different profile that is not Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JolieRose
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is beautiful, the service is good, but the location is supreme. Unfortunately, we were busy doing other things and spent very little time at the hotel which in turn made us doubt the price we paid. If you're going to spend more time at the hotel, I would recommend it. If not, its probably not worth the money. I would definitely go back though.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: nmclennan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel from 14th - 19th February in a Club King Opera House view room. I was attending a conference in Sydney during the week and my wife joined me for the final two days of the stay. This was the first time I had stayed at this hotel - we usually stay at the Four Seasons or the Westin. I would rate my arrival as a 1 out of 10. It was not busy at Reception and the Receptionist who checked me in was quite surly. There was certainly no 'Welcome to the InterContinental Hotel." It was very matter of fact and here's your key. I was surprised at the small size of the room, particularly the bathroom. The shower was in the bath tub with a plastic shower curtain. Also, the bathroom had only 1 sink. I was expecting more for a Club King room. The king sized bed was the smallest king size bed I have ever slept in and for me, was not that comfortable. My wife found the bed to be very comfortable. After my very unwelcoming reception experience and my initial impressions of the room, I wished at that point, I had kept my booking at the Four Seasons. Room service was OK. I ate in the room for three of the nights. On every occassion the person taking the order over-promised and under-delivered. Each night they told me that it would be up in 30-35 minutes. On two of the nights it was 50 minutes plus before the food was delivered. But the longer I stayed at the hotel, the more I enjoyed it. The view was incredible - these Opera House rooms face the harbour and look straight out onto the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The location is down the Circular Quay end of town. It was probably about a fifteen minute walk to the main shops in the centre of town. But this location is very convenient if you are going to travel on the Sydney ferries to the beatiful surrounding areas and attractions like Watson's Bay, Taronga Zoo, Double Bay & Manly. The Club lounge was interesting. Staff were very professional, friendly and generally attentive. Breakfast buffet was just like any other basic buffet - nothing special here. Afternoon tea comprised a selection of small cakes, scones and some finger sandwiches. The evening cocktails were served from 5.00 pm to 7.00 pm - the views were amazing from the Club lounge at this time of day. There is a menu of drinks to choose from - if you deviate from that list you then pay for what you order (I have never struck this before) - there is no champagne on the list - that was $30+ per glass. There is no food put out to help yourself - you are served a chef's platter of 3 different hors d'oeuvres at your table - that is it. The hors d'oeuvres were consistently good and very well presented and each hors d'oeuvre was explained by a very polite young waiter with a great French accent. We have enjoyed many club lounges over the years - this one was the most unusual in terms of their offering. Rod Stewart and his family were staying here during his Syndey concerts and we saw them in the Club lounge for breakfast. The Club lounge always seemed very hot - it felt like the air-conditioning was not working. Overall, we enjoyed our time at this hotel. It is certainly not the most luxurious five star hotel you could stay at in Sydney - but location is great, views are stunning and staff are very well trained, professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service made for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: blowenz
Reviews.Content: Location close to Eastern Distributor on and off ramp which is convenient. Also a minute walk to Circular Quay (Rocks, Opera House). A bit of a walk to the Pitt St Mall shops but use the 555 free bus at the Circular Quay bus stop - does the city circuit at 10 minute intervals. Hotel is well presented and rooms are very clean and well furnished. However, bathrooms looked dated and could do with an upgrade. Beds great and towels nice and thick. Great views. Gym was good but very hot the day I visited around 5pm. The room service was good except the dessert was not to my liking (creme caramel). Breakfast buffet was good also but expensive at $40. Service is fantastic, professional, attentive and friendly from valet parking, check in and check out, and particularly liked the Instant Service phone function. I had trouble logging onto the hotel wifi for an urgent message I needed before leaving for an appointment. The lady who helped me gave me free 30 minutes in the Business Centre and helped save the day as I picked up my message on the way out. This happened around 5pm 22 Feb so I hope this is read by management and she is commended. Will definitely stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most famous and favorite InterContinentals in the world - all for the right reasons.”
Reviews.Author: ck050877
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for a short business trip and booked this hotel as soon as I knew I was going to Sydney. I heard so much about it, especially about the Club lounge and the "Best View" of Opera House and Bridge in the city. The hotel pleased me a lot, because of : A) Location, Location, Location B) service. Especially since they employ and train so many young people with great ambitions and great customer service, this is definitely good. C) one of the best Club lounges am. InterContinental can offer. Even tops the one in Dubai... I would definitively return, even though this is a grand dame and not one of the brand new InterContinentals, but especially since it has that soul it is attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding night accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our reception. Checked in to the 26th floor with eastern harbor views (great!). Rooms were very nice & clean. We were offered a free late check out but we didn't arrive until after midnight. Breakfast was great. Location is very close to circular quay & the botanical gardens are right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Poorest intercontinental experience to date”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemikesyd
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the intercon bangkok, ho chi minh and now sydney. Service was poor. Air conditioning vent had grease marks around it. First room had no iphone charger but second room did. Shower in a bath ? I thought that went out with grandmas house. Overall poor quality and do not believe it rates with other intercontinentals which are truly 5 star. I would rate it a 4 1/2

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect of a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikey-st1
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Sydney is everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. Perfect location within walking distance of the Opera House and Circular Quay. The staff are very professional and efficient. I required the usage of the Business Centre which was more than adequate. The rooms are comfortable, clean and have all modern fittings. The breakfast was outstanding, a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience, breakfast was a highlight”
Reviews.Author: Lynda O
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on the 7 January 2012 in room 1401. We had just joined the Ambassador program using our points. We also stayed two years ago with my husbandâ€™s boss with me booking the accommodation as I had always wanted to stay at the Intercontinental. I have to say the first experience was great and thankfully left an impression on our bosses as well. We were only talking about it the other day and they remarked that it was the best hotel they have stayed in Sydney. We were hoping with our booking in January for a repeat experience and it was so much better than we anticipated and I have high standards. We also just joined as Ambassador members as well so were looking forward to the extra touches especially the late checkout of 4pm. We were on a package that included breakfast and valet parking. Can I just say the breakfast was out of this world. It was such a sensory experience. The best breakfast we have ever had. I honestly could not stop touching and looking at everything and next time will pause on the coffee to have later at the end of my breakfast. To other guests go early and leave time to really enjoy. It was so different to the breakfast we have a few years earlier. A great investment as it was the highlight of our stay. I cannot remember the name of those yoghurts and must as they were in such cute bottles, organic and the farmers deserve so much credit. To those staying try and stay on a package with breakfast included as it really is a must you will not be disappointed. It does appear expensive if you were paying for it not included in a package but after going there I now beg to differ. An improvement would be to have the staff in sections as we went early and at times I felt the staff was hovering yet they were always very polite. I must admit being an experienced traveller I did Google trip advisor and was surprised the comments werenâ€™t better. I was taken aback that customer service seemed an issue. When everyone takes the time to go away you just want it to be such a great experience as time is really precious. Well I can honestly say we were blown away. Our room was ready for us an hour earlier. I requested a high floor and though it wasnâ€™t as high as I would have liked the room number I now believe is what counts. We were in 1401 and the views were spectacular. As Ambassador members we received complimentary fruit and bottled water, there was a Mind/Body magazine and a surprise - a beautiful bottle of red wine. This was a really nice touch as everyone likes surprises and if management are reading this it is really nice as most people who become Ambassadors know what extras to expect and to have a surprise well everyone needs more of those in life and it was a really nice touch. The only suggestion is before saying the room is ready is to ensure these are in the room prior to showing the guests as people will have expectations and then enter and in my mind I was thinking where are the extras. I said to my husband letâ€™s just go out and I am sure they will be there when we return and sure enough they were. However, a better approach would be not to leave the guest wondering in the first place as first impressions count. We went to Jamieâ€™s Italian that night which was fantastic, finishing off at the Intercontinental as I love the interior where you can have a nightcap. It was great not to rush the next morning so the choice of a late checkout is a great idea and feels like we had more time away and will encourage us to be back for another short weekend soon. Can I just say as repeat Ambassadors try and keep up that element of surprise for our next trip and for other travellers as it really made a difference? I have to also say I found the staff always polite and always smiling. I understand others may have had a different experience but we could not really fault the service. We had a sneak peak at the club level and would really like to try this next time but want to have breakfast downstairs as I am itching to go back for this experience alone. It was truly a great two days away and felt like longer. Thank you and we hope it is just as good next time. Lynda O and Gregory Miles

Reviews.Title: “five star”
Reviews.Author: peteTimaru
Reviews.Content: this is a well located hotel in the centre of Sydney park across the road for walks,close to the opera house and water front,shops near by as well.The hotel is high standard with lovely dining areas

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: LBriggs
Reviews.Content: The good the location is v good, opposite the museum of Sydney and a block from circular quay. The views, a long as you are high enough, are great. It's clean The staff are very friendly and helpful. Beds are very comfortable. The bad The rooms, particularly the bathrooms, are looking a bit tired. The breakfast is hideously expensive and just a buffet. They hung up towels I left on the floor for replacing. They only change the linen every three days. I think I would try the Sofitel or the Westin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a very short walk from the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: paulagayefisher
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Sydney and stayed at this hotel - a little bit pricey but very convenient for all Sydney's sights and transport around the city either by bus or by ferry. Great views if you have the right room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_49
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Sydney for the first time and chose Intercontinental Hotel. This hotel is amazing. Fantastic location one block from Opera House, Botanical Gardens and waterside! Great rooms and fantastic harbor view rooms. service was excellent and the breakfast included in our rate was the best continental breakfast we have had by a hotel. Much better location and views than Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jajuco
Reviews.Content: If you choose this hotel, make sure to book a 'Club room' you will not be disappointed. We had 2 hours 5-7pm of canopes & drinks, overlooking one of the most gorgeous cities in the world! Being that they are included I thought they might be a little slow, however this was not the case, and the staff were lovely & friendly. Breakfast is also in the Club room, and after a meal out we would head back for a night cap or 2, (latte/cappuccino coffee & tea are included in Club room price). Rooms were clean & comfortable as you would expect. The staff immediately provided a wheelchair for my mother upon request, who couldn't keep up with our pace while sightseeing, so that made life so much easier. Can't wait to go back, everyone deserves to be spoilt for a while :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and pool; average otherwise in its class”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: Steps to Circular Quay and the ferries, the Opera House and its wonderful promenade of outdoor restaurants, the Domain and the Botanical Gardens. The view from the pool over Sydney Harbor was excellent. We were there a few days prior to the annual New Year's Eve fireworks extravaganza and regretted we had planned differently our itinerary. Restaurant meals were ostentatious and very pricey like many premium hotels but that is an unfortunate part of Sydney's current charm. Very awkward front entrance set up, potentially dangerous to pedestrian guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel overlooking Sydney Harbour & Opera House”
Reviews.Author: DorothyOz
Reviews.Content: One cannot pick a better location than this hotel. We booked Club rooms from the road on iphone and was upgraded the first nite to a suite. Wow was it fantastic! a corner living room and separate bedroom but since the rate was 1800 a nite, I had not booked it. Instead I choose the regular club room and was delighted when we were upgraded due to my Ambassador Intercontinental membership. It is literally a small city block from Opera House and was again super easy with GPS to drive into town and see the building as I exited the highway- though entrance was around the corner on opposite side we arrived super easy. Service was great, check-in and out was exceptional, valet was great as expected and again the Club was wonderful. The regular room- still Club level again had an exception view of Opera and Harbour but was on the smaller side-however due to proximity, I would choose it again. The Club it quite large with ceiling to floor glass walls- it has an outside wrap around deck with table chairs outside for unbelievable views of Sydney. Though drinks are only complimentary during the hors doerves hours, one can order drinks and even dinner and charge to room at any time. Breakfast was included and was great. The only thing I would do to improve would be to have self serve coffee. The staff and manager were wonderful and helpful- suggested a simple Neutral Bay boat ride which was perfect for us as my husband has mbility issues and was a good analysis by the Club Manager to suggest that simplier trip of the Harbour. Would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I booked a club room. Among the 5 star hotel chains I would rate it as OK. The beds are not overly comfortable and no match for those at Sheraton or Westin. Service in the club was deplorable. It took more than 15 minutes after I was seated at breakfast to be offered tea or coffee. They managed to stuff up my partner's order for tea also, which eventually arrived half an hour into our breakfast. The best thing about the hotel is the location next to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury home away from home”
Reviews.Author: vornb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very fussy as we're used to staying in the best hotels and our expectations are high. We have been very happy with the InterContinental in Hong Kong. It's one of our favourite hotels in the world. This was our first time in this hotel in Sydney as we usually support the Park Hyatt which has been closed for renovations. It was a different experience with old, charming architecture of the building. We were pleased to be upgraded to a Governor's suite for being an InterContinental Ambassador member. The room was very large with fantastic views of the opera house and harbour bridge. To be honest , although very clean and tidy, the room is in need of refurbishment as the decor is outdated. Service and the way were treated was fantastic. We had a very enjoyable stay and can recommend this luxurious hotel, it's great staff and fantastic location a few steps walk from Sydney harbour. We look forward to returning! Vaughan Bullivant - Daydream Island resort

Reviews.Title: “A top rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie D
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. The staff at check in were very good - quick & very helpful. Our room was amazing, such a good view to the Bridge, gardens, etc. One of the best locations in the city. Only 2 minutes walk to the Opera House & Circular Quay! All of the services offered by the Intercon were fantastic. We did, however, experience poor service in the Cortile lounge and the room service menus are incredibly expensive (think $30 for a small omelette). You're much better off going for a walk into the city - i.e. The Rocks area or Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kgiberson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Location was near wharfs, restaurants, Sydney Opera House, shopping, whatever you want to do. The staff is extraordinarily supurb. Very pleasant, professional, and courteous, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: extr3me_84
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! I arrived around 9 am at the hotel and I can have an early check in. It is perfect for me after spending the overnight on the plane. The location of this hotel is great with just 2 minute walk from Circular Quay station and not in a congested area. The pier and Sydney Opera House are just within walking distance which is perfect for someone who wants to do the Opera House backstage tour that starts at 7 am. The room is comfortable, clean and spacious. I can also listen to the radio or television in the bathroom. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay here very much even though I didn't get a harbour view. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: Toptown
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy our stay as it is right in town.Would always be happy to stay here when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect for us and breakfast was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RedNailz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the advice of our travel agent, who said, "It's a once-in-a-lifetime trip, so you should spend a little extra and get a good view..." While we didn't get a harbour view, we were perfectly happy with the bay view (which included the Royal Botanic Gardens). Beautiful! The location was great: not in a congested area but close enough for us to either walk, catch a bus, or take a ferry wherever we wanted to go. Service was good all around. Our room was not ready when we arrived at about 11:00 a.m., so, having just completed a 14-hour flight, we asked for a place to change clothes. We were given access to the club showers and locker rooms. These were very clean and well-stocked. However, the pool area looked small. We also made use of the concierge service throughout our stay and found them to be very helpful. TIP: Purchase discounted Opera House tour tickets via the concierge. I had no idea we could do this and really overpaid. By chance, we happened to get the breakfast buffet included due to some U.S. market promotion. This was valuable, considering what breakfast would have cost us otherwise. And it was very good! I absolutely loved the muffins, pastries, yogurt (yoghurt, actually), bacon, eggs, fresh fruit, bread, fresh butter, jams, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for people on expenses”
Reviews.Author: moumoulous
Reviews.Content: Fabulous views from our room , corporate style room with very comfy bed. Are the views worth Â£400? Perhaps not. Can't comment on food but gin and tonic worst ever packed full of ice and little gin. Concierge service exemplary, not only do you receive written confirmation of your request but also displayed on your tv.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but lacking atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Southdown_Man
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is an ideal located hotel for Circular Quay, it would not be one of my favourite Intercontinentals. We arrived late evening and whilst check in was fairly friendly, I got the impression that because we were using an Ambassador voucher we could be treated a little less than one would expect. Club access was offered at $150.00 per night which is extremely high, particularly looking at some of the recent reviews about charges. We had an East Harbour view which was an upgrade in accordance with my Ambassador privileges! The room was fine and kept well attened during our stay. Breakfast in Cafe Opera was fine, reasonable choice for the continental selection but the cooked section was very lacking. Check out was fine although if you have a shuttle booked you have to exit from the side entrance which means you have to lug your luggage up to sets of steps, albeit only four or five steps each, but with heavy luggage and no assistance it is not one expects from this grade of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better every time”
Reviews.Author: DCM51
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at this hotel and have enjoyed it on every occasion. Small problems are dealt with efficiently and courteously. The club lounge is a wonderful environment with excellent views and superb staff who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. As we arrived at the hotel I wondered if we would try somewhere else next time for a change, but everything went so well and all the staff were so welcoming that this thought soon vanished. The views from the room of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House are stunning. For those visiting the Opera House the location is excellent. Easy walk through the Botanic Gardens to the Art Gallery of New South Wales.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: RamaDrama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Intercontinental during our Aus/NZ trip. The room was perfect with the view to Sydney Harbor Bridge. We chose the Harbor view room. It's perfect location and just few minutes to best restaurants and harbor area. I would not recommend the breakfast in the hotel as there are many restaurants nearby. I want to specially thank the person who took me to the top most floor on the last night of our stay so i could take some great pictures of Harbor bridge and Sydney opera house. Do not miss the view from top most bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ouzo09
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room was ready when we arrived at 10 am. Fab view from room worth upgrade. Pool disappointing for 5 star very strange layout but super views. Drinks expensive but location and decor make up for it. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Clifton
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed five beautiful days both at the Intercontinental and in Sydney. It was a first for us at the hotel and upon leaving immediately said this is where we will stay when we are next in Sydney. Views to die for, close to Circular Quay, 20 minutes to the airport, The Rocks only a 5 minute walk away, great service, excellent room, the Bridge and the Opera House you can nearly reach out and touch etc etc. Darling Harbour, the shops, the gardens and more are all within easy walking distance. Absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Hotel In Every Sense”
Reviews.Author: confused_11
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and this is my favourite Hotel. The staff are first class, and the rooms excellent. The view of the Opera House is great, and the atmosphere is relaxing. Afternoon tea in the lobby area, or early evening drink is really good. The restaurant, as you might expect is also really good. You might expect this from a first class hotel, but so many let you down. I was told that one reason this hotel excels, is because it is (or was?) used as a training base for its staff interationally. The only problem I found is that like many American Hotel chains, there is an insistence that you book through the Central Reservation Centre, which is usually based in the USA. I hate that so much that I always find ways to contact the Hotel itself - much more satisfying. Whenever I stay in Sydney now - even for a vacation - I always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb view, couldn't be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: KLmum
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6am after a 23 hour flight and were absolutely delighted to find we were able to get into our room straight away (although our travel company had warned us we wouldn't get access until 3pm). The room (2101) was a reasonable size for the four of us and our view was spectacular - although we had to pay extra for it. I would have felt cheated coming to Sydney and not being able to look out over the harbour and bridge. The concierge and reception staff were amazingly helpful and the breakfast was wonderful. Since we were still on UK time and ravenous, the range of cooked and contintal choices enabled us to eat as if it were dinner for several days. As we gradually adapted we headed out to cafes and food stalls in the Rocks, 10 minutes walk away. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bandmanjp
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was in a perfect location, just a couple of blocks from the harbor and a short distance from the Rocks. It was a modern hotel with all the modern conveniences you might expect. It was not a cheap place to stay, but well worth it for all the right reasons. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great rooms and beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: ABA17
Reviews.Content: Our room was the Deluxe Harbour Bridge View on the north side of the building. The view of the bridge is clear and uninterrupted. However because we were on the 14th floor there was another building directly in front of our window, but it did not interfere with the view of the bridge. You can also get a slight view of the opera house. The room was clean and more spacious than I expected for a room with a king size bed. There is seating area right by the window and a sofa, which was nice to have. The bathroom was clean and a decent size. Between the bathroom and room there is a window which was interesting. I found out towards the end of my stay that you can also listen to the TV in the bathroom - thereâ€™s a turning knob by the power outlet that controls the sound. My favorite part of this hotel is its proximity to Circular Quay (less than 5 minute walk down the hill), the Opera House (approx 10 minute walk) and The Rocks and Harbour Bridge (approx 10-15 minute walk for great photos). In addition to its location, the staff is friendly and accommodating. We were greeted warmly and with a smile each time. I didnâ€™t purchase a club pass as the weather wasnâ€™t great for photos (which was be the primary reason for me to go up there) though I would recommend purchasing one if you have good weather. Thereâ€™s also a back entrance to the hotel that will bring you directly to the perimeter of the Royal Botanic Gardens â€“ walk past Concierge and go up the stairs and make a left. It is also the smoking area for guests. Because our stay was so short, we didnâ€™t order any room service as we wanted to venture out in the city so I canâ€™t comment on that part of the hotel service. I was considering on staying at the Shangri-La and Four Seasons but am very happy that I chose the Intercontinental. We had such a short stay in Sydney (only 1 full day) and this hotel added value and memories to our very short trip. Important points to consider: - Location! Location! Location! Itâ€™s literally steps away from the Circular Quay and the Royal Botanic Gardens and the Museum of Sydney (across the street from the hotel) - Short walk to the Opera House, The Rocks and for taking photos of the Harbour Bridge - Great staff! - Awesome views of the Bridge â€“ try to get a room on the north side and higher floor

Reviews.Title: “Super Suite!”
Reviews.Author: 2far
Reviews.Content: July 2010 We decided to try the IC after our disappointing stay at the FS Sydney and our Virtuoso advisors recommendation. At check in we were warmly greeted by the assistant manager and upgraded to a Governors Suite from the Deluxe Club Harbor View Suite, we paid for. The Governors Suite is 110sq meters with a panoramic view of Sydney harbor and opera house. The suite has a large panoramic view lounge room with a flat screen TV and Bose sound system; there was also a full dining room with a view downtown view and the bridge view. Also there was an office with a desk, fax machine, computer etc. The bedroom was quite large as was the bath with Jacuzzi off the bedroom. There was also a guest bathroom, and a large entryway. To put it lightly the place was jaw dropping over the top fabulous! It is my wifeâ€™s favorite room to which all others are measured. There was a club on the 30th floor for club floor rooms. Drinks and snacks are offered during cocktail hours. Service is very slow and one can only order drinks and orders one at a time from a very slow waiter. The next night we just had wine in our suite and avoided waiting. The Governors suite was much more comfortable than the club anyway. The hotel is located easy walking distance to the opera house and Sydney harbor. We visited Australia when a USD yielded 1.27 AUD, so rates at the hotel were reasonable. With the AUD as strong as it is we are avoiding Sydney as things are much more expensive and we do not find good travel value there. The Governors suite is still our favorite suite, thus far, in the world, and the hotel staff (except at the club) are excellent. Weekend rate s are worth looking into for they represent a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Harbour Bridge view room 16th floor”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang H
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception and very friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay - 5 minute easy walk. Walking distance to city shopping area MYER-DAVID JONES Westfield etc. Cafe' Opra had nice buffet breakfast. Dinner was very good quality but served a little too cold. Etch Restaurant food was excellent and evrything was very good & nice atmosphere. Atrium coffee/tea/wine and cake area was a place we enjoyed every night after going out. Room was very nice and had everything we needed and expected from a classy Hotel. Swimming pool and Gym area are very nice. Also nice view to the Harbour from 30th floor. Best Hotel we have stayed in so far in Oz and we will be back in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this lovely hotel, well situated in Sydney just a few blocks from the Circular Quay and the shopping areas and across the street from the lovely Royal Botanical Gardens. Other than the somewhat small bathroom, the room was lovely, spacious and modern, with effective lighting, authomatic shade and very comfortable bed. The concierge services were the best we've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in IC, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: r15xeb
Reviews.Content: Stunning views in the club, fantastic suites but priced accordingly. Staff generally friendly, but, annoying all drinks shown in the club are not included - champagne bottles and Louis XIII are prominently displayed! A few service errors, like our luggage was lost for 15 minutes, but overall very enjoyable! $45 for guests on the lounge borders on the unacceptable too.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - very impressed - a true 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: MickiAustralia
Reviews.Content: Last trip we stayed in a club room and the whole club experience was fantastic. This time we stayed in an Eastern Harbour View room Pros The views out over the harbour and Botanic Gardens were spectacular ! The fab, big and supremely comfy bed with good quality bed linen Postion - very handy for visiting the Opera House, The Rocks etc, 15 minute walk to Myers David Jones. Breakfast in Cafe Opera was excellent - great ambience, plenty of staff so service was efficient (this is often not the case in Australian hotels)Terrific choice of top quality food on offer. Price - an absolute steal at $275 per night including valet parking and breakfast for 2. (We are Intercon Ambassador members so we get a free upgrade, 4 pm check out etc) Cons The bathroom was fairly ordinary and small - could do with an upgrade sometime soon We loved our Intercon Sydney experience and will be back for sure. Thank you for a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best views from Club Intercontinental lounge in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDentistUK
Reviews.Content: This is an excellently situated hotel with the best views from the club lounge in Sydney, better than the Four Seasons or Shangri-La Hotels.The service is excellent and the lounge is open on New Year's Eve for CLub guests which is brilliant. The lounge has views of both the bridge an Opera house from a great angle.It is a 5 min walk to circular quay and the restaurants at the Opera House, ferries to Manly Beach are close by which is much better than Bondi Beach. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why are they so tough on reward stays ?”
Reviews.Author: mrittmayer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and to be quite honest the location is one of the best in the world. However that said the hotel staff and management was for some reason extremely high strung for Australia and they made me feel quite uncomfortable. The lounge personnel looked at you twice during the happy hours and it always felt like they were out to add-on extra money to your bill and tried to charge you when the time was up. They slow served during happy hour and the minute the "free session" was over they were there to ask if you wanted more....the front desk staff had to apoligise for misinformation several times, rather than agree to a guest and take it as a lesson they generally tended to disagree and then later after it was found there stance was incorrect than they apoligise. This would be reflective of harsh management as everyone says "no" first and then works to yes...which is extremely frustrating and mentally consuming...just what you need at a 5**** hotel. Anything grey = "NO !" Rather than an excellent trip, it was tainted with this constant pressure that our $$$ not we were wanted...so while I would stay there again it is not your normal friendly IC hotel so be ready and print everything and keep records of all conversations you have with different people at IC including reservations and rates...if you can handle that you'll enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lolatraveller
Reviews.Content: Four of us just experienced a most disappointing Christmas lunch at the Cafe Opera. As family were overseas we decided to book as many years ago we had an excellent dinner there. All of us agreed that the lobster was the worst we had ever had. Tasteless, like cotton wool. The cook should know that if you defrost frozen lobster in fresh water that it takes the taste out & you need to put salt in the water to bring the taste back.The waiter did try and replaced our first lot but second just as bad.There was no sign of a whole turkey being carved. The oysters were the smallest we had ever seen as if the hotel was buying the smallest oysters to save costs & for $220 we would expect normal sized Sydney rock oysters .The ham was good and desserts also but we all agreed that we had paid over the top and that none of us would ever repeat the experience. As someone who had nearly 30 years in tourism and did site inspections of European hotels, this felt far below the Intercontinental standard. Staff seemed to be 'training'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: teegs64
Reviews.Content: I was quite happy with my stay at this hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious and they allow baby's to stay in the room with you which was great. The bathroom was a bit out dated and the shower had a shower curtain, not really what you expect for 5 star. The staff were excellent and so polite. They came up to our room and collected our bags and had them packed into out car ready for us on check out. Breakfast was fantastic. Overall very happy with our stay. Would recommend it. Good value on the Sydney package with breakfast and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Ezz17
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Intercontinental. We stayed in a city view room, and it was very comfortable, and the view was still good. Room had a window seat which you could see the harbour from if you leant against the wall. The concierge was very helpful and social and offered us a room on the 22nd floor, and a late checkout for free because we were checking in early. The view from the pool was awesome! Only negative I can say is that the coffee in the Cortile lounge was very very overpriced - $7 for an espresso! So I recommend going elsewhere for coffee. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel very close to The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: In a good spot, my opinion is that the Intercontinental is one of the better higher star rated hotels in Sydney CBD to stay at. All the things you would expect from a 5 star hotel - soft white fluffy robes, great pillows, good sized bathroom, fantastic bar and personable, friendly staff.
