The Intercontinental is just a short walk to The Rocks, Opera House and Circular Quay. I had a great view of the Harbour Bridge. Definitely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, Top Location, Top Service”
Reviews.Author: ozmuzziemoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located close to Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge & the city. We opted for a Club Room which gave us access to the club lounge on the 31st floor where we were provided with breakfast & complimentary food & drinks late afternoon. the views from this area were stunning. There was also complimentary wifi in this area. In all read of the hotel the staff & service were excellent. We will stay here again -:)

Reviews.Title: “Old style hotel with Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: wierzbaski
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, payed 150 $ for Club loung access. Which is not worth it at all. You get a small platter and if you ask for seconds then they rudely tell you to be patient and you might get some if there are leftovers, How rude is that. Mattress was old and worn, gave me a bad back ache. Never ever again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend in Sydney starts with the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: mmerc2004
Reviews.Content: Booked a Fri/Sat night stay at the Intercontinental Sydney for a nice weekend break after a week on the Gold Coast (I know, tough trip). The intercontinental lived up to expectation despite its position on the block and strange entrance and exit from the street. My taxi driver was a newbie and didn't drop me off at the lobby, so it wasn't just me. Despite this, the hotel is PERFECTLY situated for all the wonderful places you want to see in Sydney and made an ideal base for all my walking tours around downtown. With Hyde Park, The Domain, the Museum, Circular Quay, the Opera House, The Rocks, and every other highlight within sight of the hotel (literally used the building for navigation), I was able to cover the entire downtown, night and day, from the location just blocks from the touristy craziness of the Quay, to the peaceful and beautiful sculptures in Hyde Park, I can't remember when I have enjoyed a stay so much. The room itself was compact (regular king) but very stylish and well thought out. My three tenets of travel were more than covered; noise (nonexistent), sheets/bedding ( superb!), and towels/bath (thick and adequate). There was a nice touch for a news hound like myself. In the bath, there was a tv speaker and a small window that you could open to watch the market news while shaving. All my meals and entertainment were outside the hotel, so cannot comment on the restaurants, but the smells in the lobby hinted of a delicious meal or two. Beyond that, I cannot say enough about the good people of Sydney. I so completely enjoyed my weekend, due in large part to the happy, smiling, cordial people of Australia. Despite traveling by myself, I never felt alone or wanting for company. Every pub and table was open to the this wayward traveler, with interesting conversation and good friends just a 'hello' away.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: garrymenon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really fantastic. I liked everything: the size of the room, the size of the bathroom, the big window in the bathroom, the unusual but very well-thought layout of the room,the delicious buffet breakfast and the wonderfully positive hotel staff. This hotel is well above the...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: fizzscottle
Reviews.Content: Hi, I recently stayed at the InterContinental last month and it was excellent. The value is great. On arrival, the room was very clean and the room had air conditioning and on arrival, I got upgraded to a larger room with a view over the harbour. Would highly reccommend. The indoor poor and the extensive gym equiptment was pleasing and the location isn't that bad even though it isn't right in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “The Intercontinental Experience is hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: FRANK11528
Reviews.Content: I recently had a 3 nights stay on 10 December 2011 in my favourite hotel in Sydney. I have stayed there may times before and as a Gold Ambassador Member the extended check out time to 4.00pm is particularly convenient. Location is away from the hustle and bustle of the main cbd but close enough if you care you walk to offices and/or shopping destinations. I had the harbour executive suite which is a corner room with the amazing view of the best harbour of the world, including the Harbour Bridge and The Opera House. Checkin was seamless and took less than 5 minutes. There was already a welcome fruit platter in the room and my extra hard pillow was also there. The Staff are courteous and not overly friendly - I mean, I don't really want every single hotel staff to greet me with a big smile and a 'hello'. As this is a relatively old building, certain features of the rooms are in need of rejuvenation. Hence the missing star in the five star rating. I am sure Management is aware of this - must be hard to find a timetable to do it as this is a very popular hotel and consequently often full.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the (real) "Suite" life”
Reviews.Author: jetsettter
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Intercontinental Ambassador programme, I was looking forward to my "upgrade" with some excitement for our 2 night stay. So upon checking in at the Club level of the hotel with the stunning Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House as our background, it was even more stunning to find that our upgrade was in fact to a State Suite, a further level higher than expected. The State Suite was huge, occupying a corner of the hotel on the 30th Floor, with a separate living room that afforded post card views of the harbour, the bridge, the opera house and the heads. The suite also had a baby grand piano, perfect for budding song writers in need of inspiration or perhaps a private gathering with a pianist - I'm sure the options are endless. The living room could easily accommodate a private soiree, or an intimate dinner for 6 such is its flexibility. Adding to the ambience of the Baby Grand is the Bose surround sound system with iPod/phone dock. The Suite amenities are also upgraded from the mini bar inside a larger fridge in its own galley kitchen, the upgraded Chopard personal amenities to the complimentary spirit and wine selection (750ml bottles). A separate toilet, walk in wardrobe, spa bath and twin vanities round out the Suite design. These are "Club" suites so when staying in one of these rooms you'll have access to the Club located on the 31st Floor of the hotel with views of the city, the harbour and the city's east. Whatever the superlatives used, they all fit. Simply one of the most iconic views in Australia. Could talk about the view all day..... The staff were friendly and attentive although not engaging and I was never addressed by name (and no...I'm not important - it's a comment based on previous club experiences around the world) and although a couple of the staff knew and recognised us when we returned to the club other staff did not. Apart from that, the food quality (Breakfast, morning and afternoon tea and pre-dinner hors d'ouvres), the table service, the coffee and other drinks, all delivered without any problems. We enjoyed dinner at the Opera Cafe (full restaurant service), lovely ambience, excellent menu choice and best of all excellent food quality. Highly recommend this restaurant even if itâ€™s a little pricey but thatâ€™s Sydney! Room service food was equally good, the Signature "Club Sandwich" was wonderfully tasty and it was delivered hot and in good time. Recommend that as well!! Okay, that was all the good stuff.... These suites retail on the IC website for $2900 per night (2012) and whilst I am certain you could get them cheaper via alternative channels there are a couple of things that let the room and the hotel down. First up is the internet. Itâ€™s patchy in the suite and it is NOT included in the rate. You'll get $50 bottles of alcohol included but you will have to pay some $20 per day for the internet. Yep I donâ€™t get it either. Just ask at check-out to have it waived. My guess is they will. The king bed in our suite needed replacement. The pillow top was very ordinary and the bed also seemed a little short - may have been my eyes.... No slippers, we had to request them. An oversight maybe. A phone system that was impossible to know how to work (good thing they had an old style one as well) and with no instructions that I could find. A very very noisy fridge and some traffic noise from the expressway on the bedroom side. From the loyalty point of view, no welcome letter. All that aside (it may have been an off day), much of which will not affect every traveller, this Intercontinental is in a great location close to the Ferries, the city centre and a 15 minutesâ€™ walk to the rocks. I would recommend the suites to those who were looking for an option for a private dinner party, an intimate honeymoon option (although for the price you could probably go OS), or perhaps an intimate wedding. A romantic stay would also suit. It certainly has the view. Would I stay again? If I could get that room and a better bed - in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Melaluka23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked one night in a city view room but were pleasantly surprised by an upgrade on check in as we had informed them it was our fourth wedding anniversary. Our upgraded room overlooked the Botanical Gardens and the eastern part of the harbour. Unfortunately our view also included the Cahill Expressway but the noise wasn't too bad (we were on the 11th floor) unless a police car with a siren went past. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. We had access to the pool and the view from there was stunning! What impressed me the most about this hotel was the service from the staff. They are so naturally friendly, eager to help and no request is too much. I've never experienced such friendliness at a hotel like this before. The other highlight was the buffet breakfast. Make sure you book this - delicious. The omlette was divine and the array of food amazing. I am gluten free so I was happy to find things I could eat such as gluten free cereal and bread. I kept thinking about the food for the rest of the day. Yummm. This IC hotel is also a very short walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Perfect location. It also isn't far to walk to the Domain, Hyde Park or a number of museums and art galleries. If i could, i'd rate the hotel 4 and a half stars but i can't select that. The only thing i'd change is the rooms could be improved a little in appearance and the busy road outside my window wasn't great but if you pay more for a better room this wouldn't be a problem. We had such a great time, we hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GES57
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with Intercontinental. The whole feel of it, the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff, the beautiful lobby/ cafe/sitting area and of course the position just right outside the Sydney Museum and across the road from the Botanical Gardens and near Circular Square makes it the perfect base. The rooms are spacious and luxurious with great views and the pool on roof level affords even better vistas. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a lot of Intercontinental group hotels, this is one of the better ones in Australia. From check in to check out the staff were excellent. The views from the club lounge are fantastic, the staff attentive and professional. The rooms are little small considering the cost. It can be an expensive hotel, but book on the their website, in advance and the cost is a little more reasonable. Parts of the hotel look like they need an update. Internet in the room is expensive, and should be free as in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not that great 'value'”
Reviews.Author: srikrishnak
Reviews.Content: Due to the exponential growth in OZ $ value lot of travelers found AU is no longer a reasonably value tourist destination. Just paid over AUD 350 for a night and some how I left unsatisfied from IC. Coming to the point, I am a business traveler so transport is critical to me and this hotel is right across the cahill expressway so going to north sydney or macquire park is pretty easy. Getting a taxi is good (but nowhere comparable to Singapore though) almost all the times. Within the hotel the pool is great and facilities are well maintained. Room (my room was @ 21st floor) is spacious and offers a partial view of Opera House & Harbor. Bed, etc all are as expected and no upside/downside surprises here. One minor downside is the occasional 'bike' wrooms on the express way. First time I heard the noise in a star hotel and I believe there should be some problem with window seal/vacuuming. Service is great and beat my expectations. Surprisingly I haven't had a great experience at Park Hyatt during my last visit but Interco did a good job and I am happy I choose the right place this time. Most of the tourist destinations in Sydney can be reached via public transport and If you want to rely on the public transport the nearest busstop is around 10 min walk. The Train station is 800 meters away so you can say 10min for the train as well. Both Wynyard & Circular quay stations are within walkable distance. Reg food, It doesn't offer great food choices and most likely you'd end up walking to the city central area. Again 10-15 min walk. I ordered twice using the in-room dining as it was quite late and for $39 I got a cup of rice + 4xpieces of Naan + Butter chicken. Doesn't taste like indian food but atleast there is an option for me so I was happy. Overall it's a good stay and 5 stars if not for the 'charges'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Views and an amazing Lounge”
Reviews.Author: LuxusTravel
Reviews.Content: We moved from another local hotel (similar price) that was very close by and the difference in service and finish level was amazing. The rooms were very well appointed and the staff was amazing, great recommendations form the concierge and an amazing lounge on the ground level. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel near Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: AliD78
Reviews.Content: Lots of staff at check in desks to ensure no one waiting for a long time. Room clean and comfortable. Bathroom amenities good quality. Get a Club room if you can has one of the best views in Sydney. Had breakfast in Cafe Opera and while the choices were great, the hot food section items were stone cold. Good omelette bar where the chef makes omelettes to order. Would recommend this hotel. Check out was speedy although 11am and very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Preety Average”
Reviews.Author: FunkyBeat
Reviews.Content: The famous Intercontinental Sydney, know for the celebrities that stay in the $6000 suites. However staying in a deluxe room, there was nothing deluxe about it really. The room was clean and comfortable, but nothing special about it. The bathroom however needs bit of upgrade, the bath and shower combo dose not work too well, bit on the small side. The club lounge has one the best views of the harbor, very hard to fault that. However the main problem is for breakfast, it's either the view or have a better breakfast (better selection of food ) on the lower level. What most overseas hotels are doing now if you book one the club rooms, the mini bar is for free, why do you still have to pay for the mini bar, even though you could go up to club lounge and get your drink for free!. Overall my experience was pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff at a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: skimegheath
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot to Sydney for work. This is the hotel I always stay at. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the staff - they ALWAYS go above and beyond the call of duty to assist guests - and it does not matter whether you are a regular guest or a one off guest.I have stayed at hotels all over the world - from 5 star to no star hotels. The staff here are by far the best I have seen in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short stroll to Circular Quay, which is the main ferry terminal, also about a 10 minute stroll to the Rocks. The rooms themselves are very nice, a work desk area, a nice king sized bed. We were on the 24th floor and it was still a bit noisy from traffic surprisingly. It was hard to fault the service, was offered any upgrade even for a four night stay and platinum pc member, which I thought was a bit rough. Not even free Internet. Overall I think this hotel is very nice, but for the money I think I can do better and probably not going to return.

Reviews.Title: “A consistently excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: GeoMo
Reviews.Content: This hotel consistently impresses. We stay here most times we are are in Sydney and regard it almost as a home away from home. From check-in through to departure the staff are unfailingly friendly and attentive and every one of them seems to take a pride in belonging to the management team. Guests are greeted lightly and politely as they move around the hotel and nothing seems to be too much trouble. This trip a forgotten i-phone charger was sorted immediately with an I-pod dock available at no charge for our stay. The supreme measure of a great hotel, the breakfast, is very, very good with every possible preference catered for in the commodious Cafe Opera. The seats at table are wide and high, giving plenty of support and little things impress such as the ease and silence with which they push back from the table for ease of egress. Plentiful coffee and cold juices make for a great start to the day. This time a real breakfast favourite was slow roasted smoked bacon, cut thickly from the loin. Prunes flavoured with star anisse and cinnamon were a delightful exotic touch. And only in Australia does one get a cool guava juice that is almost syrup it is so thick. The Cortille on the ground floor remains one of the most enjoyable venues In Sydney for a drink to start and evening on the town but if you want something light to eat at the other end of the night the kitchen is likely to have closed, something that lets the experience down a little. The one aspect of the Intercontinental that remains less than optimal is the expensive internet service. Unless access is part of your room tariff, charges can be expensive though there is a menu of price choices available. Still, at AU$40 for 2 days this is a service that could be improved substantially...not that this will cause us to change our preferred accommodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in October as part of a Tauck tour. Checkin we quick and efficient. The room was nice - not huge but a good size. The bed was excellent. Room was clean and very quiet. The bathroom was big, with a reasonable amount of counter space. It was a little dim. It has a window into the main part of the room - I have no idea what that's for. The hotel location is excellent. Easy walk to the Opera House, Bridge, Botanical Gardens, restaurants and shopping. We used the restaurant once for dinner and all 3 days for breakfast - excellent each time. Used the bar once - it was a nice quiet place to have a drink. Didn't use the fitness centre. The Pool was nice and big, but a little cold. Great views from the pool room. Staff were very good - concierge was helpful. Only complaint is that internet access is $30 a day. This is unacceptable these days.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: possHawksNest
Reviews.Content: Total lack of service from the start.long wait for service at reception.Rooms not the requested bedding configuration-more time wasted on phone and at front desk.Rooms outdated.Everything overpriced.Attempted to charge significantly more than what had already been prepaid for.Then over 1 k off our credit card for the privilege of having stayed there.More phone calls etc .Overall crap stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: DavidFoodie
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a very nice location. Only issues were related to unfriendly ad inflexible front desk staff and unfriendly and less than helpful concierges. I am sure we hit the exceptions rather than the rules, but we seemed to keep on hitting them.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Patricia201126
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed by the quietness of our accommodation, there was no corridor noise and we were not aware of the air-conditioning or refridgerator. We could have been alone in the building! We were also impressed with the professionalism of the staff, from the concierge to the room maids, everyone was warm, friendly and courteous. The breakfast buffet in Cafe Opera catered for every requirement and the omlette chef incredible! It was gratifying that Cafe Opera's Tom Woods remembered that I had mentioned that the air-conditioning was very fresh the day before, and sat us out of the draught on our following days. The Cortile lobby cafe was very comfortable too and they made great coffee there. We enjoyed the view of Circular Quay and the Bridge from our room, although next time I wouldn't worry about the aspect though, I think any room would be good at this hotel. If there was a downside to this stay, and I had to rack by brain to think of something, it was that they changed the sheets every day during our 7-night stay. I would have preferred that they hadn't!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable with areas to improve”
Reviews.Author: JamesDM_11
Reviews.Content: Generally the hotel appears in good condition with a pleasant lobby and the public areas are well kept and welcoming. The restaurant offered good quality buffet food at both breakfast and lunch at a price you would generally expect to pay at this sort of hotel. My king-size room was fine with good views over the Eastern Harbour and was kept clean during my stay. The bathroom was clean but starting to look a little dated. Concierge and staff in general were very friendly. A few minor annoyances (perhaps more from a business customer perspective): - Internet not included in room rate - for the price paid this is not something I would have expected - WiFi is based in the lobby of the hotel so as you move up the floors the signal gets weaker, by my floor on the 14th there was very little signal and for my colleague on the 17th it was non-existent. Requests for a refund given the lack of connection were not well handled. - Lifts - minor annoyance but the lifts in the hotel appear very slow and often seem to be very busy - Top floor bar / decked area - I think the hotel has really missed a trick here. The top floor bar/restaurant is reserved for club members which is fine but often seems to be dead and overly exclusive. Having paid >$2,500 for a weeks stay I would have expected to have access especially given it's advertising on the website. Overall the location is good (botanical gardens nearby are excellent) and the hotel is generally fine, I would be tempted to look around next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JeanieGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a girl's weekend away. Our room was clean with 2 double beds. Shower was good. Had city views. We arrived early and got into 1 of our rooms straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: megphi
Reviews.Content: I am a Royal Ambassador with InterContinental Hotels and I travel extensively. I don't often find the time or the need to write a review but our recent stays in Sydney exceeded all of our family's expectations. We had 2 rooms (2307 and 2308) from Nov. 11-18 and another 2 rooms (1902 and 1904) on November 21st - we were traveling as a family (myself, my wife, and my 3 kids aged 8, 5, and 3). This property is very well located in Sydney's CBD and less than 150 metres from Circular Quay - giving hub access to ferries and public transport. It's an ideal location. But more importantly, the stays were wonderful because the staff were absolutely incredible - from the front desk staff to the room servicers. I want to identify some members of the Sydney InterCon team for their customer service acumen. Emily Stansfield is the Guest Relations Manager and she went above and beyond in making arrangements for our family trip in the weeks and months before our arrival - she even came by to introduce herself and offer her continued assistance while we checked-in. Emily epitomizes what a Guest Relations Manager at a top hotel should be. I also want to thank Zafar Reza and Gary Lee at the Concierge Desk - wow, these guys are good! From activities to restaurant reservations, they took care of everything. And I will be forever thankful to Zafar who took care of my Avis car rental when I quickly figured out that I wan't going to be able to drive on the opposite side to what I'm accustomed to in Canada. I was exhausted after 24 hours of travel and he simply took the keys from my hands and made the problem go away. And no review would be complete without the acknowledgement and praise of all the staff in the Club Lounge who were most receptive, hospitable, and accommodating during our stay. And the views from the lounge......wow!

Reviews.Title: “Near everything with nice park opposite.”
Reviews.Author: curlup44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all you could want been done up lovely from an old heritage building.Just up the road from the Opera house which suited us ans close to the ferries for many excursion around Sydney.Definitely worth the dollars for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: DubaiDoug066
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Sydney occupies a prime site above Circular Quay and is one of the few hotels actually owned by ihg group as opposed to just managing their extensive hotel chains worldwide. From the 31st floor club lounge the views are absouletly breathtaking overlooking Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, then down the bay towards Rose Bay and even the headlands at Manley are easily visible. From breakfast to sundown the view is constantly changing and the vista is inspiring. Like having your own living tapestry in front of you! The club level Twilight Drinks from 5 - 7 pm is excellent with a Tasting Plate and hors d'oeuvres plus free cocktails and wines is a wonderful start to the evening. The rooms are well appointed and what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. What I also like is the automated blinds you can power up and down from your bedside so if you are lucky enough to have secured a harbour view, you can lie in bed when waking up and see what surely is one of the best views in the world. All in all then a top class hotel with some unique featrures and THE place to stay in Sydney. I always hate leaving but love returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: muffyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We finished a business trip in Sydney with a weekend visiting family and staying at the Intercontinental. From the moment of our arrival, the staff from reception, luggage attendants could not do enough. Room service was excellent and the staff on the Club Floor were friendly and efficient. The only flaw was that we had been travelling and were hungry and ordered a snack on the club floor, but were not told that in 10 minutes it would be complimentary. When we realised this we cancelled our order, but nevetheless I believe the staff should have told us, other than that we always find it an excellent hotel to stay, with great access to cross harbour ferries and other forms of public transport.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: KarpeDM23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental while on holiday in Sydney. The location is GREAT...just one block away from Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House, and ferry rides to the zoo, Manly Beach, etc. The staff was fabulous. Everyone was very helpful with directions and recommendations. The king size bed was very comfortable and the bedroom/bathroom was very clean. Would recommend to anyone vacationing in Sydney. Thanks to all at InterContinental who went that xtra mile to make our trip to your hotel fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: delsy78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. The service was amazing. I didn't feel like I had to ask for anything as it had already been provided and taken care of. The room was very well appointed and clean and the room service was really nice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always impresses me”
Reviews.Author: invisigirl
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to be able to check in 2 hours early as I had a wedding to get ready for, and as an Ambassador I was upgraded to the eastern harbour view room - on the 23rd floor, which afforded me a gorgeous view including part of the Opera House. As I was getting ready a lady from guest relations arrived with a bowl of fruit, mineral water and a bottle of red, on the house. Always a lovely touch. The room was spotless and well equipped. My only gripe is the lack of ipod dock. The TV radio channels lacked any upbeat "getting ready to party" music, so a dock would have been handy. Upon my return to the hotel at midnight, the turndown service staff had placed more comp water beside my bed and a bucket of ice near the mini bar- perhaps they noticed what I had consumed prior to leaving for the wedding and thought I might need it ;-) The room was oh so quiet, which was much appreciated the next morning when I awoke with a sore head. A quick call to reception ensured my 4pm late check out was noted on my reservation. When I did check out it was fast and efficient. The only sting being the $150 odd mini bar bill - oops. The IC Sydney will remain my number one choice when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not WOW!”
Reviews.Author: KTJ058
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October mainly for the excellent location close to Circular Quay. Although I didn't have any complaints about the room or service, my overall experience fell a great deal short of expectations for a 5 star hotel with the Intercontinantal badge as previously experienced in other Intercon. hotels. The room was fine, the bathroom a tad dated, the service OK, but for the money not worth it. On a plus side however the buffet breakfast was lovely having a large range of organic options which was much appreciated. However the long wait for a table, then for coffee to be delivered and then waiting again at each food station was annoying. I don't think I'll be coming back as there are plenty of other better value 5 star hotels in as good a location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Sparky354
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were lucky enough to stay at the Intercontinental Sydney for 5 nights in September. We arrived at 7am after a 21 hour flight and were booked straight into our Eastern Harbour view room, and what a view that room had! The hotel is in a fantastic location, we do not think we could have been closer to everything, The Botanical Gardens, Opera House, Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge.The room was spotless and very quiet.Breakfast in The Opera restaurant was amazing with such a great selection, Room service was also fantastic! All of the staff were so friendly and more than helpful, The concierge, restaurant and cleaning staff are a real asset to the hotel. We hope we are lucky enough to be able to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning this winter”
Reviews.Author: Skippy50
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome and pleasant staff, but do not expect an early check in, even if you have flown for 24 hours to get to Sydney: the hotel will charge another night. Rooms are excellent and we were fortunate to be upgraded to Opera House view - amazing - where I could see my office across the water. Very clean, as you would expect, and a great location for business and vacation - bring a short walk to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Views!”
Reviews.Author: Agnes L
Reviews.Content: I had to be close to Sydney CBD and previously I stayed on Pitt St. in one of different hotels but this time decided that I needed to be even closer to the destination I was visiting. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating despite that I showed up at the hotel at 8am in the morning. The rooms are very well maintained and clean, super soft pillows meant that the time difference melted away at night. The pool is located on the top floor and the views are great, so you can relax, enjoy exercise and experience great views of Sydney. Gym was actually very busy but there was space to exercise even in the morning rush. Buffet dinner and breakfast are worth stopping by if you are in a hurry or not sure where to eat. The location of the hotel is perfect for those needing to get to anywhere in the CBD, most places are minutes away, Circular Quay train station is very close by as are obviously all the ferry services from the Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “If a showere makes or beaks a hotel then dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Brad W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work & it was rather soulless To me the deal breaker was the shower over the bath - water pressure is non-existent. That in itself is enough for me to prefer to stay at lower rated properties with equal service

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: I see I last reviewed this hotel November of 2010 and gave it five stars. Have returned a year later and 5 stars, again, well deserved. Most notable change is the bar menu - a few new martinis seemed to be added. Try the White Lady for a superb lemon vodka martini but brace for sticker shock - $25 for a martini. Again location couldn't be beat. They honored my request for late check out - some hotel clubs give you a hard time about checking out late but not this one. Towels were thick and absorbant. Shower worked well. Lighting in room adequate. Staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. I see no reason to find another hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed hotel close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideAndrew
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, very close to Circular Quay (main transport hub in Sydney) and if you pay a little extra (about A$70) you can have a room with a view from Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Heads. It wouldn't be the cheapest hotel in Sydney, but is definitely fine accommodation. We found the Concierge and all staff very helpful and walked to most locations although the hop on hop off bus was close on Macquarie Street and a free city loop bus seemed to also go right past the hotel. There are a number of 711 stores nearby, a multitude of restaurants at both ends of the spectrum, and a couple of good pubs (bars). Great location take take up all that Sydney has to offer - a must see destination.

Reviews.Title: “Club Rooms are worth the money”
Reviews.Author: markis100
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of my favorite hotels in Sydney, while not located close to Darling Harbour or the shopping area, the views and service are fantastic. If you are looking at staying do invest in the club upgrade, its worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Costs but still Worth a Stay for Once”
Reviews.Author: livetutravel
Reviews.Content: Location: This is a superb financial and tourists neighborhood right at the harborfront in circular quay. City Rail station is within 2-minute walking distance. The hotel could be easily found if one arrives by train. The Royal Botanical Gardens are nearby. The hotel building is overlooking Sydney Opera House. Check-in: No priority lane for club members was found. Waiting time was around 5 minutes during my check-in at around 5pm. Bell staff were not so helpful and were quite reluctant to help take our bags until they make sure we were genuine hotel guests. Front desk staff were nice and friendly. We waited in the room for our bags after check-in. Finally, the bags came more than 45 minutes later. It took me 2 calls to request them to speed up because we wanted to have clean clothes to change after showering. Room: I booked a city view room and received free upgrade to eastern harbor view room by club status. The harborview was gorgeous! It was fun to watch yatches and ships sailing on the sea. Room size was small but functional. Bathroom was basic. Expect no surprise. Club Lounge: I booked a room with club lounge benefits. The club lounge is located on the rooftop and offers one of the best views of Sydney harbor! A visit to the club lounge is a stunning experience in itself! Evening drinks were offerred from around 5pm to 7pm and they are not to be missed! Value: The room rates are overpriced in general. For regular rooms, the rates are not very reasonable in value-for-money terms. For the same cost, Four Seasons and Shangri-la might offer better rooms and service. But it is definitely worth the extra costs to stay at a club room for just once to experience the service and scenery in the club lounge because there is hardly any other place to compare with the world-class view of Sydney harbor from the club lounge. After this stay, I think I might not stay there again unless the room rates are adjusted to a more reasonable level.

Reviews.Title: “TRIP OF A LIFETIME”
Reviews.Author: TREVI36
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were here this past December with the Oprah Winfrey show as a receipant of the Australia trip. We didn't pay for the room and maybe the Australia people and Harpo Studios made our stay more memorable because of that but there is just nothing negative I can say about this place. It's very well located to everything, extremely clean and with great food. The peopole that worked there were incredibly nice, there were choirs set up in the lobby to greet us and it's a very pretty and unique place with nicely appointed rooms and comfortable beds. I would stay there again even if I have to pay for it next time. My only disappointment was that it was Dec. 15th and there wasn't a single Christmas decoration anywhere that I can remember.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmospheric hotel. 5 star excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Deborina1
Reviews.Content: We stayed on our final night in Sydney. It is a truely beautiful hotel. perfect location for opera house & circular quay & a short walk from the rocks. The room was lush, bathroom is glorious & even Elemis toiletries. Worth every penny & would definately stay here again in preference to other hotels I have stayed in in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stephenandteresa
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a birthday weekend - early check in very much appreciated, complimentary birthday cake, much bigger room than i was expecting, staff very helpful, breakfast which was included in the rate one of the best i have eaten in a hotel. so close to the opera house loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sydney Intercontinental for three nights including a weekend and was very impressed. It is located within a one minute walk of Circular Quay and only a 5 minute walk to the Sydney Opera House. The service at check in, restaurants, gym, bar and bell service were all great. The room was large, comfortable with a great king bed and flatscreen TV. The 31st floor pool, gym and sauna are fantastic. I was stranded in Sydney during the Qantas grounding of flights and the staff did all they could to get me a room for an extra night at reasonable rate and provided free internet so I could try to book a new flight with another carrier. My only complaint is the internet. Why the large chain hotels charge for internet services is beyond me. I have a MacAir so couldn't connect to the cable in the room anyway and there is no wireless except for the first 2 floors. This is poor. The rates are outrageously expensive. Having said that I would return to the Sydney Intercontinental next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: FD67
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in club suite, room will need an upgrade soonish, staff bit arrogant, had to go back down to reception twice to get key card to work. Best club lounge in Sydney. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing -waste of money”
Reviews.Author: TarakayAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 2 times now and will never return. Our room was not ready until 3.30pm and then the room had a blocked toilet. It would have been impossible for the cleaners not to be aware of this. Our room swipe card would not work and we had to go to reception and wait and get another one. Next our club floor swipe wouldn't work either and we had to get that redone. We paid more for a club floor room. This is a total waste of money and would like to warn people about it. Firstly, they allow people to smoke cigars. Yes can you believe it. We couldn't. We were trying to eat our breakfast on the terrace and had foul cigar smoke in our face. We moved. The problem is, they don't have enough tables and chairs to cater for guests and even admit this. Although you have paid extra to go to the club floor, there may not be enough room and you can't enjoy the terrace because they allow smoking while you are eating breakfast, or afternoon tea. On both occasions to this hotel the eggs and bacon have been stone cold. We contacted the general manager of this hotel and his response was excuse after excuse after excuse. He couldn't care less that we were kept awake all night by the service door that staff allowed to bang all night and where they talked disturbing the rooms just a few feet away. On the ground floor there is a lounge and we saw cheesecake and other cakes left unrefrigerated and when you order this is what you get. The hotel has rooms very close to the lifts and you can see big gaps under the doors. It is very noisy in those rooms. Then if you are further down, you have the service door banging all night and staff coming in and out. One final thing, we could not get over how for the price of the room, you had to climb into a bath to have a shower and you had a nasty plastic shower curtain. Oh my goodnesss, those things don't exist anymore we thought. Well at the Intercontinental they do. You have a shower in a bath with a shower curtain that puts water everywhere. Also the toilet is right next to the curtain. The bathrooms are the smallest bathrooms we have encountered. As if you could use the bath, knowing that was everyone's shower where people stand. Combine all of this with a general manager who doesn't care, we would like to warn people not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ccmelbourne57
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at which to base yourself for a weekend in Sydney. Close to absolutely everything. Staff are non intrusive and exceptionally helpful when call upon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with harbour views”
Reviews.Author: beachtide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. No need for a hire car as it is so central to harbour ferries, The Rocks wonderful restaurants and The Rocks Markets. We couldn't fault the hotel and the breakfast was to die for. Superb heated swimming pool on the 31st floor. A surprise of a bottle of wine and chocolates when they knew it was our anniversary was delivered to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't get Enough !”
Reviews.Author: Skeney57
Reviews.Content: Have just had the pleasure to have our 7th stay at this wonderful Hotel and never tire of the experience. From the Reception staff, concierge, wait staff, housekeepers etc , their drive is apparent as they all strive to make our stay enjoyable. We honestly struggle to single out one staff member when doing the leaving survey, I'd vote for them all ! The Hotel itself is ideally located for walks to the Rocks and environs, the Botanical Gardens for a stroll and picnic, the Opera Bar for afternoon music and drinks, a walk or cheap cab ride to Theatres and Shows, Ferry rides to Manly or Watsons Bay !! Or if your feeling lazy , while away the day or evening in Club InterContinental over a book , paper or evening drinks/canapes. You can never tire of the view and breakfast on the deck on a sunny Sydney morn is spectacular. Dining in the newly refurbished Cafe Opera was also a highlight of our stay, really great food. Fred and his crew are to be congratulated , and my best tip is to stay a minimum of 2 nights so that you can really unwind

Reviews.Title: “One of my faves”
Reviews.Author: Travellerwithoutname
Reviews.Content: Great location, but what makes it really special is the roof top club lounge. I just wanted to sit there all day , working and enjoying the magnificent views of Sydney Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: kiosor
Reviews.Content: it's our home away from home. love it - central, clean, roomy, great breakfast, excellent service. And, WHAT A VIEW!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Unbelievable Views from the top”
Reviews.Author: Wizey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights with my girlfriend. Thought we'd splurge and get a Club Room and I can honestly say it was the best money we'd ever spent at a Hotel. The nightly canapes and drinks up at the Club were first class, as well as the breakfasts up there. Couldn't fault a thing. Staff were nice and helpful whenever we spoke to them so couldn't fault any service there. Yes the bathrooms were a touch small but they were clean and tidy and it's not like we wanted to hang out in there so they were fine. Excellent location and we never got sick of the Views from the top of the Hotel. Prob be a while until we stay there again as it was a splurge for the weekend but we definately got our monies worth. Couldn't fault a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rounsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding anniversary. Staff were excellent, gave us complimentary wine and chocolates. Clean, nicely furnished. Staff attentive without being in the way, concierge was really knowledgeable. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in convenient location - a cut above.”
Reviews.Author: organboy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Conveniently located just steps from Circular Quay. Rooms are spacious, although I wish we had booked a harbour view room! Lobby is a bit underwhelming, but the central bar area makes up for this. We had a drink in the Club Intercontinental lounge on the roof of the hotel (despite not being members of this club) - expensive but well worth it for the spectacular views. The views from the hotel pool on one of the top floors is also stunning. Concierge were absolutely brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better CBD hotels, big rooms, great service, though no wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: phillysilver
Reviews.Content: I really love my stays at the Intercontinental in the CBD. I stay there about every 3-4 weeks for work. I used to stay at the Sofitel but made the switch a few weeks ago. The service is great. Someone else wrote that it is great service, but that the staff is invisible unless you need them. That is a great description and I love it. The staff is friendly and helpful but you still have a lot of privacy. They are super responsive to needs and come to your room within minutes if you need something. They have obviously been trained to try to remember your name, as the front desk treats you like their best customer. A great group of people. The rooms are very big, and if you're facing the bridge or the east, you have great views. Have never been on the other two sides. I think it has been said that the bathrooms are nothing wow, and that is true. Definitely dated, but always clean. But I would not say that the hotel seems dated at all, it feels fresh and friendly. One big downside is the lack of Wi-fi. I like to be disconnected as much as the next guy, but it would be great to flop down in the bed and use your ipad. iPads won't work, and you need to make sure you have a laptop and use the cables to connect to the wall. I hope they are planning on making the investment. For such a first rate property in such an amazing location, and the associated room rates, I would make it a top priority if the manager. But rest assured, the Intercon is a great home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Upper-end of the Hotel market but a nice splurge”
Reviews.Author: ksar1901
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel is not within all budgets, unfortunately. For us it was a business/leisure splurge. A grand hotel that lives up to its name. Fantastic rooms, service and views. We added the breakfast to our stay and it was relatively cheap. Delicious variety of morning feasts. Location great, especially near Circular Quay train station. Unlike other reviewers, i actually found the staff very friendly even though i was not wearing designer clothes and despite the fact that my luggage was worst for wear.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, staff could be a lot more humble”
Reviews.Author: Thejinxs
Reviews.Content: The location is second to none. Views from the rooms are incredible and they are cleaned well and to a really high standard. It's a great hotel and we loved to staying here. Nothing to fails with the hotel it's great. The staff are no great though. They were mostly good and willing to help but a few are extremely abrupt and seem to think that as they are working at a 5 star property they can be condescending and arrogant when they should be the opposite. May be its how I looked, because I wasn't dressed in a suit I deserve less service? Any way it wasn't what I expect from a property of this standard in the ihg hotel group. Check my review of crowne plaza London. They could give this hotel some serious lessons in front line staff. Only a small problem in an otherwise great property.

Reviews.Title: “anonymous”
Reviews.Author: anonymous114
Reviews.Content: Long weekend with friend. Room quite small compared with other hotels of the same star rating. The saving grace was the Concierge - Zafar. He was extremely friendly and helpful and when advised that we had noisy neighbours moved swiftly to have us relocated to a quieter room and organised late checkout the following day. His local knowledge and advice on transport and places to eat was substantial. His friendly smile and manner made our stay very pleasant. On the negative side hotel rooms were clean but tired and the bathroom was too small and would have preferred a separate toilet. Would recommend a short stay based on the Concierge alone - he was faultless!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and and not much service - stay somewhere else next time!”
Reviews.Author: LucienZ
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a Bridge / Opera House view room at the Intercontinental in Sydney - it was their most expensive (non suite) room at approximately $410 per night. We travel often and have lately been fortunate enough to be able to stay in 5 star establishments. The Intercontinental room itself was small - really not acceptable for this type of room in such a (supposedly 5 star) hotel - the bathroom was small, ordinary and outdated - it had a shower curtain - basically very cheap. You could see both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera house from the room but there was a very large building smack in the middle of the view in front of you. We wanted to have a cocktail in the rooftop bar but were told that we had to be members of their special club (Ambassador Club I think it was called) to access their rooftop bar - we could join for $150 - very arrogant attitude. We were meeting a friend who took customers to her home local Intercontinental Hotel restaurant for very expensive meals on the corporate bill - their local Intercontinental hotel had arranged for her to access the Sydney rooftop bar after 8pm and we went there for a drink. There were only a few people up there and there was no entertainment on a Saturday evening - the view was spectacular (much better than the view from our room). Cocktails were around $25 however the staff were to busy to bring us some nibblys as they were to talking amongst themselves and preparing for the next morning's Ambassador Club members breakfast which is held up in the rooftop bar area! We ate breakfast downstairs with all the other normal people. The only time the staff provided us with any service was to take your order, bring you your order or bring you your bill! This hotel lives in a different world - overall poor value (a normal cup of coffee downstairs was $7-how much harder can you rip-off people), poor service, arrogant attitude and make people who stay in their most expensive (non-suite) rooms feel like they should go somewhere else - which is exactly what we will do next time as there are several 5 star hotels in the same area. I would have thought that it is exactly those (high paying) customers that they would have wanted back again - we are actually amazed at their attitude. The rooftop bar and hotel management staff need a retraining session (ie need to be unemployed for a while) on how to provide some service in order to get repeat visits. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Normally great.....this time okay”
Reviews.Author: or_elsa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on numerous occasions and have always been 100% happy with our stay. We are Ambassador members and always book the cheapest room and then you get an upgrade to a harbour view room. On this occasion our upgrade was to an "East Harbour" room. I will make sure next time I specifically ask not to be in one of these rooms. Even with blinds the sun was streaming in our room by 6am, I was sooooo tired but couldn't sleep in. The room desperately needed curtains over the blind. Also traffic was quite noisy as the freeway is right next to it. We still had a lovely 2 days but not as good as normal when we are in a harbour view room. I love the location. Hence why we always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: baribegum
Reviews.Content: Although the CBD is not the most happening place in Sydney, it makes a great place to stay with the Circular Quay, the Botanic Gardens, the Art Gallery of NSW etc. all in walking distance. It also means you'll get the iconic views - the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. A smoothly run, calm, relaxing hotel, whose staff are invisible until you want someone. Great breakfasts. The bathrooms lack wow but are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - But price may put people off”
Reviews.Author: jennymac72
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental range of hotels obviously is in the higher brand of pricing. However does this one in Sydney, deserve to charge the rate that they charge? I don't think so. I've been to a few intercontinental hotels around the world and their facilities and services have been far greater than the ones available here. It's a good hotel but the price should be lower than what it is at the moment. As for the service, porter was really good, customer service staff were also really good, so the service of the staff is there but the facilities simply aren't compared to other intercontinental's. Hopefully this will be rectified in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property twice in the last 10 days, once for business, once for leisure. The rooms are modern and spacious. The bathroom is a bit small and I hate the shower over bath! The service is excellent. I love the location as I enjoy a morning walk around the Opera House and through the gardens, but if you need to attend meetings in the heart of the city, you may have a 10 - 15 minute walk. Overall very good value and I will be keen to stay here next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1948_10
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was a little small. The room provided a wonderful view of the Royal Botanical Gardens and a partial view of the Sydney Opera House. Within walking distance of the Sydney Opera House, the Circular Quay and other sites. Concierge and wait staff were courteous and most helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views of Sydney from the Club Lounge...”
Reviews.Author: robbertl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club room at the Intercontinental Sydney, Australia. Location: Excellent, within a short distance of Circular Quay Transport: Excellent, taxis no problem, bus stops on the road outside. Train from airport stops at Circular Quay. Sightseeing: A short walk from the Opera House and Circular Quay Rooms: Very nice, tastefully decorated. Staff: Very Friendly Food; Very Good Now the best bit... The Club Lounge. If you take a club room, you get access to the club lounge. If you have never been to Sydney before... this is a must - honestly. The club lounge has wraparound windows and doubles as club breakfast area. The view from the Club lounge balcony is THE BEST IN SYDNEY - no kidding. Waking up in the morning, going up for breakfast and just looking out of the window... WOW. Imagine this... the sun is shining, you are sitting on the club lounge balcony with a cold beer... in front of you is the opera house in all its glory, to the left is the harbour bridge... and all you have to do is sit there and take in the view. ABSOLUTELY PERFECT. you can sit there all day looking at the city stretched out in front of you. The harbour bridge walk is great, but the view from the club lounge is much, much, much better. At night you can see clear across the city and the street lights and traffic of sydney... really nice. Word of Warning.... dont even think of booking for Christmas/New Year... because of the views its booked solid every year. Advice: GET A CLUB ROOM - You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Nature1973
Reviews.Content: Awesome service by Chris from the Front Desk, great location, and extremely friendly. Excellent service beyond the call of duty, I've rarely experienced anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Young and energetic staff, but cold and unwelcoming.”
Reviews.Author: HKasyouare
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: A taxi ride to or from the airport takes 10-20 minutes and it costs between 45-50 AUD inclusive the road toll. Very centrally located. HOTEL: The check-in was speedily provided by a young and energetic front desk staff. They were in such a hurry that the direction of the lift had been left out. Maybe this was part of the new no-frill policy by the Intercontinental Hotel Sydney? Or maybe they knew I have stayed there before, hence the direction of the lifts should be obvious? Otherwise, not much has changed since I stayed there in November last year. The room was bright but looked tired and the bathroom badly needed a change of tiles. The shower was either too hot or too cold, not to mention the low water pressure. CONCLUSION: I had hoped my second stay at the Intercontinental Hotel Sydney would be better than the last one. I was wrong. Yes, the check-in and the check-out process have become faster, much faster, but not any friendlier. Do not expect getting a helping hand with the luggage in and out of the taxi from the bell boys either. They were way too cool to assist you and too busy entertaining each other.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ELEGANT HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT STAFF AND IN A GOOD POSITION”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Taxi from the airport to hotel approximately US$42 - all taxiâ€™s use a meter. CHECK IN: Very good - arrived at 11am and room was ready and an upgrade to club lounge also included. ROOM: A little on the small size and the bathroom was rather small for an Intercontinental hotel. SECURITY: Good security and your room card key will only let you go to your floor level. In room safes have been installed. CLUB FLOOR: Breakfast quite good with a much better selection than any IHG in the USA where the group is based. From 5pm to 7pm daily excellent range of alcoholic drinks available including wines, spirits and liquors plus tasting plate of 4 different food types plus self serve olives and peanuts. The view from the Club Floor is absolutely breathtaking as it encompasses the Harbour, Opera House and the Harbour Bridge and you can watch the cruise ships go in and out from the open air deck, or if you prefer, just sit inside the lounge. TIP: You can take a photo from the deck and include the Harbour, Opera House and the Bridge and also include your partner in the foreground with just the one photograph. POSITION: About a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay where you have access to trains, buses and ferry services plus a reasonable selection of restaurants close to the hotel. About a 25 minute walk to Chinatown where there is an abundance of Asian restaurants. TAXIâ€™S: Very difficult to get a taxi if itâ€™s RAINING as the hotel is at the north end of the city - ringing up for one makes no difference to the wait as there is just not enough taxiâ€™s to service this area when it is raining. On normal sunny days there is no problem getting a taxi. TIP: Ask the taxi driver to take you to the airport via Elizabeth Street and Redfern as itâ€™s much shorter and you will save the Toll fee - most of the taxiâ€™s want to use the toll road but itâ€™s longer and more expensive. Same applies for the trip from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, unbelievable views”
Reviews.Author: sunnynz1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and was upgraded to an opera house view room on the 30th floor. The views of the opera house and harbour bridge were unbeatable. Other than that, the room was top quality, spacious, very well-equipped and with some nice touches like complimentary macarons and bottled water. I ordered breakfast to the room at a specific time and it arrived right on time. Service was excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try their breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_0084
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after watching a show at the opera house, which is within easy walking distance. Room and hotel in general was nice and clean, but my favorite part of the hotel experience was the buffet breakfast which was plentiful and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price - Best Place”
Reviews.Author: rninstyle
Reviews.Content: Since an overnight stopover in Sydney was included on our trip my partner and I decided to stay in 5 star luxery - usually staying at either Marriotts or the Hilton, we decided on the Intercontinental due to a great deal through a hotels website which included buffet breakfast for 2 for an extra $15. As we were driving we really appreciated the valet service, especially after navigating Sydney's CBD, we were greeted with a friendly smile and offer to take our bags and an attendant dealt with the car. Looking a little worse for ware after our 11 hour drive from Brisbane we were made to feel very welcome and were impressed with the quick check in process having arrived at the time we could check in 1500hrs. Without having requested we were accommodated in a high floor corner room (which we preferred) and immediately we knew we had made the right choice. The room had a great feel of luxery, nice view of the city and spacsious bathroom, everything was clean and climate was optimal without being too cold or warm. Very quickly after arriving we received our bags and the days local paper which I meant to read but unfortunately didn't chance to because once I layed down on the bed I was asleep, the mattress being so comfortable with the right amount of pillows - honeslty have to say the best hotel bed I have slept in for ages. I was concerned after reading some other reviews on this property that noise could be an issue, but other than hearing our neighbours entering and exiting their room we found it pleasantly quiet. After a quick kip we decided to check out the scenary and realised what a great location the hotel is, circular quay is metres away. Knowing that we were coming back to Sydney for a culinary tour in a few weeks we chanced trying the room service available at the Intercontinental. My partner had the club sandwich while I had the rib fillet plus desserts of tiramisu and creme brule - all were substantial in size, quality and were above most restaurant offerings in Brisbane. We had an early Sunday morning buffet breakfast which was a steal at $15 in the Opera Cafe. Everything on offer was fresh, hot and great varitey of fruits, pastries, cerals as well as favourites like sausage, bacon and the best hotel poached eggs. We are glad we came early because by the time we left at 8.30 the area was filling fast with people. Check out was smooth and easy, although unexpectidly the car arrived while I was still finalising the bill, my partner had to circle the block as we were blocking the laneway to let cars out. I am so glad we chose this property to stay on our 1 splurge night in Syndey, cannot speak highly enough of the service, value, food and accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: lisacarter7778
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for only one night but during that time we were provided with excellent service and a pleasant experience that means we will think about coming back to stay if we need a city break in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “oh my God!”
Reviews.Author: Sosperec
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Thanks to fidelity card got upgrade to bridge view room. Breakfast is excellent. Good location, friendly personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranjana_ranjana
Reviews.Content: We got a great room with views of the sydney harbour bridge. Our checkin at reception was great. They communicated and explained but were not long winded. Our room was clean and comfortable. We got a late check out when requested. The hotel is close to the ferry and other restaurants. Our breakfast was great and the selection at the buffet was very good. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... Will be back”
Reviews.Author: budsy987
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2nights and my last stay was almost 7 yes ago. Property has been well maintained. Breakfast buffet was excellent and generally the staff was very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to the opera house , great location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service after health difficulties”
Reviews.Author: JonnyG1953
Reviews.Content: While staying at the lovely Intercontinental Sydney for a conference, I had some health difficulties that resulted in admission to hospital. The staff at the hotel handled the situation with fantastic professionalism and care, both during the incident in facilitating the ambulance people, and afterwards in packing my bags and ensuing they got to me. And they followed up later on to ensue I was OK. It's hard to forget that sort of attention. Well done guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: Lukeandjamie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for both business and pleasure activities. The best part of this hotel is the service, and the people that greet you, meet your needs are second to none. The location is a block away from Circular Quay, and right in the heart of the business district of Sydney. The rooms are clean, modernised, although the only thing I would say to management is to re-do the bathrooms, as showing in the bath shouldnt happen in a 5 star hotel. If your lucky to get a view, the views are amazing, and I suggest asking at reception is you can get a room with a view over Sydney Harbor. The gym facilities are great, pool is small, not big enough for laps. Give the in-room dining a miss, its overpriced and not that good quality. Overall however, a great experience. I would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole excellent”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 13 years ago for a week and we never looked at any other hotel this time. We generally are big fans of this hotel chain and have had positive experiences throughout the world. The location is the best for a tourist - one block from the quay and across the street from The Museum of Sydney and The Polic Museum. Plus within walking distance from stores. However, it is no longer as busy as it used to be probably due to the influx of other hotels to the area. Thus the lobby cocktail lounge (a most pleasant spot) is almost a ghost town and it used to have a 100 people milling around. Aside from the location, the next best things are the room decor (lots of high tech features which we loved such as the two types of roller shades and the tv menu system) and the housekeeping service. The latter is the best ever for us. Room has everything you may need. Watch out for the food and laundry prices - sky high. We bought the B&B package combined with the advance purchase to keep costs down and were pleased. A curious thing: twice we ate breakfast at 6:30 AM and twice at 9 AM with very different experiences with food (cold at 9) and service (15 minutes to get coffee at 9) and staff (different people it seemed at both times). Staff at last day tried to charge us for breakfast and were surly when we refused to sign charge slip and it took 2 requests for them to check with front desk on our included breakfast. Put a damper on our visit. We also did not enjoy (disliked actively) the Red Carpet tour of the Hunter Valley the concierge recommended (only one choice given). An all day winery tour with 2 wineries visited, a ridiculous cheese place visit and a strange lunch. Thanks heavens we had arranged tours on our own in advnace which were excellent. By the way, taxi fare from or to the airport is $50-55 Aus one way, not the $30 the website states.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Notcomingback
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay for business Aug 2011 Check in: very quick and efficient ( they did have my details as I am a priority club member) Getting to room was easy, fast lift which recognizes the floor you are staying on from your door card. Room: standard king bed layout, large tv, comfortable bed and good pillow selection. Lighting effective and uncomplicated, electric roller blind over window blocks out all light although still a little road noise even on 27th floor. Bathroom very basic, shower over bath, good selection of toiletries. Good steam iron! No paper in the morning? Internet was via Ethernet cable in room, would like to see Wi-fi in room also. Breakfast: great selection and high quality ingredients used. Check out: very smooth. The business sense package averaged $300/night including breakfast and Internet

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and dated.”
Reviews.Author: Kbel3
Reviews.Content: Perhaps some of the hotel is more stylish than the part I stayed in but I was surprised by the dull and dated room for the top end price. Yes the location is nice, as is the very handsome concierge but the room itself was a let down. Pricey wi-fi, a shower over the bath with a nasty, flimsy shower curtain and no ipod dock. At $350 a night? Just as well we didn't plan to spend much time in the hotel. The pool is good (a bit on the cold side) with a great view (that you can't actually see from the pool). On the plus side the bath towels in the room were high quality and the beds were extremely comfy. However, we found the price to be too high for the tired state of the room and won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic Concierge”
Reviews.Author: lckemelcee
Reviews.Content: I arrived a day early for my meetings and spent 3 nights in this hotel. The weather was perfect when I arrived and so I decided to attempt the Bridge Climb. The Concierge arranged it immediately. After learning that I was off to lunch before the Bridge Climb, he warned me that they do take a breath test and suggested that I kept the consumption of wine to 2 glasses. I appreciated the thoughtfulness. In the next few days, I had business meetings, lunch and dinner meetings that required reservations in Quay, Marque and Rockpool. The concierge assisted with my reservations seamlessly. I was upgraded to a harbour view room which was quite spacious and was given early check in and late check out. My only complaint is that there was no separate shower. The shower was over the bath tub. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel....Terrific Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: CandLJacobs
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Intercontinental in August and spent 5 days in Sydney. The hotel is historic and beautiful (it is the old Treasury building). The rooms were spacious and clean. Also, it is very well situated to ferry and train. The true highlight of our stay was Zafar Reza, the concierge. Zafar would continually go out of his way to make my wife and children feel comfortable. This, in addition to his knowledge of the city, made our stay in Sydney truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: geeijo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from booking mystery hotel so it was great value Location was great - right at circular quay. Room was very nice and I loved the window seat I had giving me views over the botanical gardens. Staff very friendly Only point of issue was a really old digital alarm/clock (really old) that didn't keep time at all and was really out of place in an otherwise fairly modern room.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good location, ok price”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1513. Good room facing the Museum of Sydney. The hotel itself has an amazing lobby, and if you are working the AMP tower, it's right next door. The TV is a bit small, and internet is not included. Note that the bed is on wheels. So if you come back to the room after a hard day's work, or sightseeing and run and jump on the bed, you may notice it go sliding across the room! The bathroom is clean, but lacks the tempurature control on the shower, like the Four Season's and Sheraton on the Park have. The location is good, it's up the hill from George Street and Circular Quay. But both are fairly close. The hotel and room, and bathroom were very clean. The service was good except for one thing. I had a 7:30 flight, and I left the hotel at 5:30. There was no one there. No one out front, no one at the lobby, no where. My wife was checking out later so I did not need desk assistance. Luckily someone was arriving as I went to the cab area, so I was able to get a cab. The guy coming into the hotel though, was going to have to wait!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: juk4
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights at the beginning of our holiday and liked it so much that we stayed the last 2 nights as well. Very welcoming and a great check in. Loved the atmosphere and the service could not be faulted. Had breakfast in the Opera restaurant and one dinner as well. The food was well cooked, varied and enjoyable (buffet style meals) The room was spacious and we had a great harbour and gardens view. We enjoyed being able to relax in the central area and order whatever we felt like, whether it be coffee, a drink, a delicious cake or something more substantial to eat. When we left, our taxi was waiting for us at 4.30am as we had requested. All in all, we were made to feel very special and the location was tremendous - a quick walk to Circular Quay. We would definitely visit again - congratulations to all the staff who know what 5 star service means.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Luxury Hotel for the Business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Adel-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney regularly over the past few years and have generally found it to be an excellent choice. It provides a reliably high standard of service and the staff there are friendly and efficient. Checking in and out is usually a breeze and they remember your preferences from previous stays, something I don't always find even in other 5 star hotels. Location wise it's in a great spot for doing business in the CBD and with it's proximity to Circular Quay and the Botanic Gardens it also in a handy location for tourists. The rooms are always clean and comfortable, with possibly the best desk and chair set up of any hotel I've found in Sydney. Great if you have to do a bit of work in the room. The bathrooms are in need of some decor update, but they function OK. the Intercontinental is not the cheapest place to eat and drink in, but you expect to pay premium prices in a place like this, especially in Sydney. The quality of food is always high and room service fairly prompt and efficient. All in all I find it an excellent choice when doing business in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Really torn. Was very comfortable and overall happy, but a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it was a business trip and the room had no wireless Internet, which in this day and age is unforgivable. Secondly, the room service menu lacked basics. When traveling for business, some nights I don't want langoustine ravioli with truffle foam I want past penne with tomato sauce or a nice basic soup. The regular restaurant was closed for renovation, so breakfast was served in a depressing ballroom (not the hotel's fault but it was a bummer). BUT the room was very comfortable, the view was beautiful overlooking the arboretum. The staff was nice. The gym was nice... I would stay again, except for the Internet issue. Only having access to email and Internet in the ground floor lobby bar was lame.

Reviews.Title: “A must for a stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OzyFreddles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Extremely friendly staff from the moment you walk in to the second you leave with a can do attitude. The room was very modern, comfortable and must be some of the best views of the Harbour bridge and water. The location is brilliant 5 mins from the CBD, shopping centres, Circular Quay and the Rocks and many excellent restaurants within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: EPACY
Reviews.Content: As with most of the Intercontinetal hotel, the location and the view from some of the room and the club was fantastic. Unfortunately the room we were given seriously requires some renovation (Supposed to be an upgrade). Apart from its location, I would probably only gives this hotel a 4 stars when compared to other 5 stars hotels. The service was good but not exceptional. Would I go back to this hotel. Yes I would only because I am a priority club platinum member.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Sydney”
Reviews.Author: busymumsydney
Reviews.Content: The Intercon Sydney has always been a popular choice for me over the years based on it's location, function space and Club Lounge, complete with the best views of Sydney. We stayed as a family on a Friday night and found the entry level rooms not too bad, but certainly looked a little tired in places.
