The views from the large room windows of the city were stunning (would recommend booking a harbor view room if your a first time visitor to Sydney). The decor needed a bit of a refresh in keeping with some of the newer Sydney hotels. The staff are very friendly and helpful with assistance throughout the hotel. Recommend breakfast in Cafe Opera which is a great buffet and very plentiful (also great lunch buffet with plenty of diverse choices). The pool is good for families and indoors. Although I didn't have club access to the lounge this visit, I would strongly recommend considering this option if it's within your budget as the views are the best in Sydney with both a outdoor deck and large comfy chairs to sit back, relax and watch the world go by. Drinks, breakfast and afternoon canapes are a must. From previous visits, the hotel and service are consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel just the best everything”
Reviews.Author: TashAdelaide
Reviews.Content: In February prior to going on a cruise we met up with our Canadian friends choosing to stay in a Club room at this lovely hotel for two nights. The hotel club room is well worth the extra money especially if you want something special to share with overseas friends. The club room has the most magnificent views, is very well designed to make the most of this. The staff in this area are as good as you would find any where around the world. The hotel rooms are very comfortable,the hotel suites facing the harbor and the bay are divine, suites and rooms are spotlessly clean, provide great bathroom products, many of the rooms also provide beautiful views. The hotel is in walking distance to Circular Quay and the city shops although both of these may be too far for the elderly. Bus transport is close by with the train a little walk to Circular Quay., there always appeared to be plenty of taxis with the hotel also happy to help acquire one for you. The main restaurant does not have any views however this was made up for by great service as well as excellent food. If you have the usage of the Hotel Club room you can order meals to be brought to that area, this way you can eat and still enjoy the view. The hotel club room has a large outdoor balcony area where you can have an early breakfast and watch the day arrive or enjoy a beautiful sunset, just sensational. If you are a member of Priority Privilege(is connected to the world wide Priority Club) which we are,you can get a very good discount on your room and 50% off your food account; this club is well worth joining if you are an Australian and like to travel or eat at the Intercontinental hotel chain. If you are looking to have a special weekend in Sydney look no further than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff were excellent”
Reviews.Author: Traveller141414
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week at this hotel, using it as base to tour Sydney. Its location was excellent, the room was not too small and well appointed and the staff were friendly and attentive to any questions that were asked. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at this property”
Reviews.Author: jackcameback
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Sydney gave our family a good first impression of Sydney and we would definitely return to stay at this hotel. The location is fantastic with access to the Rocks, the Botanic Gardens, and the ferries to Manly. Staff were friendly and helpful, our rooms were comfortable. Concierge services were helpful for opera tickets and directions. Our rate included breakfast and we found this to be something to look forward to every morning. Outstanding array of breakfast food in the Opera Cafe. Sunday High Tea at 3:00 was really enjoyable too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ormiston62
Reviews.Content: Great location nearby Circular Quay, amazing restaurants and top service, great for business, couples and solo, not sure about families due to cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PerthAussieFamily
Reviews.Content: We were checked in immediately and found the service very good for a big hotel. The rooms were great and the location was unbeatable. So close to the sights. The breakfasts were wonderful, the quality of the food and the range of choice was excellent. We would stay here again. We were a family with four children and the accommodation was excellent for us.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a view ....”
Reviews.Author: thomas_destinations
Reviews.Content: On of the best club lounges in the world. Amazing views. Great breakfast. Fantastic Sunset cocktails. Rooms are a bit on the small size and could do with a freshen up. But upgrade to the club .... well worth it ... with great service.

Reviews.Title: “aaarrrgh! no wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: Terrigaltravelller
Reviews.Content: Great location and in walking distance to the Opera House (make sure you see Opera Australia's La Boheme - a masterpiece) this beautiful hotel has friendly service, great food choices, well appointed rooms but NO WIRELESS INTERNET CONNECTION available in the room. How can that be in a hotel of this quality???

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kindred00
Reviews.Content: If it was not for the location and spectacular views from the club lounge this hotel would be empty. There are nearly always long ques to check-in. With almost every stay, there seemed to be a problem with my booking: a request I made prior to arriving not being done, an upgrade that needed to be asked for, incorrect rate for room being charged, reception loosing a "buy one get one free" certificate you hand in upon arrival, no amenities delivered to the room. The rooms are a little tired and dated as is the bathroom. Had trouble with the shower pressure also. The beds were comfortable enough but i found was a little hit and miss depending on what room you ended up with. The club lounge breakfast is great but the evening is a real let down. You get one tasting plate and that is it. Nothing else is bought around, you cannot even go and help yourself to some food, there is nothing, except for some olives and nuts. Unless you are in their face the whole time asking for more drinks, on the busy nights you are forgotten. I once sat in the lounge for over 2 hours and was only offered a drink when I arrived. Despite the many staff that always seem to be running around looking busy no-one cleared my table or offered me another drink. Its pretty poor. The view from the lounge is spectacular and is basically what sells this hotel. As a Royal Ambassador you come to expect a certain level of service and recognition. Here I found you get none. They in my opinion don't value RA's and seem to have their own loyalty scheme going. Normally I would recommend people join the ambassador program as you get treated well and get room upgrades. The only word I could use to describe their attitude is mean. For example, on a stay where every suite type they have available was bookable when I checked in, they refuse to upgrade to suite. Other IC properties routinely upgrade RA's to suites but not here, here you get a 'view' room half obstructed by a building. If you have never stayed here, you may want to still give this hotel a go, but I know i definitely will not be back there and a number of my colleagues who travel often will give it a miss too. I have tried time and time again to give this hotel a go even thinking things would get better with the management change but sadly in my opinion it has not. Its a crowded Sydney hotel market, and with so many really great high end ones it is easy to give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: backspaced
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our Priority Privilege. Also have Platinum Priority Rewards. We were immediately upgraded to a harbour view room and after my husband mentioned it was our wedding anniversary we were asked if we prefered sparkling, white or red! Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant but no overcrowding ( which I have noticed from many of the Crowne Plaza group hotels). The seafood buffet on the the weekend is absolutely outstanding apart from the great choices they constatly offer lobster which is cooked as you order. Cannot say enough loved the room loved the food. We will be back. Thankyou Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brad085
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the standard of the Intercontinental in Sydney. Big bucks sure - but we have found that does not always guarantee a great stay. Here it was worth every penny- great service, lovely rooms taht we would expect and a good night's sleep in excellent beds. Location is as close to perfect as you can get - just a few steps to that harbour! Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlisoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, my room was not ready. My flight arrived from Dubai at 6:55am, so I was at the hotel shortly after that. Even though the room wasn't ready, they knew I had been on a long flight and gave me a key to their showers in the locker room. This allowed me to clean myself up after a long flight. I had a light snack in the hotel lobby and then decided to go walking around downtown Sydney. When I came back, my room was ready. The room wasn't too bad. The hotel is good, but it's getting close to where it needs to be refurbished. They have a 3ft cord for your computer, as there is no wi-fi in the room. I asked for a longer cord and they made one for me. It definitely made things easier when I would sit in bed and look things up. Internet is definitely on the expensive side...$25/day. I wanted to do some unique things on my trip and their concierge really made it enjoyable. They set me up on a sea plane ride that showed me the coast and took me to a 7 course meal at a beautiful restaurant. They also made reservations for the Harbor bridge climb. I'd highly recommend that you do both! You're within walking distance of Circular Quay, the Harbor Bridge, and the Opera House. Overall, the hotel is in a great location, the service was outstanding, but it did lack wi-fi. Wi-fi in Australia is horrible overall. I would stay at this hotel again. I would trust their recommendations on anything you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Thanks”
Reviews.Author: freelunch1
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but was very impressed with the service. Clean bathrooms and rooms were floor less. No complaints, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sannagran
Reviews.Content: We paid extra (they were offering a special deal) to have access to the Club on the 31st floor. Amazing view but I am not sure that it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay very close to Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: 1873KB
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Four Seasons when traveling to Sydney, but as this was a last minute trip, I was booked into the Intercontinental instead. The rooms here are find for business travelers - plenty of room, a decent sized desk to work on and the bathrooms are also all that you need. While I'd say that the beds at the Four Seasons are marginally more comfortable, I do like that the Intercontinental has heated mirror de-misters, so that you can get out of the shower and have a shave without having to constantly rub the mirror down with a towel. It also has neat "mini window" that you can open up so that you can watch the tv while having a wash / shave (at least I'm assuming what it was intended for!!). ALl in all, no complaints about this hotel - it's a really handy place just off Circular Quay - very handy to the train station too, if you intend using that for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Mike640
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Sydney on June 10th and checked in immediately before noon. I was booked as a King Club but was upgraded to a suite that overlooked Sydney harbour with the Bridge to my left and the Opera House to my right. I assume the upgrade was the result of my Ambassador status and the fact that it is a slower time of year in NSW. The room was quite nice although when I sent a photo of it to my fiancee she cheekily suggested it was designed "by a guy". It wasn't exactly lush but I thought it was quite nice. Certainly there was more than enough room for one person. I found the staff to be outstanding...from check-in to housekeeping to the people working the Club Lounge upstairs. When I checked in I forgot that I was leaving a day later....when I called back to correct that I was told that my final night would be added at a cheaper rate than I'd booked. I appreciate that kind of customer service. The Club level was very satisfactory for breakfast....the staff were amazing. There was one morning on the holiday Monday Queen's birthday when I faced a massive lineup but other than that family holiday the Club room was relatively empty and the food and service were worthy of praise. The bed is quite comfortable and if you book a suite you will have enough pillows to put everybody in Sydney to sleep. Internet charges were better than I expected....fifty dollars for six nights. Ordered laundry service and it was taken and delivered back within five hours. I must complement the staff...from the front desk to housekeeping to the taxi area. Even in the hallways, you always have a "good morning" or similar greeting from staff. Always nice. This is a very professional hotel with staff hired to provide that level of service. It is, however, quite expensive at the level I booked. There is an IGA store across the street in the AMP building if you need supplies and you're steps from Circular Quay for many convenience stores or bottle shops. I would think the Intercontinental would be one of the best places to stay in Sydney if you are on business. If you're holiday bound....it is a little too placed in the business district...but it's a 15 minute walk to the Pitt Street shopping area and Sydney offers amazing public transit options. This stay cost me dearly but I have absolutely NO complaints about what matters most to me...the people who work in the building. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: k7781
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location, which was great as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. However, I was very disappointed with the hotel room, mainly due to the lack of window glazing meaning that the noise from the road traffic was very loud especially at night. Not sure it all rooms experience this, but it was very loud, even on the 14th floor where out room was. Our room overlooked interconnecting highways leading to the Harbour Bridge, meaning all night we had to listen to the traffic. First night, I got hardly any sleep due to this noise and also due to the very uncomfortable pillows. I woke up tired, with a headache and sore neck. Not the best start to our weekend in Sydney. Bed was ok, but nothing special - two singles put together. Second night, I bought earplugs which helped. But after paying big $$ to stay here, one would hardly expect to have to buy earplugs just to be able to sleep! The room itself was nice enough, nothing to rave about. The walls aren't very noise proof and we often heard our neighbours and their children. And at one point, our neighbour must have jumped on their bed and hit the headboard, as the whole headboard of our bed moved too! Thin walls! The staff were good though, valet service was great - although you kinda have to pay for this as where are you going to park otherwise? We won't stay here again next time we are in Sydney, but will go to a hotel that has decent windows that block out noise, and sound proofing between walls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: docsteve
Reviews.Content: It was just a 8-10 minute walk (downhill) to the Opera House. It was about 10-12 minutes to Campbell's Cove (lots of places to eat). The rooms were big and nice. The staff was nice and very helpful. They even booked a time slot for The Bridge Climb.

Reviews.Title: “not as sharp as they use to be but still good.”
Reviews.Author: chrisco57
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel , its location , its view and most times its staff. Some rooms are a little tired but that's ok. The club room is fantastic with great views and worth the extra money. However our last trip we found the service a little under what we were use too. Forgotten drinks was the main problem. I am also an ambassador member which give entitlements such as free bottled water and fruit.. These were forgotten as well. Mentioned it at check out but was met with the usual i will tell someone important. We will go back as we do like but it needs to improve back to the standard they were before.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD Sydney location”
Reviews.Author: DandDCA2PA
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental has the best location, in the midst of everything but in a quiet block of Sydney. One block to the Circular Quay, easy access to the fabulous public transit systems in Sydney- ferries, buses and trains are one block away. The rooms are nice, the views of the harbor fabulous and the help is top notch. Cheap eats note - the AMP retail plaza across Phillip St. is open for breakfast and lunch take away or in the cafeteria style seats.

Reviews.Title: “Not really up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Back_to_Sandringham
Reviews.Content: Although the architecture of the hotel is interesting (modern tower block built on top of a historical low-rise palace-like building), it looks decidedly 80s, and thus dated. The dated feel carries into the rooms. The phones, or instance, are ancient. And luxury hotels these days do NOT have shower curtains, because they always look slightly dirty. The breakfast room is uninspiring, but the food is decent. The lobby bar is not particularly interesting, but the atmosphere is cozy because it is in the old part of the building. It should be said that the Intercontinental Sydney's top-floor pool probably has the best view of any pool in the world; right over the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The pool is small though, so don't expect to do any laps in it. The gym is also quite small, and you might find it difficult to get a machine to work out on at certain times. The location is the best part of this hotel, only a five minute walk down to the Opera House and the harbour. Apart from the restaurants down by the harbourside there aren't really any restaurants in close proximity to the hotel, and as it is surrounded by office blocks, there is a bit of a desolate feel to the neighbourhood in the evening. I'll probably try a different hotel next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent standard, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: js9530
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable, and lived up to expectations. The room had great views and was spacious. The bar in the central covered courtyard area is also a nice place for a drink and to meet people, and the breakfast were good. Used the gym too which was a good extra. On the down side, there was no free wi-fi which should be a standard in hotels, especially good ones. The concierge was helpful during our stay, but was not very good at coming back to us on our questions when he said he would - and a response to a query I made in advance of the stay by email was poor. Overall, a nice enough place to stay but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views of the Sir Stamford hotel...& the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: The view of harbour is beautiful , the bridge, opera house, ferries & Lunar Parkâ€™s iconic face are all clear but what people fail to mention is the Sir Stamford Hotel rises up directly in front of the Sydney InterContinental & obscures the view with its massive concrete frame, with this being said, the Sir Stamford Hotel has the superior uninterrupted view of the harbour. Room 6462 on the 16th floor is a suite with plenty of space. The king bed has fine Sheridan 1000 TC bed sheets & body pillow. No pillow menu. The standout for the room are the 2x daybeds positioned at each of the windows to encourage people to sit & enjoy the view...of the Sir Stamford Hotel. Small bathroom for a IC suite. Small shower head. Shower large enough for 2. Separate bath. Small vanity area. The rooms are nice but need a modern refit to better the Perth InterC which is far more modern & creative. I found the robes to be superior of any of the Australian InterC hotels. The Club Lounge is very popular here with its great views however it was completely booked out several days before our stay so get in early. Ambassador Club: upgrade to a Suite Harbour view. There was no separate check-in desk for members. Ambassador gift was a box of 6 chocolates. Small fruit plate, some strawberries were bruised. No flowers. No welcome letter at check-in or in room. No letter in the room outlining our benefits either. Free bottled water. Elemis bath products. Free newspaper. Fast check-out. The hotelâ€™s bottom floor is the refurbished former State Treasury building. The heritage listed building is constructed out of large sandstone blocks in colonial style architecture, unique amongst Sydneys 5 star hotels. The lobby cafe leaves a lasting impression of old world charm with a modern touch in an atrium setting. The Opera House, the State Parliament, Supreme Court of NSW, Sydney Conservatorium of Music, Royal Botanic Gardens are all on this road. Circular Quay train station is 10 mins around the corner. At around $300 for lower-end rooms this is cheap 5-star in Sydney but not worth the cash if theres no harbour view or breakfast included to dampen the $45 valet parking & expensive 3 course meal which is easily over $600 in total. Is it worth it?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: CraigWilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late April to early May; for three nights. Travelled to Sydney with my wife and we took my parents for their first trip to Sydney. Stay was paid for on my fathers honours points and upon arrival we had a pleasant surprise. We had been upgraded to a harbour view. From that moment on until the end of our stay the staff were incredibly efficient and helpful. One evening my wife and I were looking for a restaurant and the concierge assisted us in finding the restaurant and showing us the menu on his computer. The rooms are a good size, the beds incredibly comfortable and the view was excellent. We overlooked the botanical gardens and harbour. Could just see the opera house if peering out the side. But this wasnâ€™t a big issue. 5 minutes walk and you can see the building up close and personal anyway! We would definitely return here again, perfect location for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing specieal either”
Reviews.Author: 0eus0
Reviews.Content: Great location, and I love how its a modern building inside a historic one. The hotel is quite literally just up the street from the opera house. Its a 4 minute walk to the opera house, 10 minutes to the Rocks. We got a Deluxe Harbour Bride view room, and it did have a great view of the bridge and the opera house, unfortunately, there is an equally tall building right infront of the intercontinental, so the view wasn't actually as nice as it could have been. I would suggest you save your money and not upgrade to one of those rooms. The room itself is actually on the small side, but the use of mirrors and a clever use of space makes it feel quite large. The bathrooms are nice, and it has an old charm feel with the tilework on the floor and bathtub while also being clean, useful and modern. The service was nothing special. We were on our honeymoon, and every hotel after this one did something special to welcome us (whether it was a bottle of champagne, welcome note or flower decoration on the bed), but we didn't have anything here, and the stay felt very impersonal The rooftop swimming pool has the best views of the harbour. Definitely swing by. Its a shame they don't have a hot-tub.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic weekend away”
Reviews.Author: lindat44
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just stayed here for a weekend of pampering, shopping and dining. The IC ticked all the boxes for us. The staff were brilliant, checking in and out was smooth and the concierge most helpful. We stayed in a Deluxe Eastern Harbour view and it was very roomy considering we had 2 double beds in it. The location was excellent, walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. The only downside was the buffet breakfast was a little ordinary, I ordered poached eggs which were over done, and there were no surprises in the buffet selection. That said, we will definitely return, we'll just eat breakfast out. We had the most wonderful massage at the Odyssey spa on the 9th floor, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service and a handy location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaL1604
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home from a wonderful weekend at the InterContinental. The service we recieved throughout the hotel was faultless - reception, concierge, restaurant, bar. We stayed in a harbour bridge view room, a great view to start the day and a turndown service and chocolate on the pillow were a great way to end the evening! Quiet rooms and handy location for our day trip to Manly. Thank you we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: globegal
Reviews.Content: I was only in Sydney for 3 days so wanted a luxury hotel in a convenient location. Just minutes away from the hotel is the Opera House, the wharf, view of Harbour Bridge, The Rocks, etc. It's a great location. Across the street from the hotel is a food court with very reasonably priced food, a supermarket, etc. Couldn't be more convenient. Taxi from airport to hotel was about $40 AUD. My room was well appointed with a phenominal view of the Botannical Gardens. i could have slept without window shades if I wanted to as there was nothing blocking my view. It was one of the quietest hotel rooms I have stayed in. However, for a 5 star, I was disappointed by the mattress as it was sagging on one side of the bed (the side closest to the bathroom). The internet connection was a bit slow too making the use of Skypes a bit of a challenge. The fee for internet was $25/day and wireless is not offered in the room. Telephone calls (local or otherwise) from the room were very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in an excellent location, but front desk staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: HKasyouare
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: A taxi from the airport to the hotel costs around 35 AUD. Centrally located, only a three minute walk to Circular Quay and Sydney Opera House. HOTEL: The room was small, albeit bright and clean. Check-in was very slow, chaotic and amateurish. An extremely busy period perhaps? It was painful to witness how badly the check-in staff copes in stressful situations. A simple apology for the delay from the staff would suffice, but none was offered. CONCLUSION: Running a hotel is hard I am quite sure. A simple three star hotel can get top ratings by reviewers, while a five star hotel only receives mediocre reviews. The check-in does not have to be extremely efficient. The location does not have to be perfect. The room does not have to be brand new as long as it is clean and bright. All imperfections can be overlooked and forgiven as long as the staff is apologetic and polite. Politeness is the key here. InterContinental Sydney is a good hotel. The location is excellent. The room is functional and clean. What it lacks is the staff excellence of a welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, fantastic gym!”
Reviews.Author: Swamp_Donkey66
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I find that most 4-5 star hotel rooms in major cities are pretty good, so am often swayed by other features of the hotel. I booked the intercontinental purely based on proximity to my office. The room was lovely with a pretty good view and all of the amenities were comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. Not outstanding given the price and rating, but certainly nothing to complain about. My only peeve (and this is a personal thing) was the shower over bath and shower curtain arrangement. I just dislike shower curtains.......... The gym is something that is often basic in hotels and the Intercontinental certainly shined here. Plenty of equipment, plenty of space and plenty of variety, easily the best (non-resort) hotel gym I've used in a while. It is a differentiator that will likely see me back. My only other complaint is reasonably priced meals can be tricky to find (particularly late) in that part of Sydney, the Intercontinental is in a bit of a quiet spot, not quite in the Rocks and too far from Chinatown or Darling Harbour to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful beds”
Reviews.Author: Gilmore68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the IC twice this year and won't be returning until they upgrade the beds and reburbish. I can see other reviewers have expressed similiar comments. The bed was dreadful on our last stay and was certainly not any better this time around. The extra mattress topper we requested made little difference. These beds are NOT plush. If you want a comfortable bed, your best bet is to stay at the Sheraton or Westin. The bathrooms are also quite shabby and small. On a positive note, the service in the club lounge was an improvement. The staff were somewhat friendlier and far more welcoming this time around.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: MyHomeIsMyself
Reviews.Content: Read the mixed reviews after having booked the IC. The rooms may not have been the most modern, but they were pleasant, cosy and very inviting and the shower was lovely. The service was excellent from start to finish and the communal parts of the building itself (dining room, bar etc.) were beautiful. I honestly had no complaints at all, thought the food (had room service, and food from the bar) was nothing special and if it wasn't for the cold, I would certainly have ventured out somewhere else. That said, I wished I'd discovered the Cortile Bar whilst I was still living in Sydney - it was a perfect, surprisingly intimate, place to catch up with friends on a Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for interstate and oversea visitors - efficient service”
Reviews.Author: AK_Australia
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic for visitors who are in Sydney for 2-3 days - it's within walking distance to the opera house (you can get there early and beat the crowd), rocks (for breakfast) and the ferry terminal (make a trip out to Watson Bay, stroll along the cliff then finish off with a fish and chip lunch). It's a nice stroll to the CBD or the park as well. The room was quiet and clean, the bed was v. comfortable. The service was discrete and efficient. We haven't stayed in many Sydney hotels (compared to Perth/Melbourne) but the standard of service was higher.

Reviews.Title: “Club lounge is great but beds need replacing”
Reviews.Author: CharlesDP
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times now and are happy with all aspects of the hotel experience except for the poor quality of the beds. We've encountered the same issue in all the rooms we've stayed so it makes me think that it is a hotel wide problem. Essentially, the beds are too soft and springy because I suspect they are due for replacement. They are not diabolically bad but bad enough to interrupt sleep. Otherwise, everything else is fine. The club lounge is the defining feature of this hotel and it offers excellent food, drinks and service at any time of the day. You could spend hours relaxing there enjoying the view. Even though I don't like the bed I'm still prepared to stay here because of the club lounge. I just wish they would replace the beds so that I would have the perfect hotel to stay at. This time we tried the Etch restaurant. We were very pleased with the food and service here and would strongly recommend dining here. You can get 3 courses for 2 diners for about $150, excluding wine, and the food is innovative and well prepared. Just remember to make a booking because on the Saturday night we wanted to go there we had to take a 6pm reservation because it was fully booked after that.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Luxury”
Reviews.Author: benjaminmichael
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times. Rooms are stylish and modern, comfortable and clean. Great views of Circular Quay and Hyde Park and one of the best positions in the City. If you can get club access, do it! The bar is amazing and the views are to die for. Expensive hotel, but a good investment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Excellent Hotel,Wonderfull service”
Reviews.Author: darrenvh
Reviews.Content: Great Location for this hotel just a short walk up from the Circular Quay where all the ferries leave from.Also Train station at Circular Quay and FREE bus(555) that takes you round CBD.The hotel was Excellent ,the room we had looked over the Botanical Gardens and was really comfortable.The only criticism would be that the bathroom was a bit small and there wasn't a separate shower,it was over the bath.We arrived at the hotel at 9am having just flown in from Hong Kong,and we were able to go straight up to our room,which was really good as we need a lie down and freshen up,check in wasn't suppose to be until 2pm. While we were there we had free wifi use whilst in the lobby and lounge area which was really lovely.We asked the concierge for any restaurants he could recommend for evening meal, and he told us about an Italian restaurant tucked down a narrow lane,which you would never come across, that was excellent. We stayed at the Intercontinental for 4 days in April and it wasn't long enough to see all of Sidney so hopefully one day when we saved up, we would love to come back to Australia for a month next time instead of 3 weeks and we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: HotelXray
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel if you dont have corporate rate but fantastic place with great concierge department! from the moment we arrived to departure part nothing was a problem. Staff are friendly and helpful for Sydney ... If you can effort to stay here definitely stay in club room - best view of Sydney and great location of the hotel. Only 2 suggestion - main restaurant needs some changes it seems like we are not in InterContinental there is no visual link between great lobby bar and restaurant (its like moving back in the past 30-50 years ago) 2nd - driveway under the hotel (car park area is shocking and dirty - difficult to drive) we were disappointed with what we saw

Reviews.Title: “Best Location !”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowStephen
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel ,perfect location ! Upgrade if possible, views tremendous. Main areas of hotel beautiful, pity they cannot incorporate the outstanding main facade more into the reception, seems such a waste to use it as a back door !!. Staff attentive, and efficient when we had a problem with our room, changed us immediately. Breakfast nice. This hotel wins in its location, ideally situated next to Circular Quay, Opera house on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views 'to die for'”
Reviews.Author: PinkPeeps
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week long city break at the Intercontinenal Sydney and decided to upgrade our 'Opera House view' room to 'Club access' on check-in - what a wise decision that proved to be! The views from the Club Lounge were spectacular and the included extras (breakfast, tea and twilight drinks service) were excellent and good value at Sydney prices. Overall, we were very pleased with our room on the 28th floor, which was a good size and had stunning views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. From start to finish we were pleased with the level of service provided at the hotel eg. early check-in was arranged at 9 am following our 6.30 am arrival, Club staff were very attentive and check-out was swift and smooth. During the week, two minor maintenance issues within our room were dealt with swiftly and efficiently. The location of this hotel is excellent - a five minute stroll downhill to Circular Quay and the Opera House and an easy walk to the Rocks or the main shopping areas of Sydney. To sum up, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental Sydney and plan to return there next year at the start of an extended tour of Australia and New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Urgent refurbishment candidate”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: The IC is very well located and rooms with harbour views are the best.But this hotel is overdue to be upgraded.Room fittings are basic and tired.There is no way this is an International class five star hotel.The club on the top two floors is well worth the extra charge (about AUD75/night) as it provides stunning views of Sydney and has been upgraded.Wireless internet is available in the club once you upgrade to this level - elsewhere its not wireless - so pathetic. Unfortunatly Sydney lacks good premium hotels so the IC can get away with this unacceptable product.

Reviews.Title: “Never an outstanding experience - even at Club level. I just like the location!”
Reviews.Author: cjseestheworld
Reviews.Content: Im a Gold Ambassador and now Priority Privilege member. I've stayed here 4 times. Each time they have never acknowledged the GA status. Had to always ask about what room we would be upgraded to. The last stay were were in the club rooms. We needed another night due to flight probs.....and GA members are guaranteed a room. The Club Concierge couldn't get us a room, said he would try from 11am when rooms vacate and call us.....he called at 1.20pm leaving a voice mail to say there were no rooms and suggested to stay at the Shangri-la or Holiday Inn!! We didn't wait long after 12noon to hear from him, so we called the reservations line ourselves. Initially they said there were no rooms, then I repeated that I was GA and didn't that mean a room was guaranteed, then suddenly one was. When we returned to the club lounge, Michael the CC didn't even try to soften the blow. He repeated that same message. I simply replied that we called and got one. Shame, isn't that what having a Club Concierge is all about? To make those arrangements? I can say that the Rialto at Melbourne has the best service for Intercon in Australia. I've stayed there 3 times, and after the 1st visit they greet me with familarity and know I'm a GA immediately. This is why I keep my membership!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and hotel decor were great but that's where it ends.”
Reviews.Author: VintageRUBY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as our first stop before going overseas for our honeymoon. I am a priority club member and also made a note that we were on our honeymoon on the reservation. The girl on reception didn't even acknowledge this note and just silently checked us in. When she did talk it was to ask us if we wanted to pay $150 extra for a Opera House view which I politely declined. The rooms were nothing to scream in excitement about either. We had a city view room the window seat was probably the only good thing. The bathroom felt out-dated and could do with a refurb. But all in all the room was ok. The hotel itself is gorgeous and location was great, a short walk to the opera house etc. I was really disappointed in the level of service. Front desk didn't seem to give a damn we were on our honeymoon and with the other 5-star hotels we stayed at for our honeymoon they all provided us wonderful amenities. It wasn't even the amenity we were after but acknowledgement we were on our honeymoon - which didn't happen at the InterContinental Sydney. They definitely need to re-train staff (or reiterate) on the importance of providing 5-star service to customers! Small things like acknowleding a honeymoon or anniversary go along way in terms of customer service. I have stayed at other InterContinental properites which have gone above and beyond, InterContinental Sydney definitely did not live up to the brand in this case. I wish I had kept my original booking at another 5-star Sydney property but decided to book the InterContinental Sydney as I thought it would shine like it's other properties. It most definitely did not and we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “everything you would expect from a 5star”
Reviews.Author: JMTE
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is everything a 5 star hotel should be. Beautiful big well appointed and sparkling clean rooms. A massive super comfortable bed with luxurious linens. Good sized bathroom with lovely fluffy towels. And a mini bar and room service with prices you would need to re mortgage your house to pay the bill for!! We had the hotel "cheap" room (king superior city side room) and sometimes even in a 5 star these rooms can be a little disappointing - but this was fantastic. If you craned your neck just enough there were even glimpses of the harbour bridge. Great location with a 1 block walk to circular quay and lovely rooms but unless having a special dinner at the lovely hotel restaurant Etch eat all other meals elsewhere. The other hotel meal options are less than inspiring. Breakfast can be enjoyed for a fraction of the hotel cost over the road at the Museum of Sydney cafe which does a great and quick service coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Window seat the winner”
Reviews.Author: CFBtripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on an Opera trip. Large well laid out room with the distinguishing feature being a comfortable window seat big enough to sleep on. Plenty of light and a top sheet on the very comfortable bed (many Australian hotels now only provide a doona with no top sheet resulting in you being either too hot or too cold - I hate it). Good service throughout and for the Opera House, a very convenient location. Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Amazing Lobby Lounge, Outrageous Room Service Prices”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, much in need of refurbishment (rooms, gym, pool) but benefits from an incredibly convenient location and one of Sydney's most stunning lobby lounges. Together with the lounge the service is the only aspect of this property that is at 5-star level (and that helps draw attention away from the yawns generated by the tired bathrooms and ants in the bedroom). The Concierge staff in particular are an asset to this property and genuinely helpful. The buttons to call the elevator on my floor were broken for most of the week without any signage or protection should a child decide they wanted to stick their finger into the open wiring - it was shocking to see the lack of attention to basic maintenance (pardon the pun). Room service prices in Sydney are outrageous to begin with but the Intercontinental helps take it to a whole new level by charging $10 for a simple bowl of cereal + $6 delivery charge. A 4 or 5 star property would serve it in a bowl, but in the case of the Intercontinental it comes in a micro mini box so you can DIY. In all this property provides standard business accommodations with a decent comfortable night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with service”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: room facing the opera house & the harbour bridge. great service except we were not told about the free bus 555 when asked for direction

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Cuttingblade
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental oozes class and understated elegance. The staff are all very professional and helpful. The bar area was quiet and a great place to relax or meet up with friends. Our room had a great view of the bay and the Botanic Gardens we could even see the opera house if we look side on! The bed was huge and so comfy and although the bathroom was rather small it was immaculately clean. Loved the Elemis toiletries! Would definitely choose to stay here again, just for the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: ravi_s13
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel because of our proximity to our office.It was a brilliant location with just 5 min walk to the opera house....it is situated in brilliant location with great views early morning. The stay was wonderful and food was excellent.All the facilities were excellent, rooms were spacious. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: emdeme
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night for an event at the Opera House, so this hotel is perfectly located just a short walk down the hill. Firstly we had a room without a view but as we were staying just a short while it didn't matter. If I was a tourist looking for the advertised view I would have been disappointed. There were 2 cracks in the bathroom basin, not what you would expect in a hotel of this standard. Otherwise the room was lovely with a great bed. Our service issues were that they missed half of our breakfast order and we had to ring and wait for the rest to be delivered, valet parking apparently forgot that we were waiting for our car and brought other cars up first until we asked again where it was and were given an excuse about not being able to get the car park on the phone, but then couldn't remember which was our room number that they had already been given. We had a problem with a lift giving warning beeps and the doors wouldn't close but the attendant was too busy holding another lift for a group and wouldn't let us use that one, he then tried to force our doors closed which still didn't work, then ignored us completely as we left the faulty lift and found another one. We expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: PandaHouston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney for a 3 week stay in February 2011. The room is a standard hotel room. There is a work desk and a sitting area next to the window. I did not get a view of the harbor which was a disappointment. The only complaint I would have would be the bathroom. It is small. There is a tub which serves as a shower but it is hard for 2 people to fit in this bathroom. I received complimentary internet as part of my rate as I was there on business. It is not wireless in the room but the wired access is very fast. There are plenty of channels on the tv which was very nice as I had a 3 week stay here. The location is very convenient. It is near Circular Quay. There is a free circular bus shuttle (555) which operates 7 days a week. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: c73
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Sydney, staying at the Intercontinental. Fabulous location, being close to both shopping - 10 min walk to Pitt St Mall and 2 mins to the waterfront. Also right next to the Botanical Gardens, and walking distance to Paddington (although a decent walk!) We stayed in a city view room on the 11th floor, being this low down actually gave us a lovely view of the Museum of Sydney (rather than higher up where you might get roof tops!) Staff were pleasant, rooms great, plenty of room - although the bathroom was quite small with shower over bath as you get in many hotels. Bed wonderfully comfy, lovely elemis toiletries, pool and gym good (fabulous habour views from the pool). Buffet Breakfast was included in our package at Cafe Opera (?) the breakfast was suffiicient without anything to write home about (ie had much better breakfast buffets - this was fairly standard, but all that you need) Lovely ambience on the ground floor bar area. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: rle99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, but very pricey. The hotel is up to date, clean, and comfortable. Friendly, helpful staff. No complaints about the hotel, just the price. The only rooms available included access to the club level on the top floor. The club included breakfast and evening cocktails. Breakfast was good, not great. Evening cocktails and the complimentary appetizers were very good. The hotel is in a great location, great views from the club level. The swimming pool looks really nice. My only other complaint is that the hotel gym seems to be privately owned and sells memberships to locals. So it was too busy for my taste. I am looking forward to my next visit, hopefully at a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sekincognito
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel from many points of view if you try the club level -lovely rooms overlooking the botanic garden and the Sydney Harbor, free wifi/breakfast/coffee and tea drinks all day, free wine/beer/drink of day and small plates from 5-7 p.m., and very gracious wait staff and concierge service in the club. Hotel has decent restaurant with lavish seafood focus of nightly buffet. Four blocks from the Rocks and Quay areas. Only drawback is no wireless access in hotel rooms, and internet access in rooms is $25 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good sized rooms friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pipoflux
Reviews.Content: If you want good room sizes in Sydney go to the Intercontinental. We stayed in 3 different rooms and all were a very good size. It is understated elegance. Restful colours and nothing high-tech. Don't stay here if you want push button this and that or mono chrome colours. Service was excellent and nothing too much trouble. Location is fabulous, opposite the Botanical gardens, close to Circular Quay and just far enough away from George Street to avoid the noise and hustle but close enough to walk. It is expensive but if you don't mind paying the extra I would recommend it. All in all a good hotel with friendly helpful staff. If you like views you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Couple of tips when staying at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: riverrun50
Reviews.Content: We just recently spent a week at his hotel. I wanted to share a couple of tips for future travelers. First, if you travel frequently and plan to use some points at this hotel prepare to stay on the first floor (actually floor 11) without a view. It really doesn't matter if you are a platinum member or not. The rooms with the lower room number (1-10) seemed to have the better view. If you room ends in 20 you're viewing the air conditioning unit at the building next door. Requests for ice/towels were all met quickly. The employees were very cordial. The bed was extremely comfortable. Second, breakfast at this hotel can get expensive every single day. We visited the Museum of Sydney across the street and paid about half. They serve an excellent eggs benedict for about $17. Third, this hotel is close to Circular Quay so it makes travel very convenient. However, the station is at the bottom of the hill. The daily hikes to/from the hotel from Circular Quay can be exhausting in the heat. You can take two escalators by going through the building next door during business hours. Finally, we had a hard time finding a good place to eat lunch that was close to the hotel. We didn't discover the food court in the building next door lower floor (across the street right out the front door of the hotel) until a few days into our trip as it's not clearly marked or obvious. There is a grocery store located in the food court as well that is a lot cheaper than the surrounding convenience stores. Stock up on water/soda/snacks at this grocery. We found three great restaurants in town: Spice I Am (Surry Hills), Zaaffran Grill (Darling Harbour) and Lord Nelson Brewery(near the bridge). We visited both Manley and Bondi beaches and preferred Manley. We probably wouldn't make the trip to Bondi if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY NICE HOTEL - WE RECOMMEND THE CLUB LEVEL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: GalvestonJT
Reviews.Content: We just finished 4 nights in this luxury hotel in Sydney, Australia. The hotel is very quiet and clean. We payed for a 23rd floor room with a link to Club Intercontinental, their 31st floor club level. This 31st floor has a great view of Sydney harbor and an open observation deck. With the pricier room, one gets free internet, a big buffet breakfast from 6:30-10am (with excellent "to order" coffee), a goodie-filled tea time from 4-6pm and a cocktail hour from 5-7p (with a nice 4 part appetizer plate). The only issue is the free internet is only located on the 31st floor, so one must take the laptop to the club room. The hotel had excellent concierge services. They helped booking a bus tour and made solid restaurant recs. The staff was friendly, as well. All in all, I would make sure one purchases a club level room. Our overall Sydney vacation experience was better with this addition.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent property but!”
Reviews.Author: rtjny99
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Intercontinental hotel is located in a building the first couple of floors of which is a former treasury building. Beautiful, with interiors to match. Like all Intercontinentals it is expensive and well appointed. The extensive breakfast buffet is excellent. Some of the prices however are just outrageous, for instance $60 for a Sunday brunch which is very good ...but! One of the most annoying was the lack of wireless internet service in the relatively small rooms and a $25 per day charge is if you wish to plug into the hard wired system.

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy001
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Sydney is best suited for business stay, due to its location; Which is well connected to business area. You can also enjoy the beauty of Sydney right from the hotel, It gives a fantastic view of Opera House and Sydney bridge if you are located at higher storey. Opera House, Sydney Bridge, Park and Perth are just walking distance. So if you are a morning or an evening walker, you will just love it. Rooms are modern and spacious, Gym is also well equipped. If you don't enjoy too much sun in summers, you will like its indoor swimming pool. I would rate its food quality and its Service as Average. It also has a Jewellery shop, and if you happen to be during the discount season and can pickup good gifts. But other famous shopping malls are not very close. Their concierge can help you plan your day well. Overall you will enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Experience "High Tea" in "The Cortile Lounge"”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: It has been years since I've visited "The Intercontinental Hotel". So I arrived with a small party of friends just before Christmas 2010 and we all enjoyed a "High Tea" experience in "The Cortile Lounge". I was not disappointed by the food, or the service, nor were my friends!! We enjoyed delicious and freshly made sandwiches and drank our lovely tea in a charming courtyard atmosphere, listening to the tinkling piano sounds playing in the background. A perfect and festive time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Horrible beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: someonechicago
Reviews.Content: Connecting rooms not available (as requested, with young children) so as a fix roll away cots were offered. It took FOUR (count them....with young children) FOUR hours to bring one bed in, then another 45 minutes for the second. Then, the beds (including the kingsize regular bed) were like sleeping on the floor and the pillows were like sleeping on cardboard. Not what you'd expect from an Intercontinental Hotel. Spend your sleeping hours elsewhere....Not worth the time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Views from Harbour View Rooms on Higher Floors”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one other time in 1989 shortly after the hotel opened and remembered the spectacular view of the entire harbour, bridge and Opera House from our 28th floor room. This time we had a still lovely view from our 18th floor corner Harbour View King Room but, with several buildings having sprung up over the last 22 years not quite as spectacular. Also, with the the Aussie Dollar now worth 1.01 U.S. compared to 75 cents US the last time, we found Sydney QUITE EXPENSIVE. The hotel's location is excellent, also, being right next to the Botanic Garden and two blocks from Circular Quay from which ferries can be taken to many interesting sights. Only criticism would be the old-fashioned and VERY small bathroom. Indoor pool on the small side but quite lapable and fitness center small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sleep and a great view of the Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: dagger-trotter
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay as always with an Intercon hotel. But seriously, what's with the nickel and dimming on the in-room internet? Make it standard already, will you? Comfortable beds as always, convenient location, good food all the way around. Good hotel, good stay with the standard fare expected of an Intercon. Didn't quite blow me away as other Intercons have in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: baytravellers
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay as we were attending a concert at the Opera House - just a short walk from the Intercontinental. Everything about this hotel was lovely. We had booked a city view room but ended up with a great corner room which gave us views over the botanic gardens and harbour. The room was spacious and very well appointed. The staff were fabulous - everyone from reception to housekeeping had a cheery smile and greeting. Parking was a breeze with the valet staff quick and attentive. Breakfast was good - not great as some of the hot food was only warm - one of my pet hates, so I passed by most of the hot food. However there was a huge selection on the breakfast buffet and I had no difficulty in putting together a good breakfast. We loved the warm pool with its great views and hope to return on another visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: verzaro
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - easy walk to the waterfront and botannical gardens, but this huge hotel is nothing special. The rooms are very small and uninspiring. My room was tiny and very sparsely furnished with no additional extras - no hotel compendium, no guide to Sydney, the mini bar was ridiculously overpriced and the complimentary tea and coffee selection was very poor. The tiny bathroom desperately needed up-dating - the shower control was old-fashioned, shower pressure weak and I don't expect a nasty plastic shower curtain in a 5-star hotel. The drains rumbled periodically throughout the night. There was nothing here to inspire me after 2 exhausting days of business. On a positive note: the lobby and first floor is attractive and Cafe Opera serves good food with plenty of variety and tasty/healthy options and the staff were reasonably attentive. I am sure discerning travellers wanting to stay in Sydney's CBD could find better accommodation at a comparable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarahwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of our trip and got a really good rate that included breakfast as our friend was geting married. This hotel is in a great location next to circular quay, the opera house and the botanical gardens, there are lots of shops and fab restuarants nearby to. This is a lovely hotel, all the public areas are nice and clean and in good condition, the check in was quick and effiicient and the staff were all very friendly. Our room was large and clean and well equipped and the safe was free. The bed was huge and both the bed and the pillows were really comfortable and the blackout blinds were very useful in the morning. The bathroom was a little dated but was clean and had good shower products by Elemis, it did have a strange window that opened into the hotel room, not sure why that was??? The pool area was nice and had a fantastic view over the opera house, the pool was warm and not to deep and was quiet everytime that we visited. Also used the sauna and the changing rooms which were clean and pleasant. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, and we got this free with our room, it was buffett style and was yummy, however, not sure if i would have paid extra for it as you could get similar elsewhere for a lot cheaper. we did also use the ironing service for my partners suit, which although it was not cheap, he suit came back looking brand new and really quickly aswell. I also had my hair put up for a wedding in the salon, whilst I was happy with my hair style, the stylist was not the happiest or friendliest and for $75 for 15mins work he could have made a bit more of an effort. Our friend, the bride, had a gorgeous suite on the 31st floor (i think) which had amazing views over the opera house and the bridge, the only annoying thing was we couldn't go up and visit her as our room was on the 14 floor and our key cards would not let us up any higher than this, either by the lift or stairs! thought that this was a bit unnecessary. Our friend also had club access and we went up there as her guests for a drink, was fantastic sitting on the balcony/outside deck drinking beer overlooking the harbour in the sunshine, really enjoyed it, thouh not sure if I would have paid the extra money for it. Overall we loved our stay at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to friends. Whenever we go on holiday now we always look to see if there is an intercontinential hotel there as we were so impressed! Fab hote and a fab end to a great holidayl, wish we were still there!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shazrazmataz
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the Intercontinental Sydney, what can I say, truely found it to be a 5 star hotel. We arrived in the morning & were able to check in which was a bonus. Our room was fantastic, big, airy & clean, the bed was big & so comfotable & the bathroom had lovely white thick fluffy towels :-) The staff were all friendly & courteous & nothing was too much trouble. There is a fabulous indoor pool plus a sauna & gym. The hotel is just minutes walk away from Circula Quay, the Botanic Garden were right accross the road & the Opera house minutes away. I'd stay here again in a heart beat, great service, great location, just a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: danjed
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location minutes from circular quay and campbells stores and loads of great restaurants. Great service, lovely atrium lounge. Lovely rooms modern equipments well worth paying to get a harbour view. Two downsides wifi isn't available in the room which nowadays is a basic requirement in my eyes for a 5 star hotel. Wifi is in the lobby but that just doesn't cut it these days. Secondly lack of flexibility on late checkouts was something that I would have expected. Otherwise great stay lovely hotel. However as wifi in room is essential to my business I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LBCanberra
Reviews.Content: The good reviews on this website are misleading. While certain aspects of the hotel did meet my expectations, its downfalls were bad enough to ensure I will never stay there again. We had booked a harbour-bridge-view room, so we were on the 21st floor and the view was spectular (including a partial view of the Opera House). However, the room smelt strongly of stale cigarette smoke. We spoke to the front desk about changing rooms, but they said they would have to move us to a lower room category on the 14th floor - no mention was made of a discount or upgrade. As a first option, they said they would send someone from housekeeping to freshen the room. After twenty minutes, someone did arrive - they opened the door without knocking, muttered something and then left. No one came back. On our way out to dinner, we mentioned this to the front desk and once again we were assured that someone from housekeeping would be sent to our room. When we got back from dinner, nothing had changed in the room so we assumed housekeeping did not visit. The other big let-down was the poor sound-proofing. The guests in the next room included small children who spent a lot of time screaming and not using their inside voices when talking to their parents. We mentioned this at the front desk and they said they would talk to the noisy neighbours. However, the noise levels remained the same, which is not hotel's fault, but they should properly sound-proof the rooms to begin with. To top it all off, when we checked out they tried to charge us for the room, even though we had paid online months ago. We tried pointing this out, but were informed that we had it wrong, and that there is no way our credit card would have been charged. Luckily we had a print-out of our booking receipt, but still this wasn't enough - they spent ages on the phone to the accounts department before conceeding that we had already paid for our stay. Assuming everything was fine, we returned home to discover that our credit card had been charged anyway, even though we hadn't signed anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: farrowp
Reviews.Content: Great location for Sydney harbour and the financial district nice hotel but they let themselves down on the simple things like over priced internet room service and room bar. also no complimentry water in room and poor information about hotel facilities. Howver very comfy room with good cleaning. Come on guys you could make this a great hotel with a little effort

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, beautiful views, beautiful hotel but not the friendliest staff.”
Reviews.Author: BostonSunworshipper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Intercontinentals and the quality is always superb, the Intercontinental Sydney was no exception. The rooms were posh, the lobby was beautiful, the gym was great (although is also a full-time membership gym with lots of trainers lurking around), and the indoor pool was also very nice. The best part is the superb location (footsteps from Circular Quay and the Botanical Garden) and the stunning views from the harbor-side rooms. Our only complaint is that compared to the other hotels we stayed at during our trip to Australia, the Intercontinental Hotel staff was aloof and uninterested, particularly the concierge who seemed bothered when asked questions (which was shocking given the nature of the job!) If they can work on the staff, it'd surely get 5 stars from us.

Reviews.Title: “A Fading Star....”
Reviews.Author: Gilmore68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over the Christmas period in an excec suite. I hadn't stayed for a few years and was honestly disappointed. Although we had a lovely view the rooms are starting to look shabby, particularly the bathrooms. Our bathroom, which was quite small in comparison to other 5 star hotels, had peeling wallpaper and a chipped vanity, although the Elemis toiletries are a nice touch. The bathtub was also not inviting. I understand the exec suites are the only rooms to have walk in showers and that other rooms have over the bath showers. The beds have awful mattresses, you can feel the springs in them even though they have mattress toppers. After the first night I asked house keeping to put another mattress topper on the bed as I thought this might improve the comfort of the mattress - I was wrong! The IC could learn alot from the Westin regarding bedding. The staff are also very rude. When we first made it to the hotel, after some confusion about which driveway to enter, we drove straight down to the underground car park. The parking attendant was very rude and seemed annoyed with us and I saw him roll his eyes when I asked to collect one more thing from the car before they parked it. The service in the exec lounge is not geat. Drinks service is very slow, although the drinks menu is good. My husband was disappointed that there were only tasting plates and not a snack buffet. I left the lounge to go back to the room and get something and when I came back I was literally chased down for my room number, ironically by a staff member who had previously served me 3 drinks.... On the positive side, the quality of linen on the beds is very good and the view from the club lounge is great, especially at night, however we won't be back until they do a refurb and the attitude of their staff improves. I will be keeping on eye on trip advisor to see if reviews improve.

Reviews.Title: “Fav Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yngflyer
Reviews.Content: Been to Sydney a fair bit but this was the first time at this IC and I was totally happy with it! The room was on the second top floor with an amazing view of the bay and a slight view of the opera house! The bed is amazing and the sense of space in the room was great. The only slight let down is the bathroom but I am sure that will be the next for a major change- it was far to small! Service was excellent from check-in to valet to check out all friendly! I've stayed in some decent hotels around the world and this IC is great and I will be using it as my Sydney regular! :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Eamonn1975
Reviews.Content: Great location and view but that was about it. The staff were generally cold and disinterested with one or two exceptions. We were on our honeymoon and on checking in we were practically ignored by the receptionist. No welcome, no inquiry as to how we were. We had spent the past 36 hours travelling to Sydney and I was taken aback by the coldness of the greeting, or lack thereof. It set the tone for our stay and we are unlikely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: ToshKent
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights here as part of our silver wedding anniversary holiday and chose an Opera House view room which was quite expensive but really great. However, that was the only aspect of our stay that rates well. On check-in our greeting was almost non-existent and the receptionist chose to deal with another customer at the same time. This was very disappointing given that our travel agent had advised all of the hotels on our 10 week itinerary that this was a special holiday and almost all the others had special greetings for us, or flowers in the rooms, or some sparkling wine or all three. By stark contrast we were made to feel distinctly ordinary by the staff at the Intercontinental who would normally carry on conversations with each other before pausing to deal with a guest request. After a day of this I took a list of complaints to the Concierge desk (there was no-one at Reception) and was told the manager would be advised. Either he wasn't or he didn't care because we had no contact from him or his assistants - not even a note in the room apologising for the service shortcomings. My summary is that this is a 5-star hotel only in terms of the building and the fixtures/fittings. The service most definitely is NOT 5 Star. In fact I've had better service at 3 star Holiday Inns !! If we go back to Sydney we will choose the Shangri-La, the Hyatt or the Four Seasons - all of which are similar prices/gradings, but with 5 Star service to go with it. In fact, so bad did the Intercontinental makes us feel at the end of our holiday that it is unlikely we will use them again - EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Justretiredlovinit
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale hotel located downtown a 5 minute walk from pier, ferries, excellent restaurants and Opera House. Part of hotel is a well-maintained, beautiful 1800's historic building with a modern hotel tower attached. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast in the Cafe Opera was extensive and complete with eggs made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: inttraveler77
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend wanted to stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in Sydney b/c she had heard that the one in San Francisco was superb. This was not the case here. We were rudely awakened by the sound of hammering and drilling every morning from the construction that was going on the 25th floor. You would think that they would have the construction crew start later instead of at 7am when guest are still sleeping. When I asked customer service what was going on, she responded that there was construction going on and that she had asked them to start later. Unfortunately later was only 30 minutes later. I am disappointed she did not suggest moving us to another room. What poor service. This was also evident with the chief concierge, David [-]. When I had asked him directions on how to cross the harbor bridge, he then asked me if I had a map. Seriously? If I had a map, would I be asking him. I think Mr. [-] has been too complacent w/ his title of chief concierge. If anything, Phil should be the chief concierge. He was very thorough and helpful. Thank you Phil and Danny. They were two of the most helpful staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the view”
Reviews.Author: accipitor
Reviews.Content: This Intercon has well furnished comfortable rooms although the bathroom is a little small and old fashioned. We only stayed one night on our way home and skipped breakfast as we had lunch plans. Get a room with a view of the harbour, order a bottle of wine and turn the lights off! Great location by the Botanical Gardens just off Circular Quay and the blend of old with new building is very good.

Reviews.Title: “wishing we were in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: tomtib
Reviews.Content: stayed here for christmas 6 nights in total in a club room room fine check in staff great club room staff need more training the hotel is in an old building and we expected it not to be as swish as some intercons but staff training can be done anywhere. the room was fine but overall it just did not have it

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Standard - Almost Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Genius12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a wider holiday to Australia. Check-in was efficient and professional, with the porters addressing us by name, having picked up our name from our frequent flyer bag tags. As an IC Gold Ambassador, we were upgraded to a room with a better view, which was lovely. Whilst the twin room was fine and had recently been refurbished, the bathroom was not, and didn't have a walk-in shower (none of the standard rooms in the hotel do). Furthermore, the bathroom drawers were chipped, the sink stained, the toilet flush cracked and mould was around the base of the tiles by the bath. We called won to reception who offered to show us another room, however the condition of the bathroom was exactly the same. Shortly, the duty manager arrived and showed us a corner suite (fantastic - with hall, cloakroom, living room, bedroom and bathroom with walk in shower, and in much better condition). We accepted this room for a 50% reduction in upgrade price - the view was spectacular of the harbour bridge and opera house. The Club lounge view was staggering, and breakfast selection excellent. There was one waiter on our first evening who was a bit rude as we tried to access the club with our keycard that wouldn't work for some reason - he practically accused us of trying to gain access when we weren't entitled... Apart from that, the rest of the serve was excellent. There is a paid-for menu in the Club lounge after canapes which is a tad confusing for those accustomed to all Club lounges being free! The public areas of the hotel are very nicely appointed. One small gripe - mineral water was not replenished daily and fruit bowl was not awaiting on arrival in our room. Apart from this and the minor gripes about one waiter in the Club lounge and the standard room bathrooms, the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AZEgan
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was very good. I booked a Bay View Room on Priceline and it was in my price range. I am not a frequent traveller and I don't rack up a lot of points so I am never upgraded, but that's ok with me. The room was clean and comfortable. I was on the 17th floor, if I remember correctly and I was not bothered by any traffic noise from the expressway below. This was in part due to a low hum coming from the air conditioner. I like to sleep with consistant white noise so it was okay. I was in room 1707 and was one off from the elevator bay, If you are in room 06 or 05 you might be bothered by elevator noise. The elevaor bay runs east/west. I liked that they have a power converter in the room and I will add my voice to the chorus of those demanding free wi-fi. All in all, a great location. Personally, I would not spend the money for the Harbor View, but I would not say no if they wanted to upgrade me.

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dogpoint
Reviews.Content: We entered our room only to be welcomed by a strong room deodorant that failed to mask the cigarette smell. There was almost no pressure for the hot water in the shower so my husband ended up taking a cold shower. The hook to hang robes in the bathroom was dangling from one screw. The hotel in general could updating. The room had a lovely view of the harbor, but the room was not what you would expect for $480.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: In Sydney I usually stay at several Holiday Inns, but I found a good deal for a couple of nights at the IC and decided to give it a try. I was lucky to receive an upgrade to a harbourview room. Unfortunately, from the 20th floor you only get to see a small part of the roof of the Opera House, but I had a quite a nice view of the Harbour Bridge sandwiched between 2 buildings. The room was a bit disappointing, though. Not too big and with quite old-fashioned furniture, but it didnâ€™t worry me much. What looked much better was the Cortile Bar downstairs, really elegant, even though I didnâ€™t go inside. The swimming-pool, on the 31st floor, is nice enough and has great views of the bridge and, this time, the Opera House. And location is great, with the harbour 5 minutes away, and other interesting parts of the city walkable from the hotel. So all in all a great hotel, but maybe too expensive for what itâ€™s worth.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: dlg22
Reviews.Content: These people do what they're supposed to do very well and small minded complaints about minor issues are distracting from what's really good about this true five star hotel -it's stylish, staff are friendly and it's in a great location with views of the Sydney Opera House. The harbour as beautiful for my 3 day trip. The Oprah Winfrey show was in town while I was there and it was amazing to see how much Sydney was affected by this. It was extraordinary - I never would have believed it if I hadn't seen it. The Intercontinental was fantastic and worth it as a genuine good travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gone to the dogs”
Reviews.Author: Isurava
Reviews.Content: This place used to be one of the best hotels in Sydney, perfect location, great service, can do attitude. Used to be being the operative words however.
