We stayed here just after Xmas and it was a huge disappointment. Every thing we asked for was a problem. The staff were all "very busy" and "very important". We paid $60 extra for the lounge access. What a rort. The staff there have no idea. The service was precious and very slow. They chase you down like a war criminal for your room number but try getting a drink! Or the right drink. Just way too busy it seems. The other thing we found frustrating was that the hotel seems to be staffed by 15 year olds who have English as a third language. Now I'm all for the holiday visa scheme but in a five star hotel it would be nice if the staff could understand what your saying. If you want genuine 5 star service in Sydney this is just not the place anymore. Shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice bed”
Reviews.Author: hockeygirl28
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, upscale hotel. The lobby is very elegant and the front desk and concierge were very professional. My cousin had his wedding here and put us up for a few nights. There is a swimming pool with a nice view and a good fitness center with a variety of machines and free weights. The best part of the room was the bed. Well decorated and super comfy. I had a view of the park. Turn down service was fun and the automatic window shades were a treat. The shower could be updated. There was a little window in the bathroom and speakers so that you could watch tv . Location was excellent. Just a 5 minute walk to the Opera House. Pretty pricey hotel but if you can afford it-go for it! In general, food, accomadation, and activities are expensive in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in standard city-view room for two nights during the beginning of Jan 2010, just for a short break. My first impressions of the hotel were through the reception desk and lobby. The reception staff member was quite friendly and I was allowed an early check-in at about 10am. The lobby itself struck me as being quite small and not particularly grand or large for a hotel in this class but it was functional. The room seemed to be quite bland and average and the furniture and fittings didnâ€™t look overly impressive for a five-star hotel. Unfortunately, I could find dust in many parts of the room and particularly in the difficult-to-access areas such as under the TV and on the bedside cabinets. The room just didnâ€™t seem all that well integrated and welcoming, it looked like the various items had just been put together without much emphasis on how well they integrated. The quality of the furniture didnâ€™t seem high. The sofa seating directly next to the window was quite worn. The room also didnâ€™t seem to be very large. I had a slight problem with the room air-conditioning, as the air flow wasnâ€™t quite sufficient even on a high setting. I was staying with a few relatives who were in a separate room and their room seemed to be much better ventilated on the same fan setting. The bathroom was quite small and couldnâ€™t really convey a sense of luxury. Itâ€™s in the same colour scheme as the Intercontinental Singapore but wasnâ€™t as large and the overall quality was not as high. The bed itself was comfortable but I had a difficult first night, possibly due to the pillows being a little too soft. I had a better second night, probably because I was used to the room and environment more than anything else. Overall, if I was to compare the room here to that of the Intercontinental Singapore, itâ€™s clear that the room standard was a fair bit lower here. The room was smaller, the furnishings and bathroom were not as good as in Singapore and the overall sense of homeliness and ambience were just not quite there. Having said all that, the room did seem to come to life a little at night and the lighting created a much more intimate and special ambience at night-time. The view of the city at night and during the day were both quite impressive. I had room service a number of times during the stay and while the food was alright in my opinion, my relatives didnâ€™t seem impressed and they had been staying here a few times over the years prior to this stay. They commented that the food quality and presentation had declined from previously impressive standards. Once, they were quite late with an evening order so they made it complimentary, which was nice but weâ€™d ordered room service a few times up to that point. We also tried the high-tea once and again, there seemed to be some issues just keeping it from being a top-quality experience. The furniture was quite worn and the setting wasnâ€™t really that classy. Service was ok, as with other parts of the hotel. The service was always merely just ok. Once, I asked the concierge desk about whether there was any internet available free-of-charge and they didnâ€™t seem too welcoming in first receiving any questions and then with the question itself, which is not really how a five-star property should operate. My mother wanted to book a stay here and the reservation desk wasnâ€™t that helpful in answering questions and when she called back to confirm the stay, nobody answered in spite of 3 calls, where there was plenty of time given to pick up the phone. She ended up staying at the Four Seasons in Sydney, where the service at reservations and at the hotel was much better, but the rooms there were very small. I did try the breakfast here, the quality and range were ok but again, the price demanded a little more. The location of the hotel is a relative strong point. Itâ€™s close to the Rocks area and also to the Harbour. I walked to Darling Harbour without any problems. Overall, this hotel is likely to be quite good by Sydney standards and its relatively high ranking on Tripadvisor is perhaps justified but the hospitality and room standards in Australia for the five-star properties are quite some way behind those in Asia while costing more and thatâ€™s a view professed by quite a few Australians on travel websites. Taking that into account, itâ€™s difficult to give a precise opinion on this property but for a five-star in Sydney, it likely makes the grade, although it did appear to be slipping a little in some areas. Note: A video of the hotel room/bathroom can be found on my youtube page: http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good facilities”
Reviews.Author: pcjhome
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our first and also last stop in a tour of Australia & NZ from the UK: we used eBookers and got a good rate. The price of the continental breakfast seemed quite high, but then the exchange rate was not particularly good at the time. We had dinner in 'Etch' which was very good.....the restaraunt is in the hotel but run as a separate entity. The swimming pool was a good size. There was a separate billing arrangement for internet. When we returned in December our room allocated was designed for wheelchair use: we found it lacked enough shelf space in the bathroom and the bathroom door was large and difficult to close. The reception staff were really very good and changed our room even though the hotel was fully booked with Opera Winfrey supporters.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: savvyttraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night. We chose it for it's proximity to Sydney Opera House as we went to see George Benson on our final night of our holiday. The hotel has a very impressive lounge area and restaurant - beautiful old building and very nicely decorated. It's only a five minute stroll to the Opera House and even closer to Circular Quay - so great as a base to explore the fabulous harbour and make use of the ferries. The rooms are very spacious and clean with ample space for suitcases. The bathroom is smallish but very clean and great toiletries. It has a novel little window that opens into the room - we guess it was to see the tv whilst cleaning your teeth! Very comfy beds. Tea & coffee maker in room, in-room safe, gowns and slippers, ironing board etc. Nice looking pool and spa area and we had a peep at the top of the hotel which is for club members only at the private bar with outside terrace - what a spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “The view from the lounge is priceless”
Reviews.Author: MrC64
Reviews.Content: My first experience of Intercontinental. Service was polished and friendly. We were lucky enough to upgrade the room to include access to the top floor lounge. We arrived early and our room was not available but the lounge staff arranged coffee, organised access to a shower (which was great after a 24 hour flight). We used this hotel at the start and end of our trip to Australia and were able to leave 2 suitcases at the hotel whilst we travelled. The rooms are spacious and with great views. The location is perfect, 3-4 minutes from circular quay and the opera house. If we are lucky enough to return to Sydney in the future we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Intercontinental 5 years ago on business. This time, again for 2 nights, was for leisure. It was a "mixed bag" experience. The location, just one block from Circular Quay, and opposite the Botanical Gardens, is great. We walked everywhere - to shopping in the city, to the Art Galleries, and to the Wharf Theatre. I would give a 5 star rating to the beds, linen, pillows, towels and TV. The room itself (city view) and the bathroom are only 3 star quality, and at $329/night, grossly overpriced. Seating consisted of a comfortable desk chair, and a very uncomfortable chaise lounge and window box seat. The shower was over an old bath tub, with very poor water pressure. The basin's hot water tap leaked. Breakfast, at $45 per person, was woeful. There was no-one to cook eggs to order. Bain marie food included poached (cold) and scrambled (watery) eggs, tough mushrooms and tasteless bacon. The tomato juice was watered down (or of a very inferior quality), the coffee was undrinkable, and the wait staff were surly. A much better choice for breakfast is the Museum of Sydney, diagonally across from the Intercontinental main entrance - great food and coffee at reasonable prices. The pool has a great view of the city, but if you are a lap swimmer, don't bother - you will only do 3-4 strokes/lap! Parking costs $45/night. I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of it All -- Great Place To Be for New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay here, especially if this is your first visit to Sydney, this is hands-down definitely the time to splurge on 1 of the rooms advertised with a Bridge & Opera House view (along with whatever set of amenities best suits your needs). The views of the iconic Opera House, Harbour Bridge the coves & Darling Harbour are the icing on the cake and entirely WORTH IT. Be sure to opt for a room permitting you access to the rooftop (Exec. club level), ESPECIALLY FOR NEW YEAR'S EVE. The Aussies put the rest of the world to shame when they celebrate NYE with their fireworks! Alternatively, if you don't have that luxury, you have an excellent view of both from the pool level and the hotel itself is located just steps from the Opera House, Circular Quay, the Rocks, etc. One of my favorite parts of Sydney is the Royal Botanical Gardens, which are RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET. It is beautiful in there, relaxing and great to bring the paper or a book, or go for a run through the paths. Btw, look for bats -- even during the day (no joke). If you like to shop, exit the hotel on Macquarie St. and make a right to head to the Queen Victoria Building, or QVB, the shops in/around Martin Plaza & lining George Street (high-end). Along the way, you'll see several really great museums. General impression of hotel staff and accommodation: Overall, they were polite...no particular complaint, but the staff just weren't as enthusiastic to help or show me their city as I've experienced when visiting other hotels***. I was unpleasantly surprised to find that my 15" laptop could not fit in my in-room safe or that the staff downstairs did not have a safety deposit box large enough for my laptop and refused to take it (a 5-star hotel should certainly be able to handle a request like that)***In-room internet fees are much too high. The hotel is tastefully decorated. The facade, to me, somehow reminds us of Australian roots in mining. The entrance lobby/first floor has a nice, sleek design. Security is a priority with key cards being required for elevator operation. There were several features to my rooms that I was happy the hotel utilized: speakers (linked to TV system) in bathroom to listen to the news while getting ready in the morning; part of the bathroom console opened to the room, which allowed a lot of natural light; a lot of magazines, books were stocked in the room, and I found them very informative; and, finally, I was happy with the electric-powered blackout shades.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Subrus
Reviews.Content: This is bang on Sydney Harbour, with great views of the bridge and Opera House. If your office is in the CBD, this is perhaps the best option. Plus, with Harbour station, within walking distance, you can commute easily, to your desired destination. The only caveat I see is that the hotel is expensive. If you want to eat out, it is best that you walk down to the harbour and check out the cafes there.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on previous trips, and this visit makes we want to return again. Room #2820 is spacious, with a king bed and a city view to the Royal Botanic Gardens. Spotless housekeeping. All the stuff you expect in a good business class hotel are here: coffee maker, nice toiletries, good linens, robes, in-room safe, iron & board, etc. Admittedly, if my wife was with me, she would have preferred to have a bathtub, but there were two shower stalls that were roomy and with different shower heads. I always enjoy booking the Club level here. Great harbor views are a nice setting at the complimentary wine/beer hours (5-7) with good hors d'oeuvres. Very good breakfast omlets, pastries, etc. in the morning. It was also nice to see that the manager was often around the breakfast room. Dinner at Etch was quite good. It specializes in local food, fresh ingredients, pretty good wine list. The pool and fitness center are on a high floor, also offering nice views. I didn't use it much -- I was on the go -- but it seems well-maintained. I was here on business for a week with colleagues and experienced professional, friendly service with no glitches the entire time. We also used one of the well-maintained conference rooms. Excellent location -- an easy walk to the ferry, subway stop, and the Rocks area, which has upscale shops and cafes. The hotel itself is a nice mix of a modern hotel tower grafted onto an historic Treasury building, with the public rooms pretty grand.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome resting place in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BarefootReviewer
Reviews.Content: As a base for exploring Sydney this hotel cannot be bettered. We had a deluxe bay view room - spacious, clean, quiet, amazing view... Room service was prompt, courteous and efficient. Both meals we had in our room were excellent. The room had automatic blackout blinds which were super-effective and really helpful when trying to nap in the afternoon due to jet-lag. Everyone we encountered was courteous, helpful and efficient. I would love to return for longer! Bathroom was good with plenty of free toiletries. Having an ironing board in the room was a nice touch: also a 'welcome' plate of macroons was much appreicated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times since 2005 and would expect to us it again on my next trip. The hotel is one block away from the Harbor and overlooks the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens. The buses and train are close by as well. ( It is $4.50 and an 11 minute train ride to the airport) Hotel room was quiet, very clean. Plenty of hot water in shower. Room had plenty of space and fabulous city view. Concierge helpful. Property is in great shape and is modern and stylish. My experiences at this hotel have been consistently excellent. Try breakfast on the harbor at the Portobello (opera house side). People watching is fabulous especially around 7 ish as the bars by the opera house start to fill up.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, what you'd expect from upscale chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCBiztraveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in the CBD, with circular quay, opera house, and botanical gardens at your doorstep. Very competent service--I stayed for 10 days and had no problems or glitches. However I would not call the service exceptional in that it lacked the personal touch you find in the best hotels. Rooms comfortable, well-equipped, nicely decorated and very clean. Club level has spectacular lounge and was worth the upcharge. Main complaint: fees for extras, food, etc. are exoribant--for example, $25 per day for internet, $45 for buffet breakfast, $6.50 for a very small bottle of water from the minibar, $15 for one piece of laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but rather overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Wurst2
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Hotel is located in the Sydney CBD, but it is a few blocks away from where most of the other premium hotels are located. Rooms were quite dated and obviously needed a renovation, quite urgently. The restaurant and bar were definitely quite overpriced for what they offered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirlandpaul
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights at the Intercontinental Sydney. A lovely hotel. Just one gripe - I was ignored when I ventured down to the Cortile Bar, felt invisible! Apart from this just perfect in every way

Reviews.Title: “Club Lounge service poor”
Reviews.Author: diablo11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel to stay, particularly with the views of the Harbour and Opera House. As Ambassodor members we were upgraded to a perfect room with a fantastic view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. However, the Club Lounge needs to offer a better service. The wait to be served by the hotel staff was a ridiculously long wait; twenty minutes and Sunday morning breakfast was a disgrace; it many . The staff could not keep up with the demand. As a result, we had breakfast elsewhere. However, after saying all that, the Club Lounge staff were extremely courteous and aware of the lack of appropiate staff levels and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE. But only if your boss is paying!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous065
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. You are 15 mins walk or less from the Sydney Opera House/Botanic Gardens/Sydney Tower/Museum of Sydney. You're in the CBD, so buses are everywhere. Waiting area in front of reception is a little spartan but the furnishings improve once you're in the main lounge area. The room was in excellent condition and view was good though the construction work on one of the buildings a block away did spoil it a bit. I would have preferred blockout blinds, or at least a thick curtain to cover the window, rather than the pull-down blinds they had when I was there, which were a tiny little bit see-through - I like my sleep in complete darkness but i guess you can't have everything! Would have wished the rates weren't so high; at least I know it's a quality establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: culverwood
Reviews.Content: The club rooms give you access to the rooftop bar/terrace and are worth getting if you can. The position is good but the surrounding tall buildings limit the views to some extent. The king-size bed was poor as my partner could feel every movement I made and they were not able to find a twin room of the same standard to move us into.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome position. Staff fantasic”
Reviews.Author: suez
Reviews.Content: Staff were great. We arrived and asked if we could upgrade to a club room. Yep no problem. We had great service for breakfast and pre dinner cocktails. Unfortinately the tasting plate with pre dinner drinks let it down. We stayed there 5 nights and I would have to say quality of nibbles was ok at best. Considering the quality of the hotel why weren't the canapes heated Was this because a wedding reception was on the same night. Seriously someone needs to take control of these ad they create an incorrect impression

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: snurglefarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in a Club Room with my fiancee. The checkin process was speedy and our room was upgraded to a harbour view. We visited the Club lounge on the top floor for cocktails at sunset. the view across the harbour was fantastic. All staff we encountered were polite, enthusiastic and helpful. We had the buffet breakfast in the Club lounge every day. Highly recommended! The hotel is in a great spot. We were able to walk through the Botanic Gardens to the NSW Art Gallery and on to Potts Point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: helenandmatthew
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is a great hotel that will suit any person wishing to stay in a central location, easy walking distance of most sights within Sydney, whilst also enjoying a high standard of service. We found there were many business travellers, though this was a good experience with the famous faces we saw there.. mainly the England Rugby Team! The staff were very helpful and friendly and we had a truly enjoyable stay. The option of upgrading to a Club room or paying for Club access locally is a MUST as you can enjoy spectacular panoramic views of Sydney Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with in good location”
Reviews.Author: tupu_rana
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed there for 4 nights from 16th July. I was with my husband and a grown up daughter Hotel is located at very good place and with good rooms, view and services. Room were large with Darling houbor view. Hotel staff were helpful. Overall good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE service; faulty rooms”
Reviews.Author: reportingfromupclose
Reviews.Content: Never understood what some of the earlier reviews meant by "bad service".. Always thought - how bad can it be ?! Well I know now ! We were shunted across 2 faulty rooms (over-heated, non working air conditioning) and wasted an hour before being given the final 3rd room. The people at the reception are very bad and have no concept pf service... The bad service spoilt opur vacation in Sydney - wouldn't recommend staying here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean room with a superb view.”
Reviews.Author: 1200det
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many 5 star hotels around Sydney in the past few months for Business and Pleasure. Intercontinental was superb during our last 4 night stay in October. Upon arriving our bags were unpacked from the vehicle and taken up to our room ready for check-in. Upon arriving to the room it was super clean (with gorgeous body washes and robes etc.) and within 5 minutes our bags arrived into the room. Daily we received a newspaper and the cleaners were very thorough... We stayed on the 24th floor with an outstanding view of the Botanic Gardens. The POOL is super super warm and the view from the Pool is brilliant looking over the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. I went up to the pool before 7am for some pictures... What a picture and view A ++++++++ Circular Quay is about 2 minuteâ€™s walk from the hotel down a slight incline in which there are several 24 hour stores with groceries etc. including a 24 hour cafe in the Quay. Easy walk couple of minute walk to the Quay, Botanic Gardens, Ferries and Train which opens you up to Darling Harbour, Manly etc., We also caught a local bus from the Quay to Bondi Beach. As mentioned previously during checkout we were not asked how our room nor stay was and 4 days later I still have a few hundreds $$$ hung up on my credit card so will need to watch this to ensure I am not charged any extras.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient, high end hotel, in the heart of Sydney's tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyman56
Reviews.Content: The room size was great with comfortable king bed. I loved the corner room with lots of windows, and saw the marathon out them. It was one block from Sydney Harbor, the Opera House, and the Historic Rock District. Wet bar and parking were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat34B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in early October 2010. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. Room was immaculate with a great view. Bed was very comfortable. Although hotel's address is listed as Macquarie Street, vehicle entrance is off Phillip St near inception of Bridge St,

Reviews.Title: “Really well located comfortable hote - thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Diva_8
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we'd an initial problem with husband's credit card and staff we're extremely helpful and patient. Room was beautifully layed out, one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in have to say. Well located - 5mins to Circular Quay (ferries, Sydney Opera House, view of Harbour Bridge), and less then 10min walk to Georges Street (main street). Restaurant was quite fancy, ate there once, food was yum but extremely overpriced and felt quite out of place amongst the elite of society whilst we wore our day clothes. But all and all, big thumbs up for here

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: AussiExpatinHongKong
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay here and whilst it is clean, and the location is good, with all necessary amenities and facilities, it just doesnâ€™t quite make it as true 5 star hotel. There are obvious areas where the hotel has tried to make savings, which at 5 star rates is not OK. The service is a bit hit and miss, some are great , some staff obviously donâ€™t want to be there. Particularly the service in the breakfast restaurant. The gym is outdated these days, needs equipment upgrading, and as they let outside guests be members its very busy in the morning particularly. Pool is nice. Iâ€™d stay again, but not expecting the WOW of a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: biddy9
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for one night at the InterContinental hotel. I was thoroughly impressed by the consistently good service. Every staff member I encountered was professional and highly service-oriented. My friend and I were also thrilled with our 'triple upgrade', with a view over the harbour. The location is excellent too - right near the ferries and train station (easy access to the airport). I will be coming back here and recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for first Sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: Robbieinvictoria
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our base for a six-night visit to the Sydney area. The location is perfect for walking to Circular Quay, the Rocks and the CBD. I most appreciated that it is located directly across the street from the Royal Botanic Gardens, since I took morning runs through them and around the Opera House each morning. The hotel integrates Sydney's historic Treasury Building into a modern hotel structure. The result is far more interesting, from an architectural point of view, than a typical corporate hotel. We found our room and bathroom to be on the smaller side, but both to be comfortable, quiet and clean. There is a nice window seat, which is an unusual feature. My only suggestion for improvement is for the hotel to offer internet rates that are competitive internationally. We paid twice what I pay at the Four Seasons in North America. Free WiFi access in the lobby would be a reasonable amenity for guests. We walked to McDonalds instead, which offered free access. Seemed strange to be staying at an InterCon, and having to walk to McDonalds to check email. I would recommend this hotel primarily for its fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Special and memorable”
Reviews.Author: thirtyfour
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and enjoyed every moment. The setting was perfect and the hotel staff were the best I had ever come across. Their politeness and assistance made our stay even more memorable. Management deserve a big pat on the back for a well run operation. The hotel is very central to all amenities and attractions. Within walking distance to everything.The hotel Restaurant (Cafe Opera) is so good there is no need to dine anywhere else. In fact after a day out sightseeing I looked forward to getting back to the hotel to relax and the sheer pleasure of being there. The cost is reasonable considering what you get. I would rate this place very highly toanyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Top location”
Reviews.Author: Theogeor
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney between the 11th and 23rd of September on business and I have chosen the InterContinental Hotel for my stay. I arrived at the hotel on a Saturday night and quickly the staff got my bags and the check in was quick and efficient. I was given a room on the 25th floor with City Views which might not be as good as the harbour but it was at the corner of the hotel so I had no noise at all. The room was nicely decorated and clean and a nice fruit platter (which was maintain during my stay ) was waiting for me with a handwritten letter welcoming me which it was nice. Breakfast in the hotel was fine but not one of the best I ever had but no complains about it. The hotel bar on the other hand was great for light dinner and drinks and the service was excelent with the staff been friendly and efficient. Location wise not only it was not far from our local office but I was only few minutes from the Sydney main attractions i.e. Opera/Bridge etc which it was great as some nights I was able to go for a quick and relaxing walk around the sites. One thing I was impressed with the facilities was the TV system they have in the rooms. Not only you have a good LCD screen but also a fully digital high quality TV system which is nice to see as I do not often see that in hotels. From what I have been told is a very new installation. Price wise is what you excpect of a hotel of its class and location so not cheap.. I would say overall I was very pleased with my choise and my stay was confortable so next time I am back in Sydney it will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: liveforholidays-44
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on the weekend in a King Deluxe Harbour View Room, which had a fantastic view of the Harbour Bridge. The hotel was really conveniently located near Circular Quay & the Opera House. The staff were great, really helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We didn't eat in the restaurants but did have roomservice one night which was very nice. I thought it was very handy having the beauty salon on site - great if you have a special occassion planned. We had a great stay, will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern, clean hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneEmma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with friends. The rooms were clean and modern. We had a great view of the harbour. All interactions with staff were very friendly and helpful, especially concierge.

Reviews.Title: “My home from home,..... across the world!”
Reviews.Author: TheVeryLastResort
Reviews.Content: I frequently stayed at this hotel during my working life, and have seen no reason to alter that situation, now that I am retired. In short it is; my most favourite hotel in all of the world, and trust me, I've stayed in a few. We've chosen to stay at the Sydney Intercontinental 3 times in 13 months and have found absolutely no reason to ever consider anywhere else. Faultless service, treated as a guest not as a commodity, where 'How can I help you Mr........?' means exactly that. Housed within the Old Treasury building, the hotel is low key and quietly understated in external appearance, but once inside, the best kept secret in Sydney reveals itself immediately. The rooms are all beautifully maintained and are immaculate in every way upon arrival. We prefer the slightly more expensive Watsons Bay rooms, (as we are there primarily to begin or end a cruise), but have also been fortunate enough to have been given the full sydney harbour view rooms including the Opera House too. The location is second to none, just 2 minutes down to eclectic Circular Quay with its ferries, trains, buses and waterside restaurants and cafes, and only another minute further to the Opera House complex itself. The Sydney Waterfront and the 'Rocks' area are no more than a 10 minute stroll away. Alternatively, Horseshoe Bay, The Botanical gardens and the Music Conservatoire are just across the road, if looking for some quieter recreation. All that Sydney has to offer right on the hotel doorstep! I just can't fault this hotel, and therefore see no reason to do so! Sure, it is probably my biggest luxury in life , but why not when it is always this good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the best breakfast and very happy with the stay”
Reviews.Author: move_along46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in easy walking distance to circular quay, the Sydney Opera House, the botanical gardens and Sydney Museum. We had a room on 25th floor with a fantastic city view which included some of the harbour so we can only image how good the rooms with a harbour views must have been. The food in Cafe Opera for breakfast was all delicous and a great selection. We had dinner in Etch restaurant which was delicous. Very good service and a lovely setting and we thought it was very reasonably priced for an up market restaurant. The service was generally very good esp at reception. Only staff issues noted were er the porter was very slow delivering luggage to room and the waiter in Cafe Opera for breakfast took our tea and coffee order then forgot to deliver it! The hotel services required you to view them on the TV but it wasn't working due to a recent "upgrade"and there was no back up of written information in the room. Lots of lovely touches like turn down service with chocolates and bottles of spring water. Complimentary newspaper delivered to your room. Pool and gym looked great but didn't get a chance to use them. We would be happy to stay here again if we got another great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay From Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: BeccaAir
Reviews.Content: After traveling overnight with my grandfather from the States and booking a Bridge View room I was so pleased to be upgraded (due to being PC platinum) to an AMAZING room of the full Sydney Harbour/Opera House. My grandfather has always wanted to come to Sydney and this room exceeded his expectations and was well worth the flight down. We had fantastic service from the reception area, one young lady in particular went above and beyond to make this trip perfect for us. Our room was exceptionally comfortable and well appointed. I normally stay elsewhere when in Sydney but will now be a return customer whenever I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not moving with the times”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to come back to this hotel, but in truth this last visit of 3 days was, for the first time, disappointing. The suite was beginning to look tired and just a little drab, the living room especially, and yes, in-room internet still being charged at extortionate rates. Fortunately, the Club lounge has complimentary wi-fi (as should the rooms for the rates charged) and it is a reasonable comfortable, though not private, place to work on the days issues. Lounge also offers an adequate breakfast and quite a good selection of evening canapÃ©s and drinks, with the option to sit on the roof terrace (though a bit cold this time of year) Overall, nothing wrong as such, just a hotel stuck in a time warp. Time to check out alternatives I think.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicejan
Reviews.Content: The usual good hotel features apply for this hotel. The bed was very comfortable and fittings were reasonably modern. The bathroom was good without being luxurious. As you would expect with an international hotel in a city location staff were attentive and friendly in that charming Aussie way. The thing that I will remember however is the magnificent club lounge: the views over Circular Quay are breathtaking especially just as the sun is setting.

Reviews.Title: “A trip across the ditch”
Reviews.Author: TimJ4
Reviews.Content: The location has to be the best part. Right on Circular Quay. If you can, get a club floor. It is well worth the lounge access. Rooms are excellent, although you could probably do better at the Sheraton, Hyatt or Shangri-La. Stay here for the view...

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: rfengler
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay at the Sydney Inter Continental, My wife and I was extremely great full to all the staff we interacted with. From the moment we drove up to the time we left the next day, every member of your staff we came across were pleasant, courteous, engaging and willing to service your requirements and make our stay even more pleasurable. During our short stay we met your staff from the front of house, reception, concierge, waitresses, room attendance and even the car park when we needed to retrieve an item from our car. I wish to convey our appreciation to all and we will be looking forward to our next stay. R&K Jerrabomberra NSW

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great heart & thoughtful.... Can not fault it at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Saturday Night August 28th 2010, which was yesterday. Me and my partner celebrated our anniversary. We booked a Deluxe Bayview Room which was great. I had never stayed here before and I was coming into this thinking it wasnt going to be a great experience but I was in for a good surprise. I had checked into the hotel with my friend first cause she wanted to see the hotel room cause we had spent the day in the city together and I had to wait for my partner. Upon arrival I was welcomed with a smiling faces from the concierge and bell person, which felt really nice. As I made my way to front desk to check in at 2pm (even though check in is 3pm) There was a bride making her way out to the car,kids were running around the bride and family following the bride laughing and having a good time, this gave me an instant feel of warmth and happiness. When I checked in front desk staff congratulated me on my anniversary and gave me a warm welcome.. When I entered the room, the room was spotless, the view was absolutely amazing. i was on level 25 we were in room 2509. The room felt so cozy and intimate but the best bit was the window seats. I had arrive with my friend first and still waiting for my partner, So we decided to go get something to eat, we came back around 4.30pm and to my surprise my friend notice a bottle of wine, 2 wine glasses and lil envelope and box of some sort. I opened it up. It was a box of Guylian chocolate and the envelope said congratulations. Which I thought was really sweet and thoughtful. Also after me and my partner came back from dinner we notice that they did a turnover service and chocolate on the side of bed. At around about 3am when we came back from enjoying a friends bday in the city nightlife we decided we needed a late check out. I called the Instant guest service and a pleasant staff member by the name of Dereck I think organized a late check out for us for 2pm. He was very pleasant and didnt sound dead or annoyed at 3am in the morning. We were very impress by that. Now to the bed, we had a great sleep, the bed was very soft and comfortable and the pillows were really really soft and fluffy. When we woke up we didnt want to leave because of the view so we decided to just sit and enjoy the view one last time. When we checked out, check out was quick, smooth and efficient. Overall this experience was fantastic....I can honestly say I really cant fault it.....I really regret not being able to fill out the feedback form even though I was meaning to do it but I just forgot.. I would definitely stay here again and recommen it to another. Even my partner who is very picky about customer service was very impress and could not say one bad thing about it. I hope they keep doing what they do because making people happy will give them alot of good karma....Thank you to all the stafff at Intercontinental Sydney.....Also I forgot to say....When we needed a taxi to get anywhere there was always a staff at the front of the hotel organising cabs every all hours of the day/night even when outside was freezing cold.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fipty801
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there on a quick trip to Oz. Booked online through Priority Club (Intercontinental Hotel Group Reward Program), and was not expecting such a wonderful room. Corner room overlooking Botanical Gardens on one side and Harbour Bridge / Circular Quay on the other. We actually stayed there the night Richmond AFL Football CLub got into trouble (Ben Cousins), but we didn't notice anything as we were already asleep by the time that blew up. As with all things Intercontinental, the service was excellent and you paid for it. Minor issues - we arrived at 3pm and our room wasn't ready, so we were offered drinks in the lobby lounge. When checking out we noted we were charged for the drinks! But if you can afford to stay there, a few extra bucks shouldn't matter. At least that was the attitude of the check out staff. Checkout was painfully slow. Too slow for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: nigeldiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. If you get a higher room the views are of the bay or harbor bridge. Fantastic outlook. Rooms were large, with modern fixtures. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was a little disappointing, I had a room with a step in bathtub for a shower, bathroom amenities were basic, but this could be resolved with a call to house keeping. Little bit of traffic noise from the 14th floor. Location is excellent, in circular quay, tourist mecca and CBD for business. I have run into two world famous atheletes here, Cathy Freeman and Martina Hingis. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very special”
Reviews.Author: autumn19
Reviews.Content: Checkin very smooth, staff polite, valet parking easy. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 28th floor overlooking the Botanical Gardens and the harbour to the east, everything was sparkling clean and fresh. Just loved the towels in the bathroom. Dinner in the Cafe Opera was great fun and lots of good seafood available. Breakfast was fair, the eggs were scrambled and not that nice, the poached eggs looked like wee white bullets...not game to try. But the worst was the spoon you used to dish up the scrambled eggs, it was kept in a container with water, with everyone putting it back in after use...a great way to grow "bugs"... this should be a big NO NO in a hotel of this standard. Only problem we had was a lack of instructions re the blinds...we could only use the see through blind which meant we were awake when the sun rose, and you could see all the lights all night. But will be VERY happy to try this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: hmlphoenix
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is situated in a very convenient location. It is a block and a half from the train station, Circular Quay (pronounced KEY). Our view was unbelievable. We could see almost the entire harbor (on our side) as well as the Opera House and could watch as visitors walked or jogged throughout the Royal Botanical Gardens which was only blocks away. This hotel is not for the money misers. It is, to quote my husband, "rather posh" and the prices reflect that. The internet is very expensive in Sydney and the room service/in room drinks etc. were exceptionally expensive. But, we had a comfortable bed, great tv to watch rugby in the evening, and one great view. It was worth it for our short stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant courteous helpful staff, terriffic service.”
Reviews.Author: jan_evans
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had the pleasure of staying in a room on the 16th floor with Club Lounge access. The cost was great value compared to other hotels with Club Lounge access. Hospitiality was AAA+, service in Club Lounge AAA+. From the moment we checked in and Ben (29th July) attended to us to the brialliant courteous staff in the Club Lounge and the checkout by a Duty manager on 31st July, we could fault nothing, food and drinks excellent, highly recommended and I would stay again. Location was perfect for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: digitalspy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a perfect location just up from Circular Quay where you can catch ferries, trains etc. Only real downside is that it is a business hotel and is fairly expensive but look around and you will find a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel.......poor immature service”
Reviews.Author: Furree
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller from Melbourne to Sydney where I work in Sydney Thursdays and Fridays. I work for a large firm and was excited to see the Intercon on our list of hotels to stay at. I over the past 12 weeks, I have stayed at the interview 12 times and a total of 24 nights. The rooms are great however, the front of house staff are shocking. From the doorman on the driveway to the front desk receptionists. I understand many of the staff are hotel school and believe in training junior members. I am however shocked that you would put some youth in a front line position that are unable to converse or engage with a guest. I have since started to stay at the Four Seasons down the road and cant fault that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I've been there in 2008 and coming again in 2010”
Reviews.Author: nowakadventuretravel
Reviews.Content: Good location, good standard, best view from the last floor. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff = 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: ruby2002Perth
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our daughters aged 8 & 12 years old. At our arrival there was a small issue with our room which wasn't the hotel's fault. The manager on duty handled it to our full satisfaction. The room offered the best views of Darling harbour, all the staff were very polite and helpful, the club lounge was fabulous, great breakfast, fantastic location. Overall one of the best hotels we have stayed in Australia and overseas.

Reviews.Title: “World's Best View from Your Room”
Reviews.Author: Whereisjan
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in one of the great hotels of the world. It's all about location and service and the InterContinental at The Rocks in Sydney has it all. The view from our room looking out over Sydney Harbour with the Opera House right there and the Sydney Harbour Bridge larger than life was fantastic, by day and especially by night. And the romance of watching the Circular Quay ferries cutting their way across the water was just unbeatable. Thanks so much to the wonderful InterContinental staff including Katie who were so accommodating. It's just a short stroll down the hill to Circular Quay and the Opera House and all of the history and spectacular scenery that goes with being right there in The Rocks. When it comes to value for the money you're spending on a 5 star experience, the Sydney InterContinental wins hands down compared with other nearby competitors we've experienced, including the Park Hyatt. This is one of life's great experiences at not much more than a normal hotel price. We've travelled to many great hotels including The Oriental in Bangkok and some of the super hotels in Dubai, and this one surpasses all because of the incredible view and incredible comfort. We hope we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: zoogma
Reviews.Content: The staff has been overload with work so missing some smile at the reception, but the concierge is always here to help you! Well centered in a business area and close to the Harbour... The view of the Harbour was amazing ! Rooms are beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views but very poor service and disappointing food quality”
Reviews.Author: ShonaWard
Reviews.Content: We chose a harbour view room with a stunning outlook ----comfortable room with all facilities. Rest of hotel was shabby and in need of refurbishment. Buffet dinner was $90 a head discounted to $75 for hotel guests. Cold buffet was wonderful but hot buffet was cold! ! Service was almost non-existant although the dining room was quiet. Hotel was expensive but seemed like a tourist class hotel ! Breakfast disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Location cant be beat”
Reviews.Author: ET59
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney and each time have had a great time. With a 5 yo and a 3yo, location and access to activities is paramount. Just a short stroll to Circular Quay Terminal for the ferry to Taronga zoo, or the Station to visit the Museum or Darling Harbour . We generally filled our mornings at some attraction, had a short afternoon break then a lovely walk thru the Botanic Gardens ( 3 mins walk away). Or a play in the indoor pool. The Club room we had this time included breakfast and a spectacular view. Room service was great and the room was easy to sleep in . Not bothered by the bath in the shower arrangement as you only spend a very small time there ( unless you are a kid in a bubble bath!) Are there any negatives ? Well this is mainly a business hotel so you see a lot of suits and snobby business types and some times the staff convey the impression that if you dont have a suit you may be less important. However I cant find any other hotel of this class with the practicality of the location and ease of access to all Sydney's main sights ( there is also a IGA supermarket 250 m away in the AMP building so you can buy all the basics you need ). We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I love the automated blinds”
Reviews.Author: keclare
Reviews.Content: The blinds give complete 'shut out' of the lights and this is really appreciated after a week of late nights while on business trips. I also like the small little window for your to still catch your tv shows will in the toilet. The toilet is a little disappointing as it is small compared to other 4-5 stars hotels i have stayed in as there is no seperate compartment for shower cubicles and bath tub. One thing I notice about non-asia hotels is that they don't cap the bottles of the shower gel, shampoo and conditioner after use. They dont usually provide complimentary water as well. The laundry is also not collected during housekeeping but you have to make a phone call and wait for them. Interesting but I still like this big rooms, Digital TV box and the modern concept around the hotel. I also like the lobby area, decent and quiet for an afternoon tea

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Paddingtontraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - only a short stroll from Opera House, and across the road from the botanic gardens. Our room had a beautiful view of the harbour. The room was a good size and well furnished. The bathroom was however a little dated. My wife says that the hot water had run out when she got back from the gym mid-morning. Service was professional. We were able to check into our room early, and were given a late checkout on request. A minor hiccup with the booking was fixed with the minimum of fuss. We had an excellent meal at one of the restaurants - 'Etch'.

Reviews.Title: “Whats with wireless in Australia?”
Reviews.Author: constantglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms. Snacks a bit measly in the top floor lounge but a killer view from up there. Gymn adequate.Breakfast adequate, but in a very nice, stylish atrium setting. Service is good too. my only gripe-and the Intercontinental is far from the only culprit in Sydney-what is with wireless access. Absurdly expensive. Ridiculously complicated to get hooked up. Only available if you stand on one leg facing due north with your laptop held to the heavens in exactly the right spot within the hotel. Come on guys-it's just a few electrons-you can probably afford to ease up on me 16 character cryptic passwords and maybe invest in a few more routers?? oh and by the way I am sure I'm not the only guy who wants to hook up his iPhone and iPAD and laptop without paying 3 x $25 for 24 hours worth of Internet access. okay-gripe over-everything else about the place ranges from adequate to good to excellent for the location and for the bed/sheets

Reviews.Title: “Impressed - Seafood Galore”
Reviews.Author: MOLLY255093
Reviews.Content: Well - WOW is all I can say when it comes to Cafe Opera ( Syd. ICH restaurant ) seafood buffet on Fri and Sat nights - it is exceptional with lobster halves and a fine array of countless other dishes. Stayed in a great Opera House view room with club access and enjoyed every minute of it. A special occasion for my partner and I which was made even more special by the beautiful club level privileges incl. high tea, twilight drinks with tasting dish and breakfast. Breakfast was the only component where a bit of work is needed on the hot food which is OK but limited. Staff were courteous at all times, while still being professional, with club level staff very attentive and well drilled. Location is great as is the view from the higher floors - I only hope we can afford this type of luxury again in the near future. BTW previous reviewers are correct when they mention the shower in the bath scenario which doesn't suit everyone ( especially older or impaired travelers ) which needs some attention in a five star establishment. The cleanliness was excellent though as was the bedding and turn down service. If you can afford it enjoy it - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Slow Slow internet!”
Reviews.Author: bizotraveller
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney each week and often stay at the Intercontinental to accrue my priorityclub rewards points. The rooms are ok, modern and you can control the air-con. But in recent trips the internet has been like dial-up. Unsure if guests are leeching torrents through the rooms when I'm there, but the average website takes 30 secs to load! I resorted to my wireless broadband to get access to the net instead. I have found the four seasons hotel just down the road to be much better in terms of room upgrades and overall service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...poor service”
Reviews.Author: scampy86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last Friday with my partner. We paid the full amount online earlier in the week and when we checked in they charged me for the room again on my credit card plus the $100 holding deposit! When I called to complain they told me I would have to wait 4-5 business days before receiving my money back. Shame about service...the room was nice albeit a bit dusty:- comfy bed, reasonable TV and a great view of the botanical gardens from a window seat. The buffet breakfast was ok, however it would be better to get there before 9am when the food is fresh. Good hotel if you want a quick stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: FranceMartine
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with a fantastic view over the harbour. Staff and service was excellent. We stayed for 3 nights and will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “what a poor hotel! I am disgusted!”
Reviews.Author: Tailer48
Reviews.Content: On my young family's trip around Australia one part we were all really look forward to was Sydney. We arrived at the hotel a little early and were told at reception desk a room would not be ready for around 2 hours. The concierge recommended a lovely cafe to eat in and then we returned to the hotel for our room - it was done. The room was not great for the price, did enjoy the electronic blinds though. The bathrooms were small with old shower/bathtub combination, very outdated for a hotel that claim to be 5 star. The view was good though. The main problem we had with this hotel was on our second night we wanted to ask concierge for a restaurant recommend but they were busy. We then asked the reception supervisor for a restaurant for a family - it was my 7year old daughters birthday. This person directed as to a restaurant in Kings Cross. Being from another country we were unaware this is actually a red light district with xrated "bars"!!!!!!! We were shocked to find ourselves walking through a red light village with unmoralistic women everywhere! I was disgusted and checked my family out the very next day without explaining what had happened for fear that if i saw that man i would not be able to restrain myself! We went straight to the Park Hyatt, now this was a beautiful hotel with knowledgeable staff!

Reviews.Title: “So good, we came back!”
Reviews.Author: Pudtraveller
Reviews.Content: As frequent and discerning travellers, we had high expectations of the Intercontinental in Sydney. Arriving from London in the very early morning, I was disappointed that the 'Ask the Concierge' service by email had not responded to my request for early check-in or advice as to what arrangements could be made for us to store luggage until our room would be ready. I took the precaution of booking an extra night so that a room would be provided upon arrival without the hassle I had been forewarned about on Tripadvisor. However, once we touched down in Sydney for our first visit to Australia, the hotel's meet and greet service had, as requested, sent a car to the airport to meet us and it was all plain sailing from then on. The rooms, housekeeping, facilities, restaurants and concierge services were all of the high standard we expect from Intercontinental. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. All in all, such a good experience that we changed our plans to return to this hotel for another few days at the end of our holiday so we could soak up a bit more of Sydney before departure. Its location is perfect for sightseeing and we found we did not need a car at all - everything can easily be reached by ferry or on foot or taxi if you are in a hurry. Intercontinentals are always expensive but in this hotel you get what you pay for - both the prices and the services delivered are 5 star. We had a very happy stay there and are happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TheCameleer
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here late last year. The hotel is in a good location for leisure travellers, being close to Circular Quay and nearby attractions, handy to public transport and as a bonus our room had a great view over the harbour. Although the rooms were a touch tired, they still had the expected amenities and live up to what you would expect from an Intercontinental Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for Sydney holiday”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteKL
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after reading the negative reviews about the InterContinental Hotel Sydney and we were pleasantly surprised! The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the location is perfect for sightseeing in Sydney. It's a 2 minute walk to the Circular Quay ferries, train station, buses, Opera House, restaurants, Botantical Gardens, etc. We arrived to the hotel at 8:30am after an overnight flight from California and our room was ready for us to check in immediately. The front desk personnel was friendly and efficient at check in and check out. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants as we wanted to try local restaurants instead. There is a small grocery store and take out food court in the AMP building across the street which is convenient to buy bottled water (hotel charges $10 per bottle), quick breakfast items, fruit and snacks. Be prepared at how expensive food and goods are in Sydney compared to California prices. We highly recommend the FJ Tours for the day trip to the Blue Mountains as they only had 6 people sign up for the tour that day and they didn't cancel it like some other tour companies apparantly do per the Sydney Tourist Office. The $145 cost was very reasonable which included a delicious 3 course lunch at a country club, price for the railroad and skyway rides and entrance to Featherdale Park. We had a great tour guide who was just as excited to have the just the 6 of us instead of the 21 that the tour bus could hold. Also, we highly recommend the Essential Opera House Tour and you can find a 20% discount coupon (pay $28 instead of $35) in the various tourist books you can find around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great View But You Pay For It”
Reviews.Author: ald59
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but that about it. As a frequent business traveller to sydney usually stay at the Westin or Sheraton but thought I would try this Hotel for a change.The views are outstanding from the higher floors but the bathrooms are older style(no seperate shower)and the bed was not as comfortable as the Westin.Being both a platinum and ambassor status only one upgrade level whereas at the SPG hotels always get free use of club facilities as a platinum member.So apart from the intercontinental having better views the Westin is a much more modern Hotel and better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Generic good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tori171
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental is nothing spectacular. Yes, the rooms are quality. Yes, the beds are big and the bath towels are wide enough to wind sail with... It's got pretty toiletries and wide beds and soft sheets. But really, it's nothing special. Just boxy rooms that have been better days and good amenities. Probably best for jet setting business types who spend the night there and just crash. I wouldn't choose it to treat myself. Ps the view on the side that's not facing the harbour is just not pretty. Office buildings, anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Tk100964
Reviews.Content: Indeed, the location is top. A few minutes walking of most of the top touristic attractions of Sydney. The location cannot be better ! The hotel is also good, though not great. Prices are skyhigh and you clearly pay for the location, you don't pay topdollars for the hotel which is good, but nothing special. Interior is nice, service is really good, though bathroom is small and I have to say that I hate to shower in a bathtub with the wet showercurtain touching my wet naked body. Also the internet connection is very slow. Not the quality you would expect in a 5 star hotel which is hosting a lot of business people. Overall : good, overpriced hotel with some irritations at top location

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: caseymoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental as a splurge on the final leg of our 3 week stay in Australia. Going in, I had an expectation that The Intercontinental would offer world class service, comfortable rooms and an amazing view. As I reflect upon our stay there there are a couple of things that did not live up to my expectations -- particularly given the price we were paying for a 3 night stay. Upon arrival the lobby was filled with folks checking out, one of my first impressions was waiting in line for a front desk person to check me in. The woman I was in line to see looked up at me and asked that I go to another front desk person across the way. As I headed there another pushy guest ran there to beat me. The second front desk person took care of her instead of me, forcing me back to my old place in line. Once I got up to the first front desk person she asked me to hold on for a moment while she firmly told the guy behind me to not wait in her line. She was trying to encourage guests to wait for the next available front desk person instead of for a specific person....this only confused the guy behind me and left me thinking, "if you want people to queue differently get a queue line! Don't try to manage the crowd by yelling behind a desk!". Very Strange for an alleged World Class hotel. I was thankful that we were able to check in to our room early -- this was a very special treat that offset this earlier confusion. The next surprise to me was the room itself. We splurged on a room with a view of the Sydney harbor and were thrilled with the window and window bench, however, I was shocked at how small the rooms were. The bathrooms are tiny and overall these rooms are not spacious. It put me in mind of a cabin on a cruise ship. Again, given the price point this was a bit annoying. The third surprise to me was how the lobby bar closed up early (around 10:00 pm on a weekday) but even more surprising was catching the bartender as he had Just Closed the place and asking for a couple of beers and having him tell me No, we're closed (it was minutes after he had closed out the register) even at a mid range hotel I would expect the bartender to hand us the two beverages and write down on a piece of paper that room XXX need sto be charged for 2 beers and to remind the opening guy to ring it up with tomorrow's business. Another morning we decided to have room service, the directory said to choose a number on the phone to get to room service. We dialed and it ringed without anyone answering for 10-15 minutes. I eventually called their Golden Service area (concierge) to find out how to connect and they hunted down the room service attendant to take my order. It left me wondering ....is this brand's target market is the business traveler who may have a higher tolerance for lower service levels since they are not paying for it out of their pocket? For leisure guests willing to splurge to experience world class service and a comfortable room with an amazing view this hotel really only delivers on the view.

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Hotel - with the occasional bad egg”
Reviews.Author: Casualtraveller2
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Sydney is of the standard you'd expect for the Intercontinental brand - modern, fantastic location, beautiful decor, lovely rooms. I had an enjoyable lengthy stay here, which was marred only by two aspects: one, the bathroom in the standard room is quite small, compared to the rest of the room, and is probably due for a refurb at some point. It is really adequate and was always cleaned spotlessly, but I think it is being outclassed now by other 5 star establishments' bathrooms. Secondly, I received excellent service from all staff, except for one staff member - who I found condescending. I think it was obvious to him I was a junior member of my work party that was travelling and while he was nice as pie to the obviously more senior staff of my delegation, he was largely flippant and at times borderline rude to me. The concierge (who the bad egg was not a member) were fantastic and always helpful. The hotel also overcharged me on my bill (by $95 on room service) but rectified the matter quickly. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average value for money”
Reviews.Author: camleypark
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a couple of nights on business and this was suggested as being near to our Sydney office. It is well located for the CBD area of Sydney, close to the Rocks, CIrcular Quay and the Opera House so a good location for sightseeing and business. I booked a harbour view room, and the harbour was indeed visible but only as a verticle slit of water glimpsed between the two buildings opposite so check what you are getting for your money before parting with the extra cash for a harbour view (as opposed to the distinctly ordinary city view. The rooms themselves are okay, reasonably spacious with a bench seat by the window. They are somewhat dated however with faded brown scuffed furniture and dull dull dull corporate prints on the walls. There is no wifi in the rooms, nowhere to play an mp3 player and the entertainment system consisted of a TV that came from the ark and atiny clock radio that looked like it cost 4 quid at Argos. The bathroom was small and dark, with a clammy curtain over the bathtub and a scruffy, dirty set of scales that I wouldn't touch with a barge pole. No flowers, no little welcoming touches. So all in all distinctly unspecial for the very unspecial price of A$355. Adequate I guess but hard to recommend when you can get so much more for your money. They clearly spent all the money in the last re-fit on the public areas and very little on the rooms. Whilst not a disaster, I can't see myself coming back. Chris, London

Reviews.Title: “At best a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: skysailor1975
Reviews.Content: I spend approx. 200 nights per year in hotels around the globe and the Intercontinental in Sydney is a disappointment. The rooms are ok, but not fantastic. The service is really poor. The value for money is certainly not there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMajidian
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. Very nice lounge, room, pool, gym, great buffet breakfast, and friendly helpful service. It is walking distance to Harbor Bridge and the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we gave it a try”
Reviews.Author: MidtownSurryHills
Reviews.Content: The best parts of the stay were: - TV in the room was a new LCD - room was very clean - the bath towels were the size good hotel towels are supposed to be: massive - we both had a great night's sleep on the king bed - the air conditioning adjusted exactly as set - the view from the gym and the pool is awesome; with the facilities in the gym more than you could ask for (maybe some cups to go with the water fountain please!) - the check-in and check-out were both efficient and welcoming

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever! will definately visit again.”
Reviews.Author: jenniferNSW
Reviews.Content: Great place, loved pool, pillows, room service, buffet breakfast and everything else. First class. Kids were blown away by it all. Great location. The staff were fantastic and well trained, always had a smile and were eager to assist. Queen beds would be better and a separate beds for the kids would have been better than 2 doubles though. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected and can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: surfingtoday
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we knew we had made the right decision in choosing The InterContinental Sydney. The ground floor is beautiful. The rooms spacious as is the bathroom. We had lovely views out towards Watsons Bay and could see the Opera House. The chaise lounge along the window was a fantastic idea by the interior decorator. The food was fantastic for both dinner and breakfasts and worth every cent. It was a great experience and we look forward to returning again one day soon. We felt we had value for money overall though a bit surprised at the bar prices on the ground floor. The pool is a bit disappointing for 5 star but i guess it is in the middle of a city and across the part are the City Baths which we were told were very good.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay and it just gets better !”
Reviews.Author: Skeney57
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying in this great hotel now on 3 seperate occassions over the past couple of years, the most recent a 2 night stay over the Easter weekend. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendlier from the check-in , to the turn down service to the Club Continental staff. The rooms (Opera House view) are spectacular on outlook and worth the additional cost , the Watson Bay outlook isn't far behind but nothing beats watching the ferries in and out of Circular Quay with the Harbour Bridge , Opera House and Luna Park as the backdrop. A few hints would be to take in a bottle of wine (or some beers) as the mini bar can be pricey ! The gym , pool and Sauna gets a work out and try to start the sauna a bit earlier to get the heat up !

Reviews.Title: “If you want to hear every word in the adjacent room this hotel is for you”
Reviews.Author: PrivacyAboveAll
Reviews.Content: If there is one thing I want in a hotel, it's privacy and sound-proofed rooms. To be able to hear anything, let alone EVERYTHING, in the adjacent room, is intolerable, especially from a purported 5-star hotel. The wall was not much better than a sheet of thin cardboard. Unable to tolerate the situation, I called the front desk and got another room. Fortunately I was able to sleep as no one was in the adjacent room that night. It is beyond my belief how a supposedly reputable hotel can care so little for the privacy and comfort of its guests as to use such pathetic materials for the walls between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Could be alot better”
Reviews.Author: SheffSwan
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for New Year 2010 on the first stage of out Asia Pacific trip and to be honest after coming from the Intercontinental Hong Kong, it needed to be excellent. Unfortunatly It didn't come anyway near to the HK IC or other Intercontinental's. Rooms We had a standard â€˜City Viewâ€™ room where on the side you could just see the Sydney Bridge if you leaned into the Window, otherwise their was a huge office block in front of the window. The room was and comfortable and well equipped but very dated and in much need of a revamp. The bathroom again was very dated and wasn't cleaned properly with hairs in the bath. Hotel The lobby was very good as you would expect but shame the rooms didn't match up. The bar was great We had the Seafood buffet for NYE and it was very good and worth the money The location is very close to Circular Key and the Botanical Gardens, but quite a way to Darling Harbour for the good restaurants and nightlife. The hotel had a pool but we didnâ€™t go there as it was full of screaming kids when it was open. Staff Staff were good and attentive but just lacked the detail seen in other Intercontinental's. Value I must admit this was a freebee paid for by my ICH Priority Points. But it still cost my company loads to stay in other ICH group hotels. Even being their top Platinum member, I wasnâ€™t treated any different unlike most of the other Intercontinental's.. Conclusion I would not stay here again, having stayed in quite a few Intercontinental' and it just didn't meet the same standards. I think staying in the Crown Plaza would have been better. If I travel to Sydney again I would go to the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “5 star? Hardly.”
Reviews.Author: HCHMum
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, as I had been told it is one of the best and it was near ARIA where we were having dinner. The hotel is lovely, but the rooms are hardly 5 star. Our bathroom at home was bigger! the bathroom needs updating desperately-cracked tiles, stained walls, shower over bath and shower curtain.....hardly 5 star! The view of Watsons Bay was ok, the bed was comfy, but I have had better. Breakfast was pretty standard and then we had to pay $40 parking! Nowhere on the website does it tell you that-a nice little surprise for us when we checked out. We would not have driven if we knew we had to pay. I would not stay here again and for the money would not reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great anniversary, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbSYD
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with standard rooms, nice breakfast and great location. My husband called to tell them it was our anniversary and booked quite in advance. i know i sounds like a whinge but I wont be going back. We go to a city hotel each year and this hotel has a reputation for being the best, but there are other hotels which are much better value and have better guest relations. Basically had to beg front desk for a late checkout, parking is $40 astronomical and after breakfast our room key didnt work at 10am, so we stood outside our room for ten mins till someone came up. These are small things which make you feel nice about choosing a certain hotel for your anniversary, which the intercontinental didnt do.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location great views very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: teddyLondonUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights with 'club' facilities and bay view at the start of our holiday and also 2 nights at the end of our holiday on a 'room only' basis with city view. As other reviewers have said the location is perfect for proximity to the Opera House/Ferry Quay area. Check-in was speedy and efficient and the room was very comfortable with lovely bed and linen, when we flicked the bedside switch to open the window blinds in the morning the bay view was simply stunning. The club facilities ('complimentary' early evening drinks/canapes & breakfast on the 31st floor) however were only memorable due to the truly spectacular views - we were so busy in Sydney we missed the evening drinks on 4 of our nights, free Internet facilities consisted of only 2 PCs and it was difficult to find these available, Service was variable and overall we did not think that the 'club' upgrade was worth the premium price paid. When we returned at the end of our holiday with a hire car we found the reception service wonderful as they arranged the return of our car to Avis (I really wasn't looking forward to driving through the city to find the King's Cross drop off point). We had booked 'club' facilities again but at check-in we asked if we could change to room only and again service was very friendly and accomodating - we ended up with a very reasonable room rate, we had no problem with the city view and had a lovely inexpensive breakfast at the Museum cafe opposite the hotel entrance. Overall we loved staying at the Sydney Intercontinental, although extras such as club facilities and bay/harbour views come at a premium price. Tip: for a gorgeous inexpensive lunch try the Opera Bar underneath the opera house - excellent flathead fish and chips!

Reviews.Title: “Cool style and great location”
Reviews.Author: CharlesDP
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Intercon. The first time was 5 years ago so my memory of the hotel had faded a little. On returning this month I found it to be a great place to stay with modern style and a comfortable room. The location of the hotel is, as others have noted, very handy. It's a very easy walk to circular quay station and the gardens. Depending on what part of the CBD you're visting that's walkable as well. The trip to the airport is also very quick by car, it took us only 15 minutes on Sunday afternoon. We had a standard room with a view over watsons bay and the gardens. This is a great view and as I've seen the opera house many times before I prefer this view and wouldn't pay more for the other rooms with a view. The room is compact but they have made the best possible use of the space so that it doesn't feel as cramped as its 32sq m would have you believe. The bench seat along the window is a smart idea and I enjoyed lounging here and looking out over the gardens. The decor is modern and well executed. Unfortunately we found the bed to be too soft and couldn't sleep very well on the two nights we were there. This would be our only complaint about the hotel. Room service was fast, reasonably priced and tasted great. The breakfast downstairs was average and it's not worth anything near the $38 they charge.
