For us it was only $10 more per night to have it included in the room rate and at that price it's good value. There was a reasonable range of hot and cold food but the service was limited. On the weekend it's quite busy for breakfast and there aren't really enough staff for a 5 star hotel breakfast. We're going to try the club next time as it seems to be more civilised.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Harrison
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully situated close to the Opera House and the lively "Rocks" area. Usual excellent standard of accomodation and service that one would expect of Intercont. A short walk to the bay front, with all its restaurants and bars, and along to the wonderful Opera House The view from the indoor swimming pool on the 31st floor is not to be missed...a panorama sweeping from the Harbour Bridge across past the Opera House to encompass most of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and view, but could do better for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ad91on
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a joint Girlfriend's birthday/valentines do, for no real reason other than not having to get a taxi home from the city after dinner that night. It took us ages to find the place but it's not like we researched where it was, exactly, but I wish i could have know where the proper entrance was as I ended up driving under the building into a hugely crowded carpark - understandable as it was a busy weekend - but I had borrowed a fairly fancy car and was a bit nervous, really. But that was more just me worrying, no fault of the hotels. We checked in and the counter staff were young, but they got the job done and we went up to our room which was really very lovely, big panoramic window with lush furnishings and LCD tv - kinda what you expect at this price range - but the bathroom, although clean and well appointed - is looking a bit dated and a shower curtain at this level of accomodation is a bit iffy. Very nice otherwise. Didn't have enough time to really explore the features of the hotel but we did have a cocktail or two down in the bar which was nice and funky but quite pricey. The bed was fantastic, it was just a thick doona but my partner and I don't like sheets so that wasn't an issue. Buffet breakfast was comprehensive but i must say too crowded and we were sitting under an air-con vent - i wouldn't care had not the waiter put us there when the rest of the room was empty (the other rooms were crowded). Twas good breakfast, however. We checked out and it was all very crowded everywhere, and we waited a good 20 minutes for the car to be bought around, where the guy driving it just handed the keys over without any question of who we were (and we should have aroused suspicion if anyone was going to - no one my age could afford the car i had borrowed!) but overall it is a very nice place. But for $550? You could do better.

Reviews.Title: “I can see Sydey harbour from my window!”
Reviews.Author: GMcC_7
Reviews.Content: Easy transfer from airport by taxi. This has nothing to do with the hotel, but why does a family of 4 with luggage cause so much of a problem with airport taxis? Heathrow, San Francisco and Sydney? Check in was simple and faultless. We were there before noon but were given room with no issue. Room was compact for the 4 of us but that was expected. Great view over the harbour to the east. We did not pay the extra for the view of the bridge etc. Concierge did allow us to go up to the club level for pictures etc. Stayed 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Stay were great, concierge organised restaurants, cinema etc. etc. The location was outstanding. 3 minute walk to the operahouse, Circular Key. 10 minutes to the Rocks and bridge climb. Whole family enjoyed the stay. Evening snack and drinks in the bar were expensive but what do you expect. Suited us completely and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, service in need of improving”
Reviews.Author: tucano
Reviews.Content: Everything our predecessors wrote about location is true. Only 5 minutes to Opera, City Center and Botanical Gardens. By all means: select Club Level. It is on the top floor and gives 210 degree-view over Sydney Harbour and that is one the most exciting views on earth! To mention the better things first: rooms are nothing spectacular, a bit smallish, but ok and comfy beds. Concierge Mr. Raza is extremely knowledgable on food and restaurants. He recommends not the most expensive, but the very best dining experiences- truly amazing. Sandwiches in the Lobby Bar are excellent. Now, unfortunetly, there are negative points, that should be corrected. At the reception most of time there is only one person, so there are long waits. Bell boy service takes half an hour minimum. The wonderful lounge on top of the building has more than enough staff- but they are not trained or maybe, temporary labour . Most of them are or indifferent or just not up to deliver service. At breakfast e.g. ham is piled up in a very careless manner- the aspect is just not tempting. And it "sweatens"- mean, has not been taken out of the plastic wrap. It can take a long time before you get your ordered tea or any refill at the buffet. It is a shame to have to write all this. The rooms are expensive- we paid about 450 Euros and from 2nd to 3rd of january with special New Year supplement the night was at nearly 1.000 Euros. And to offer such a poor service for that very steep price is really not pok in an otherwise good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, not so perfect interior”
Reviews.Author: rebeccat83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again on March 6, 2010. I LOVE the location of this hotel, an easy walk to Circular Quay. The view from the room isn't very spectacular, but the view from the Pool is fantastic. The room is kind of average considering the price. We had a very bad odour in the room and out in the hall...kind of like a dead rodent smell! I didn't complain since we were only there for a very short time, but it was pretty disappointing for a hotel of this standard. The staff are polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was lovely and great location near CircularQuay”
Reviews.Author: 007hollie
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. The room was really nice although the view wasn't great. The toiletries they provide are excellent. The food is lovely although quite expensive. The location is great as it's a short walk to circularquay and Opera House. Also close to some lovely restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: craigie2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fabulous holiday visiting California, Auckland, then cruising from there round the Fiordland National Park heading to Australia and on to Singapore before reluctantly flying home. In Sydney we stayed in the Intercontental Hotel and it was excellent. The room was spacious, spotless and had a superb picture window with window seat. It's also in an ideal situation. A ten minute walk will take you to all the major landmarks. I highly recommend this hotel. PS. We stayed in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Singapore and it is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and dirty”
Reviews.Author: countryNSWBam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in Jan 2010 with Club access. The club on the top floor has wonderful views over the harbour but that's about the only positive I could find with this place. We checked in and were greeted by an obnoxious girl who seemed disgusted that we had dared to bother her! She directed us to the top floor club level to check in and didn't even tell us where the lifts were. The room was ok, the bathroom was very tired and wasnt overly clean. Overall this hotel is overpriced and a little tired. I think you can find better 5* hotels in Sydney with better rates.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: rbbrooks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a Watsons bay view room. You could see the water if you looked out the corner of the window. The service was reasonable, however was asked at check in if we wanted a paper delivering, yet they failed to deliver one to the room either day. The rooms are rather dated. Was surprised to see a old style TV instead of a plasma or LCD TV. In future probably wouldn't pay the extra to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, Great location”
Reviews.Author: dklondon
Reviews.Content: Our Harbour View room was perfect, offering uninterupted views towards the Pacific, overlooking the botantical gardens. In the morning the rays from the perfect sunrise start your day with a smile. The only negative was the pool, which seemed a little small (although the top floor location makes for a great view!). We only stayed one night and our room rate did not include breakfast so I cannot comment on the food and service, but this hotel ticked our boxes - a friendly, full service experience at the end of long flight before we flew north to Port Douglas

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: schmeves
Reviews.Content: Sadly a real disappointment. We booked with the view of having a romantic weekend away in Sydney for the first time since our little boy was born (and a decent night sleep!) but on the second night of our stay the hotel hosted 2 weddings and we were kept awake by neighbouring guests until 2:30am. I'm not against people enjoying themselves but I fail to understand why we were put on a noisy floor amongst all the other wedding guests when I specifically asked for a quiet room away from elevators etc when I made our booking 3 months prior. Overall the hotel was clean, slighty dated and not very sound proof. I could hear people going to the toilet above, below and next to our room in the early hours of the morning....not very romantic. The management did send security to have a wander around when we told them there were noisy guests loitering near the elevators so we can't complain there, plus they did give us 10% off our bill as way of compensation. Frankly we would rather have paid more for a better hotel and saved ourselves the aggrivation than have a measly 10% taken off the bill. Will try the Hyatt next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Standard 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: further40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the best locations in Sydney. It is close walking distance to the Quay, to the Botanical Gardens and to most CBD offices. The rooms are standard 5 star hotel rooms. Nothing distinctive but the facilities are good. It has a good bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but one expects more out of a five star hotel. This is not a great value!”
Reviews.Author: JaySha
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked this hotel for our 8 day/7 night holiday for two reasons: 1 - Location looked ideal and 2 - for the Intercontinental name. Location did not disappoint, but the Intercontinental reputation took a hit during this trip. - No airport transfer is offered (Shangri-La does have this service). - Check-in experience: I called the hotel in advance to let them know that we would be arriving in Sydney very early in the morning and would appreciate an early check in if possible. They couldnâ€™t accommodate us, but I didn't expect them to since it was the start of the high season. I was surprised though, that I had to ask the concierge to let my friend and I use their showering facilities upstairs. (It was 7am and we couldnâ€™t get into our room until 2pm.) We had just traveled halfway around the world and hadnâ€™t seen a shower in nearly 24 hours â€“ but I donâ€™t care if you had only traveled 10 miles and were checking in â€“ youâ€™re a five star hotel! Isnâ€™t customer satisfaction top of mind? By the way, at 2pm, the maid was still in the room. - Rooms: If youâ€™re getting a double, donâ€™t expect a great view. These rooms are limited to the lower floors. We paid extra for a bridge view room but couldnâ€™t see much thanks to our place on the 10th floor. The rooms are also quite small, especially the bathroom, where the tub, tile, and sink are incredibly dated and there is hardly any counter space. No flat screen TV, either. (If you read the below reviews, the management states that theyâ€™ll eventually remodel the rooms and have flat screens in every room.) Also strange was the lack of sheets on the bed â€“ itâ€™s just a light duvetâ€“and how often do they really clean those? The 2 redeeming qualities about the room: the nice bench by the window and the automated shutters. - Big EWWW experience: I was sitting by the window one evening when I heard a distinct buzzing sound. I turned on the desk lamp and sure enough, a rather sizeable roach was crawling all over our room. Thankfully my friend was deep asleep; otherwise she wouldâ€™ve seen a giant, dirty bug crawling on top of her head. I was forced to defend her with a magazine until said bug crawled into the ventilation shaft. I stayed awake for an hour before figuring it wouldnâ€™t be returning. Next morning, I explain this to the concierge and request a thorough clean up, only to receive a â€œOh, so sorry, yes weâ€™ll clean things up right away.â€� We return to the hotel later in the afternoon to find no special attention was given; in fact the bathroom was short some towels and we were left with a tall stack of linens and pillowcases on our desk. Really?! No comp drink tickets, no bottle of wine, no apology note from management? How much does a note cost you? A large, stinking cockroach was in our $325+/night hotel room, and weâ€™re going to act like nothing happened? Dear management: please thank my friend for being coy and not letting me create a scene in your hotel lobby, and for not letting me post the several photos I took of the roach crawling around on the ceiling for size comparison. Sheâ€™s saved you some embarrassment, though I doubt this review will help you any, either. - Vibe: Hardly any. Despite itâ€™s location, the lobby bar downstairs was far from exciting. The upstairs bar wasn't hopping, either. Patrons are mostly business folk. While not a bad thing, not a great place to mingle, either. - Staff: Billy at check out was our only stand out staff member. The others were cordial enough, but a young blonde lady couldâ€™ve used some lessons in humility. Pros: Hotel is in a good location if you want to go to the Opera House and Botanical Gardens every day. (Note that the Shangri-La really isnâ€™t that far on the other side of the Quay â€“ Sydney is deceptively smallâ€¦) Rooms are decent and for the most part, comfortable. The AMP tower has a very convenient and cheap food court next door â€“ great for brekkie. Cons: Hotel is dated and smaller than expected. Bottom line: If youâ€™re going to pay a 5-star price, check in to the Shangri-La, because you can do better, and they will do better by you. Please note that Iâ€™m being hard on this hotel because it is an Intercontinental brand, is ranked as 5 star, and is in one of the greatest and most visited cities in the world. (Did I mention the $325+/night price tag?) You wouldâ€™ve expected more, too. Management: Would highly recommend that your ops team pay a visit to a Ritz-Carlton or a Mandarin Oriental for some training.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Hobo
Reviews.Content: * Not at all impressed with this so called five star hotel * Room was OK but quite tired * Hotel reception was awful - understaffed & uninterested * Tried to extend my stay at reception (by a month) & was told to "go on-line to Wotif or Expedia"!! * We moved to the Sheraton on the Park - an all together much better experience

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Weekend Away - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: summerlover030
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last minute weekend away with friends & was so glad I did. The hotel service was excellent & we were well looked after from the minute we arrived. The apartment was spacious, clean, had wonderful views & was well serviced. First thing we did was go downstairs to look around & everything was at our doorstep, museums, shops, restaurants & close to attractions. A beautiful hotel & well worth the stay. On the way back on the plane I felt like I had a good break & will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - awesome club lounge”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandSarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 2009... our room was great - very well appointed and well serviced. The black out blind came in handy on New Year's Day! The bathroom was good and Elemis toiletries are always nice. Bottles of water from the turndown service were welcome after a night enjoying the bars and restaurants of Sydney too. As mentioned in previous posts - the club lounge is fantastic. Unlike the recent review about poor service, we were very well looked after by the staff in there. On the first night we stayed, the host arranged for us to have the best table in the place - an outside table with the best view over Sydney. The canapes and complimentary twilight drinks between 5 and 7pm were excellent and plentiful. The staff would replenish your wine, spirits, beer or cocktails throughout - I think I had seven glasses of sparkling wine one evening! We wished that we had planned to stay in the lounge for NYE as the view of the fireworks would have been fabulous - but we had tickets for a Harbour Cruise instead (also fab!) It probably would have been quite expensive to drink there from 7pm til midnight tho! We ate in the lounge once other than breakfast and the meal was very good. Breakfast itself was a good choice of continental options, bacon and eggs and lots of fruit. Complimentary internet access was available in the lounge too. Had an excellent stay and will definitely go back when we're next in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DART193
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Intercontinental very early in the morning after a long flight from London. Our room was ready for us which was a great relief. Our room was a standard rate room which we found to be perfect for us and our teenaged son. The staff were very helpful and made us feel very welcome . When we mentioned we were driving from Sydney to Brisbane the duty manager gave us a list of must see places along our route.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service in the club lounge”
Reviews.Author: SurreyCassie
Reviews.Content: I booked a club room which was good nice view though not uninterupted. The room was clean and quiet. There was a problem with the papers being delivered in the mornings. The club lounge has stunning views over the harbour and opera house. However the service did not in any way match up to what I expected this is not a cheap hotel, but the service definitely is. I ate with a business assosiate one evening at the club lounge. The starter and main courses were served at the same time. When I queried this the girl said she was new. The food was also cold when we complained it was taken away and returned only luke warm. The staff seemed indifferent to the problems, the service was also very slow. I waited 30 mins for my coffee to arrive at breakfast and this was not a one off. The gymn was also very dirty, Children were also using this area as a playground and were throwing around the equipment which was a potentially dangerous situation. I have stayed at other intercontinentals the best one being the Grand Stanford in Hong Kong which is far superior in virtually everything. The staff there are proffessional and everything was spot on. The Intercontinental Sydney is by far the worst the staff seemed very unproffessiona; and frankly untrained.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing...”
Reviews.Author: ozden
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbour king Suite at Intercontinental Sydney between January 05-09, 2010. On the plus side' Intercontinental Sydney has a central location minutes to harbour, shopping, many museums, etc. It has comfortable beds, big nice goose down pillows and oversize towels...And that's about it. From their website you may get the impression that they have unobstructed views of the harbour, which certainly was not the case at a harbour view room on the 20th floor (see photo). When we arrived at around 11 PM the reserved extra bed was not ready. And then it turned out to be a portable wreck of e bedframe with the thinnest and most uncomfortable matress on it. Probably the housekeeping also does not resemble it to a bed themselves, so that they declined making it up in the morning. Although we were three adults in the room, all cups and glasses were for only two, and not that we use it but I think it is outright cheap to provide just one tooth brush for three people. Daily paper was never delivered even after requested. Small daily mistakes at reception gave the impression that things are not under control. There was very poor choise of breakfast. The staff was kind and helpful, but the service in general was slow. We had the feeling that they are either under-stuffed or not trained enough. Finally they topped everything up by charging % 1.5 for paying with credit card (unheard of for us).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDScotland
Reviews.Content: Chosen for its location and opportinity of the best view of the fireworks what should have been a memorable occasion turned out to be a bitter disappointment. Lesson learned - check & double check everything you believe you are paying for or suffer the disappointment we did. Sadly caught between hotel and travel agent we have no one accepting the blame which if we had known the shambles we were going to would have booked elsewhere its not like th only hotel in Sydney! Having stayed in Cairns, Noosa then Sydney with this being by far the most expensive it was by far the worst for simply not delivering what we belived we had booked. Starting point was on check in where as a company of two families each requiring two rooms and specifically requesting adjoining rooms to allow our children to be next door we were firstly met with rooms not being ready at 3 in the afternoon, then being informed that adjoining rooms were request only and that they were VERY busy we ended up with 7 floors between parents and children! Wec then had the fiasco of being given a smoking room which to non smokers is nothing short of vile! Simple requests of he staff therafter simply became ridiculous with room changing between the wrong rooms, fumigation of the smoking room multiple times, no access to the rooftop lounge which only after complaining were we grudginlgy afforded limited entry. Piece de resistance yes you've guessed no access to rooftop for the firworks the whole point in booking this hotel and trust me we checked on numerous occassions that we had this access. The staff in reception were less than helpful, very pretty but less than helpful and certainly not what you would expect from a top class hotel. VERY VERYdisappointed in this hotel wouldn't recommend it to anyone, I wouldn't expect to have to carry e-mail evidence as proof to any hotel and have never had to before - to be honest I felt less like a guest much more of an irritation to busy people! Our NY firworks were saved by joining my nephew on the rooftop of his very small hotel in Kirribilli where the owner was delighted to welcome us to a wonderful evening of buffet, champagne and fantastic never forgotten fireworks show. Enough of the rant but please double check before you think of booking this hotel! NB 2nd week in Crowne Plaza Coogee was fantastic and so much more enjoyable with great staff always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “High $$$ for an average room and poor service”
Reviews.Author: ddcjv
Reviews.Content: The Christmas Buffett dinner was priced at $150.00 each!! We found that out and cancelled our reservations - had a fantastic seafood dinner in Darling Harbour for $75.00 vs the $300.00 they wanted!! Spend your food dollars elsewhere. Room service one night - the worst Rueben I have had in my life and a cardboard quesadilla was $62.00. Stay in Darling Harbour - take the ferry to Circular Quay. The meal $$$'s alone will more than pay for the ferry. Never stay there again - no where to go to eat that is under a 1 mile walk. Indoor pool cold, no spa, NO ACCESS TO ROOF TOP LOUNGE UNLESS YOU UPGRADE AND ADD $150.00/NIGHT. YOU CANNOT EVEN GO SEE THE VIEW. NO ACCESS.

Reviews.Title: “Average with Complete Lack of Personalized Service”
Reviews.Author: DiggerDeals
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay on layover. Priority Club room upgrade was Watsons Bay view from City view. Room was quite and clean. Location is great for Circular Quay and Opera House Business centre closed on weekend. Didn't feel warranted paying $150 extra/day for Club access. In comparison to other five star properties had a four star feel eg not a single member of staff adressed any of us by name or asked if we had enjoyed our stay. Location balanced staff performance to "average" which is a disappointment for five star. Probably will not stay here again if given a choice of ICH group sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PerthBob123
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney to see the ballet and catch up on some of Sydney's great restaurants. We stayed at the Intercontinental due to their having a package which included stay and ballet tickets. We organised a limo transfer from the airport which was on time and the driver polite and courteous. On arrival at the hotel the reception gentleman was curt and waved at us to come over to him. First impressions are lasting impressions. He could not answer our questions re the tickets for the ballet and said without asking anybody that we had to go to the Opera House to pick them up. I let it go and when we got to our room, contacted the Concierge who then organised everything for us. What a gentleman - Why the receptionist told us that we had to collect the tickets ourselves, was a mystery to me and had we not have been on similar adventures previously, we may have wasted our next day running around trying to find our tickes. It just proves to contact the Management if you are not satisfied about things. Apart from that little fiasco we loved our stay. The two gentleman Concierge's were fantastic and helped us plan our leisure time in Sydney. They are a credit to the organisation. Special comments are due to the gents at the entrance to the hotel who open the car doors for us, call taxi's and great us so politely. They are a great asset to the hotel. We will return and shortly. Try the main restaurant it was fabulous. We had a great room overlooking the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience, gracious staff, ideal location for first visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SkippyWonderdog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 8 yr old son the week of December 19th. From the moment we arrived our entire experience was lovely. We received exceptional and gracious service from Stephen, the manager on duty who welcomed us, checked us in and made sure our holiday got off to a great start. Like others who have written reviews here, I recommend selecting a club level room--it is well worth the added cost. Views from the club lounge are amazing and the breakfast, snacks, and evening tasting plate are all lovely. We experienced friendly and professional service from the team in the club lounge throughout the week. Most of our travel is for business and it was nice to see that the club lounge is large enough so that business travelers, couples, and leisure travelers with well-behaved children can peacefully coexist in the space. If you are visiting for more than a few days, you should also consider purchasing an Intercontinental Hotels ambassador membership as it provides a guaranteed upgrade and late checkout---both nice extras that further enhanced our visit. The hotel location is just about perfect. Only a block or so from Circular Quay to catch a ferry and literally across the street from the Royal Botanic Gardens. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay ...”
Reviews.Author: JaneRj
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel several months ago and then became concerned as the reviews on TA started to reflect a downturn in its quality. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived and were upgraded to a corner suite with fabulous views of the Bridge, the OH and the harbour towards the ocean. The rooms were decorated and furnished in a mix of traditional and contemporary styling with a large bathroom and separate cloakroom. The bed and bedlinen were of high quality and very comfortable and we thought the standard of housekeeping to be very high. All staff we came into contact with were very pleasant especially those in Club Intercontinental where we had excellent breakfasts in an informal environment. We also enjoyed the early evening drinks but thought that it would be better having this start and finish a little later. The Club area has really fantastic views and a contemporary feel with two free to use PCs ideal for checking email or weather forecasts! The location of the hotel is excellent being less than five minutes walk to Circular Quay and the Royal Botanic Gardens. All in all, a very good stay that enhanced our eight day stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in ideal location close to opera house and bridge. Along with ferry terminal and bus station. Food good. Also plenty of restaurants nearby. Only negative is the bar shuts at 11pm and room service is poor in terms of time and cost. Store nearby sells beers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great location, fanastic views from pool, nice food”
Reviews.Author: Vintagesuburbia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights with my family (2 young children). We had a great time - the pool is absolutely amazing - views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We had some drinks in the downstairs bar/cafe, sitting in lovely leather chairs - beautiful. The staff did not mind that we had our children there (although I have trained them to be well behaved in public). Some places do turn their noses up a bit when you have kids with you, but this never happened at the Intercontinental. Other advantages: - VERY comfortable beds, great room service (expensive, but very very nice) I find this option good when you have children as they can go to sleep or whatever and my husband and I are able to enjoy a romantic meal together. The other upside of this is that we had bought a bottle of wine with us and were able to drink that with our meal (hotel room had wine glasses in it). Hotel provided lovely cot for baby with baby soap etc Cleanliness of room and beds IMPECCABLE. Beautiful crisp white sheets. Only cons: - The breakfast was expensive, as they charge $23 for kids 6 years and over - we had breakfast diag opp the hotel at the Museum of Sydney which was nice - entrance of hotel is very hard to find, we ended up having to drive into the hotel car park rather than the valet parking entrance, which was not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamseattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Dec. 2009. The best location and view of Sydney harbour. The service was excellent and the room was lovely. Will definately stay there again. HIghly recommended for first time visitors who want to be in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but unpassionate”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel three times over the past year, and as I cannot remember details of every stay, this is a summary of my findings. This is a very hard hotel to rate. Although I am always well treated, comfortable and somehow pampered here, it is not memorable â€“ its actually rather soulless. The problem is that I donâ€™t know what it is. It might be the layout of the hotel â€“ reception area is very small and not integrated to the rest of the hotel. The lobby bar is beautiful but with the choices you have in Sydney, it has never tempted me enough so I would go in. I once used the concierge (am very familiar with Sydney) and it was a little disappointing (suggested Aria when I asked for ideas for a cozy and relaxed restaurant (everything Aria isnâ€™t). The staff are all very well trained and efficient â€“ too efficient to my liking â€“ you will find no smiles, I donâ€™t think they care â€“ its corporate heaven if all you want if efficiency. I had rooms facing the harbor and the city â€“ both views were pleasant. Please note their harbor views are called Bridge view rooms â€“ you are guaranteed to see the bridge, not the opera house. I had this room twice, in two different floors and could see the opera from one but not the other â€“ for uninterrupted post card views go to the Shangri-la. The rooms are very well appointed with all the perks you can expect from an Intercon. The shower is over the bathtub so thatâ€™s a little inconvenient. They still have old style TV sets, but also a window seat that is just amazing. I have visited the Club Lounge and have to admit it is my favorite of all Sydney 5* hotels. My only food and beverage experience was an overnight room service that was cold and undercooked â€“ horrible. Stay here for the convenient location and comfort, but not for the views and carrying service

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Henkybaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IC over x-mass in 2009. The hotel staff is amazingly helpful. When I was forced to come a couple of days early due to a possible BA strike they offered to accommodate me in a club room for the two extra days at no additional charge. That is good service, especially since I am booked on a Friends & Family Rate. The club is excellent and offers a very nice breakfast, an afternoon tea with nice sandwiches and great wine as well as a sundowner where they serve hot snacks at your table. Maybe a bit less comfortable for those who sometimes use the club buffet as a dinner substitute. Yes, I am one of those people... :) The rooms are nice enough. Where the hotel drops it is housekeeping. They should work faster and make fewer mistakes. Also I tried to contact 'instant service' a couple of times to find that service is anything but instant. I consider myself to be nitpicking however. I like the hotel. When you come, make sure to book a club room. The club has excellent views and is very much ,like a commercial bar. It is one of the best I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Sydney InterContinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: My stay at InterContinental Sydney was a fantastic experience. The man who checked us in was very courteous and efficient as well as all other members of staff I came into contact with. Our room was a Watsons Bay View room which offered a nice open view of Sydneyâ€™s eastern harbour areas. The room itself was spacious with 2 large double beds, flat screen television and all the amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. My only complaint with the room would be that the bathroom is starting to look a little tired and would benefit from an upgrade. I also didnâ€™t see the point of the little frosted window between the bathroom and the rest of the room. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant but the baguette I ordered from the room service menu was fresh and tasty and arrived quickly. The location of the hotel is great. Itâ€™s situated only 1 block from Circular Quay and close to great restaurants and shopping areas. Overall my stay at the InterContinental Sydney was excellent and I would recommend it highly for anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Service, Fab Food, Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: pyrmontvillage
Reviews.Content: Both my partner and I needed a break, from the humdrum of Sydney, life and work, so we decided to spend a few nights at the Intercontinental here in Sydney. Absolutely loved the experience and I felt that we got value for money. There was a slight hiccup with reservation, when we booked in, which was a tad tiresome, however, once we got into our rooms, and stowed away our clothes, we were in heaven. The views out to watsons bay were simply sublime. Room service and the food that came with it was okay. The objective was relaxation and that was accomplished.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stevoCardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fab location with shops/ferries/Opera house and Bridge within 10 minutes walk. Didnt eat or drink in hotel but it seemed pricey. We booked a Harbour Bridge room and the sight when you first open your door is priceless. We stayed in room 1725 , with a stunning view of the bridge , botanical gardens and harbour. The room was spacious and very clean. The hotel has a lot of business guests , so the tourist really just uses it as a base. The location is its primary plus point. When returning to Sydney , will book here.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have hoped for a better hotel in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mjjBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with my wife and children to celebrate my wifes 40th birthday. We are so glad that we stayed here rather than one of the other hotels in the Rocks area. The location of this hotel is fantastic. You probably won't find another hotel closer to Circular Quay. As an ambassador member we received a free upgrade to a room with a Opera House view. The small cafe on the first floor was particularly cosy and we spent many afternoons here endulging in afternoon tea! The only complaint we had was with a rude waitress in the breakfast lounge. We complained to the manager and later found a bottle of champagne in our room which I guess was an apology. All in all we really enjoyed this hotel and would certainly stay here again on future visits to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Policy - Blame Someone Else for their Non Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: westraveler
Reviews.Content: Where do I start???? We are Priority Club Members, but we booked two rooms for two nights through Qantas. We have done this before but have NEVER had any problems. When we arrived at 10.30am on the morning of check-in, we knew we were early so we just wanted to leave our bags and drop our hire car off and check in later - 3pm hotel policy. While we were waiting lots of other people were upgraded and were allowed to check in, so maybe they paid extra for this service. When our turn came, after several minutes we were told by a staff member that there were no bookings under our name for two rooms with City Views and Buffet Breakfast inclusion. We produced our receipt from Qantas booked and paid for about 5 weeks before. We were told it shouldn't be a problem but leave our bags and they will sort it out and come back in a few hours time. They kindly stored our suitcase etc. My husband returned about 1.30pm and was told our 3 rooms are ready!!! The funny thing is we only booked and paid for 2!! My husband was given the keys to the rooms but no one pointed out to him were the elevators were so he had to go back and asked the staff. The rooms were very nice, clean, spacious and the views of the city were spectacular. Later on I went downstairs to reception to find out where we will be taking our buffet breakfast in the morning, but was told our rate does not include the buffet breakfast!!!! At that stage I did not have my receipt from Qantas so I got them and went down again but this time I asked for th Manager. The Manager came and spoke to me after a few minutes and the excuse was that Qantas did not send the paperwork till 9.30 this morning, now remember we checked in at around 10.30 that morning and was told there were no bookings for us full stop!! The manager came back and said he has adjusted our booking to include buffet breakfast. Don't bother with the breakfast inclusion, very average range for the price you pay. The pastries on both days were over baked and they were "Sara Lee" quality. The poached eggs tasted of vinegar and bacon was very dry! When we checked out on the morning of departure we were told by the staff that it was showing that we weren't suppose to check out till the following day!!!! So from no reservations for 2 rooms to reservations for 3 rooms for 3 nights!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very special experience....”
Reviews.Author: Tattoosydney
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Intercontinental for our big gay wedding weekend - because we were having our reception at Etch Restaurant. It being a special occasion, we booked the Governor's Suite. Upon fronting up at the reception desk at the advertised 3pm check in time, we were very politely asked to go and have a drink until 4pm because our room was not ready. Upon returning (after a lovely Pimms cocktail in the foyer bar), we were informed that we had been upgraded to the State Suite - the second best room in the place. Our luggage was accidentally delivered to my brother's room - an easy mistake to make in a hotel with several rooms booked in the same surname - and the last time all weekend that anything went wrong - from that point, everything was perfect. The State Suite is stunning - 150 square metres, a huge bedroom, a huge bathroom, office area, guest bathroom, dressing room, lounge area, dining area and (slightly gratuitously) a grand piano. The views from the room are breathtaking, even for a jaded Sydney resident who looks at the Opera House every day at work. Room service was punctual, the food very good. Every single staff member was friendly, happy and polite, and could not have been more helpful. The bed was comfortable, the shower a joy. The rooms were spotlessly clean, and cleaned promptly. Checkout was easy. Etch - the restaurant associated with the hotel - is perfect, and ran the perfect wedding reception, that has our friends and family still talking. This was a magnificent stay - a perfect weekend in a perfect room with perfect service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel and Great Views”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend break. This is a classy hotel from the ground floor foyer to the Club room on the top floor. Desk staff were very helpful and great ambience in the lounge area on the ground floor. We had a room with access to the executive Club on Level 31. Again, the staff in the Club area were very polite and helpful, and the club room itself has views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and down the harbour. Breakfast is served here, and offers a good selection - but the only eggs available are scrambled from the warmer - nice but no chance for an omelete, fried or poached eggs. Still with views like these...... The hotel has room service, light meals served in the foyer lounge and has a bufffet restaurant. We didn't make use of any of these as the hotel is only a few hundred metres from the Circular Quay and the Opera House and so there is a wide selection of restaurants nearby. The address of the hotel is given as Macquarie St, but if you are taking your car, the entrance is around the back in Phillip Street just before the corner with Bridge St.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Standard...in Australia (!)”
Reviews.Author: Advisors_r_Us
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times in recent years, most recently a couple of weeks ago for 2 nights for work purposes. Being a Royal Ambassador member, I was nevertheless pleased to receive an upgrade to a Club room, and have to acknowledge the many other reviews suggesting the views from the Club Lounge are absolutely spectacular...As a former Sydneysider of 10 years, I was surprised the impact the view of the Harbour, the Bridge and Opera House had on me. Pleasingly, the food selection and service at the Lounge were of a commensurate standard. Facilities in the Hotel were OK, not the best Gym, not the best Pool, but both sufficient. Rooms were very good, Beds / Pillows were what you would expect and the overall In-Room experience everything you could ask for. Having traveled a fair bit over the years, I would have to say this Hotel is right at the very pinnacle of accommodation options in Aust. and certainly compares very favorably with International 5 Star hotels I have seen. Great hotel, great location and great service..Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime Stay”
Reviews.Author: MM2H
Reviews.Content: When we checked-in, late at night, we were disappointed to find that despite re-confirming by e-mail a few days beforehand, our reservation was incorrect. This was not the fault of the hotel but due to confusion at Priority Club over our Platinum Priority Club status and our more recent Ambassador membership. In a full hotel, this meant that they were unable to offer us the guaranteed room upgrade - one of our key reasons for choosing this hotel against other chains. However, after a little gentle persistence, in lieu of the room upgrade we were offered use of the Club facilities, which for us was actually nicer. The room was plush and comfortable and although initially we were disappointed to have a view of an office block a few metres away, this was more than made up for by the view from the Club. We took breakfast there - definitely a cut above the usual Club Lounge fare - and were very well looked-after. One afternoon we popped in for afternoon tea while we took a break from seeing the sights and a couple of evenings we tried the cocktails and canapes, again, a very pleasant experience. If there is a downside, it is the cost of parking but then that's true of Sydney as a whole. We decided that whilst in the city, a car was actually a hindrance because of the cost to park so we collected it after we checked out and headed off for the rest of our break. After the initial confused start, we had a delightful stay. The location was excellent, the staff friendly, the room quiet and comfortable (though the bathroom was very small it was nicely equipped) and we would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. I'm sure that we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: marcushall
Reviews.Content: The location is extremely close to Circular Quay. The service was the best that I experienced in Australia and some of the best in the world. The breakfast buffet was also the best that I had sampled in Australia. The only negative is that appreciation in the Australian dollar has made the American dollar price of this hotel merely a good bargain compared to similar properties like the Hyatt and Observatory instead of an absolute steal. The indoor pool had wonderful views of the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Location expected luxury an marvelous staff”
Reviews.Author: AlandDiane
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental is about two long blocks from the Opera House, across the street from botanical gardens and their fruit bats, two blocks from circular quay [key], and a short 15 minute walks to Hyde Park, the Australia Museum, the fine arts museum, and the bridge among others. It is everything you would expect from an Intercontinental property. And, a VERY helpful staff. One of the staff escorted us into the Club room on the 32nd floor to take some great pictures of the harbor, gardens, etc. The first thing to know about Sydney is that it is expensive in comparison to US prices. $3 or more for a 355 ml [12 oz] Coke is just a simple example. Across the street from the hotel and down an escalator is a food court. Great selection of "to go" food and beverages at competitive prices. Also, a small but good grocery store. However, it is only open M-F from about 7am-5pm. There is a marvelous 24 hour diner on the circular quay [roughly at the entrance to Quay 4] that is often packed with locals in the afternoons. Very reasonable [by Sydney standards prices], good service, and good food. Sydney is a "what's not to like" city. This intercontinental is a "what's not to like" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, not in love with the service”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2783
Reviews.Content: My third stay at this hotel for the year, which really is my favourite hotel in Sydney. Everything beautifully clean as usual and requests made with the reservation met. Very comfortable beds and pillows as always. Few minor issues with this stay though. Firstly, when checking in I encountered a problem with checking in as an additional guest, which I have never encountered before. The explanation given was 'policy' which seemed odd as it's never been 'policy' before. Also, cleaning / mini bar staff entering the room before check out time was a bit disappointing. I realise they're a busy hotel but it seems it may not be difficult to have a system which involves waiting for the guests to check out before cleaning the room / checking the minibar. Lastly, many of the service staff loitered around waiting for tips, which, given the largely unfriendly service I wasn't really very keen to give. All in all though, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney. However, it would be great if the standard of the service could return to its former glory!

Reviews.Title: “Australia 2008/09”
Reviews.Author: IanT4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great views & brilliant location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: backpaqer
Reviews.Content: When filling in the guest survey form, I put a big line through the whole form and simply wrote - "Would not consider staying anywhere else in Sydney unless location was a factor". We stayed in club level accomodation, which is basically the normal room with King Size bed and access to the Club Lounge on the top floor. Club accomodation gives you a few extra little amenities, extra attentive service and arguably the best view you will ever get of the harbour possible. We couldn't fault anything really. There were a few niggles such as botching the guaranteed upgrade to a better room and the late 4pm checkout associated with joining their Gold Ambassador program - something I recommend you do if you're staying for two nights. For US$150 you get a voucher that entitles you a free second night with no blackouts - and that's not simply a 50% discount off 2 nights...the second night is free! We paid $330 for the first night...the second night would have been $360 (weekend rate - Club Level)...but we only paid $330 for the full weekend (+US$150 which at current rates is very good value!). We have since signed up to the Priority Club (free) and the Priority Privilege Club ($289) and they've really paid for themselves. Here's another trick - if you sign up to the Priority Privilege Club by browsing their New Zealand properties, you can get away with paying NZ$289 and save yourself another $40-odd...The Priority Privilege Card gives you 2 x 2-for-1 vouchers + 2 x 25% off vouchers + $50 hotel credit + a whole stack more goodies. It paid for itself on our first stay!

Reviews.Title: “There will always be a place in my heart for this lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pegasus8London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in Sydney over two years ago now, but felt compelled to review it now that I am a regular Tripadviser reader. This is a smashing Hotel and I am so pleased to see that it gets mainly very good reviews. This was my first 'big' holiday away with our two sons travelling basically 'solo' with them, and so it could have been daunting arriving on the other side of the World. However it was not - thanks in no small part to the team here. As soon as I walked into the reception the staff were so nice and helpful and played an integral part in making our trip to Australia so memorable. They were all exceptionally friendly to all of us; chatted to my sons every day, and I will always remember Simon the Concierge's very helpful tips on what to do each day. The Hotel is brilliantly located and we were never at a loss as to where to go or what to do! The food was superb, and our room was very comfortable, clean and secure. I felt totally relaxed in this hotel and I would recommend it to anybody visiting Sydney, whether that be on Business or pleasure. I do hope that I get round to returning there one day!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel - Top Location”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Sydney is in an excellent location right next to Circular Quay and very close to The Rocks as well as George Street and Pitt Strett Mall shopping. Darling Harbour is just a short and convenient ferry ride away. The room had an impressive view of the harbour bridge and a very comfortable bed. Furniture was in very good condition and contemporary in style. The only minor issue in my mind would be that the bathroom fixtures could be a bit more modern - but this admittedly is really looking hard for something to complain about. Check-in was fast as was check-out and staff overall were very polite. Didn't try any of the hotel restaurants as we went out every night. Overall I have to say a very good hotel which comes at a price.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMints
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this hotel with a group of friends just for 1 night for our last night in Sydney having travelled around Australia. We thought we would treat ourselves with it being our last night and we were blown away by the level of service and quality of everything within the hotel. Check in was quick and easy and our bags were in our room before we were. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The rooms were very clean and staff very professional and friendly. The hotel is a 3ish minute walk from Circular Quay which was a fantastic location I would 110% recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sula70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Sydney for 3 nights. The hotel was classy, clean, and close to nearly everything. I would highly recommend spending a little extra money for a room with a view - we were on the 22nd floor and had an amazing view of the botanical gardens, the bay, and a slice of the opera house. It was a great place to stay and didn't cost an arm and a leg like some of the other hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 16 days trip through Australia and for Sydney we decided to stay in the Intercontinental hotel. Our experience was very positive. The hotel is well located in the CBD and only 5 minutes walking distance to the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The rooms are nice and clean and the service from the staff is friendly and to the point. The gym is good too with sufficient equipment, but the pool is a bit disappointing as it is very small. We loved the interior style of the reception hall which mixes modern design with classic architecture: really impressive! No complaints whatsoever and would definitely recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travellers if you are staying in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag. Not a 5 Star at all....”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: I must say, a bit disappointed with the overall experience. Service was slow and at majority of the occasions it took us more than 3 times to reach room service or housekeeping because there was no one to pick up the phone. Room was ok and so as bathroom, you canâ€™t say 5 Star though. Normally 5 star hotels offer an extension of at least 2 hours for the late checkout but when I enquired about it, the lady first said 2pm and then within couple of seconds said, sorry only one hour extension would be possible i.e. from 11am to 12noon. Imagine I was not an overnight customer but was staying in the hotel for 7 nights. Over one weekend, house keeping only cleaned the room after 2pm whereas we left the room with card on around 10am. Any crockery received from the room service was not clean either, with old scratches on the glasses. Concierge staff was very helpful but did not know all the things. We discovered on our own one free shuttle that goes from central quay to main CBD area. Overall, apart from location there was no such great thing that the hotel offered to us specially if you are staying there for 7 nights and being a very well known 5 star hotel in the world. I regret I cancelled my Marriott reservation over this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: neomedic23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the last week of September, and truly enjoyed it here. The location is great, just two blocks from Circular Quay for the ferries and the Opera House, across the street from the Royal Botanical Gardens, and a short walk to the Rocks. We didn't dine at any of the restaurants within the hotel, but the menus looked good. We did order room service a few times, and they were very timely and the meals, while small, were tasty. The staff were very helpful, from the bellhop to the concierge. The room was pretty spacious. The bed was comfortable. Internet access was expensive at AUD $25/day!!! You'd think for such a nice hotel, they'd include it for free! The view was amazing from the bay window...we were able to see the sun set over the Harbor Bridge every night! The cushions for the bay window need to be changed to a better fabric, because the plastic ones were not comfortable. The bathroom NEEDED updating! It was small, the tiles were ugly, and the counterspace was limited. Other than those small complaints, it was a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Business District/ The Rocks Choice.”
Reviews.Author: Rory K
Reviews.Content: For part of the visit we wanted to be in the Central/Rocks area to do all the tourist things. Choice of Intercon was influenced by chance to use up Priority Club points for part of the stay. We did not regret the choice. The hotel is excellently located, being a few minutes walk from Circular Quay (ferries and trains plus many buses) while still providing easy access to the CBD for those visiting on business. Rooms are large and well equipped and very clean. Good gym (used) and indoor pool (not used). Lobby area attractive and reception etc service friendly and efficient. As plenty of restaurants nearby, did not really use F&B outlets. One gripe is (very) expensive internet at A$25 per day - so used free sites close by.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Perks”
Reviews.Author: old3
Reviews.Content: There are two main reasons that the Intercontinental was the PERFECT choice for our all-too-brief 3-night, 2-day visit to Sydney: (1) location, and (2) club floor access. The hotel is a quick walk to the principle downtown sights (e.g., Bridge Climb, Opera House, Botanical Gardens), as well as to the water ferries at Circular Quay which connect downtown to the harbor area. The highlights of the club floor were the extensive breakfast buffet, the unparalleled views on the club terrace, and the happy hour drinks (warning: there is a specific happy hour drink â€œmenuâ€� and drinks off the menu and at any other time are VERY expensive [e.g., $25 cocktails]). We often use club floor snacks and canapes for our evening meal, but the Intercontinental only provided each person with a 4-piece canapÃ© tasting tray. We had a nice view of the Harbor Bridge (and a slice of the Opera House) from our room and one night there were fireworks over the harbor visible from our window. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is professional. We highly recommend the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way back to the US. The room was fine and so was the breakfast but what really made the stay enjoyable was how helpful the concierge was with restaurant reservations, faxes and shopping help. Everyone here is pleasant and efficient and we were well looked after. We had several meetings on the premises and had a delicious dinner at Quay which was a 15 minute walk. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Pleasant Service, Fabulous View Night and Day”
Reviews.Author: elnap29
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many fine hotels worldwide, the Intercontinental Sydney stood out for it's fine service and incredible views - all of which were unique in many respects and contributed to an overall oustanding experience in Sydney. I had taken my elderly mother on a special trip to visit her homeland and family; we stayed 3 nights in Sept. in one of the Club Floor rooms with a Watson Bay view. My mother especially enjoyed the window seat with it's view of the Royal Botanical Gardens and the Opera House. The room itself was clean and pleasant with soothing decor; the beds were extremely comfortable and every detail provided. (If you want a large, high luxury room, go elsewhere; this is designed for a business traveller). Service was a stand-out throughout the hotel. Since we were not moving quickly and spent a lot of time in the hotel, we had time to notice the excellent teamwork among the staff. Intercontinental management should be commended for its excellent training of staff, who were always pleasant and helpful. Even a wheelchair was provided for our use, and when the wheelchair had 2 flat tires, a team of 5 (5!) staff members plus an engineer and concierge worked furiously fix it. Teamwork was also a strong part of the service in the Club Intercontinental (rooftop lounge) on the 32nd floor. A complimentary array of breakfast items were beautifully presented until 10AM each morning, afternoon tea from 2 - 4 pm, and drinks and gourmet canapes from 5 -7 PM. Someone was always available for concierge-type service in the lounge. Table service was always provided in the evenings. Access to the Club Lounge was well-worth the cost of the Club Room. The 350 degree view was outstanding, especially at night with all the lights around the harbor. We had prime views of the Sydney Harbor Bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay, all the bays, Royal Botanical Gardens and more. For this reason, we chose to order our dinners in the lounge (food comes from the central kitchen in the hotel, so basically same menu as the hotel restaurants at the same prices). I recommend the Intercontinental highly and do wish to thank all the staff there for making our stay so enjoyable, particularly Club Lounge staff (including Caroline, Mary, Griselle, as well as others who moved so quickly I failed to see their nametags). Also - the location is superb - a short block to Circular Quay, much closer than it appears in photos.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views with an excellent suite to boot!”
Reviews.Author: HochEV
Reviews.Content: It is clear from reading other reviews, as is the case with many hotels, the room location is key. We had a king club harbour executive suite. I cannot imagine having a better view in Sydney. To our right were the botanic gardens. Straight ahead the Sydney Opera House. Finally, to our left Harbour Bridge. With sunny days during our stay it was excellent! The room itself could use a little updating, in particular the two sofas in the sitting room. But otherwise, very spacious and well-appointed. It was nice to have two toilets, one in a separate room. A full-size bath and separate shower was also appreciated. The Club Lounge is located on the top floor and offers breathtaking views. It was matched only by our room. The lounge is of a good size with plenty of space for everyone. Breakfast there was not as grand as the hotel restaurant but it was perfectly adequate. The afternoon tea service was also very nice. In all, the lounge was the perfect place to unwind, admire the views and relax. Finally, the hotel service could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing welcome to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaxBelfast
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early on the morning of Sunday 26 July 2009. On arrival in the reception/lobby area of the hotel our bags were whisked away and we were advised that our â€˜Club loungeâ€™ would be opening for breakfast at 6.30am (about 10 minutes later). The receptionist was very friendly and welcoming, and genuinely showed an interest about our trip both to the hotel and also where else we were heading. We were given our keys and directed towards the lifts where we took it to the 29th floor. I must note here that there is a bar, restaurant and shops located in the lobby also. We very quickly admired our room, which was more like a suite, and decided to take the lift to the 36 floor where the gym and â€˜Executive Intercontinental Club loungeâ€™ was located. All we can say is WOW!!!! This hotel has the only view of Sydney Bridge and the Opera house, which both looked within touching distance. The lounge had a free-internet area, a fully stocked bar and the breakfast was laid out in a buffet service. Waiters were on hand to get fresh coffee and tea if required. Around the lounge, outside, was a viewing area â€“ all decked in wood. This was just luxurious. We had a wonderful fully cooked breakfast (cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, cheeses, etc were also available) followed by lovely Danish pastries and excellent coffee. Go and look at the views from the indoor swimming pool too. That evening, the lounge was open to Executive club room guests for drinks and to sample the â€˜tasting menuâ€™ which was changed each evening by the Chef. We were only here for 2 nights (on arrival in Australia) and both evenings the food was excellent. Especially the soft shell crab. Drinks were premium and you never had to wait long before a friendly waiter/waitress came to full up our glasses. We saw some amazing views over Sydney, most noteworthy was the wonderful sunrises and sunsets. Thank you Intercontinental, you made our arrival (and first trip to Australia) a very memorable one for all the right reasons. This hotel ticks all the boxes, although I felt the dÃ©cor in the rooms was a little bit jaded, but this did not take away from the wonderful experience. Go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views from club lounge”
Reviews.Author: MickiAustralia
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable - great bed, good bathroom . Good position - close to Botanic gardens, Opera House, Circular Quay etc but handy for shoppiong too. The highlight was the Club Lounge - those views blew us away - sublime - sitting sipping cocktails ovelooking what must be one of the best views in the world - the harbour - Opera House, Harbour Bridge wow ... and to think we used to live in Sydney and took it all for granted !Breakfast in the lounge was fabulous - 5 star service and quality. We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marybs6
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Intercontinental and it was great. The location of the hotel is perfect for getting around the city easily. It's two blocks from Circular Quay which offers ferries, buses, and trains. Although the hotel sits high above the quay, across the street is a building that has escalators from the top of the hill to the quay with a food court plaza halfway, so if you are tired after a big day and don't want to walk up the hill, you can take the escalators and maybe stop for coffee and a snack at the food court as well. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and spacious, with nice views. The beds are excellent and there are lots of pillows. We found the price very reasonable, maybe partly because it was winter in Sydney and they have fewer guests. We never ate in the hotel, fully expecting it to be be overpriced. There are so many restaurants to choose from close by at the quay, the Rocks, the promenade to the Opera House, and the International Passenger Terminal Building, why eat at the hotel? City Extra at the quay became our favorite breakfast spot. Their mango and coconut muffins are addictive. If I have any criticism they would be: the hot water in the shower is really hot and could be dangerous for some people with small children or health problems. Some of the desk staff seem to think working in a really nice hotel justifies a snobbish attitude. I find that a little comical when I'm dealing with a 20-something who has likely never been beyond Australia. We've stayed at four hotels in Sydney and this is our hands-down favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur and Luxury in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: danthegirl
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip a few months ago to coincide with a work conference and to take advantage of the Winter Escape packages on offer. After we booked, we read many of the reviews on here and started to get cold feet. The upshot of some of the reviews said that it was overpriced for what you get. Nothing could be further from the truth. The Intercontinental is a truly lovely hotel to be in with lots of little extras that we didn't bank on. I felt special from the moment I walked in until the moment we left. The staff were incredibly competent and friendly and did everything we asked and more. I will add that we were there for the quieter moments as well as the super busy check in/check out times so we got to see the Hotel at work under pressure and it passed with flying colours. It is an expensive hotel drinks wise, but we wanted to have a weekend in the big smoke and wanted to stay in a hotel that has everything you could want at your fingertips. The prices of the minibar, facilities, parking etc were around the mark of any other 5 star hotel with the same aspect. We got what we asked for. An additional pleasant surprise was the restaurant "Etch" where the silver service was impeccable and the food was amazing and very reasonably priced (cheaper than Mad Cow @ Ivy or Est. - also good spots to eat). We also took advantage of the buffet breakfast in Cafe Opera and note that one reviewer here said it was "bland and tasteless" and not 5 star. I don't know what frame of reference they had, but I had just stayed four nights at the Novotel Darling Harbour for a conference before upping the ante to the Intercon for the weekend and the buffet at Novotel was nothing short of atrocious. My frame of reference from many buffet breakfasts I've had at 4/5 star hotels over the years was that this was the best I've had. I would recommend that you ask for a table on the terrace rather than a table inside, because the ambience was less "buffet". I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good nights sleep with a beautiful view to wake up to (we were in room #2006 and had a Watsons Bay view room), and who appreciates the value of being surrounded by culture and history. The shower was fantastic and HOT and the aircon was efficient too. Some complained about the traffic noise but we had no problem even though we were higher up above the Cahill expressway/EDT where you'd expect the noise to travel and be louder. If you are on a budget, you will find it hard to stick to it, but the experience is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrian s
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to your every need. My wife and I had the most wonderful time in Sydney and a lot of that was thanks to the Interconty. Our view was spectacular, overlooking Sydney Harbor. The room service was top notch, with amazing food. Delta Airlines lost our bags and didn't get them to us till we only have 3 days left in our trip, so that was difficult. Even though obviously it wasn't their fault, the hotel really spoiled us by sending us a complimentary bottle of very good wine and a cheese platter. they also upgraded our room and just made us feel very welcome. They got us hard to get reservations at the best restaurants. Talk to David Pratt at the concierge. He was one of the best we've had. The beds here are so comfortable that i didn't want to go back to mine... and I have a pretty good bed. I will never forget this trip and it was thanks to the attention to detail that we witnessed from the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice - but the photo does not do this hotel justice”
Reviews.Author: coastalmom
Reviews.Content: The properties I considered for this trip were the Intercontinental, the Marriott Circular Quay, the Four Seasons, Westin and Shagri-la. I'm very glad I made the choice I did. The Four Season & Shangri-la required 2-room since we were traveling w/out 10yr old and 13 year old. The westin, Marriott and Intercontinental allowed the 4 of us in one room. We reserved a Watson View Room because it overlooked the Royal Botanical Gardens and as I'd hoped, I didn't feel like we were in a tall building 'stuffed' between other tall buildings in a big city. Our view was incredibly beautiful. The room was clean and good size but not large. The decor was nice and the furnishings were very practical. There was a lot of space for luggage - even though the closet was just average sized. The bathroom was very clean. The beds, pillows were soft and comfortable. The turndown service came every night at 8 with bottles of water and some chocolates. The pool on the top floor was small, heavily chlorinated and simple. The kids enjoyed it anyway - and I really enjoyed the views! Wished they had some drink and/or snack service up there though. We were there in late-winter during uncommonly warm weather for the time. It was in the 70's and very comfortable. I could see if it were cold, or rainy, this would definitly be the place to stay so you wouldn't need to bother with getting around - the Intercontinental is perfectly situated for ease of getting to any tourist attraction. We were a 5-minute walk to the Opera House, and to the Quay where you get onto the Ferry's for the zoo and other tours. The Royal Botanical Gardens were literally across the street and we visited daily so our kids could fly their boomerangs. We were a 10-minute stroll to the Rocks which has trendy shops and nice bistro style restaurants. The Hyatt which is also well rated is located in the Rocks - and I think our location was equally as good, maybe better considering the Hyatt sits directly beneath the Harbor Bridge. Everything is closer than it appears to be on the maps. We didn't get the hop-on-hop-off pass because it was easier to take a harbor tour, then just walk everywhere. Once we did take a cab to the Pit Street shopping areas - but we walked back afterwards. The staff was polite in a somewhat business-like manner. They seem to cater more to business travelers than to vacationers although there were a lot of vacationers at the hotel. We didn't really need much from them, so it didn't matter. When we did need something - they were effecient. The restaurant staff was very good and attentive. 2 mornings we had breakfast across the street at the Sydney Museum. Simple menu, about the same price as the hotel, but the breakfast was very good. It was recommended by the hotel reception desk. A waiter there told us a story of when former President George W Bush had recently stayed at the Intercontinental. He said all the streets were shut down and security was everywhere. Well, if its good enough for George, its good enough for us. Bet he had an Opera House view room. Please note that if you do stay here, there's ample opportunity of opera house viewing, to the point of opera-house 'overkill' if there could be such a thing. In a city with so many options, it may be hard to go wrong. But we defnintely did it right by staying at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally-located hotel with professional service”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Stopped through Sydney for a couple of days, and booked the Intercontinental. The Intercontinental was my choice because it was right in the middle of the Central Business District, and an easy (uphill) walk from Circular Quay rail station. From a transport-accessibility point of view, the location of the IC is great. Easy access to a large number of ferry and rail services, close to the beautiful Botanical Gardens, and not too far from the shopping district downtown. That said, the immediate area doesn't have too many cafes and restaurants (you have to walk down to Circular Quay/The Rocks or up towards Pitt). When entering the IC lobby and bar area, the clean lines and open corridors give the appearance of luxury and prestige. The staff was decent, and provided me with a city-facing room, on a lower-floor. The room facilities were standard (king bed, good shower), and modern. Pool and fitness facilities were on the top floor, and well-maintained. Being a standard upper-tier hotel, you have to pay for everything else, including parking, Internet, and so forth. In addition, my particular room had a weird smoky smell. After complaining to the front desk, they offerred to ozone the room, which did a decent job of removing the smell. Everything at the IC reflected professional, smooth service. If I had business in the area, I would definitely place this on my shortlist. If I were a leisure traveller, I would choose this if there are good value deals, or I had a lot of Priority Club points

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Inter Conti!”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: Great location, Nice hotel, well appointed rooms (bathrooms need upgrade!!!), good service. Breakfast is rather expensive. Housekeeping job well done. Guest Rooms are well maintained and roomy. Amenities and service are good. One of the best reasons for choosing this hotel is perhaps its location. Staff is nice and very friendly. We would come back here anytime. We enjoyed our stay and we will certainly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay !”
Reviews.Author: Zunipink
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Intercontinental Sydney for 3 days on route to Dublin via Singapore. I found everything in the hotel fabulous! The staff could not have been more helpful, the view was brilliant ( see pics! ) I choose an Opera House/ Bridge view (room 2525) Room was well above par to any 4/5* I have previously stayed in . Cant understand some negative views regarding this hotel. Question for 1 reviewer... If I was on my honeymoon ... the Internet cost would be the last thing on my mind ! (:)) ) I would stay in this hotel again if I return to Sydney. A big mention to a waitress called Kristen in the Piano bar, this lady could not have been more helpful and courteous. The food was superb and the location.... well 2 minutes walk to Circular Quay?? I sometimes wonder what people expect ??? Maybe if I was staying for 2/3 weeks I may have discovered something amiss, but certainly for a short stay you could not beat this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but awful service”
Reviews.Author: Rob158
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon. The location is very good (5 Mins to the Opera House & Bridge). However overall our experience of this hotel was a negative one. The service was very poor and the manners of some of the staff was terrible, and not of a five star standard. The male member of staff when we checked in was very rude and unhelpful. We also didnt get towels left in the room on one occasion. We used room service on one occasion, which was "average" at best, considering the price. Whilst the location is good, there are many other hotels in this region, which I would use in the future. There is internet, which is extremely expensive, and the printer was broken when I used it. Our room was sold as a "City View" but we had little view other than a neighbouring office block.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover962
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental on the way in and out of Australia (visted another area). The location was fantastic. Close to everything.
