Didn't eat or drink in the restaurant but ordered room service and the pizza was great. All desk assistance and concierge service was very accomodating and nice. Had a City View room both visits and both offered nice views. Bedding and linens were very luxurious and especially liked having all the light/window shade fixtures at the night stand.

Reviews.Title: “Bonding trip for single mom & college age son”
Reviews.Author: WilPowerMom
Reviews.Content: I am a full time caregiver for my elderly mother who has Alzheimer's and my disabled brother and am a sinlge mom to boot. Suffice it to say, I never get a break. So when I got a chance to go to Sydney to actually spend time with my son and be a mom, I jumped at it. I splurged and booked a room on the Ambassador levels - it was well worth the extra money. We arrived .very early am so our room wasn't ready but I was able to shower and change in the Ambassador club and wake up with pots of coffee. Our room was gorgeous and the staff brought extra trays of coffee to the room immediately - once they heard my story, they couldn't do enough to make sure I got the break with my son that we both so depserately needed. The breakfasts on the club level overlooking the Opera House and Botanical Gardens were large enough to keep a teenage boy full through lunch, meaning we never had to break until late afternoon when we returned for afternoon tea and the complimentary cocktails and snacks. We were steps from the train and ferries and the Opera House and across from the Botanical Gardens where we strolled almost every day. The little extra touches like the complimentary water bottles and luxurious toilitries and bath robes and spa slippers in our room made me feel pampered (a nice change). When we left, I forgot to pack an airplane kit to be able to freshen up for the long flights home - the concierge gave me extra packs of toothbrushes, combs, etc. for the flight. They even made sure to make an adjustment to my bill and follow up within two days to make sure this was done to my satisfaction. My teenage son loved how he was treated in the executive level - with free beers, and all the food he could eat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmyGoes211
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Sydney Intercontinental. We were pleasantly surprised, after our speedy check in, to find out that our room had been upgraded to a harbor view! We had a beautiful view of the Harbor Bridge, Opera House, and Circular Quay. The room was spotless and beautiful, and the bathroom was sparkling clean and spacious. We didn't require much in terms of service, but the hotel staff we did encounter was friendly and polite. I would definitely recommend this location to a friend based on the quality of rooms and prime location. Wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near Circular Quay, but had inadequate service during our visit and was a poor value for the money. The hotel staff seemed quite overwhelmed during our visit. Room service was good, but difficult to get through to by phone. We found the concierge service to be uneven. Although we received one good restaurant recommendation, on one occasion, we could not locate the concierge (the people at the front desk did not know where the concierge was either). Definitely far below expectations for an Intercontinental in terms of service. The rooms were of a good quality, however, and our room had a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and top notch service”
Reviews.Author: CSRC
Reviews.Content: The service at the Intercon was the best we have experienced in Sydney (having stayed at the Radisson, Swissotel and Shangri-la on numerous occasions) and, as far as the Club staff go, the best we have experienced anywhere. In fact, the service in the Club and the views would be the two standout features of this hotel, in my opinion. We stayed in a harbour view king suite which was very spacious, had a massive spa bath and a second separate toilet. The views were as good as it gets, looking down on the opera house and bridge. The rooms are decorated in a traditional style, with marble bathrooms and gold taps etc, but have flat screen tvs. Overall the room was luxurious and well-maintained. The Club lounge is the nicest I've ever seen - on the roof, views to die for, comfortable inside and with plenty of outdoor seating on the deck. The staff, as I already mentioned, were fabulous. I was amazed at how polished and genuinely friendly they were. We have used club lounges all over the world but the standard of the staff at the Intercon was exceptional. The lounge was busy in the evenings (it was a long weekend) but the staff maintained their professional and positive attitude. It may be wise, however, to cater for this by having self-serve drinks and canapes like most club lounges. Regardless, there was never much of a wait for service. Although we didn't have much contact with other staff in the hotel, I was also very impressed by the door staff - their attention to detail in, for example, offering to adjust the taxi seat to give my partner more leg room was unusual and refreshing. The one negative is the pool/sauna/gym, all of which are small and a bit daggy. There might not be much room for expansion but the changing rooms and gym could be refurbished. However, we had a fantastic stay and have already booked our next stay in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Callumsgrandpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 15 days and you get to know a hotel in two weeks. Our room overlooked the harbour and the botanic gardens. Housekeeping was well above par, nice attitute and prompt service. As mentioned by others, the hotel is right at circular Quay and all the buses, ferries and trains were right at the our doorstep making travel very easy. The bus to Bondi is a block away. My only complaint is the staff at the lounge, they appear to try to avoid you and when you charge $25 for a martini you should be offering excellent service. Overall a fine place to stay in Sydney, We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: obdocSanJose
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Intercontinental is in a wonderful location, right next to Royal Botanic Gardens and waterfront walking, close to the Rocks with lots of great waterfront restaurants, right next to Circular Quay with ferries, trains, and buses easily accessible. The Opera House is within walking distance. The room was spacious enough for the four of us, beds were very comfortable, gym and indoor pool on 31st floor a bonus. The staff were all very helpful and friendly from check in to check out and concierge. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room didn't have a view, but we didn't pay for one. I can't find anything to be critical about - we had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ks3804
Reviews.Content: This trip marked our second stay in Sydney but our first at this hotel. This hotel has a really fantastic location, which is one of its biggest selling points (especially if you are unfamiliar with the area and want to be absolutely sure you will have zero problem finding the "big Sydney attractions".) It was no problem whatsoever to get to shopping and other major sites in Sydney (like, of course, the Opera House). It's in a very safe area and has easy access to ferries and taxis so getting around beyond the immediate area is also a snap. The check in process could not have taken more than a few minutes and the woman who was working at the front desk had a great, upbeat attitude. Our room was spacious and very clean and they had a bowl of fresh fruit waiting for us when we got there. The bed in our room was very comfortable (always a plus after a very long day of travel.) The concierge helped us set up a tour to the Hunter Valley and our room service food was always delivered quickly. We ate breakfast at the buffet a few times, which I would say was pleasant and well done but nothing amazing (and a bit pricey, but you pay for the convenience). We also had appetizers and drinks at the lounge a few times as well (again, nothing *outstanding*, but good enough for what it was.) All in all, if you're looking for a good "home base" for touring Sydney, you can book this hotel with confidence. I would absolutely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but nice location”
Reviews.Author: RathRath
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute (literally 1 hour before arriving) on a travel website (not their own) and paid $288 for a rate including harbour views, valet parking, late checkout to 2pm and full buffet breakfast. The first room we were offered smelled of smoke (it was a non-smoking room) and the "harbour views" were of the highway, however they were very courteous and efficient moving us to a higher level (24th floor) of the same room type for a better view and a much better smelling room. The check-in process went well considering they had only an hour to process our booking and all staff very friendly and helpful. Loved the window seat concept - unfortunately the seat itself was very uncomfortable. Otherwise very standard looking room with average but clean and adequately stocked bathroom for this star rated hotel. There was no pressure in the shower head - two options either a cold "shower" like standing under a garden hose or boiling hot. Breakfast was very disappointing - not much choice given it is meant to be a full buffet breakfast in a five star hotel. It was a bland looking arrangement of food with no colour and what was there was not very tasty. The hotel location is terrific and the staff all very nice and helpful, but the room itself is not very atmospheric. The bar in the Atrium is lovely though. Parking, check-out all worked well. I agree with another poster that the driveway is difficult to locate and is actually best approached by driving down Macquarie St towards the Opera House, then left into Albert St and left again into Phillip St. That way you can turn left into the driveway of the hotel. Internet is via a broadband cable (no wi-fi available) and was $15AUD per hour or $25AUD per day. I realise the daily rate is probably fairly standard in Australia but the hourly rate is certainly a deterrant if you just want to quickly check emails or check something on the web. When we questioned alternatives we were not offered 30 minutes free of charge or any other options. If the shower had worked and the breakfast was better then this rate would have been good value for money. As with any hotel, I am sure the Club level is an entirely different experience, and I know I certainly recieve great service at the hotels I regularly stay at for work, so perhaps the regular corporate travellers have a different experience. As a one-off customer, we were certainly not provided any special treatment. We will definitely not return. Also note, our harbour view room was a view over Wooloomooloo and towards South Head, which we were happy with as it gave a great perspective out to sea, but perhaps first time visitors to Sydney may expect to see the Opera House. As always buyer beware of the wording! For dinner we walked up to Rockpool Bar & Grill on the corner of Hunter & Bligh Streets - it was excellent. If you can't get a table, take a seat in the bar and order a few "small" plates of food - everything we tried was delicious. The food was not too expensive however the wine list (which is huge and comes in two books) is on the pricey side but the atmosphere is pure Sydney and we had a great night. You can also easliy walk across the Harbour Bridge from here - either up through the Rocks (throught he Rocks Market if you are there on a weekend) or via the Cahill expresway - there are steps not far from the hotel entrance on Macquaire St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: emily462
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, this hotel is excellently situated. Itâ€™s a very easy walk to Cricular Quay (subway stop, ferries to zoo, Manly, Darling Harbour etc., Harbour cruises), the Botanical Gardens, Opera House, and The Rocks. We arrived at the hotel at 8am after over 30 hours of traveling, the hotel staff were very courteous and, to our surprise and immense happiness, they informed us that our room would be ready in an hour. In the meantime, we were offered access to the gym, pool, and changing rooms in case we wanted to freshen up. The showers in the changing room were clean, stocked with soap, and there were hair dryers as well. True to their word, we were able to check-in to our room at 9am. The room itself was very clean and well-appointed, though nothing very out of the ordinary except for the view (of Harbour Bridge, Opera House, and the Botanical Gardens) which was fantastic. We ordered room service one night, and it arrived at the scheduled time and hot, plus it was reasonably priced. When we asked about internet access, we were offered a complimentary 30 minutes. All staff that we interacted with were professional and courteous. We look forward to returning to Sydney, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: The_Hotel_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rm 2619 (King City View) on 21 Mar 09 at a Special Rate of $199. Vehicle entrance to this hotel is not well marked and you may, like I did, have to circle around a few times before you pick it. Valet Park is $30AUD. Check-In Experience was average, staff member was cold. Porter took ages delivering bag - had to call down after an hour as it had still not arrived. Room is fairly nice (good value/location for price I paid), with partial water views and intelligent inclusion of window seat to enjoy it from (even if it could have been more comfortable). Bathroom was looking somewhat tired but inclusion of high-quality Elemis tolietries a very nice plus. Standard overpriced mini-bar and iron/ironing board round out room. As I was only there to attend a production at the Opera House I didn't check out the pool or gym, and I passed on eating at Cafe Opera as attitude I got from staff member when I asked to see a menu put me off. Went and ate at the Bavarian Bief Cafe on O'Connell Street instead (can recommend). Check-out experience was better as one of the Conciegres checked me out - very polite and warm. Long wait for car though - wasn't allowed to call for car until I was down in lobby (hotel practice). If the price is cheap I would probably stay again but I think there are better options around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1307boss
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have been staying at the Sydney Intercontinental at least 1 night a week for business for the past 3 years. The location is sensational. If you are planning a trip here opt for the "club floor" it is certainly worth the cost difference, the view from your room is breath taking. There has been a change of General Manager and with this there has been cost cutting. The pool is somewhat ordinary as with the Gym . The staff are friendly and helpful. You are a 10minute easy walk to the opera house, we often take the Cahill walk over the Sydney Harbour bridge and back in the morning. The Rocks area is only a 10minute easy walk away. The Sydney Theatre company is a easy 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “What a bad stay!”
Reviews.Author: zzzman1
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's the global fanancial crisis but I got a distinct feeling this hotel is cutting staffing to maintain profits...and it shows. Everything you asked for was either delayed or ignored. Check-in was lengthy, as was checkout. Staff seemed to be in an attitude of "how quickly can i get this done". Not a real even 3 star experience. Sure the hotel is nice (but not great) but what lets it down so much is the service. You can't have a hotel that is nice with this level of service. Food and Beverage outlets where a joke. Club evening drinks where nice but breakfast was a joke (as other people on this site have commented. The fact the past few reviews have all been negative maybe explain the interconts reaction to the economy.....cut costs at any cost. Never again. Totally disapointing. Much better to offer from other hotels. Service is just terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: sammeus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night for a special occasion and everything just seemed to go pear shaped. Wrong room type allocated, a fight to get the room booked. Room was not ready at checkin time and had to argue to get a room 45 minutes after checkin time. Filthy pool complete with scum on the sides. Several requests ignored. It sempt that to have anything completed you had to call at least 3 times (I waited on hold to speak to an opperator for 8 minutes). Inroom movies failed, room service was cold and had to be replaced, then instead of bringing the requested tomatoe sauce, sweet chilli in a red packet was delivered, so i ended up having sweet chilli sauce all over my meal. I would have called room service about this, but by this stage I had been waiting an hour and 45 minutes for the meal (that I planed to eat whilst whatching the movie that failed. It was disapointing the hotel didn't have any spa facilities either. Could mention a list a mile long of other issues but in the end just wished to have never had left home in the first place. Avoid Intercont at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming, maybe the runt of the Intercontinental litter”
Reviews.Author: Welshman_Abroad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last night of a very brief trip to Australasia at the Intercontinental Sydney. En route we had stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore and had a wonderful stay, sadly the hotel in Sydney left us both feeling underwhelmed. On arrival at check-in the receptionist was engrossed in what must have been some important paperwork as our arrival wasnâ€™t even acknowledged until the final staple had been applied. Comparisons with Singapore couldnâ€™t be avoided. However, he eventually noticed that someone was trying to check-in and greeted us with an adequate welcome. As a Platinum Ambassador member I reserved a standard room on points, but on check-in asked if I could pay for an upgrade to a Club Room. This was possible at a charge of AU$150 but this was balanced with a no Ambassador room upgrade, as I had paid on points and this was the Intercontinental Sydney! Our room was a typically well appointed Intercontinental room with a city view ( as reserved) but there was no water or fruit in the room and despite advising at reservation stage that it was our anniversary no acknowledgement of any kindâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..again comparisons with Singapore crept back. Iâ€™ve recently stayed at various Intercontinental hotels as part of trips to celebrate either my wifeâ€™s birthday or an anniversary, each one (London, Paris, Singapore) has recognised the occasion and made a gesture which is very much appreciated. Sydney however, is different and whilst I donâ€™t expect something for nothing there should at least be some consistency. At Singapore the receptionist wishing my wife a happy anniversary was thoughtful and enough. As usual, we took a wander around the hotel to check out the facilities and found a fabulously well appointed hotel. The swimming pool is indoors and has the view of the harbour but the best of all is the Club lounge, the view of the harbour, including the bridge and Opera House is amazing, especially at night. Sadly, our time was limited and we werenâ€™t really able to enjoy the lounge and its magnificent vista. The hotel is located very close to Circular Quay, so picture postcard Sydney is right on your doorstep making it a great place to be. The Botanical gardens are just across the road, and the Opera House is literally only a few hundred yards away. Breakfast was in the Club lounge, service was courteous and the selection was broad and plentiful. We have no complaints at all and again enjoyed a wonderful view over the harbour, but there was something lacking. The hotel facilities are as expected from an Intercontinental, the location is exceptional but we left still feeling underwhelmed. Service from sister Intercontinental hotels left this one in the shade despite its fabulous location, and if I stay in Sydney again Iâ€™ll probably pitch for one of the Holiday Inns or maybe the Crowne Plaza at Coogee. Never mind.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is the way to go.”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and booked a Club Level Room. The room was spacious enough with a good desk for working, but it is again time to refresh the rooms -- not tatty, but need refreshing. Very good housekeeping. Nice large windows provide nice harbor views and light. All the typical business class amenities: ironing board, in-room-safe, toiletries. I did not check out the in-room internet connection because of the annoying charge ($20 US, or $25 AUD,) and the fact that there is free access in the Club Lounge and where I would work during the week. The Club Level provides a very good value for the upcharge from a standard room. First, there is a wrap-around view of the harbor, which makes for a nice atmosphere at any time of day. There is a lot of complimentary food at different times of day. The continental breakfast buffet of fruits and pastries was pretty good. Later in the day were free wine and beer and very good snacks. Booking the Club level also allows use of a small conference room, which came in very handy. The hotel itself is very well located to many of the tourist attractions, the Rocks area, etc. Because of being on the Club Level and business and touring activities, I didn't explore much of the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special, service is horrible or simply not there”
Reviews.Author: icartip
Reviews.Content: we arrived for a one night stay in a king city view room. That is exactly what we got but the room amenities were dated and while the bathroom and room itself was clean, the staff were simply uncoordinated or ineffective. we asked for 2 envelopes and it took over an hour for anyone to bring it to us and when they did it was past 1 am. Instead of placing it under the door, they had the audacity to open the door when the do not disturb sign was out and intruded into our privacy. The hotel seemed very quick in chasing guests out. At excatly 11 am, we were asked if we were extending our stay or needed help with out luggage. To add damage, our loyalthy points either did not post or were posted wrongly. Television channels were also dismal and lacking for business hotel. Hotel amenities were ok but we didnt had time to check it out. Room decor was of nice colour tone but that is where the praise ends.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere. Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravels
Reviews.Content: Hy husband surprised me with a night at the Intercontinental on Saturday. He found a package online for $310 including valet and full breakfast and the restaurant we wanted to visit was in the bottom of the hotel - so a bonus! As Sydneysiders we have stayed a number of city hotels for functions in the city but had never stayed here. Valet parking was smooth although the driveway was a bit tight and had a number of cars parked along it. Reception was slow with only one person serving at 5:30pm and we waited close to 10 minutes to check in. At check-in the receptionist was quick to advise that the valet would be refunded at check out. The room itself was just that - a room, Nothing overly fantastic but a very large desk took up about 1/4 of the room. Fine if a business traveller - but not for leisure. The view was a promised - out over Watson's Bay to the heads, but also overlooking the expressway. The shower curtain had some odd red stain on the inside (looked like shower gel?) The tiles were chipped and cracked and the water pressure was abysmal. The shower gel and shampoo smelled quite strong and ended up overpowering the perfume I put on later. We had drinks in the Cortille Lounge and at $20 a cocktail, I expected a lot less ice and more cocktail! The waiter poured the best beer we had ever seen!!! On to the highlight of our stay which was the Etch restaurant in the bottom of the hotel. The food and service was impeccable and I could rave for days! Highly recommend the pork belly and scallops. Once back in our room we settled in for a quiet night without children, only to be woken up at 3am by a very loud humming noise in the room. After 5 minutes of searching we realised it was the air con, which we promptly turned off, but the room quickly became stuffy. So much for solid night's sleep. Unfortunately the breakfast buffet the next day was a huge disappointment. At $38/head (if purchased separately) I would have expected eggs cooked to order and top quality fruit and meat, but it was cafeteria quality at best. My husband had to ask twice for his pot of tea and when it arrived, it was just a regular bagged tea. We ended up walking out and crossing the street to the cafe at in the Museum of Sydney and for $35 got the best breakfast for two! Including the best eggs benedict and coffees. For the money - I would recommend the Shangri-la over this any day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lmp51
Reviews.Content: For our last four days in Australia, we sprung for a club level room w/ opera house view. It didn't disappoint. A nice size room w/modern decor with window seat overlooking the opera house, Harbour bridge, and Sydney harbor -- a delight to watch the ferries come and go, the sun set and the lights come out. Bathroom not large, but well-supplied, clean and elegant. I think the value at the Intercontinental is the club level -- for not much more $, you get an elaborate full breakfast, afternoon tea, and drinks and canapes in the evening in the club lounge on the 31st floor, with spectacular views. (With all the free eats, we only bought one meal a day in during our stay!) The concierge was helpful, and we found the staff to be courteous and unobtrusive. Excellent location for the tourist -- Circular Quay, Opera House, the Rocks, the Botanical Gardens, ferries and train are all within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour views, if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: A typical InterContinental. Location is close to the Rocks area and its about a 15-20min walk to the city centre proper (i.e town hall). Food and drinks generally expensive, so take a short walk to the Rocks area (or the opposite direction towards the city centre) for a range of options. The Club Lounge has great views of the harbour, ANZAC bridge and the Opera House (I am told the best view of all the hotel's in the city). I was upgraded to a harbour view room, and that was quite nice with bay windows on two walls. Breakfast in the Club Lounge is fine, did not try the restaurants except for the lounge bar which is a bit hard on the wallet. The only gripe I have is that the front desk/reception is way too small, and just about every time I have passed by, there has been a queue. If you are unfortunate enough to be checking in or out when a group is doing the same, then you are in for quite a wait (and you may not even get standing room).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great locatiion”
Reviews.Author: shushh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for night just after Easter at the club intercontinental room and had a wonderful stay. Check in and check out were efficient as was the valet parking. Our room was a little on the small side but it was clean, comfortable and the decor was tasteful. The club intercontinental really made our stay special. The view was phenomenal. We enjoyed our breakfast, afternoon tea and pre-dinner drinks and canapes. The staff were friendly and professional. There was a good range of drinks available and the food of good quality. The pool was a little disappointing. Although it had a great view, it was small and a little stuffy. Gym facilitiies were excellent. We really enjoyed the proximity of the hotel to circular quay. It meant we could walk down comfortably and enjoy the harbour front atmosphere and restaurants. Wouldn't hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “One of Sydney's Best”
Reviews.Author: Sazzar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for only one night and would love to have stayed a lot longer! We checked in at 9am and were offered a twin room, but opted to wait for our king room. Staff were friendly and attentive. The lobby was full of charm and character, especially the cafe area with the original building faÃ§ade. When we finally got to our room at 1am (after a wedding), we were immediately impressed to find the bed turned down, the luggage in our room and a chocolate on the bed. The room was spacious, clean and classy. Despite not having a harbour view room, the view was still impressive. The bed was also very comfortable, making it very difficult to wake up. After waking too late for breakfast, we decided to go to the lobby and have breakfast from the cafe. We had warm muffins and pastries which were delicious. The service was prompt and friendly. During our stay, the city experienced a blackout which the staff handled with apparent ease. Despite the chaos, the concierge managed to get us a quick taxi out of the city. This was truly a magnificent stay and we will be returning to this hotel again when we next visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 nights over Easter. Hadnt stayed there for almost 10 years, so decided to give it another go. The rooms have been updated, I had a harbour view room, very nice. The bed was quite soft, as were the pillows, but otherwise comfy. The TV was generous with the cable TV channels, (thanks!), unlike other CBD hotels who are still just purchasing sport channels (women travel too!). And the TV was easy to use. The volume was annoying as the sound came from the bathroom via a speaker under sink. I had to turn the TV off during showering as it was so loud, couldnt be adjusted and was too annoying. The staff were very nice, no complaints. Room service staff especially, very polite and charming. Towels were bigger than sheet size and plenty of them, which was great. Room was spotless and kept so by housekeeping. The electrical points which werent replaced during the renovation dates the room, but no drama. The room service menu isnt great, but the prices are reasonable and aside for the watery, inedible scrambled eggs (thankfully only $10), the food is delicious and generous. The room is at least 40sq, and generous sofas etc. I enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: ViolinDingue
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the staff were not very attentive and on our arrival proceeded to have a five minute conversation whist we waited for them to finish but putting that aside the room (albeit a great view which we requested) looked very tired. The location was good but the hotel itself failed to live up to its 5 stars, that said we had just arrived from Asia where 5 stars means 5 stars or more.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- go for the Club room and that rooftop view.....”
Reviews.Author: jpaulcook
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights visiting my 23 yr old daughter.We all had access to the Club lounge and sat with the chef,s tasting plate and a glass of wine, all included in the room cost, on the roof terrace enjoying the best view in Sydney! Fabulous! The room was very comfy with 2 Queen beds and a nice bathroom- all very modern and spruce. After our first experience of Sydney hotels-see my other reviews-this was a vast improvement and yet they are not far apart on Tripadvisor's rating- it just shows what a couple of rogue reviews can do. I feel some of the less favourable reviews-"staff a bit "up themselves" for example- are not fair as this is a 5star hotel and the service, for us, reflected that. Breakfast was fantastic and we found the rapid check out worked perfectly. Go for a club room, pay the bit extra and you will not be disappointed as the extras more than make up the extra cost. By the way, the Atrium is stunning and the pool , gym etc what you would expect from Intercontinental. The position is great too and I have no idea what the person who complained about "the hill" was talking about. It is just a block up from Circular Quay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmurph13
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a short trip (One night). I was accomodated with an early check-in and late departure with no problem. The airport limo transfer they setup for me was just fine. The room had a fantastic harbor view. I finished my meetings early on the check-out day and was able to walk from the hotel to the Opera House through the Botanical Gardens and then around part of the Harbour. The Hotel's location is fantastic. Room service was quick and effcient. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Over-rated, although excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hotpot2215
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, 2 minutes to Opera House and Circula Quay. More business guests than tourists. Hotel was slightly up it's self. Rooms were spotless, although compared to other hotels nothing special given reputation. Staff were slightly rude, and thought highly of themselves. Our check out was a nightmare, valet parking went wrong and no taxi's could get through. Be carefull of the telephone bill's as they charges are rediculous, and the manager tells you to go get a phone card! Still a nice hotel, one or two things not up to scratch, did enjoy our stay although probably not the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Still a favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: This has always been one of my favorite hotels. It can be expensive but always good value. This time I booked a club room so we awere able to have breakfast drinks etc on the 32 nd floor. The view is amazing from the club. The club facilites have been upgarded so you can enjoy refreshments all day - tea coffee etc which is great. Our room overlooked Watsons bay and was very clean and comfortable. There is a turn down service every evening which was not too early so we were always at dinner when they arrived. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. we were also left a complimentary bottle of bubbles which was a nice touch. The bathroom was well stocked with Elemis products. Plus bathroom scales which I avoided after two weeks of holidaying! However great for the weight watchers as living in hotels can be a waistline hazzard. The staff were friendly and efficient. However when we reported the faulty lift the concierge did not take us seriously and informed us that the manaufactuer cannot find anything wrong with it. I felt this was a flippant response as the lift was quite clearly faulty. stopping between floors is a problem to me! Anyway that did not detract from our stay I just made sure I used the other lifts. e did not use the resteraunts this stay but have on previous occasions and they were fine. The location of this hotel is great becuase you can wander down to circular quay and there are many little cafes and resteraunts. This vist we ate at Bubbles and the Italian Village and both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Service, trading on great location.”
Reviews.Author: IntTraveling
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and some pleasant public areas however it is certainly trading on these aspects, as we found the rooms very average and the service lacking with a shocking ability to consistently get things wrong. The hotel is certainly not a good ambassador for the Intercontinental chain!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great for families with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: wcchung
Reviews.Content: *Warning: Long, toddler specific review * The Intercontinental was our first stop on a month long trip in Australia (we later went to Melbourne, Brisbane and Noosa) with our 2.5 year old son. We stayed at the Intercontinental for four nights. We've been to Sydney several times (though before we had our son) and we've traveled a fair amount since having him, so we had strong priors about what we wanted in a hotel. We were tremendously pleased with our experience at the Intercontinental and will certainly stay there again when we're back in Sydney. Many reviews say that the location is great. This is especially so for a toddler. - First, the entrance to Royal Botanical Gardens is just one block and one street crossing away. The Gardens offer a myriad of delights for toddlers - the water fountains, the red tram, the pools, the sprinklers, all the different types of birds, the cafe for snacks. Our son just ran and ran in the Gardens each of our three visits there. Loved it tremendously. - Second, on the far side of the Garden is the Andrew (Boy) Charleton pool. This is a public lap pool with a really nice separate toddler pool (and a small infant splash area). It is a modern and beautifully designed facility (with a nice cafe upstairs). No towels for rent - so make sure to bring your own. - Third, Circular Quay is about 100 yards away, which offers buskers - live music, juggling, other cool stuff to enthrall kids - and more importantly... ferries! Riding the ferries could be a half day activity by itself. They of course go to great places for toddlers like Manly and the Sydney Aquarium (hint: buy your aquarium tickets from/at the ferry, which allows you to bypass the tremendously long ticket line at the aquarium itself). Dining options were also toddler compatible. - For breakfast, we opted for the breakfast buffet at the Opera Cafe. There is a hot item station, cold item station (smoked fish, meats, fruit, bircher muesli, etc.), asian options (miso soup, porridge, pickled vegetables, etc.), a pastry station. We ate five breakfasts - tried every option - all pretty nice quality (we lived in NYC-greenwich village for five years... so like to think we know something about food quality). With a toddler, the fact that there are many choices and the food is already prepared helps make for a nice meal for everyone. - For a light dinner/drinks, the Cortile was just right. We could order wine and light bites. Since the Cortile is essentially the atrium/lobby the large volume and space between tables/seating areas makes it toddler/kid friendly. On the menu, our son liked the three mini burgers. - There is of course also room service, which we found pretty solid - but not a tremendously diverse menu. We also ate at a few restaurants near the hotel and at Circular Quay. We found the service people we interacted with pleasant and professional. While this is certainly their job, they seemed actually pretty interested in assisting us and making us comfortable. Upon check out, the bell man suggested we take the hotel car back to the airport instead of a cab for a flat fee less than a cab and in a car more comfortable than a cab. A nice touch to an excellent stay. Our toddler son kept asking throughout the rest of the trip, especially when we got to a new place and checked into another hotel, "Go back to Intercontinental?". That says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great 24 hour layover!”
Reviews.Author: Redpandachicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. The concierge was helpful and the rooms were modern and clean. We had an excellent view from our room. Our stay in this hotel was only during a 24 hours layover but I definitely would have stayed here longer. I wasn't very impressed with the food from room service, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel but inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Motherof3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times now and love the location. It is also definitely worthwhile paying the extra to have the Club lounge access on the top floor - the views are second to none in the world. However, the service really is inconsistent and they really do need to look after frequent travellers a little better. The first time I was staying with a female colleague and they gave us a king-size bed when I had booked two doubles. It appeared that the only room available was of a lower standard than I had paid for, although it had been booked well in advance. There was no compensation of any sort for the lower quality room. The next time I had signed up to their ambassador program and part of the program is a room upgrade - there were no upgraded rooms available so I suggested that a bottle of wine would compensate - they agreed but the wine never appeared. The third time I stayed I had one of the dodgy showers - even mould in a top corner - i notified housekeeping and it was cleaned immediately. However in saying all of that I stay in Sydney regularly and it is still by far my favourite hotel in Sydney and outside of the Sheraton in Bangkok possibly the world - all is forgiven once you get those cocktails and the view at 5pm in the Club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Jo1964London
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - ideally situated very near Circular Quay where the ferries, buses and trains go from. Our room was on the 27th floor with amazing panoramic views of the harbour, the Bridge and the Opera House. Service was impeccable too. Pool and gym both good/fine and the breakfast on the 31st floor was excellent. A great place to base yourself in the centre of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Macau038
Reviews.Content: As expected, the Intercontinental lived up to it's reputation. Located right in the heart of the city very close to the quay, the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge (the Coathanger) the Intercon is an ideal base from which to explore Sydney. Although we only ate breakfast in the hotel the choice of food is what you would expect from the Intercon. As I am a member of PriorityClub our room was upgraded to a Harbour View and the Housekeeping staff were very helpful and generous giving extra water, shampoo, etc without being asked. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone. The price may be a bit above the norm but you get what you pay for is what I found.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: celi36
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat this location (although it is right next door to the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay!) - literally steps from Circular Quay so very convenient for Ferries and Trains to get around. Staff excellent. Very pleasant and helpful. Arrived at 7.30am and got immediate check in. Room was clean and well appointed - although no seperate shower in standard bathroom. On the last night I upgraded to a harbour view club room - room was exactly the same as a standard (apart from the view which was good and some bath salts!) However the club access was very nice - fabulous deck with impressive views - lovely afternoon tea - and evening canapes and cocktails - also sumptuous breakfast. Did have a couple of problems but was impressed with how swiftly they were resolved - ordered dinner and order came incomplete - but when I complained I was given additional dishes. Also there was a noisy function next to my harbour view room and when I complained I was upgraded without fuss to a suite (which had an enormous walk in shower!) Would definately recommend the upgrade to club level as this is clearly the hotel's greatest strength. If I were to pick a weakness it is definately the pool - very small and indoor it felt very claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Hot country, 5* hotel - non existent shower!”
Reviews.Author: seratonin
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m female, 5ft 4ins and have just spend a very inconvenient 6 nights staying at the Sydney Intercontinental in Room 1726 at a cost of Â£275 per night. Some crazy architect/project manager decided to beautifully refurbish the hotel in modern contemporary style, including the bathroom â€“ but only on the left hand side. On the right-hand side the bath is old, the taps are old, the shower water pressure is poor, there is no hand held shower on the taps, and the fixed shower head is 2ft above my head. Itâ€™s impossible to shower without wrecking make-up and hair. In a vain attempt to do so, and to stand any chance of getting the shampoo out of my hair in less than 10 mins, I had to stand on the sides of the bath â€“ perilous and not what you expect to do for that kind of money. My husband also commented that it was impossible to get the soap out of the bits that matter. I complained bitterly to the hotel's duty manager the first night (that's like winkling a crab out of a shell). He said I wasnâ€™t the first - but there was nothing he could do, the rooms being all the same. Even though the reservation was made back in August, we knew we had to change rooms for the 7th night. Imagine my fury when the room we were given (2102) had a lower fixed shower with decent water pressure AND a hand held shower on the taps. We rang Trailfinders there and then to make them aware/suggest they donâ€™t book others into this hotel. The Intercontinental Hotel Group spend millions on a refurbishment, but donâ€™t upgrade the bath/shower/taps in the majority of rooms? Insanity. If it hadnâ€™t been the Christmas week we would have tried to find another hotel and demanded a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Gus1221
Reviews.Content: Booked this night as it was a surprise for my wife and then dinner with some close friends in sydney on a Friday night. So we headed to Sydney after traveling 6 hours Good...Booked this hotel over the phone with the hotel and was impressed by the phone staff who offered free wine and chocolate in the room . Bad .... The chocolates and wine not in the room. (let this slide as I thought it was nice offer but did not bother me that much) Good .... Views and the beds are amazing Bad..Breakfast was cold and as most things had been sitting in the warmers for a while Good...The hotel itself and the bar downstairs Bad... The hotel losing our bags for 4 hours and sending them to the wrong room hence making us 2 hours late for the dinner booking and friends we had planed to meet. Also the front desk staff did try and help find them but when they sent up the wrong bags to the room It srtuck home they had no idea what room they had sent them to. Good... Wine in the room as a sorry for the lost bags Bad.... I emailed the manager to tell her some problems and how uphappy I was at the stay there . Took 2 weeks to answer the 1st email after i had resent it 3 times and as of yet she has not answered the email. I understand they are busy but there comes a point when you draw the line and being ignored.. All in all I was left angry after leaving the hotel after paying so much money I expected more

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Higher In The Popularity Index (currently 18th)”
Reviews.Author: FREQUENTTRIPPERPerth
Reviews.Content: We visit Sydney fairly regularly and have stayed at the Shiangri-La and Quay Grand apartments in the same area. We have also looked at other hotels in the area. Our assessment is that the Intercontinental wins hands down. Our stay was for four nights over Christmas with club lounge access. We were lucky to be allocated a high level corner suite on the Sydney Harbour side with extensive views of the harbour, Opera House and Bridge - what more could I say - just stunning!!! The view from the Club Lounge was even better. The staff were magnificent - polite - helpful and very competent. The only hiccup was the poor table we were initially allocated for the rather expensive Christmas luncheon. However this was rectified although it took a bit of nudging. The quality and quantity of the food deserves a 'best ever' comment (especially the sea food) and the wine (included in the price) flowed freely. Don't be put off by the rather tatty foyer and check- in area when you arrive. This is the weakest area of this magnificent hotel and surpring when the management must recognise that 'first impressions' are the ones that count.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff”
Reviews.Author: kissyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the intercontinental sydney prmarily because of its proiximity to the opera house, bridge and the circular quay region. But also because of previous good experiences at intercontintal hotels in hong kong and tokyo!! It is safe to say that sydney is now on that list of good experiences. The rooms are spacious and functional - lets face it, if you are somewhere like sydney your room is secondary to other activities - and therefore there is nothing at any stage of our three nights at the intercontinental that could be construed as negative!!! the fact that at the time of writing it is almost seven weeks since we stayed there and not one thing springs to mind. the setting is great, the location even better and the hotel is both functional and with air of the extra or luxury about it without being stuffy dependent on background. We were visiting friends and the staff went out of their way to make sure we were staying on the same floor if not next door to each other - which was a nice touch. Defintitely worth staying here if your not in Sydney for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near harbour and CBD”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Was attending meetings near the Ferry pier in Sydney harbour and stayed at the Intercontinental. Excellent location for those wishing to have a view and short walk to the harbour, the Rocks and the CBC. Shopping is close, as are many attractions, park, museum etc. Watch out for the high internet rates ( you have an option to choose on hour or one day...if you choose the one hour and go over, they then charge an additional one day instead of just charging the one day rate. I argued and they did bring down the bill ..but it should not have come to this. The hotel phone call rates (strangely local calls to local sydney cell phones are extremely expensive...3 AUD per minute or so..beware)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mks1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for five nights in September. I was there on a business trip but had several days of personal time before work. The room was good-sized by urban hotel standards and had excellent lighting (maybe the best I have experienced in recent memory). The location was excellent, only a 10 to 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour and just about 5 minutes to Circular Quay. I had an excellent stay and at half the price of the highly-recommended Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “soft bed”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and could never get comfortable with the pillows and bed. very very soft. location is smack in the middle of the finance district so very quiet after office hours. hotel foyer was being renovated when there. staff were friendly. rooms were starting to look a bit dated- especially the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: thkl070
Reviews.Content: I absolutely recommend this hotel. The locations is great, just a few steps from Circular Quay and The Roks. We stayed in a standard room which was very spacious, good interior, great bed, very silent. Don't forget to check out the bar, they serve great champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Litetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IC for one night before heading back to the UK as we wanted some down time before the 24hour flight back. Check in was fine albeit slightly offhand but our harbour view room was available at 11.00 am despite the 3.00 pm advertised time.The room on the 14th floor offered great views of the bridge and the view from the swimming pool was great too. We did not dine in the hotel but chose the restaurants in the wonderful Circular Quay area. The gift shop in the hotel was a great find and surprisingly no more expensive than similar shops in the Circular Quays/Rocks area. Do check it out even if only for the free sample of the Wasabi Macadamia nuts. The youg assistant in there was a delight. The IC gave us what we were looking for....a comfy bed, a great last look of Sydney and most of all the best location in town.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: bk400
Reviews.Content: First, some context: my girlfriend (a Sydney native) and I (a New York native) currently live and work in Hong Kong. We average three to four days per week traveling extensively across Asia for our respective investment firms. We also travel at times in the region for leisure. I provide this context because I want to be fair: the Sydney Intercontinental is an excellent hotel by most standards. However, the service is simply not comparable to other five star hotels (or other hotels at that price point), including others in Sydney (see, for instance, the Park Hyatt, Four Seasons, and especially the Shangri-La, at all of which we have stayed). We just wrapped up a five-night stay as a regular (that is, not a Club International) guest. The problems that we had with the service are summarized as follows: (i) not one offer of help with baggage from the point of getting out of the taxi to getting up to the room, (ii) incorrect directions provided on one occasion, (iii) had to follow up with three separate calls to retrieve clothes sent to the laundry for express pressing, (iv) no room service menu provided in the room (when called for room service, operator first responded by attempting to recite the menu, which we learned later is 10 pages long, not including the wine list), (v) soap not replaced in the shower by housekeeping, (vi) "instant service" call button is less than "instant" (only once was the call button answered within 20 rings), and (vii) empty bottle of wine left by a reveler in the elevator (discovered by the writer at 6:30am on the second night of my stay). While none of these service issues threatened the enjoyment of our stay in Sydney, the staff is clearly not as well trained as one would expect, given the price. I would refer the general manager of the Sydney Intercontinental to any similarly priced hotel in Hong Kong (e.g., Intercontinental, Mandarin Oriental, etc.), and he or she would recognize the service difference even before stepping into the lobby -- and even more so once he or she stays one night. The fact that George W. Bush stayed at the Sydney Intercontinental is less a testament to the service quality of the hotel and more an indictment of the standards to which he must have grown accustomed. To end on a positive note, one major plus for me (perhaps less so for other travelers) is that the gym is one of the more intelligently equipped that I have encountered. Notably, there is a pull up bar, high ceilings, and airy views. Just buyer beware: make sure you understand for what you are paying a premium. In this case, it is not attentive -- or dare I say even -- professional service for a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with just a few minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: wekiwi
Reviews.Content: Was here with group from work for meeting; we'd booked a city view room with the hope we'd be lucky and be upgraded. The harbour view rooms were full sadly. It pays to book these early. The rooms are very nice (view from 14th floor over city was ordinary), bed very comfortable with all mod cons. Only real negatives - one was the size of the bathroom which is poky, I would have expected separate bath and shower given the so called 5 star luxury category. The other was the state of the bathrooms on the lobby level - these were filthy and obviously not cleaned that day at all. Worse than a public toilet! Not really good enough given the so called standard of this property. If you are staying at this hotel I'd highly recommend a visit to Cafe Sydney just down the road at the Customhouse - walking distance from the hotel and it's stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place overall, Rooms average, Great Club floor”
Reviews.Author: Leigh60
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay in Sydney. Booked a Club floor City View room. Room was ok (crappy small bathroom), and view of the city is nothing special. The Club Floor was excellent, except for the selection of wine. My wife and I love great food and wine and the wine was ordinary with only a selection of about 5 wines. The food on the other hand (tasting plates) were sensational!. Freshly prepared tasting plates of a high standard. To the General Manager; if you are reading these reviews, order some better wine and include it on the menu for all Club floor clients. The type of clients that are attracted to the Club floor don't appreciate getting an ordinary wine. You only have to spend a bit more for a quality wine. When I say good wine I don't mean Penfolds Grange. The Club floor is suppose to be a classy place where great food and wine are served and sadly this didn't happen in the wine departrment, (enough about wine). The afternoon tea's were nice with a selection of sandwich's and small desserts, along with tea or coffee and cold drinks (no alcohol). I thought the breakfasts were very good with both a selection of hot and cold. The staff overall in the Club lounge during the 2 days were sensational and very switched on!. My wife and I are very experienced in body language and customer service and noted the professionalism throughout, even though you all looked stressed on the morning of the Melbourne Cup at Breakfast. The staff on check -in (front desk) were very average for a so called '5 star hotel'. No real welcome, just another check-in. To the staff in the Club floors, thanks for a great 2 days and keep up the great work. Just order some good wine. In Sydney we dined at Otto restaurant which was sensational and we had another great coffee at our regular haunt 'Bacio's @ the Queen Victoria Building'. Cheers Leigh

Reviews.Title: “Great location - check in GRRRRRRRH”
Reviews.Author: alwayswanttotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in October 2008 and booked a great deal online which included a Watsons Bay View Room, valet parking and breakfast either in our room (at anytime) or in the Cafe. Valet Parking was easy but as we had arrived early our room was not ready. No problem as we set off to explore the Rocks and rang the hotel just before 3.00pm (checkin time) to ask if the room was ready. We were fobbed off and asked whether we were told that room would not be ready at 3.00pm and if not it would be ready. Of course, after cutting short our look around the Quay we arrived at the Hotel to be told our room was not ready. We sat in reception for 30 minutes with our checkin lady doing everything she could not to look at us. We asked someone else and eventually were checked in at 4pm. We did ask for a late checkout and were given same. When we checked out it there was no smile "hope you enjoyed your stay....... come again" or any pleasantries. Apart from this the room was gorgeous the breakfast enjoyable and price was right. If only you could self checkin!

Reviews.Title: “Location + Hotel = GREAT Choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RDfromDC
Reviews.Content: Steps away from Circular Quay...just at the cusp of the CBD...and just about the perfect choice for an extended stay in Sydney. Of course, I wasn't paying (there for business) but even if I was, I'd still be plenty pleased. Breakfast was included in the rate of approx $225 USD per night, and I've gotta say...that's a pretty damned good deal. Room was excellent (19th floor)...service was as good as you'll ever find in Sydney...workout facilities, lounge, restaurant...all very good to absolutely great. Check out the view from the 32nd floor pool...it's the "money shot" for all of Sydney...the Opera House, the Bridge, cruise ships at the OPT, Luna Park...breathtaking. Cabs always ready in the queue, excellent food and drink, they even have a Bose store in the lobby. If you can get this place for <$250/night including breakfast--then stop searching and start booking!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in cost cutting mode”
Reviews.Author: bripan
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is Ok. Rooms are adequate and clean. Food whilst not inspiring, is adequate. My main problem is with the lowering of standards in any way possible to make a few more dollars out of the property without any concern to how this looks to patrons. A few examples: I have seen better quality toilet paper in public lavitories, shower curtains in five star properties went out in the eighties, cracked and stained tiles in the bathroom. I reserve my loudest critism for the Club lounge. It has the atmosphere of a bus station. A great view did not improve the meagre selection for beakfast (3 hot items being-eggs poached or scrambled depending on the day, mushrooms and bacon) Also the hotel website is misleading. It states that drinks are complimentary all day, not so. We arrived at 10pm and during check in were offered wine, which I thought was comp. When we left the lounge, I was presented with a $22 bill for a very average glass of wine. Not good enough by far. Not a five star property

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: stuiedo
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a great location. We upgraded to the harbour view room, and although a building slightly obstructed the opera house we still had a great view of teh bridge and botanical gardens. Room was great and hotel staff very friendly. It costs a lot but you get what you pay for i suppose....

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view, great rooms, a little hoity-toity”
Reviews.Author: JadieR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IC for 4 nights in June. This hotel is just gorgeous - the room was so comfortable and the view amazing. I LOVE the swimming pool on the upper floor. Really no complaints whatsoever about the rooms, room service, or views. I loved this place. My only issue is that the staff definitely caters to their preferred clientele, which I was clearly not. They let my friends and I know that we could only go to the rooftop bar if it was mostly empty, and we had to go down to reception and ask them to let us upstairs. Now, I know I wasn't staying in the premium rooms, but the exclusivity definitely made me feel like I was part of the riff raff from which the preferred clientele were being protected.

Reviews.Title: “A little quiet but a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: slinky09
Reviews.Content: Just one night in Sydney and hotels choices are somewhat hard. The IC was recommended and I give it a mixed review. On arrival, at a very early time, they accommodated me, big thumbs up. I had booked a room with a view of the Opera House and harbour bridge, on floor 28 and that was great, there can't be that many rooms with this view though because of the several, tall, adjacent buildings. Although on the small side, the room was comfortable and clean with efficient air conditioning. Early evening I went for a drink, the waitress made two mistakes. I wasn't overwhelmed with the meal / dining options and thought about the buffet but it wasn't impressive enough. The location is fine, albeit that on the weekend it was very quiet ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Zammit
Reviews.Content: There is a fantastic deal available at the inter Sydney where you can stay for around $250 including Breakfast (buffet or room service) 5pm check out and Valet parking. Rooms are very nice and recently refurb. Beds are very comfortable and true King size not 2 beds together like so many others! There is a bar doen stairs near recep that is very nice and serves a a good drink menu also while we were guests it was not that busy so you can have some great one on one time. Location is fantastic to most places in the city and a gentle walk to Circ Quay and a couple of streets from George Street.

Reviews.Title: “One of The Best Hotels In Sydney - Immaculate service”
Reviews.Author: BobMacG
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at the Intercontinental about 3 years ago, and instead have been staying at the Amora on my monthly business trips to Sydney. Because of the good deal with parking and breakfast included, I thought I would try the Intercontinental again this week and I am very happy that I did. The reception and restaurant staff have been transformed from the uninterested and fairly lazy attitude of 3 years ago - I was out of my car, booked in an in my room in about 7 minutes, served by staff who looked me in the eye, smiled and were extremely pleasant - just what you need after a 4 hour drive. The room was very comfortable, well equiped and could not fault it. Dinner in the restaurant saw excellent food and service, as was breakfast. On checking out after 2 nights the young man at reception was careful to explain all items on the bill and my car was waiting for me outside. What more can be asked for? The main difference between this hotel and the Amora where I have stayed probably about 30 times now is simply the staff attitude - at the Amora they are efficient but cold and impersonal apart from the concierge and his staff - sometimes at the Amora Reception I think if I turned up disguised as Osama Bin Laden they wouldn't notice as they are perfunctory in their duties and never look you in the eye - so well done to the management at the Intercontinental who are delivering an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: “Bad food, mediocre service - not 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: aantonop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife, while on a business trip Rooms are small, some views are great and the location is very good. But the food and overall service were not up to the standards of a 5 star hotel. We ordered room service on our last night. The appetizers were of average quality, not much better than would be expected at a 3 star hotel restaurant. Both the main courses were inedible. One main course was a risotto with scallops. Pretty much everything was wrong. Bland, dry and sticky rice, rubbery overcooked scallops. The second main course was pork sausages with mashed potatoes. The sausages were so overcooked they were hard, dry and chewy. Both courses should not have even left the kitchen. Any half-decent chef will have quality control and taste the meals or at least inspect them visually before sending them out. I could tell just by looking at them that they were bad, and I'm no pro. Disgraceful. When we complained about this, the room service supervisor apologized profusely and told us they would comp the meal. They refunded about 75% of the price *only* of the main courses, not the whole meal. Not only did we end up paying part of the main courses that were not touched (one bite then returned), but we paid service charges, tray charge, and tax on them too. We ended up paying more than $100 for 2 appetizers. It's a great location, but this hotel does not deserve 5 stars. I've stayed at plenty of 5-star hotels and the quality of service is impeccable. This was poor by comparison even to a three-star.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJB1000
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times and have to say I've always had a great stay. the overall location and ambience of this hotel makes it a really ideal place to stay in Sydney. The only negative I'd say is reception stay can be hit and miss in terms of their attitude but thats a minor point outweighed by the rest of the hotel. Coffee and cake in the great lobby is a really nice experience.Hwoever there are also lots of cafes around circular key and around the hotel/botanical gardens all of which are 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “best executive floor”
Reviews.Author: inked_chef
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable rooms... although bathrooms could be a tad bigger. What makes me choose this hotel over the other hotels in the area is the lounge on the top floor of the hotel. It has a deck that wraps around the whole building that has the view of the Opera house and the harbor bridge. Great place to have breakfast ,cocktails or a night cap. Location wise its close enough to the rocks and about a 10 minute walk to the shopping streets....

Reviews.Title: “What a view.”
Reviews.Author: legendjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent the weekend staying in Sydney at the Intercontinental. This is our first stay at this particular hotel, but it certainlty won't be our last. The view was one of the best we have experienced, the Harbour bridge was so big from our floor to ceiling window and the opera house was only a short distance away. The location is at circular quay so transport by ferry, bus, train is only 100 metres away. The rooms and pillows are luxurious and well worth the money. We also experienced the restaurant and it was satisfactory, although with so many fine restaurants nearby it would pay to explore other places nearby. We found many places nearby (400Metres) to the Rocks area.

Reviews.Title: “"Late checkout a genuine bonus"”
Reviews.Author: Keitel
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed and took the package which included breakfast ,valet parking which had cost us $40 at a nearby establishment of the same class. But (psst), the thing that really attracted us to the IC was the 5:00pm check out. This gave us the next day to have a civilised breakfast, do some shopping and grab a ferry to Manly. Then back for lunch and walk through the Botanical Gardens in the afternoon. We saw it as a second day on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, big and quite busy, but all good!”
Reviews.Author: Becandjamie
Reviews.Content: Booked on Wotif and got package with late checkout, valet parking, king room and breakfast included. Good deal. Checkin was good, room service was good. Bed was very comfy and view over city was nice. Great location. Valet parking were quick to bring back the car even though they seemed very busy. Staff we dealt with were all excellent. Breakfast was delivered to room hot and at the time we requested. No problems at all. We had a lovely night here after wandering the Rocks and the Quay for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Seacliff1
Reviews.Content: InterContinental Sydney is a very good business hotel conveniently located a few blocks from the ferry terminal and train station at Circular Quay. Easy access to ferries to Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbor which is home to the Aquarium, Maritime museum and numerous shops and restaurants. Hotel pool is small, but provides nice views of the harbor. Exercise room is above average with a nice collection of cardio equipment. Staff was professional and graciously permitted early check-in to me and my associates at 8am which was greatly appreciated after flying 14 hours from the states.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: helenm2331
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 21st Wedding anniversary on 23rd and 24th May. We have been to the Cafe Opera Restaurant many times for Sunday lunch and as they had a great deal for breakfast, late 5pm check out and valet parking we grabbed it. We were given a room on the 21st floor looking over the Botanical Gardens, we wanted a smoking room and the whole floor was smoking which was great. A complimentaty bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary was a fabulous touch and arrived in an ice bucket 10 minutes after we arrived. The room was clean, modern and the hotel is just very special. From check in to check out it was professional and efficient and so close to Circular Quay and the museums, art galleries, shopping and the botanic gardens! We would definitely stay here again, a nice part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect time at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: FrequentGuest57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Intercontinental Sydney for one night as a special treat on a weekend. We used TripAdvisor to make the choice of where to stay - and I am so glad that we 'listened' to everyone and booked the Intercontinental. We booked a deal which included breakfast, valet parking and late checkout, which was terrific value. The staff were absolutely amazing - everyone from the receptionist, to the porters, to the cleaners made a point of being kind, and asking us how our stay was going. We had a room with a view of Watsons Bay - and it was worth spending a little bit extra to get it. The breakfast was delicious, and the bed so comfortable. The plasma tv was also nice, with a good selection of channels to watch. I would definitely stay there again, and it is the nicest hotel that I have stayed in, in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “A great del for an amzing hotel”
Reviews.Author: G-HMitchell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before flying out to Tasmania. This is a very central hotel, with amazing views over the botanic gardens. Very upmarket style, disappointed we couldn't stay another night. Staff were lovely & helpful. Entertainment e.g. was aldy jazz/blues singer, or a piano player, super to listen to in the background whilst having a drink, so relaxing. The original building is on the ground floor, obvioulsy then the tower hotel built on top but the old & new go weel together. Room very spacious & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special otherwise”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March. We arrived early in the morning after a flight from Singapore and were pleasantly surprised to be able to check in. Our room was on the 17th floor with a great view of the harbour bridge, we had booked this and paid extra for the view. Apart from the view the room was a standard 4 star room. Some of the fixtures and decor looked a little tired and the bathroom was rather small and old fashioned compared to others I've seen in similar kinds of places. Overall a comfortable room but if it hadn't have been for the view, it would have been nothing special at all. We ate breakfast at the hotel on a couple of occasions. There was a good selection of hot and cold options but at $38 per person it was an expensive option unless you were very hungry. On other mornings we grabbed something smaller at the local starbucks and there were plenty of other more reasonably priced options in the area. The location of the hotel is by far it's biggest asset. It's right next door to the stunning botanical gardens and a 2 minute walk from Circular Quay. Given that we were in Sydney for the first time we didn't eat at the hotel in the evening, there are so many other places to try that this was unnecessary. We did have a cocktail in the bar one evening which was nice. The bar itself shut at 11.30 which we found unusual in a hotel of this nature in a city location. Overall we enjoyed our stay but whether we would come back is uncertain. I feel for what we paid we might have found something with more of a 'wow' factor which is what you expect from a hotel with a 5 star rating. Without the great view from this room this would have been an entirely average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms--but don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: mgizmo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with beautifully decorated rooms. Location is great--right near Circular Quay and the Rocks area. Food was very over-priced--recommend going elsewhere to eat. We stayed during a busy weekend and the hotel refused to honor my Platinum rewards card. There are a few shops in the hotel, including a Bose store. The shops themselves were very reasonably priced for tourist type goods--better than most other stores.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Travelx2
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is probably more of a business hotel, but you cannot beat the location! Book a room with a view (we were in 1826), because when you marry the view with the location, the beds, and the bathroom, this is an incredible hotel. We found check-in/check-out to be very easy and the staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Evening turn-down service (oddly we seemed to always be in when they came by) was very pleasant with chocolates and bottles of water. Pool is OK, as is the gym - but if you are touring around, you'll get plenty of exercise. The hotel is perfectly located for access to the Circular Quay - and you can get anywhere from here. The bathroom was a decent size, with nice toiletries and a roomy shower - plus a cute little glass window so you could look out to the view as you brushed your teeth! The room was pretty spacious and the window seat was excellent. The best part had to be the bed - it was sumptuous. Coupled with the black-out blinds, you couldn't help but get a great night's sleep! For our holiday, it is all about the room and the Intercontinental did not disappoint us!.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: fluffmypillow
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel in one of the top hotel locations worldwide. Wonderful staff, nice ambiance. Loved the bed and linen. The club lounge is definately one of the best I have been in...if not THE best. The magic botanical gardens are outside the door, as is the Opera House. While an InterCon, it has a boutique feel. The rooms are familiar as they follow the formula, but it manages to be intimate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Mango53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for one night and would recommend it. PROS Good location - short stroll to Circular Quay Clean modern furnishings Spacious rooms CONS Slow valet Bathrooms not as well kept as rooms No balcony I would not hesitate to stay here again however to take advantage of the views would try one of the hotels directly in Circular Quay e.g. Grand Quay, Holiday Inn. I did prefer this hotel over the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Where did the 5 Stars come from?”
Reviews.Author: walaha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Intercontinental during a business trip for more than a week. Typical business hotel with very litlle offering for family travel or similar. Best feature is definitely the location, right next to the beautiful botanical garden and close to the ferry pier. The check in was smooth and efficient and amazingly my room was ready although it was only 11am. The room overalls are very small, the bathroom even smaller. Housekeeping did an excellent job and the room was spotless and they went to great lenght everyday to tidy up the place. The gym on the top floor has an excellent view and not much more. Unfortunately during my stay the pool was closed for renovation so cannot comment on that. The lobby cafe shop is a good place for a drink at any time of the day, with a nice old fashioned touch to it and the staff was extremely friendly and courtouse. However, charging 5 Dollar for a simple croissant is close to dailight robbery. The breakfast in the restaurant was ok, but nothing really to write home about. Very dissapointing that after my business partner and myself stayed there each more than a week, they only granted late check out for like 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Club superb”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacher40
Reviews.Content: Stopped off in Sydney for 7 nights after 4 weeks in New Zealand. Researched several hotels but kept coming back to the Intercontinental. Booked a Club Watson's Bay view room and we were not disappointed in any way. 9pm check in smooth and effortless. Room spacious, quiet and comfortable. Breakfasts on top floor Club lounge offered a good selection to suit all tastes. My only criticism was that some mornings the bacon was thin and overcooked. Complimentary newspapers and free internet access made for a leisurely start to our day.
