Tea and sandwiches were available from 2.00pm and now the best bit - from 5.00pm till 7.00pm complimentary drinks and a chef's tasting plate were served. This was the highlight of the Club option as well as the views from the top floor lounge and open air deck. The Club staff were friendly and helpful in every way and because we were staying for 7 nights they got to know us and took an interest in our day and plans for tomorrow in a discrete and professional manner. They suggested an all day ferry ticket with trips to Watson's bay first then Manly for lunch and a good walk and the evening ferry to Darling Harbour for Dinner (after the complimentary drinks of course) . The lounge manager gave good advice on a day trip to the Blue Mountains and where to have lunch and she was genuinely delighted when we took her advice to the letter. Other highlights included the Botanic Gardens opposite the hotel with the legend beside the Wattle (or Acacia tree) including the quote from Monty Python " This here's the Wattle, the symbol of our land ,etc etc " Check out was arranged by the club lounge manager with our suitcases collected from our room while we had afternoon tea on the club deck. Most impressed by the hotel and so glad we opted for the club option as part of our retirement treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our return to Sydney and enjoyed the location, great views of the harbour from the club lounge. Easy to walk to the gardens and opera house. On arrival at hotel we explained we were in a club room and basically left on our own to go to the club floor , however without being checked in you can not get into the club lounge for check in. So hotel needs to take guest's to the club lounge if going to do seperate club check in. Room standard was what you would expect of a 5 Star hotel. As the trip was a special occasion hotel had placed a bottle of sparking wine in the room for us. A nice touch! Standard of breakfast in club lounge was very good and free internet access is available. It was such a shame the hotel pool was closed for repairs as the views of the harbour while swimming would have been fantastic. Also to advertise local pools that were available for guest to use and then tell them how much it would cost is not what I would have expected. Do feel the hotel should have paid cost as guest chose this hotel for it facilities. There is very little difference between this hotel and the Shangri La do feel both are mainly aimed at the business man and not the tourist. Both very large hotels so do not really get any personal service you are just a number.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding view, but falls short overall”
Reviews.Author: reptar20c
Reviews.Content: First off: the view from a harbour-facing room is sensational. But as a 5-star hotel it falls a little short of expectations. The front desk was alternately crowded with guests or deserted of staff, and it took a couple of attempts to retrieve my bags from the cloakroom. Similarly, the signposted internet access in the business centre was not working, and I gave up trying to find a staff member to help (the service centre desk was unattended). The room was excellent, however, and exactly as you would expect from the brand. The view and location is hard to beat, but I was left with the impression that they're in the business of churning through corporate bookings and conference attendees, and wouldn't recommend the hotel for a vacation or weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: JRush0519
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip that we extended to include several days of play. The hotel was absolutely stunning and the location was perfect. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a wonderful view of the harbor, the bridge, the opera house and the gardens. The staff was eager to do anything they could to help. The location was ideal because we enjoyed several days of just walking out of the hotel and walking the city. It was close to everything for the city and easy to get transportation to things further away. Expensive hotel, expensive room service but for a wonderful stay in a historic, beautiful location, the Intercontinental is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views”
Reviews.Author: robinto
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and views. From our corner room we could see Observatory Hill, Bridge, Botanic Gardens and up the harbour to the heads. Shame about the big building blocking the view to the Opera House. Room was excellent without being stunning... Service was ok although front desk seemed a little unsure of themselves at times when asked fairly simple questions. eg. Asking for a razor that was eventually able to be supplied. I would stay here again if looking for a nice hotel downtown in the city.

Reviews.Title: “very convinience place and close to opera house”
Reviews.Author: MITAJakarta
Reviews.Content: i stayed there on my first trip to Australia. the hotel not to huge but very comfy. i shud say that since its very close to the circular quay , the center place that u can have breakfast , lunch and dineraround areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cortleigh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, opposite the botanic gardens and just 5 minutes walk from the harbour. Well-equipped stylish room and bathroom. We didn't eat in the hotel but can recommend the cafe outside the Museum of Sydney just across the road for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel, however more for business than tourists”
Reviews.Author: kellyectf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during November, 2007 for 5 days, 4 nights. Research on the web when it comes to booking the right hotel really does no justice - it's not until when you finally arrive in Sydney that you realize what part of town you should have stayed in and what hotel you should have really booked. We decided to book a hotel near the Syndey Harbour Bridge and The Sydney Opera because those were the main attractions that we wanted to visit, however this was a costly decision. When trying to book the right hotel, they were all booked (2 months in advance). We originally tried to book the Sydney Harbour Marriott but they were all booked (the property is beautiful but pricey) so we decided to go for the next big thing in name - The Intercontinental Hotel, the reviews were pretty good at Trip Advisor so we figured, hey at least we wont be staying in a dump or worried that we chose a crappy hotel. The property is literally in the business district of Sydney (lots of business people inside the hotel), however, you can walk (about 5-6 long block walk to the Sydney Harbour). That is the environment all day and night long at this hotel and it's surroundings, seems to be a lot of companies nearby. This was not a good thing at night to eat, as we had to cab it to the Darling Harbour or walk to the actual Sydney Harbour for real sightseeing and eating. The hotel was great, however it is overpriced for tourists because it mainly attracts business people. I paid $1380 US dollars for 4 days/3 nights just for the room. There was complementary breakfast and it was good. Your normal buffet style breakfast. The hotel is beautiful and upscale - but again, it's not meant for tourist although it's near a tourist location. If i had to go back to Sydney again - i would stay at the Darling Harbour, it was more of a younger happening environment, more hotels, more deals, definitely the happening side of town. Us not knowing booked the Sydney Harbour side thinking that was the happening place to be - well guys, its really not, yes it full and packed with tourists because you can do your harbour cruises there, the Opera House and the Sydney Bridge, however, you can just cab it there for 1 or 2 days from the Darling Harbour. But that is my personal preference. Also, we were able to see some cool hotels which were not advertised as popularly or not known as much - for example if you are staying in the Sydney/Opera House area, i would recommend checking out the The Sebel Pier One Sydney or the Quay Grand Suites - i would definitely stay and book in one of these if i were to go back to Sydney. These hotels are in the middle of the action, and people just dont know abou them and you'll be saving half of the money. If you are staying in the Darling Harbour area (which i would stay in if i were to go back) i would stay at the Grand Mercure Darling Harbour. We walked by these hotels and we were thinking, if we only knew about these awesome properties!! We would have saved half of the money and more on tours!! Overall the Intercontinental is a gorgeous hotel, no complaints at all, it's definitely luxury, but again you are paying to stay in a business class hotel - i would definitely check out the other hotels we saw while in Sydney and stay in the middle of the action and more of a tourist feel vs. staying in a business environment hotel. I would definitely go back to this hotel if they were to offer me more of a deal, its just very expensive to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile but convenient”
Reviews.Author: hawaiichick
Reviews.Content: This is much better suited to business travel than leisure. The price is simply not worth it unless you need the convenience of being where other activities are scheduled. I'd spend a little bit more and stay at the Shangri-Law next time. The location is very convenient for tourist attractions but does not have the view the harborfront ones do, unless you get one of the better rooms, which were all booked in blocks according to the hotel reservations. I had a room that looked directly into the office building next door, and my daughter's room was just as bad, while my son had a nice view of historic buildings. The front desk said they were too full to move us. Beware that "city view" covers a multitude of sins. The rooms were decent size, decent decor, nothing special. Nothing in the way of extra effort. The concierge desk was in a whir, and only gave us perfunctory recommendations. The lobby drink prices were set for expense accounts (even taking into account that the city is expensive in general. In general, this hotel is rather sterile and better for rushing in & out and getting things done than being on vacation. For work, I'd recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Nessie77
Reviews.Content: Well my main gripe with this hotel was the concierge service. We booked a babysitter through them so we could leave our 7 month old son to go to an Xmas party. We live in Sydney but were staying in the hotel for the night so we could be closer to the baby if he needed us. We were told service was going to be $85 but when we arrived we were told, without apology, that it would be $145 instead, and they didn't know why they hadn't contacted us to notify us of the change. Needless to say I was not impressed and didn't want to avail of the service so stayed in that night. Hotel room was comfortable, great set up for a business hotel with nice desk area in the bedroom. Bathroom was pretty basic for a 5 star and nothing too luxurious in there. Pool area is pretty small but views are great. It could have been kept cleaner and mopped up a bit. Room service was diabolical, and pretty expensive, a glass of wine was $9. Don't go near the mini bar, we had the only available bottle of water - at $9.50!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gags
Reviews.Content: Sorry to disagree with other reviews on this hotel, but my experience was totally the opposite! Firstly: Priority Club Membership â€˜Benefitsâ€™: Upon check in, my platinum status and the fact it was the first stop on our honeymoon, was not recognised at all. (Incidentally why does nobody ever seem to man the Priority Club check in areas?) Thankfully we checked in early around 11AM, but when I asked what benefits I could hope to expect during my stay I received the abrupt reply that the hotel was full and there would be no upgrades available. When I asked about access to the club lounge a ludicrous figure of AUD400 per night was quoted and that it was a private club during most of the day? This did not make sense as I have used hotel lounges around the world with no such problems. As it was a 3 night stay, I asked if there would be any change the following nights and I was advised to ask again. When I subsequently asked about platinum benefits on the second night, I received the same answer as the first night that the hotel was full. This is the most irritating point is that I believe we were lied to about the later 2 nights as I had previously checked availability for these nights, outside of the hotel and discovered that the full range of rooms to be available. Of course I pointed out I had just checked this but received the same incorrect answer. Needless we were not impressed by the level of service we received from an Intercontinental Hotel. As I am also a Hilton gold card member it was a tough decision between the Sydney Hilton and Intercontinental hotels. We decided on this hotel for the supposed great views. We wonâ€™t make the same mistake twice! The Hotel Itself: This seems to be a very cold business hotel. As mentioned before, there was a conference on and the hotel had no atmosphere. The lobby area is small and not very inspiring and the cortile lounge bar was closed and boarded up due to construction works. The â€œcity viewâ€� room was OK, but lacked any wow factor. We were on the 17th floor with indeed a view of the city block next to the hotel. The room had been recently redecorated, but seemingly not the bathroom which did not have a separate bath and shower, just the usual over bath shower. There was also a strange window between the bedroom and the bathroom â€“ we thought you could maybe watch TV from the toilet?! The room was pleasant and clean enough, but for the price you are paying you expect a bit more! Yes, all rooms have the window ledge seat which appears to be a main selling point? Also, as far as I could ascertain all of the different â€œviewâ€� rooms are the same size, just with the different views. There was no phone book to be seen in the room (maybe I missed it somewhere) and only a pencil, not a pen, in a supposed five star hotel room? It must be cutbacks? The cord for the iron was frayed and looked dangerous â€“ we pointed this out on check out and hope they would have changed it by now. The room really needs the 2 doors with a small hallway to cut out the inevitable door banging which always goes on in hotels. The Fitness Centre: Very small indoor (why in Sydney??) swimming pool. If you had more than 4 swimmers it was full. Pool was approx 10 metres in length. For some reason the female changing was poolside and the male changing outside of the pool room, near the gym. In the changing rooms, the sauna was good, but no steam room. Gym was small with the usual selection of machines. Location: Very good location for Circular quay, Opera House and botanical gardens. If you want the main tourist areas, stick to Darling Harbour. Overall this hotel is no better than a Holiday Inn, and for the price you pay â€“ AUD277 or GBP122 per night as a base price â€“ very expensive indeed. Unfortunately we did not get the opportunity to check out the club lounge. There again if a certain Mr George Bush also stayed here in September then it cannot be too bad can it????

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: renbabe
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to two nights at the Intercontinental before a long journey home! We found the hotel to be excellent. We arrived very early and all efforts were made to have a room ready for us within about 45 minutes of arrival which was a good reason to have an lovely coffee in the cortile. The room was spotless and lovely. The ensuite bathroom also very lovely with elemis products. The views from our room on the 23rd floor were of the harbour and botanical gardens. The views from the pool on the 31st floor are excellent! Breakfast in the cafe opera was good with a large variety of food available, from cooked English, to continental, to smoked salmonm and all manner of other options. The hotel is well located and a stones throw to Sydney's circular quay, the rocks and the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “From the Best to the Worst IC Hotels”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel. Stayed here for 5 nights. The worst experience I have ever had with IC hotel. Three hours after check in time and after 5 calls later, finally the manager himself brought a complimentary basket of fruit and two bottle of waters. This service should not have been asked repeatedly for Ambassador members upon check in. The Concierge (Zafar) was very rude. He was on a personal phone call and did not want to finish his call so he gave me only 1 small brochure (like a pamphlet) for the city tour. I had to ask for more brochure to go to other places (the brochures are all in the cabinet/closet behind his station). He told me to just read them and did not suggest which tour I should take. Then, he went back to continue with his phone call. I went back to the lobby and spoke with his manager (David) who did not handle this matter professionally. I refused to speak with this rude concierge therefore, David (the manager who is not familiar with any tour offered) had to ask the concierge and then related the message to me. He tried not to laugh at first because for some "ODD" reason he found it amusing to explain what the concierge had told him to me. Very unprofessional. Had buffet breakfast, there were not many selection (I gave a 1 in a scale of 1 to 5 compares to a buffet breakfast in Langham Melbourne hotel, we stayed there for 5 nights prior to ths hotel) to begin with but the service was no service at all. Dirty plates were left piling up in our table. We finally had to move them to a table that had piles of dirty plates too (the customers had left). Very unacceptable for a hotel that claims to be a 5 star hotel. The business center has only 1 computer to use if you need to go online and does not bring your lap top. The hotel charges AS$18 per hour. What a joke! Good thing it was Saturday night when I had to use a computer therefore, I did not need to wait to use the computer. Next, I asked another rude concierge (I did not get his name) who misinformed me about catching my flight home. I have a connecting domestic flight in Brisbane and was not sure whether I should go to international or domestic terminal at the airport. He told me that I should have gone directly to the international terminal. Relying on his words (did not doubt of his knowledge which is none), we asked to be dropped off at the international terminal. Of course! he was wrong, we had to take either a shuttle but that comes every 20 minutes to domestic terminal or a taxi. We chose a taxi of course!. Costs us another AS$20 from international to domestic terminal which is about 2 miles a part and very bad traffic. Thanks for hiring this incompetent concierge who should not be giving any advice to any guests. What a shame!. Overall, it was a very unpleasant experience down to the very last day when the reception tried to give me a weekday rate for my Sunday night stay. I was so glad I brought my confirmation from home so I could show her that she overcharged me by AS$60 for the last night of my stay. Horrible experience!!. No doubt that I will most definitely look for other hotels next time if I come to Sydney again. Marriott Sydney Harbor and Four Seasons have equally good location. Hopefully with a much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star - Absolutely”
Reviews.Author: nalagirl
Reviews.Content: Hi, we recently spent an evening in Sydney before travelling back home to Tasmania. After deliberating over many different hotels, in different locations, we decided to stay at the Hotel Intercontinental, Macquarie Street Sydney. We stayed in a harbour view suite, which was just gorgeous!! Brilliant views of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, it was raining, which was a shame. We opted to take out the Club Harbour View Suite, which gives access to the Club Lounge on the 31st floor. This would definitely be worth taking, if you could make use of the time from 5pm-7pm, where wine, beer and spirits were served free of charge along with canapÃ©s. We however, were unable to arrive until 7pm so we missed out on this, the wine after that is quite expensive at $15per glass - that's the cheapest one!! Refreshments are free, however all day - soft drink, tea, coffee. The lounge itself is gorgeous, looking over the harbour from the 31st floor, sinking into one of their lounges. There is also access outside to the balcony, which also have chairs and tables. We did make up for missing out on the free alcohol, with breakfast the next day, This is also complimentary once you have access to the Club lounge. We were expecting something quite small - continental. We were wrong!! Much to our delight, it was a full buffet, we even requested fried eggs instead of the scrambled and it was done without a problem or any extra. So the breakfast was amazing, all the favourites - juice, cereals, toast, bacon, eggs, mushrooms, yoghurt, fresh fruit, pastries - heaps. Coffee and tea was available, or request your favourite - espresso, cappuccino, hot chocolate, the list goes on, again this is all inclusive with your access to the lounge. The room was gorgeous, very large, with a day bed in the master bedroom, which you could sit and watch the world go by. The bathroom was lovely, clean, big fluffy towels, fluffy bathrobes, huge shower and deep bath. Wonderfully clean, with gorgeous flower arrangement in the bathroom. They thought of the little things as well, such as the candle and matches in the drawer, all those little things just make the difference. The bed was huge, king size plus!! Very comfortable, so were the pillows, best nights sleep I'd had in ages. The one thing we loved, was that the room had an extra blind on the windows, as well as the heavy curtains, so it was pitch black in our room at 9am - great sleep in!! We heard nothing, being so close to circular quay we expected to hear trains or sirens, but nothing at all. My only problem was.....leaving, could have spent a few days at the Intercontinental, was a truly wonderful 5* Hotel in every sense of the word. If you plan to stay and take advantage of the club lounge, be there at 5pm, you won't regret it. Will definitely be our first choice and we'll be there at 5pm next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Not quite we had expected...”
Reviews.Author: AJSLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights for our wedding at the Intercontinental. Having done a lot of research on hotels in Sydney we decided that this looked the best of the luxury hotels. Sadly, we had quite a mixed experience there, and I do not feel that the price paid for the room reflects the experience we had. On the positive side, the room was nice, the breakfasts were very good and the staff we dealt with throughout were friendly and professional. And a very nice bottle of bubbly and rose petals on our wedding night. On the negative side, on arrival in the room I found an envelope / receipt addressed to another guest, a guest survey filled in by the previous guest (interestingly, also unhappy too) and toilet paper in the lavatory. To be fair to the staff, I reported this and received a nice apology letter and bottle of bubbly. Once we got to the room on the Thursday night at about 11.30pm it was like entering a nightclub, with terribly loud music from somewhere. Again, I had to contact the duty manager to report the problem, and it was resolved by about midnight but not quite what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Lastly, I left the flat on the Friday morning and my other half went there to get ready for the wedding (hair and make-up and so on). As such, I requested with the front desk on the Thursday night that the room be made-up at 9.15 so it was nice and presentable for the bridal party, and was told that this would occur. However nothing had been done for their arrival. I'm not quite sure really how to sum up our experience, but we had realistically high expectations which sadly the experience fell well short of. Normally these types of issues would not bother me, but as it was our wedding we were hoping for (and paying for) perfection, which we did not get.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Johnrgn
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic room right the Centre of Sydney and 5 minutes walk from the Opera House and Circular Quay. We booked the room using Priority Club points and as we hold Ambassor status we were allocated a corner room with an amazing picture window giving brilliant views to the harbour and the city. The room was extremely large and very nicely decorated and furnished. The hotel staff and concierge were extremely polite and helpful during our stay. The couldn't do more to assist us with the return of our hire car when the Sydney Marathon prevented us from returning this ourselves. The airconditioning was quiet and we did not hear noise from either the corridors or other rooms. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JOP-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at the Intercontinental and enjoyed our stay. We have stayed here on 3 previous occasions and have always been pleased with the service and location of the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and well serviced. We had a club room with a great view of the harbour area and always enjoy the added benefits of the club floor lounge. Also the best view in town from the 31st floor. We found the breakfast offered more than adequate as well as the snacks etc. offered throughout the day, however we were a little disappointed with evening canapes etc. as we remember having more variety during the previous visit 3 years ago. Have to say that the lounge staff were excellent overall in accommodating their guests. Always a good choice in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, fantastic location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MBon
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel Continental for our Honeymoon and were upgraded to a Club Harbour View Room. This gave us access to the 31st floor of the hotel - which is the club lounge - breakfast and non alcoholic drinks throughout the day were complimentary as part of the club package. The view was spectacular overlooking the harbour bridge and the opera house. The service was outstanding and we could not fault the hotel in any way. The location was in the CBD close to the bus station and the ferries - very central to amenities. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_Traveler3
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. Convenient to Circular Quay and many attractions. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is very nice, with many international selections. I had a nice view of the Harbour Bridge, even though I didn't pay extra to book a room with the view. I loved everything about this hotel. The furnishings were exquisite and the bed was very comfortable. The pool closed early, which was kind of disappointing, but it certainly would not deter me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: JeremySG
Reviews.Content: Smart hotel in a great central location. Friendly staff as always in Australia. Very comfortable rooms. Not cheap, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in different hotels in Sydney on our trips to Australia and this would have to be one of the best for location & convenience to Circular Quay and an outstanding high quality hotel. ARRIVAL We arrived by taxi from the international terminal. When we left the hotel we took the short walk to Circular Quay station and took the train back to the airport on departure. It is very convenient to use the train to commute to/from the airport to this station. It only took about 15 minutes. RECEPTION/BOOKING Check in was at 1500 and check out at 1100. We were attended to efficiently by the friendly staff member at reception who gave us an overview of the area and hotel. We had booked direct with this hotel and on arrival only professionalism and prompt service were experienced. It is nice to experience this on check in as it helps form the first impressions. ROOM We stayed on the executive club level in a room full of luxury, comfort and high standard amenities. There was a king bed, sitting area and it was a large room with a very big window to enjoy the views of Sydney. Bathrobes and slippers provided. Tea/coffee making facilities and a good range of items in the mini bar. Iron board and Iron as well as a good size closet. There was an excellent selection for satellite TV channels. The bathroom is an amazing feature of the room. It has bi-fold mirror that slides open from the inside to open to the bedroom area or kept close for privacy. The bathroom was huge. The shower had three options, stand under rain shower, hand held massage option nozzle or on the other side of the double shower a marble bench to sit on under another nozzle. The advantage of taking this room type were the premium services offered. The turndown service and complimentary newspaper are standard for all guests but it is the executive club lounge that is the attraction. The views of the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the harbour are amazing. The buffet breakfast was complimentary, and we took a table by the windows looking out to the wonderful views of Sydney. In the afternoon there were complimentary non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks for the cocktail hour, dinner snacks and drinks throughout the day. The swipe card was needed to access the lounge and there were stairs and also an elevator to reach the lounge level. FACILITIES There was a 24 hour gym, indoor pool, business centre and beauty salon. Room service operates 24 hours and three restaurants are available to choose from. However just outside the hotel in the immediate area are many dining and bar options in the Circular Quay area. The club lounge was worth paying the additional monies to enjoy the experience and features. The views from this lounge are amazing and there is an outside deck area, wonderful for photos or to sit and watch the beautiful views of Sydney. AREA The train station Circular Quay was 5 minutes away. There are ticket machines as well as a booth to make the purchases where credit cards can be used. Ferries can be taken from Circular Quay easily round to the Darling Harbour area (easiest way to arrive), Taronga Zoo or Manly for example. Just a few stops on the train to Town Hall, is the place to start exploring shops. From here are the underground shops through to Pitt Street Mall. The Rocks, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House were only a short walk away. The Intercontinental has fantastic views, location and rooms for a Sydney Circular Quay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MilenaPop
Reviews.Content: Where to begin and where to end... Location amazing Service was super pro and friendly. Food and prices were just to good for the value. The only thing i dint like a lot is that you have to pay for the internet! But that happens to other hotels as well. I think its time good hotels that you pay so much have to have wireless for free... We all know it cost nothing for them! Anyways I loved this place and I will go again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a little overpriced, georgous old building”
Reviews.Author: kazlac
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, room was lovely, a little overpriced but service was very good, found restaurants to be quite expensive, great place to stay if you are going to the Opera House/Rocks or Circular Quay, lovely old building

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ess1
Reviews.Content: This is truly a five-star hotel - no pretences here! The room I stayed in was spacious with an impeccable interior. I had room service breakfast every morning, which was exceptional. The location is great - a short stroll to the train and bus stations as well as the ferry stops - enabling you to get just about anywhere you want to in Sydney. The hotel restaurants were great and the service was exceptional. Service throughout the hotel was great, with the one exception of front reception, where the staff were not helpful in any way. However, everything else is above par and I only wish I had time to get to the gym and the pool which looked great...will do this next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Teevskis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney for 3 nights during our honeymoon in May 2005. The room itself was well appointed, and the bathroom was quite nice. I was surprised at the bigger-than-average room size. My only quibbles were with the room location (considering we were on our honeymoon, we got a room barely with a view) and the overall snootiness of the staff. We are a generally down-to-earth couple, and prefer staff that are more like us. Considering the number of choices in Sydney, we probably won't stay there again, but it is a reasonable pick for anyone unfamiliar with Sydney and doesn't want to take chances.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: davidrohome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterCon Sydney after flying in from LAX. It was a very nice hotel and worth the money after the long 13 hour flight. We almost took the train from the Airport, then realized, with all our luggage for two weeks in country, that was crazy. Took a cab instead and it was only around 30AU$. Even though we got there at 10am they had a room ready for us - what a delight! It was clean, well appointed, and the most confortable king size bed we had for our entire trip. The "view" was of the Botanic Gardens, which was okay, but its proximity to the Circulary Quay and the Ferrys made it ideal. We used the Concierge a number of times and they were always very helpful with directions, reservations, etc. It was quiet and even included turn down service, which is nice. Connecting to the Internet in the room was very expensive (25AU$), so we never connected there. We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment on that, either. All in all, very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Shoot the designer!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin3835
Reviews.Content: Ok, so, as it's an IC Hotel, you already have an expectation of what it should be like. Having just spent the previous 3 nights at the IC Grand Stanford in Hong Kong i'd become accustomed to something special.......and first impressions are important. This was the first 3 night stay (13-16 Feb) of our trip to Sydney....these being the first 3 nights, the next stay being the last 3 nights (22-24 Feb). The location when we arrived by taxi from the airport was just superb. 100 metres or so from Circular Quay and directly across the road from the fabulous Botanical Gardens. Our bags are collected on arrival swiftly and efficently so we headed for reception. I thought we'd just use the first one you get to when you arrive by car, which appeared to be the back door entrance instead of the main hotel reception........only to find that this WAS the main reception! Quite cold and unappealing is an understatement! We arrived at 9am so we werent expecting to be able to get into the room, but it was made available to us immediately, which was great after the overnight flight. I'd booked using my priority Club points and had been in communication with the hotel prior trying to secure good upgrades etc for my partners 40th birthday. i'd been upgraded to a Watson Bay room on the 14th floor, but not to Club as i'd hoped (It was full - Norwegian Prime Minister i think!). So, tired and ready for an early morning sleep we got to the room and opened the door. To say the first impression was that of a motel room would accurately describe how i felt. Dodgy striped carpet, formica furnishings from 1974, brown decor/bedding accessories, brown chais long and a bathroom that looked slightly out of date. If i wasnt so tired i'd have gone straight down and blown a fuse! Instead, sleep got the better of me so after a couple of hours of sleep and a shower i decided to head down and ask for a room that had recently been refurbished. "All the rooms were refurbished 2/3 years ago sir" was what i was told, "based on a contemporary style by a European designer". Surely not....no....it cant be......Lawrence Llewellyn Bowen hadnt got here before me had he?! Well not quite, but he could easily have done so. Lets just say, it takes a bit of getting used to.....and i recommend you always stay here first BEFORE going anywhere else....that way, the next place is always fantastic on first impression! On a plus note, when we got back in the evening there was a nice bottle of fizz chilling in ice and box of chocolates with a 'Happy Birthday' card on the table. A really nice touch. Staff were generally pleasant though a little off hand. A couple of the consierge team were very helpful (and also agreed with me on the design of the rooms ha ha). Room staff were very courteous and pleasant, and i had no problems with staff not taking note of the DND signs. Our second stay was also in a Watsons Bay Room on the 24th floor. Again, a nice touch with a full friut basket, and i mean FULL, and a nice bottle of wine. The view is fantastic, and possibly after a while, better than the Harbour View.....you get to see all the way from the Opera House to Manly and the whole of the Botanical Gardens in these rooms. If you can, ensure its a full Watson Bay Room view......those at the side of the hotle are only corner window views. Room Service is ok but you may have to ask a couple of times to get anything. Food on room service is very good and good value. All in all i'd suggest the hotel takes a look at the likes of the Grand Stanford and takes note of the reviews it gets......it isn't for no reason that it's listed so far down the rankings of hotels in Sydney on TripAdvisor. I'ts actually justified, but i guess primarily on the design of the rooms and the reception areas. As a ametter if interest, we also had a night at the Holiday Inn at the airport.......and other than the location, i actually think it's better!

Reviews.Title: “Intermediate Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: dannyw1uk
Reviews.Content: So its November 2002 I was stuck for a pace to stay, had 1 night in a dump of a Hostel and decided to treat myself to a flash hotel for my last week in Aus before I jetted home to Blighty. I had made no reservation and wandering about town with my Sheffield Wednesday shirt on, flip flops, and shorts with sweat on my brow (jeez its hot out there!!) I did not exactly cut the dashing business/got a few quid type that this hotel clearly wants to attract. Suffice to say when I asked for a room they were fully booked. On going to an nearby internet cafe and booking online however it seems they were easily able to accomodate my request and on my return, the staff at the front desk had the grace to upgrade my room free of charge to a view of the bay. Now, this hotel is possibly the most ordinary hotel I have stopped in. Its very pleasing on the eye, everything is shiny and the food is pretty damn fine, however there is nothing in it that says Â£200 a night to me. The facitilies are the same as any other lower starred hotel in the world, the rooms are a standard size and standard layout (bathroom to the left/right as you walk in, wardrobes opposite and the room directly in front). The staff do what is on the packet and other than the apologetic (I took it to be) upgrade they never really went above and beyond whe I asked about car hire or excursions to the Blue Mountains. I would stay there again if there were no other hotels in that price bracket available but can't say as I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...too much attitude!”
Reviews.Author: fatetta
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Intercontinental-Sydney on Australia Day 2007, after a phenomenal 4 day stay at The Langham Melbourne during the Australian Open. We often stay at IC Hotels in Asia (and in fact, we had a wonderful stay at the IC Singapore later on during this same trip) but I must say, this one was a disappointment. At check-in, the attitude of the bored, disinterested clerk at reception couldn't have been less warm and cordial...she was mechanical at best. Told us we had been upgraded to a harbour view room on the club level, but in fact, we were not on the club floor. Then we had to fight with them to get the key cards that would let us into the club (they actually said we were upgraded to a club floor, which was not a club floor, but inconceivably, they balked when we asked for club access!!) The rooms were a mixture of tired and small bathrooms together with generally acceptable sleeping areas, but definately not 5 star quality. We sked for a coffee maker...none were available. Then we asked for a Bodum coffee plunger brewer. Three requests and five hours later, they sent a 2-cup bodum unit up. We were given a "fruit basket" on arrival, but it consisted of 2 apples with nothing else...not even a knife! The welcome card, incidentally, was addressed to us but our name was misspelled (even though our name on the registration card was correct). Keys quit working 3 times during our 3 day stay, necessitating 3 visits to the desk. The "Club" restaurant was disappointing...very over crowded on the nights we were there, perhaps because a large number of guests were staying there for a wedding. Not enough tables, dirty glasses everywhere, and the staff were overwhelmed. There were virtually no hors 'doevres at any time, and the clientelle looked like they were of "bus tour" mentality...as if they had never stayed in anything better than a Holiday Inn, and were going to grab and consume everything and anything in sight! I can see the staff being overwhelmed during the first night, but it was inexcusable during the next few nights (and during both breakfasts). Most IC Hotels give Club level guests the opportunity of eating breakfast either in the club itself, or in the main dining room, particularly when the club level is busy. They were emphatic in saying "no" when I asked...even though the main restaurant had a buffet set up which had very little business. As has been said before dozens of times on this site, the housekeepers knock on the doors way to early, whether the DND light is illuminated or not. Why is it necessary to do this at 8:30AM...even on weekends? The location is 5-Star, but the rest of the property is disappointing...3.5 stars at best. We could have stayed at the Peninsula for the same price, and at the FourSeasons for $22 more per night. Shame on us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: LakeP
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good but service (in particular reception) is/was terrible - in fact disgusting for a touted 5 star hotel in such a prestigious location. We reserved rooms for over Christmas and new year around 6mths ago, for some reason unknown to anyone they canceled one of the rooms, so we were left with paying rack rate for that room. The 'Mint' bar and restaurant decided to close throughout this period as did the main bar at around 10pm every night. When it was open half the staff had failed to turn out, so ordering was a little tricky. I'd be very wary of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmyAshburn
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Sydney was a fabulous hotel in a wonderful location. It's just a few blocks from the Opera House and Sydney Cove, where you can pick up the ferries. The rooms were spacious and clean. Condi Rice stayed here at the same time we were there so they must be doing something right! The hotel is also close to the shopping areas. The staff was great. We had an issue our first night there and they were very helpful and polite. We also had a beautiful view of the botantical gardens and the Harbour (if you craned your neck a bit). I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a good location and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we remembered...”
Reviews.Author: vesteygirlguide
Reviews.Content: The position is fantastic. The service is mostly efficient and very curteous BUT ... not everything comes up to scratch. We have stayed before and would recommend you book on the executive floor to get access to the Club Lounge. It is what makes the stay worthwhile. The view is superb, (and we live in Sydney), the service is excellent and it is one of the best kept secrets in Sydney. However... ont he day we arrived it was being used for a corporate function so CHECK before you book otherwise I would stay somewhere else (like the Park Hyatt). The room we were given, though on the Executive Floor and meant to have view of the Harbour towards the open sea, faced an office block. Now technically if you craned your neck around the back of the bed you could catch a glimpse of the Harbour but we made them move us. And it was a fight. Despite being priority guests (having stayed at the hotel before and others in the chain), we were initially told there was only a smoking room available. When I "asserted" myself , I was told that there had been a last minute cancellation (really?) and we were eventually moved. Bad, bad customer care. The following morning when I went for a jog at 6.00am, I looked back at the hotel and noticed more than 60% of the room blinds were open. Either they had a lot of concellations or they had an in-flux of early risers! The bathrooms are small, though perfectly adequate, there is no seperate shower and it is not very powerful. The rooms are looking a bit tired and the windows could do with a clean. Not much point having a view of the Harbour if you are staring at it through dusty windows. However, the food is excellent and we think reasonably priced. Again, the benefit of the Club Lounge is that you can have breakfast overlooking one of the world's great views and you can eat outside at the 31 level which is possibly unique. If you can't get a room with access to the Club Lounge, don't bother. Try the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, Generally Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ka7890
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night towards the end of November on the last day of our vacation in Austalia. Our gateway city was Sydney so I used my Priority Club points to get a free night's stay. Based on my status as an Ambassador Club member, we were given a free upgrade to a corner suite overlooking the harbor with a nice view of the bridge but couldn't see the Opera house. The room (2142) was very nice: the furniture new and modern, the towels fluffy and soft, chocalates on the bed, free fruit and water were available to us as well. It was extremely quiet and we were able to sleep in until past 9:00 am without any noise bothering us at all. The location is great, we were able to take the train into Circular Quay and then it took us about ten minutes to walk up the hill to the hotel with our rolling suitcases. My wife was a little tired climbing the hill and perhaps I should have helped her with her suitcase but our general rule when traveling is that each person is responsible for their own luggage. By the time we arrived at approximately 11:00 pm on a Monday night, the restaurant inside the hotel was already closed. Room service was suggested to us but we prefered to go out so the City Extra restaurant down at the ferry terminal was suggested to us as it is open 24 hours a day. Eating at this restuarant was by far the worst experience we had during our stay in Australia. We wound up walking out and not paying but that's another story. The staff that we encountered at the hotel were all friendly and professional with the exception of the waiter at the coffee/cake stand on the ground floor. He ignored us for a good fifteen minutes while chatting with other customers. Perhaps it was my touristy attire of an Australian flag t-shirt and baggy shorts that gave the impression that we were not as important as the business people in their fine suits and Italian loafers. In the end, we decided to go out and spend our coffee money somewhere else. Using the internet at the business center was fairly expensive. Five minutes cost AU$5. But as I mentioned, it was a free night's stay and that was the only thing that I paid for. Since my wife and I are normally budget conscious, we would most likely not pay to stay at this hotel despite its fine qualities. But if you don't mind paying for the location and quality, this hotel may be worth it to you despite some shortcomings you may encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Emma_22
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is in a fantastic location close to the Opera House, and we were given a room upgrade to an Opera House view room, which was amazing to look out the window and see. The room was very nice, as was the bathroom though that could have been slightly bigger. We also had Club Floor access, again amazing views, and the ability to have breakfast, drinks, canapes and some very nice wine in the evening. We did have a few minor problems, such as our key not initially being programmed for the Club Floor, but overall it was a great stay and I'd go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Boring ...below average”
Reviews.Author: wendyinafrica
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently paid $350 for 1 night in a standard room (no view at all) but included bfast and were totally dissappointed with what is a VERY tired hotel....the first room reeked on cigarettes, so we requested as my friend is asmatic to move...the receptionist actually sniffed at our request like she owned the hotel...and duly we received the exact same room one floor higher... Bfast was very nice, after we had dinner down near the opera house we returned to the hotel to find the bar closing (sunday night 10.30PM) and even though they allowed us to sit and talk the atmosphere was "hurry up" and leave.... I guess if you want a generic hotel experience this is it...I stayed at this hotel when it first opened...staff were fantastic...I guess that Australian apathy has crept in... Boring boring........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Harbor Location!! Hotel Training School Next Door!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: McBam
Reviews.Content: Australia should be on everyone's Top Ten Travel Dream List without a doubt!!!! We were able to expand a three day business trip in Sydney into two weeks, including a week in Cairns and another three days in Melbourne for our vacation. Quantas was the only airline we used from Honolulu to Fiji to Sydney to Cairns to Melbourne to Honolulu. Absolutely, awesomely impressive cannot justly describe Quantas!! This companys needs to mentor the U.S. airline companies in corporate survival, business skills and customer service. Sydney's InterContinental Hotel's location in the downtown area near Sydney Harbor is hard to beat........a couple blocks to the Circular Quay which is great for people watching, street art, restaurants, catching a ferry to the Toranga Zoo, shopping........a few more blocks from the hotel takes you to the Sydney Opera House which is a gorgeous Must See........the Rocks where some of the first soon-to-be Aussies landed is also within walking distance. However, adjacent to the InterContinental is a hotel training school. I saw the students in uniform taking breaks outside the schools front door, and, also, saw the same uniforms being worn by "staff" in the InterContinental. That didn't bother me until we got stuck in a hotel elevator for nearly fifteen minutes our first day when we had some free time to roam. The emergency phone in the elevator just rang and rang without any pick up. The alarm button was then pushed without any call or other action from staff. A minute or two later, the elevator took us to our floor. Then, imagine this, our key cards no longer allowed us access into our room!! We had to use the courtesy phone near the elevator, waiting almost twenty minutes for a staff member to arrive with new key cards and without any apologies for that inconvenience or the elevator "scare". The next day, I was trapped on the elevator by myself for nearly ten minutes. The same scenario happened.....key card didn't work, no apologies, etc, etc., etc. The staff seems way too self-important, stuffy, arrogant for this hotel as the location is great, the rooms average, the food service in need of great repair. And, if indeed they are teaching others the fine art of guest service as a hotelier, they need to be shut down. We'd go back to Sydney in a heartbeat. We'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend away”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend in Sydney. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the ferry, opera house and the rocks. We were upgraded on arrival which was a pleasant surprise and the check in was very quick and easy. The view out over the harbour was great and the room was spacious and well appointed. As a previous reviewer noted the toiletries are pretty grim, look nice, smell awful. The mini bar is well stocked but as usual pricey. Didn't eat at the hotel at all but did note that the Mint bar was only open on Friday, the bar on the top floor was also closed for the entire 5 nights which was a shame. The concierge was helpful on first contact but we found out later after almost getting stuck in one of the smaller towns not far from Sydney that their knowledge is probably limited to inner city. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and it's a hotel that my husband will continue to use for business and I hope to join him.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with rooms with great view!”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights last year and was very satisfied. Stuff at reception was not too friendy, but ok...there were some problems first, because they told us that our travel agent had only booked partly harbour view, but after some discussion we were given a really nice, clean, spacious, stylish room at a high floor with full view of the harbour bridge...from our bed we had this breathtaking view through large windows! So do book full harbour view - it is worth it!!! We didÂ´t have breakfast there, but the hotel is located right in the city center, so you wonÂ´t have any problems finding Starbucks etc. ..- it is also close to the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: hcry
Reviews.Content: We booked a garden/harbor room, which, as advertised, has a nice view of the botanical gardens and harbor, with a glimpse of one sail of the opera house if you crane your neck. The room, and especially the bathroom, were small, pleasantly decorated and clean. The location is wonderfully central to the harbor and the opera house, although there is quite a hill to climb when returning by foot. We had no problems with any aspect of our stay. We were happy to be checked in early on the morning of our arrival, and the concierge was especially helpful with advice over our 4 day stay. Everything was very pleasant, however nothing about our stay at the InterContinental was 5 star, except the price.

Reviews.Title: “New Year? Forget it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MargoCornish
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Australia with our four kids and wanted a great 5* hotel with a view of the fireworks since it was unlikely the kids would keep awake . The Mandarin Oriental was closed for re-furbishment , so we were recommended this hotel by the travel agent who advised that although there were no harbour rooms available, we would get a good view of the new year fireworks from a suitable vantage point. On arrival checking in was slow and tedious and although they were aware of six people in the party they only provided two double beds in each room. It took a while to sort this out !! The hotel itself had fabulous views of the harbour from the top lounges but when we investigated the arrangements for the fireworks we were advised that these areas were closed to hotel guests as they were booked out for corporate functions. This was extremely disappointing, having payed 5* prices. The hotel wasn't interested in our complaints re this and we ended up viewing the fireworks via the mirrored office block adjacent to our window!!! Rooms were fine but bathrooms were a bit old fashioned. Great location, handy for the harbour and local sightseeing but would prefer to go to a hotel that was more interested in its guests than making a fast buck.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a great 5-star hotel. The rooms are nice and the view we had was just wonderful (from the bench below the large window and from the bed also). There were handy automatic shades that function from a bedside button too. The bathroom was very nice everything was impeccably clean. However, the shampoos and conditioners are just awful. Bring your own. We used the pool once and it's not very nice unfortunately. The room is painted a strange bluish color and if I remember correctly, there were dolphins painted on the walls. Our keys did not function the pool lock, so we had to call the front desk to let us in. Therefore, our keys did not work for the locker rooms either. It appeared there was a steam room, but that door was also locked. My problem with the hotel is that it's so stuffy. The staff is stuffy and the guests were stuffy too. Honestly, as vacationers we felt a bit out of place as we were not dressed in black from head to toe. Even getting a cup of coffee in the morning, was a formal affair. We were also charged for a bottle of wine from the mini-bar that we didn't consume. They did take remove that charge right away.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Intercontinental was perfect. I booked a club level room and was given a free upgrade to a harbor view room. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The room was very clean and nicely decorated and the Club Intercontinental on the top floor was excellent. A very good value if you can take advantage of it. The hotel is only a 3 minute walk to the ferries and the opera house and minutes away from many restaurants and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Price 1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the last six months and both times have not been without incident. The first stay (to celebrate my Birthday) in August 2005 lead to an embarressing situation for me when the friends with whom I was travelling with received an upgrade to a room with an uninterrupted view of Sydney Harbour and my partner & I were unceremoniously left to our devices several floors below. Even though I was the originator of the booking. However, my last stay and the associated incompetance has put me off returning to this hotel ever again. After being specifically advised to email me details before debiting anything to my card, and that I actually wished to use another card instead of the one they had listed, they went ahead & debited the original card causing the bank to ring and further embarresment for me on top of the already embarressing situation of having an acquaintance's card debited for the weekend when he was not even with us. Sound confusing? Well that's not the half of it. What a bunch of clowns! The View is the only redeeming feature. Rooms fittings are looking their age.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel in my experience is only second to the amazing views from that very special Club Lounge. We just loved the welcome on arrival we were given and as we were staying a few days we paid the extra for access to that beautiful Club Lounge and just lived up there every spare minute we had. Staff seemed genuine and friendly and although we didn't eat much in the hotel we found the staff serving coffee in the Lobby very knowledgable and with good attitudes. The Concierge helped us out tremedously and Stacy in the Business centre was great in helping us out with our internet problems. She was very friendly and helpful just what you need when you need info for a conference urgently. All in all we loved it and were blown away!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. While this hotel is nice, it is not a 5 star hotel. A little context here - if you regularly stay at the Best Western, you will love this hotel. However, if you have stayed at 5 star hotels (Park Hyatt in Tokyo, or a Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton etc.), you will be disappointed by this hotel. The Hotel itself is very nice and in a very convenient location (less than a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay, the Opera House etc.). The rooms, recently renovated, are very, very basic. My "King" room was actually 2 twin beds pushed together and covered by King bedding. The service at this hotel is also only mediocre. The check-in and check-out is a bit chaotic and unorganzied. All in all, a fine hotel. If you can get a good rate I would recommend staying here. However, if you are looking to be pampered and really enjoying a 5 star hotel experience, my advice would be to stay at the Shangri-La or Four Seasons (also in very good locations not far from the Intercontinental).

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Shoddy
Reviews.Content: Loved it and would certainly stay there again, located very close to CircularQuay, which is central for busses trains and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: thepeacha
Reviews.Content: We sure liked Sydney and IC was a good home to us. Rooms were clean and bright, and we had wonderful views of the Bridge and Opera House from the room, cannot complain! Staff was friendly and helpful, hotel was well- situated. Did not eat there so cannot comment but it looked appealing. All in all we thought it was a nice hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental after multiple nights at the Park Hyatt and the Four Seasons. The InterContinental represented a tremendous value at 1/2 the price of the Four Seasons or the Park Hyatt. The hotel's location is not as "good" as the Four Seasons, but may be comparable to the Park Hyatt (although the InterContinental is not on the water). The hotel is older and seems to have been refurbished. We rejected the room we were initially offered because it overlooked a roadway and was quite loud. After a lot of back-and-forth with the Front Desk Supervisor and a Trainee, we paid to be upgraded to a room on the "north side" of the hotel with a view of the Harbour Bridge. The room size was good and the room seemed to have been renovated. The bathroom was *not* renovated and seemed old compared to the room. The bathroom's level of cleanliness was not up to par with the other deluxe hotels in Sydney (ground-in-dirt in the shower, moldy shower curtain liner). We did feel the location, a 2 minute walk from Circular Quay and close to the Opera House and Botanic Gardens, was very good. The lack of a customer service attitude was disappointing and is probably what prevents the hotel from earning a better reputation. After the customer service attitude at the Park Hyatt and the Four Seasons we thought the combativeness of the IC front desk staff upon check in was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable - Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: Vilavisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in early December as the logical place to stay with a visit to the Ballet at the Opera House the main reason for it. As this was part of a one night 'girlie getaway' we sprang for Club Level rooms, and also enjoyed Afternoon Tea at the hotel. I have stayed many time before and always found the rooms to be immaculate and very comfortable and was not disappointed this time either. The Club Lounge is excellent, both in service and appointments and is a credit to the hotel. We enjoyed our champagne and canapes and also a very nice breakfast the next morning. The Afternoon Tea was good, but not excellent - mostly because it was close to Xmas and the restaurant/bar area was extremely busy and the staff somewhat harried - which was not a help to the calm peaceful period we were expecting. However, the food itself was good and certainly plentiful, and we made the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OldFed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney in late October 2005. It is a beautiful facility and offers superior customer sevice. We sprang for the concierge level, which gave us 24-hour access to the Club Lounge. The lounge offered complimentary continental breakfast, tea, coffee and soft drinks all day, and "happy hour" drinks and hor d'ouevers. Our room had a gorgeous view of the harbor. All together, a wonderful experience for our first stop in Australia!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Club Lounge!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to have some of the most spectacular views of any hotel in Sydney! As we entered our room we were greeted by an amazing view of the Botanical Gardens and harbour facing out to Sydney Heads. However this was nothing compared to the view from the Club Lounge floor. It was here that we were greeted by the Club Lounge attendant and made to feel like nothing was a problem. We thought a view like this deserves a drink, and having just thought it, it was like they read our minds and a drink was offered. It was the small details like the binoculars that coaught my eye. Fantastic idea as the view from the deck, yes - 31 floors up they have a decking that you can get out onto and enjoy the warmth of the day with a cold drink and simply take in the most beautiful harbour in the world. They do evening nibblies and drinks like other clubs I'm sure, but what makes it stand out for us was the seemless service. The canapes were too delicious and the wine topping up spot on. The perfect place to either start your night out. And not a bad view for breakfast either. Normally we're prone to dining out of hotels in regards to dinner, but concierge had suggested we try the Hotels restaurant Mint - which is more stand alone than anything else. Wonderful. Just wonderful!Great atmosphere the night we went - a Friday. So after a fullfilling meal the best anecdote a walk. Straight out of the hotel, already at Circular Quay and the Opera House, the lights of the bridge. Talk about location location location! All in all I could break down each part of our stay from arrival to departure but it can be simply summed up in one word - wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Irwins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon, it was our first stop on a three week holiday to Australia and it was perfect, definitely our favourite and most luxurious hotel. The location was excellent, just about a 5 minute walk from the Opera House and Circular Quay and close to the Rocks, the Harbour Bridge and city centre. We had a Harbour View room on quite a high floor and the view was truely spectacular. The staff were courteous and even had champagne waiting for us when we arrived. We only ate breakfasts in the hotel but they were huge and delicious. The hotel was recommended to us by friends and I'd have no hesitation in suggesting that u stay there. Highlights of Sydney part from the hotel? Opera House and Harbour Bridge of course, taking the ferry to Manly and Watson's Bay from Circular Quay (if you like steak then Ribs 'n Rumps is an excellent steak house in Manly while the seafood in Doyles at Watson's Bay is lovely, particularly with a bottle of wine on a Sunday afternoon). If you like cocktails then the cocktail bar on the top floor of the Shangri-La hotel is a must, the views are amazing and it was really buzzing when we went on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Where to go if you wanna floss in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: elpenguin
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Sydney is the place! The outside of the building is not that spectacular; in fact, it looks kinda 70's but the interior is gorgeous and if I could have taken a few pics of the Cortile bar and restaurant I would have but I was embarassed. This is the first pimp hotel I've stayed in and the whole time I tried to act natural as though visits to 5 star international class hotels were the norm, even boring, for me. The rooms are nice-- not sickeningly lavish so that you feel compelled to donate to Save the Children when you get home because of the guilt, but nice enough. The bar area in the room is beautiful, and everything is well lit. I especially like the sitting area by the window- I didn't sit in it though but took funny pictures of myself doing so. I requested a king room but I checked in early and was offered a double-- I didn't mind because I only take up 1/2 the bed anyway. The pool was nice and the sauna was great, I had it all to myself. I didn't dine at Mint bar but it looked too trendy for me. Instead I caught some Aussie Rules and ordered room service. I had some spring rolls and another appetizer- I forgot- and both were decent. I visited the business center to check email and the woman working was very helpful. I imagine if you needed to do real business here it would be a flawless event. The hotel staff was professional and polite, not gregarious and no one wanted to be your friend- which is how true professionals should comport themselves. All in all, a fantastic stay in a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, sensational harbour views”
Reviews.Author: maashad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Intercontinental Sydney in Feb 2005. We booked a Royal Botanic and Garden Harbour view Room which turned out to be just the right choice. The view was incredible! Room was located at the 24th floor with the Sydney harbour layed out in front of us. Sunrise was right outside our window, the bench in front of the panorama windows let me very comfortably enjoy it every morning, since jet-lagged European tourists do not need much sleep in these morning hours! An unforgettable sight! They offer various room categories: Harbour Garden View Room (Levels 10-26) Bridge View Room (Levels 10-20) Grand Harbour View Rooms (Levels 21-28) Executive Harbour View Suites (Levels 12-28) The Harbour Garden View Room we had did offer a side peek at the Opera house, however the Harbour Bridge and the Opera house can only be seen in full in the Grand Harbour View Rooms. One has to be careful though, since an apartment building in front most likely will spoil the view for the lower levels. But one can always enjoy the spectacular views from the top level swimming pool panorama windows (see picures). The room itself was spacious with a nice bathroom having a (lockable) window facing the panorama windows to enjoy the spectacular views while taking a shower! Room service was also excellent! On arrival we brought a bottle of champagne with us from the airplane. Since we immediatly headed out to enjoy some nightlife I called room service to put the bottle on ice while we are out. After we came back, the bottle was put on ice with two campagne glasses beside plus they added free snacks as a welcome present! Also with other requests, the reaction time of the staff was within 5 minutes from call to knock on the door to take care of our wishes. The location of the hotel is also superb! In the morning we had a nice 3-minute-walk down to the Opera house to enjoy our breakfast at the Circular Quay and then start off our day. In respect to night life "The Passage" right at the Opera house was an excellent way to end our day, enjoying a nice cocktail in front of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and then taking back the nice 3-minute-walk to the Hotel. Also the wonderful Botanic Garden is right in front of the Hotel! Alltogether we loved the Hotel and had an incredible time during our stay! It was worth every dollar spent and will be definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: Maureane
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Intercontinental twice on my last trip to Australia. Each time the room was great, the service was exceptional and warm and the location made it easy to get to major attractions as well as jog in the botanical graden in the morning. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated.”
Reviews.Author: Heritage1
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say but this Hotel is just an ordinary hotel with a great location Rooms were well appointed,bathroom average.In room information on the TV only but no instructions on how to turn it on etc. Meals were over priced and very ho-hum...service about a '2'. Generally I thought the staff though helpful were undertrained both in their job requirements and local knowledge. When we wanted to know about shopping hours on Easter Sunday we were referred to an empty concierge desk .... which when eventually staffed by an affable young man... could only offer us directions to the Visitor Centre at The Rocks...sorry guys...not good enough.Location does not win out over service!

Reviews.Title: “Great and bad at the same time”
Reviews.Author: panjack
Reviews.Content: Correct room allocation (Garden view), Efficient (early) check-in and friendly porter. Attitude and tone of voice from the operator was abrupt and exasperated. I had to call 6 times to have my cable tv repaired by 3 different engineers who never followed up (as they said they would) or handed information over to each other (my cable box was replaced by EACH engineer and I still could not access the guest compendium which was only on the tv). I then had to hassle the operator to reach restarants, concierge, etc as there were no direct dial buttons on the phones in the room. I had problems with starting the broadband in my room. 3 calls later, and a visit from the IT manager determined that the broadband was faulty, and the lead running from the distribution box outside my room had to be replaced (not possible while I was staying). On a more positive note, the food in all the outlets (In-room dining, brasserie restaurant and Mint) was excellent, and by far the best food I have eaten in a 5 star property in a long time. The service in Mint was appalling, and not what I would expect in a contemporary fine dining restaurant. The staff were more interested in chatting to each other than attending to the guests! Luckily for the staff, the exceptional quality of the food would sway me to recommend their product. Top marks to the Chef! Overall, the bedrooms are a bit tired, the actual body of the hotel is fantastic, the service varies between awful and excellent (depending which staff member you run into) and the food is just divine! I will take pot-luck and return....!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: helkon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in all ways, service, location, great rooms. Fantastic views over the Harbour including the Bridge & opera House from the top floor and our room!

Reviews.Title: “The Restaurant was very bad value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $60 per head for food in the Tasting Room of the restaurant - ther was a group of about 30. It was really bad value. Entrees OK if you like seafood - though I have seen better and fresher. Main courses inedible. Very few of the group bothered. THe deserts were the best part. The room was badly set up with furniture scattered in a haphazard way and no staff to help out. Wine was $50 a bottle - car parking $25 - all in all a most expensive night but most of all bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a hotel to avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the property after i sgned up for ambassasor programme. I had to pay USD150.00 for it Booked under the Club Grand Harbour room with the expectation that i was to be upgraded under the ambassador programme. Upon Arrival on a friday at 2pm, i was told that firstly my room was not ready and to wait till 4pm, then i was told i was to be upgraded to a suite without club access. This was a malay/indian guy who was burly in size. After explaining that i paid for the Club Room and its expected that i be given club access, i was told no straight in the face by the manager tanya who then said that it was management decision not to upgrade any ambassadors members, only royal ambassadors. Not only that, she was extremely rude when she said that. She was almost condescending in her tone. Waited till 3.30pm pm only to be given a twin bedded room. I booked a king bedded room and the hotel does price the rooms differently. Upon arrival in the room and discovering the mistake, i phoned the reception only to be told they would accomodate but that the room would be ready later. Came back at 4.30pm, only to be told by danielle the front desk staff that i was explained earlier that my room was not ready and told to come back at 8pm. Not only that, she carried a surly face and wasn't polite at all. Decided to come back home and printed out the t & c of the ambassador programme. Called the hotel only to be told that my room would not be ready till 8.30pm. When i went back to the hotel at 8.30pm, i explained my situation to danielle who then said she didn't know of my ambassador status when i did passed an email stating my ambassador status to the earlier big burly sized guy. When danielle went to pull out the check-in sign sheet, she found the email as i told her. No apology at all. Asked to speak to the manager and was introduced to Mr. Bladdin. He was ok, apologetic and offered drinks on the bar. Declined the drinks at the bar and was told no suite at all available when at 2.30pm was offered a suite. Go figure.... Anyway, i did get my kind bedded room and i did get my club access for the 2 days. I did manage to get my suite for the 2nd night but only after i pursued it with the manager. I wasn't contacted at any time. In fact soon after entering the suite, i got a call from the front desk asking if i was checking out, when i was booked for 2 nights. The hotel definately failed on the service side. As for amenities, all rooms are basically the same size and the only difference in the view which you can get from a lot of the other hotels in the circular quay area which includes the Shangri-la, the Four Seasons, the Park Hyatt and even the stamford. You might get a view of the habour at the observatory which is amongst the best in sydney. In terms of bath amenities, mainly the club rooms and the suites get the hydro bottles which are nice but essentially the same as most other big chain properties. Unless you get a suite, chances are the bathroom is going to the standard small bathroom, almost similar to holiday-inn standard.. Its taht small with a bath and shower together. No seperate shower stalls and mainly dull white walls. Concluding, do not stay here unless you want to wait from 2pm to 8.30pm for a room and indifferent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: bortiuk
