Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of months travelling round the world. Our schedule only allowed us 24 hours in Sydney so we decided to splash out on a top price package in the InterContinental. We communicated directly with the staff by email prior to booking and they were very helpful. As the hotel is close to the Sydney Opera House we negotiated a special all-inclusive Opera package. We specified a room on the top floors with panoramic views of both the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (only four rooms on each level view both these attractions). We also asked them to supply and book tickets for the Opera. We are not opera buffs but thought it would be a great experience. The hotel staff arranged everything, gave us a choice of seats to book in advance. The package included the top priced seats, programme and interval drinks. There were two intervals and the hotel arranged for us to spend the intervals in the exclusive Qantas lounge. As soon as we checked in at the hotel the tickets were available from the concierge. The hotel room was beautiful. Very, very comfortable and stylish. Faultless. The communal areas are spacious, light and airy. There are useful shops within the hotel. The location is about five minutes walk from the main Circular Quay Station. But beware the hotel is up a hill so you may choose to take a taxi from the station if you have luggage. Conclusion. With such an excellent location the hotel is ideal for short trips to Sydney. It is easy to walk to many attractions from the hotel. The rooms and view are fabulous. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: leone2107
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay in this hotel with my husband and 2 friends. Had just left the Intercontinental in Yokohama and was looking forward to comparing it with the one in Sydney. It certainly lived up to its reputation. We had booked rooms on the Club Floor and I would recommend you do this if you possibly can. Use of the Club Floor Lounge on the 31 floor gave views over Sydney to die for - the Opera House and Bridge all with uninterrupted views. The Club Lounge staff were extremely courteous and called you by name after only one day! The superb breakfast and "Happy hours" from 5-7.30pm were a bonus after a hard day doing the sights with free drinks and superb buffet. The rooms were very spacious with a long window seat to take in the views. Our rooms overlooked the harbour and park with views which were breathtaking. This was our first visit to Sydney and would thoroughly recommend this hotel to everyone - we were spoiled rotten!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, breathtaking view!”
Reviews.Author: new008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Easter period with my husband and two children. Everything was perfect from our room overlooking the Sydney Harbour and the Botanic Gardens to the restaurants, pool and gym. We particularly enjoyed the Club Lounge for breakfast and little nibbles during the day. The highlight was watching the sun set at cocktail hour and see Sydney light up from the 32nd floor. Breathtaking.....can you get a better view! Hard to leave after a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: BorisMcWhirter
Reviews.Content: I am an Australian living in Ireland, my partner and I just returned home to Sydney for a three week holiday. I always like to spend my first night back in Sydney in a hotel on Sydney Harbour, I had pre-booked a room at the Sydney Intercontinental, I opted for a Club Harbour View Room for one night at a cost of $415 AUD. We landed in Sydney on 15th February 2005 at 6.30am. We caught the train from the airport into Circular Quay, this took about 15-20 mins. The sight of Sydney Harbour and the Bridge as the train pulled into Circular Quay was breath taking as always. We got off the train and walked the 5 mins to the Sydney InterContinental Hotel. By now the time was approx 8am. The hotel reception were very friendly and even though we were early offered us showers and breakfast in the Club Lounge, this was much appreciated after a 24 hour flight. I cannot start to explain the breath taking views of Sydney Harbour on offer from the Club Lounge. There are beautiful lounges inside with panoramic views or there is an outside decked area where you can sit and soak up the sun as you look over Sydney Harbour and surrounds. After showering and having some breakfast we headed off for a look around Sydney, the hotel stored all our luggage as our room would not be ready until approx 1pm. On returning to the hotel around 2pm our room was ready, it was a modern decent sized room, very clean and high standard of furniture. The view from the bedroom window was beautiful, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House in clear view. I cannot highly recommend enough paying the few extra dollars for access to the Club Lounge, the way it works is it costs a little more but it guarantees you a room on 24th Floor or above, it gives you access to the top floor lounge whenever you like, and between 5pm and 7pm each evening there are free drinks and canapÃ©s on offer, and by free drinks I mean whatever you like and as much as you like within those two hours, champagne, wine, spirits and premium beers are all on offer. Great value as you sip away on your drink overlooking one of the most beautiful sights in the world, Sydney Harbour. Its sets you up for a great night out on the town! All in all this one night was one of the best, if not the best stay I have had in any hotel around the world all for $415 AUD (Â£170 STG or $330 USD).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diving4gold
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not worth the money. The staff are incredibly unprofessional and rude. I have stayed at numerous Intercontinentals and I would have to say that this one is probably the worst. There are so many hotels in Sydney that are worthy of 5 stars, I recommend that you do not waste your time with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite luxury”
Reviews.Author: Pausanias
Reviews.Content: I would concur with most of the above opinions - this hotel has a good location and excellent, recently refurbed rooms with typically small Sydneyside-sized bathrooms. We stayed 6-7 November 2004, a weekend, when the hotel was busy with McDonalds conventioneers who packed out the breakfast buffet and made it a generally unpleasant experience and made us feel like unwanted guests. So not a real five-star, simply because of the convention trade. Just a solid, impersonal chain hotel for business people and tourists.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 117 Macquarie Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
